cards.customization_text: □ Heirloom. This asset gets -1 cost and gains the [[Relic]] trait. □ Inscription of Glory. Add this inscription: "- Glory - If this attack defeats an enemy, choose one: draw 1 card, heal 1 damage, or heal 1 horror." □ Inscription of the Elders. Add this inscription: "- Elders - If this attack succeeds by an amount equal to or greater than your location's shroud, discover 1 clue at your location." □□ Inscription of the Hunt. Add this inscription: "- Hunt - Immediately move to a connecting location or engage an enemy at your location." □ Inscription of Fury. Add this inscription: "- Fury - If this attack is successful, in addition to its standard damage, deal 1 damage to each other enemy engaged with you." □□□ Ancient Power. You may imbue the same inscription up to three times. □□□ Saga. Replenish 2 of Runic Axe's charges at the start of each round, instead of only 1. □□□□ Scriptweaver. For every charge spent, you may imbue the axe with up to two different inscriptions.

This card’s text box now reads: “[action] If attached enemy is at your location: Parley. Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, give it a command (limit once per round per command) – “Go.” This enemy moves once in a direction of your choice.” This card’s customizable sheet loses the “Mercy” ability and gains“☐Cower. Add the command: “- ‘Cower.’ This enemy exhausts.”
cards.customization_change: - "Betray." Deal 1 damage to any enemy at this enemy's location with an equal or lower fight value than this enemy. - "Cower." This enemy exhausts. - "Confess." Discover 1 clue at this enemy's location if its health is equal to or higher than its location's shroud. - "Distract." Automatically evade any enemy at this enemy's location with an equal or lower evade value than this enemy. [fast]: Return Power Word to your hand. You may activate the parley ability on Power Word from up to one location away from the attached enemy. [action] If attached enemy is at your location: Parley. Give it up to two different commands (limit once per round per command) - You may include three copies of Power Word in your deck. When you give a command using one copy, also give that command to each other enemy with one of your copies of Power Word attached.
cards.customization_text: □ Betray. Add the command: "- 'Betray.' Deal 1 damage to any enemy at this enemy's location with an equal or lower fight value than this enemy." □ Cower. Add the command: "- 'Cower.' This enemy exhausts." □ Confess. Add the command: "- 'Confess.' Discover 1 clue at this enemy's location if its health is equal to or higher than its location's shroud." □ Distract. Add the command: "- 'Distract.' Automatically evade any enemy at this enemy's location with an equal or lower evade value than this enemy." □□ Greater Control. Power Word gains "[fast]: Return Power Word to your hand." □□□ Bonded. You may activate the parley ability on Power Word from up to one location away from the attached enemy. □□□ Tonguetwister. When you parley with Power Word, you may give up to two different commands. □□□ Thrice Spoken. You may include three copies of Power Word in your deck. When you give a command using one copy, also give that command to each other enemy with one of your copies of Power Word attached.

fhv/fhvc.back_text:
Easy / Standard - Act 2
[skull]: -X. X is your location's column number.
[cultist]: -2. Place 1 resource on this card, as a switch.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, move the Mine cart once.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, remove 1 switch from this card.
fhv/fhvc.name: Written in Rock
fhv/fhvc.text:
Easy / Standard - Act 1
[skull]: -X. X is your location's column number.
[cultist]: -1. Place 1 resource on this card, as a scrap.
[tablet]: -2. If you fail, remove 1 scrap from this card.
[elder_thing]: -5. Remove 1 switch from this card.

fhv/fhvc.back_text:
Hard / Expert - Act 2
[skull]: -X. X is twice your location's column number.
[cultist]: -3. If you succeed, place 1 resource on this card, as a switch.
[tablet]: -4. Move the Mine Cart once.
[elder_thing]: -5. Take 1 damage.
fhv/fhvc.name: Written in Rock
fhv/fhvc.text:
Hard / Expert - Act 1
[skull]: -X. X is twice your location's column number.
[cultist]: -3. If you succeed, place 1 resource on this card, as a scrap.
[tablet]: -4. Remove 1 scrap from this card.
[elder_thing]: -5. Take 1 damage.

fhv/fhvc.name: Prismatic Shard
fhv/fhvc.text:
Uses (4 brilliance).
[reaction] When a scenario card effect would discard any number of cards from your hand, exhaust Prismatic Shard and spend 1 brilliance: Ignore that effect and draw that many cards, instead.

fhv/fhvc.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is twice your current floor number (to a minimum of 2).
[cultist]: -2. If you succeed and your location is an enemy, exhaust it.
[tablet]: -4. If you fail, heal 1[per_investigator] damage from the nearest enemy-location.
[elder_thing]: -5. If it is agenda 2a or 3a, after this test resolves, remove this token from the chaos bag and add it to the predation bag.
fhv/fhvc.name: Hemlock House
fhv/fhvc.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is your current floor number (to a minimum of 1).
[cultist]: -1. If your location is an enemy, exhaust it.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, heal 1 damage from the nearest enemy-location.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, and it is agenda 2a or 3a, after this test resolves, remove this token from the chaos bag and add it to the predation bag.

fhv/fhvc.name: Little Sylvie
fhv/fhvc.text: [reaction] When Little Sylvie is discarded from your hand or deck: Play it (paying its cost). [reaction] When a scenario card effect would discard a card from your hand or deck, exhaust Little Sylvie: Place that card on top of your deck, instead.

fhv/fhvc.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X the number of revealed [[Cave]] locations in play.
[cultist]: -1. If you succeed by 2 or more, heal 1 horror.
[tablet]: -4. If you are at a [[Cave]] location, treat this token's modifier as -6 instead.
[elder_thing]: -3. If an [[Abomination]] enemy is at your location, this test automatically fails instead.
fhv/fhvc.name: The Lost Sister
fhv/fhvc.text:
East / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half the number of revealed [[Cave]] locations in play (rounded up).
[cultist]: -1. If you succeed, heal 1 horror.
[tablet]: -2. If you are at a [[Cave]] location, treat this token's modifier as -4 instead.
[elder_thing]: -2. If an [[Abomination]] enemy is at your location, reveal another token.

fhv/fhvc.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X the number of [[Insect]] enemies in play and in the victory display.
[cultist]: -3. If you succeed, you may shuffle a non-[[Elite]] enemy in the victory display into the encounter deck.
[tablet]: -5. Ready the nearest [[Insect]] enemy. It moves and attacks as if it were the enemy phase.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you are a [[Lair]] location, you automatically fail.
fhv/fhvc.name: The Silent Heath
fhv/fhvc.text:
East / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half the number of [[Insect]] enemies in play and in the victory display (rounded up).
[cultist]: -1. You may shuffle a non-[[Elite]] enemy in the victory display into the encounter deck.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, choose an [[Insect]] enemy at your location. It engages you and makes an immediate attack.
[elder_thing]: -2. If you are a [[Lair]] location, reveal another token.

fhv/fhvc.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X the number of [[Sunken]] locations in play (rounded up).
[cultist]: -3. If you succeed, you may remove 1 sinkhole from the nearest [[Bog]] location.
[tablet]: -5. Place 1 damage on the nearest [[Bog]] location, as a sinkhole.
[elder_thing]: -5. Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Grasping Tendril enemy and draw it, ignoring its surge keyword.

[tablet]: -3. If you fail, place 1 damage on the nearest [[Bog]] location, as a sinkhole.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Grasping Tendril enemy and draw it, ignoring its surge keyword.

[elder_thing]: -5. Take 1 horror.

fhv/fhvc.text:
East / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the current darkness level.
[cultist]: -1. Heal 1 damage from your investigator.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, find the enemy in pursuit with the highest evade. Spawn it at your location.

[elder_thing]: -5. Remove a barrier, decoy, or trap at your location.

[tablet]: -1. Reveal another token. If you fail, the nearest enemy readies, moves, and attacks as if it were the enemy phase.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, remove 1 barrier, decoy, or trap at your location.

fhv/fhvc.name: Ajax
fhv/fhvc.text:
Your first action each round does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
[action] Exhaust Ajax: Move. Either move twice, or choose any [[Field]] location and move to it.
[action] If Ajax is at your location: Take control of him. Any player at Ajax's location may trigger this ability.

fhv/fhvc.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is the number of [[Colour]] enemies in play.
[cultist]: -6. Discard 1 card at random from your hand.
[tablet]: -8. You may place 1 doom on your investigator card to treat this token's modifier as -3, instead.
[elder_thing]: -5. If this is a fight or evasion attempt against a Cosmic Emissary, you automatically fail instead.

East / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is 1 more than the current act number.
[cultist]: -4. If you fail, discard 1 card at random from your hand.
[tablet]: -5. You may place 1 doom on your investigator card to treat this token's modifier as 0, instead.
[elder_thing]: -2. If this is a fight or evasion attempt against a Cosmic Emissary, reveal another token.

fhv/fhvc.text: Massive. Cannot make attacks of opportunity. Forced – When you successfully fight or evade this enemy: Instead of damaging or exhausting it, this enemy does not attack during the enemy phase this round.

fhv/fhvc.name: Cosmic Emissary
fhv/fhvc.text: Massive. Retaliate. Cannot make attacks of opportunity. Forced – When you successfully fight or evade this enemy: Instead of damaging or exhausting it, this enemy does not attack during the enemy phase this round.

fhv/fhvc.name: Cosmic Emissary
fhv/fhvc.text: Massive. Alert. Cannot make attacks of opportunity. Forced – When you successfully fight or evade this enemy: Instead of damaging or exhausting it, this enemy does not attack during the enemy phase this round.

fhv/fhvc.name: Cosmic Emissary
fhv/fhvc.text: Massive. Cannot make attacks of opportunity. Forced – When you successfully fight or evade this enemy: Instead of damaging or exhausting it, this enemy does not attack during the enemy phase this round.

fhv/fhvc.name: The Hemlock Curse
fhv/fhvc.text: This skill's icons subtract from your skill value instead of adding to it. If this skill test fails, discard each card in your hand. Forced - At the end of your turn, if The Hemlock Curse is in your hand: Discard 1 card at random from your hand.

fhv/fhvc.name: Mother Rachel
fhv/fhvc.text: While you control Mother Rachel, you have 1 additional arcane slot. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower](2). If you succeed, ([codex] 1). Forced - After Mother Rachel is defeated: Set her aside, out of play. In your Campaign Log, decrease her Relationship Level.

fhv/fhvc.name: Leah Atwood
fhv/fhvc.text: While you control Leah Atwood, you get +1 [combat]. [action]: Parley. Test [combat](2). If you succeed, ([codex] 2). Forced - After Leah Atwood is defeated. Set her aside, out of play. In your Campaign Log, decrease her Relationship Level.

fhv/fhvc.name: Simeon Atwood
fhv/fhvc.text: While you control Simeon Atwood, you get +1 [agility]. [action]: Parley. Test [agility](2). If you succeed, ([codex] 3). Forced - After Simeon Atwood is defeated: Set him aside, out of play. In your Campaign Log, decrease his Relationship Level.

fhv/fhvc.name: William Hemlock
fhv/fhvc.text: While you control William Hemlock, you get +1 [intellect]. [action]: Parley. Test [intellect](2). If you succeed, ([codex] 4). Forced - After William Hemlock is defeated. Set him aside, out of play. In your Campaign Log, decrease his Relationship Level.

fhv/fhvc.name: River Hawthorne
Gideon Mizrah
fhv/fhvc.text: While you control Gideon Mizrah, you have 1 additional accessory slot. [action] [action]: Parley. ([codex] 6). Forced - After Gideon Mizrah is defeated: Set him aside, out of play. In your Campaign Log, decrease his Relationship Level.

fhv/fhvc.name: Judith Park
fhv/fhvc.text: While you control Judith Park, you may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used to fight. [action] Spend X resources, where X is the current day number: Parley. ([codex] 7). Forced - After Judith Park is defeated: Set her aside, out of play. In your Campaign Log, decrease her Relationship Level.

[action] Choose and discard X cards from your hand, where X is the current day number: Parley. ([codex] 8). Forced - After Theo Peters is defeated: Set him aside, out of play. In your Campaign Log, decrease his Relationship Level.

fhv/fhvc.name: Bertie Musgrave
fhv/fhvc.text: While you control Bertie Musgrave, you get +1 health and + 1 sanity [fast] Take either 1 damage or 1 horror and exhaust Bertie Musgrave: Parley. Draw 1 card ([codex] Ω). Forced - After Bertie Musgrave is defeated: Set him aside, out of play.

fhv/fhvc.flavor: "If it's survival of the fittest, I intend to survive."
fhv/fhvc.name: Dr. Rosa Marquez
fhv/fhvc.text: While you control Dr. Rosa Marquez, you get +1 [intellect] and +1 [agility]. [reaction] After you discover the last clue at your location ([codex] Ω).

fhv/fhvc.flavor: "Change is inevitable. The question is how we weather it."
fhv/fhvc.name: Helen Peters
fhv/fhvc.text: (Day [day]) you get +1 [combat]. (Night [night]) you get +1 [agility]. [reaction] After you enter a location, exhaust Helen Peters and deal 1 damage to her: Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location and automatically evade it.

fhv/fhvc.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is 1 more than the current day number.
[cultist]: -1. If this is a parley attempt, treat this token's modifier as a +1, instead.
[tablet]: -4. If you have fewer than 2 cards in hand, treat this token's modifier as -2 instead.

fhv/fhvc.flavor: The stone is worn and smooth.
fhv/fhvc.name: Worry Rock
fhv/fhvc.text:
Fast.
[reaction] When a scenario card effect discards Worry Rock from your hand: Draw 3 cards. (Limit once per game.)

fhv/fhvc.flavor: A traditional Abenaki doll made to look like Mother Rachel.
fhv/fhvc.name: Corn Husk Doll
fhv/fhvc.text:
Fast. Uses (3 wishes).
[reaction] When a [skull] or [tablet] token is revealed at your location, spend 1 wish and exhaust Corn Husk Doll: Treat that token as a [cultist] token instead.

fhv/fhvc.name: The Pearl Diary
fhv/fhvc.text: (Day [day]) You get +1 [intellect]. (Night [night]) You get +1 [willpower]. [reaction] After an investigator at your location draws a [[Blight]] or [[Power]] card from the encounter deck, exhaust The Pearl Diary: That investigator draws 1 card.

fhv/fhvp.back_flavor: Wilson takes pride in always having the right tool for the job. Leaky plumbing? Pipe wrench. Fallen tree? Hand saw. Interior remodeling? Sledgehammer. But recently his jobs in and around Arkham have taken on a certain strangeness. Creaky floorboards give way to labyrinthine tunnels. A broken roof shows signs of bursting outward instead of collapsing inward. It's Wilson's job to fix problems, and when those problems involve bizarre and horrifying creatures and unexplained phenomena, well, then it's time to get creative with what he's got.
fhv/fhvp.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: [[Tool]] cards level 0-5, Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-4, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 5 other [[Improvised]] and/or [[Upgrade]] cards level 0-1. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Ad Hoc, Hasty Repairs, 1 random basic weakness.
fhv/fhvp.name: Wilson Richards
fhv/fhvp.text:
Reduce the resource cost of the first [[Tool]] asset you play each round by 1.
You get +1 skill value during skill tests on [[Tool]] assets.
[elder_sign] effect: +0. You may swap a [[Tool]] asset in your play area with a [[Tool]] asset in your hand with equal or lower printed cost.

fhv/fhvp.flavor: "This is one heckuva job."
fhv/fhvp.name: Ad Hoc
fhv/fhvp.text:
Wilson Richards deck only.
Attach Ad Hoc to a [[Tool]] or [[Weapon]] asset you control.
[reaction] After resolving an [action] ability on attached asset, exhaust Ad Hoc and discard a [[Tool]] or [[Weapon]] asset from your hand: Resolve an [action] ability on the discarded asset, ignoring all costs.

fhv/fhvp.name: Hasty Repairs
fhv/fhvp.text: Revelation - Put Hasty Repairs into play in your threat area. While triggering abilities on assets you control, set your base skill value to 0. [action] [action]: Discard Hasty Repairs.

fhv/fhvp.back_flavor: Kate Winthrop has spent years researching in the basement of Miskatonic University's science building, passing up funding and academic prestige in pursuit of progress. Her single-minded focus finally paid off with the invention of the Flux Stabilizer: a powerful device capable of channeling a new form of energy. However, the price of progress is steep. The first successful test of this groundbreaking invention took the life of her friend and mentor Professor Young. Since then, Kate has worked tirelessly to understand these alien currents, in hopes that she find a way to reverse their effects.
fhv/fhvp.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-5, [[Science]] cards level 0-4, [[Insight]] cards level 0-1, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Flux Stabilizer, Failed Experiment, 1 random basic weakness.
fhv/fhvp.name: Kate Winthrop
fhv/fhvp.text: You begin the game with Flux Stabilizer (Inactive) side faceup. [fast]: Move 1 clue from Kate Winthrop to a [[Science]] or [[Tool]] asset you control with no clues on it. Forced - When an asset you control with a clue on it leaves play: Place its clue on your location. [elder_sign] effect: +0. You may move I clue from an asset you control back to Kate Winthrop.

fhv/fhvp.name: Flux Stabilizer
fhv/fhvp.text: Permanent. Kate Winthrop deck only. Forced - After a clue is placed on Flux Stabilizer: Search your bonded cards or discard pile for 1 copy of Aetheric Current and shuffle it into your deck. Flip Flux Stabilizer (keeping all tokens and attachments).

fhv/fhvp.flavor: Is this the same energy harnessed by Nikola Tesla?
fhv/fhvp.name: Flux Stabilizer
fhv/fhvp.text:
Permanent. Kate Winthrop deck only.
[reaction] When you place a clue on an asset you control: Get +2 skill value for your next skill test this phase.

fhv/fhvp.name: Aetheric Current
fhv/fhvp.text: Bonded (Flux Stabilizer). Play only if Flux Stabilizer is on its (Active) side. Fight. Move all clues on assets you control to Kate Winthrop. For this attack, you may use [intellect] instead of [combat]. If you succeed and the attacked enemy is non-[[Elite]], you may exhaust it and move it to any location. Draw 1 card. Flip Flux Stabilizer (keeping all tokens and attachments).

fhv/fhvp.name: Aetheric Current
fhv/fhvp.text: Bonded (Flux Stabilizer). Play only if Flux Stabilizer is on its (Active) side. Evade. Move all clues on assets you control to Kate Winthrop. For this evasion attempt, you may use [intellect] instead of [agility]. If you succeed and the target of this evasion is non-[[Elite]], shuffle it into the encounter deck. Draw 1 card. Flip Flux Stabilizer (keeping all tokens and attachments).

fhv/fhvp.flavor: "I've made a huge mistake."
fhv/fhvp.name: Failed Experiment
fhv/fhvp.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). This test gets +1 difficulty for each asset you control with a clue on it. For each point you fail by, you must either take 1 horror or place 1 of your clues on your location.

fhv/fhvp.back_flavor: Alessandra's life of carefree luxury enables her to hop from a stately gala in New York City to a banquet with the Maharaja of India with ease. The Countess has sampled every dish, drink, and dame from Marrakesh to Chicago. The regal title is just an act, however: behind the scenes, Alessandra uses her cover to pilfer from art galleries, banks, and the hearts and pocketbooks of the rich and frivolous. Her silver tongue has gotten her into and out of plenty of trouble. A new job with the shadowy Zamacona brought Alessandra to Arkham, Massachusetts, where the Countess learned that more lurks beyond the suggestible rich and frivolous excess than she previously thought.
fhv/fhvp.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-5, cards with "parley" level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): 3 copies of Beguile, Zamacona, 1 random basic weakness.
fhv/fhvp.flavor: "I love a good party."
fhv/fhvp.name: Alessandra Zorzi
fhv/fhvp.text:
You may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used to parley.
[elder_sign] effect: +2. If you succeed, choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location or at a revealed connecting location. Automatically evade that enemy.

fhv/fhvp.name: Beguile
fhv/fhvp.text: Alessandra Zorzi deck only. Fast. Play only during your turn. Attach Beguile to a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location. [action]: Parley. Either move attached enemy to a revealed connecting location, or perform a basic investigate or evade action at its location. If you fail a skill test while resolving this ability, discard Beguile. You may activate this ability from any location.

fhv/fhvp.name: Zamacona
fhv/fhvp.text: Elusive. Spawn - Nearest empty location, if able. Alessandra Zorzi cannot parley with Zamacona. Forced - The first time Alessandra Zorzi parleys each round: Place 1 doom on Zamacona.

fhv/fhvp.back_flavor: Everyone in the Arkham Historical Society recognizes Kōhaku's booming laughter, and the haunting tales he tells of both the yōkai from his childhood home outside Tokyo and the strange creatures that haunt the Arkham Woods. The eccentric folklorist tells everyone that the chronicling and publication of these phenomena's existence will be his greatest work. It is only when he is home with his partner Gabriel that he hears the cries of the same spirit who haunted his father, and fears that his "greatest work" will never allow him a night's sleep.
fhv/fhvp.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: [[Blessed]] cards level 0-5, [[Cursed]] cards level 0-5, [[Occult]] cards level 0, Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Book of Living Myths, Weeping Yurei, 1 random basic weakness.
fhv/fhvp.flavor: "Why not greet the unknown with wonder rather than fear?"
fhv/fhvp.name: Kōhaku Narukami
fhv/fhvp.text: [reaction] At the start of your turn: Either add 1 [bless] token or 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag, whichever there are fewer of (in case of a tie, you choose), or remove 2 [bless] tokens and 2 [curse] tokens from the chaos bag to take an additional action this turn. [elder_sign] effect: +2. Add 1 [bless] and 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag.

fhv/fhvp.name: Book of Living Myths
fhv/fhvp.text: Kōhaku Narukami deck only. [reaction] When a chaos token would be revealed at your location, exhaust Book of Living Myths: Search the chaos bag for a [bless] or [curse] token, whichever there are more of (in case of a tie, you choose), and resolve it instead.

fhv/fhvp.name: Weeping Yurei
fhv/fhvp.text: Aloof. Elusive. Hunter. Prey - Kōhaku Narukami only. Forced - After an investigator reveals a [bless] token or [curse] token during a skill test at Weeping Yurei's location, if it is ready: Weeping Yurei attacks that investigator. (Limit once per test).

fhv/fhvp.back_flavor: Growing up on a farm, Hank Samson did all the chores Ma and Pa told him to do, including taking care of his brothers and sisters. When Pa showed him the strange animals in the city stockyard, Hank felt uneasy, but he did as he was told. When Pa told him to wait, he waited. And when Pa didn't come back, Hank went to find him. Pa taught him that family is everything, and you don't just leave family behind.
fhv/fhvp.back_text: Deck Size: 35. Deckbuilding Options: Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 10 other [[Innate]] and/or [[Spirit]] cards level 0-2. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Stouthearted, "Where's Pa?", 1 random basic weakness.
fhv/fhvp.name: Hank Samson
fhv/fhvp.text:
You may be assigned damage/horror dealt to [[Ally]] assets or other investigators at your location.
[reaction] When you would be defeated by damage and/or horror: Instead, heal all of your damage and horror and swap this card with its bonded [[Resolute]] version, either side faceup.
[elder_sign] effect: +1.

fhv/fhvp.name: Hank Samson
fhv/fhvp.text:
Bonded (Hank Samson).
You cannot be healed. You may be assigned damage/horror dealt to [[Ally]] assets or other investigators at your location.
[reaction] When 1 or more horror is placed on you: Draw 1 card.
[elder_sign] effect: +1. Move 1 horror from Hank Samson to an asset you control.

fhv/fhvp.name: Hank Samson
fhv/fhvp.text:
Bonded (Hank Samson).
You cannot be healed. You may be assigned damage/horror dealt to [[Ally]] assets or other investigators at your location.
[reaction] When 1 or more damage is placed on you: Gain 2 resources.
[elder_sign] effect: +1. Move 1 damage from Hank Samson to an asset you control.

fhv/fhvp.flavor: Everyone is a hero to someone.
fhv/fhvp.name: Stouthearted
fhv/fhvp.text:
Hank Samson deck only.
Fast. Play when you engage a non-[[Elite]] enemy.
Move up to 2 damage and/or horror from Hank Samson to that enemy, as damage.

fhv/fhvp.name: "Where's Pa?"
fhv/fhvp.text: Revelation - Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. Attach "Where's Pa?" to that enemy and spawn it at a connecting location, if able. Attached enemy gains elusive. Forced - At the end of the round: Hank Samson takes 1 direct horror.

fhv/fhvp.flavor: Never forget those who came before.
fhv/fhvp.name: Ancestral Token
fhv/fhvp.text: [reaction] After you defeat an enemy, exhaust Ancestral Token: Add [bless] tokens to the chaos bag equal to that enemy's printed health (max 5).

fhv/fhvp.flavor:
"It cleans! It fixes! It picks, plucks, shines, and swishes!"
-Schoffner's Catalogue, Winter 1924 ed.
fhv/fhvp.name: Cleaning Kit
fhv/fhvp.text:
Uses (3 supplies).
Supplies on Cleaning Kit may be spent as if they were supplies or ammo on assets you control.

fhv/fhvp.name: Katana
fhv/fhvp.text: [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this test. If you succeed by exactly 2, you may exhaust Katana to deal +2 damage for this attack. [fast]Exhaust Katana: Fight. Use [agility] instead of [combat] for this attack.

fhv/fhvp.name: Ofuda
fhv/fhvp.text:
Uses (1 charge). Replenish this charge the first time a [bless] token is revealed at your location each round.
[fast] Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location and spend 1 charge: That enemy loses the alert, aloof, elusive, and retaliate keywords until the end of the round.

fhv/fhvp.name: Wolf Mask
fhv/fhvp.text:
Limit 1 [[Mask]] per investigator.
Uses (2 offerings). Replenish 1 of these offerings after you engage an enemy.
[fast] Spend 1 offering: You get +2 [combat] or +2 [agility] for this skill test. (Limit once per test.)

fhv/fhvp.name: Absolution
fhv/fhvp.text:
Reveal 3 random tokens from the chaos bag, along with X additional tokens.
For each non-symbol token revealed, add 1 [bless] token to the chaos bag. For each [bless] token revealed, heal 1 horror from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset at your location.

fhv/fhvp.name: Guided by Faith
fhv/fhvp.text: Investigate. You may use [willpower] instead of [intellect] for this investigation. Before revealing chaos tokens for this test, add 2 [bless] tokens to the chaos bag. If a [bless] or [elder_sign] token is revealed during this skill test, discover 1 additional clue at your location.

fhv/fhvp.flavor: "H-hands where I can see 'em!"
fhv/fhvp.name: Hold Up
fhv/fhvp.text: Parley. Choose an enemy at your location and an [[Item]] asset in your hand. Perform a fight action against the chosen enemy. If you succeed, instead of dealing damage, play the chosen asset, reducing its cost by each point you succeeded by.

fhv/fhvp.name: Task Force
fhv/fhvp.text:
As an additional cost to play Task Force, spend an action. One at a time, in any order, choose an investigator at your location to...
- ...resolve an [action] ability on an asset they control without paying its [action] cost.
- ...move to a connecting location.
- ...discover 1 clue at their location.

fhv/fhvp.flavor: "You still call that a wrench?!"
fhv/fhvp.name: Tinker
fhv/fhvp.text:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Attach Tinker to a [[Tool]] asset in your play area. Limit 1 per asset.
Attached asset takes up 1 fewer hand or accessory slot.

fhv/fhvp.name: Purified
fhv/fhvp.text:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
You may commit Purified to any type of test.
If this test is successful, for each point you succeeded by (to a maximum of 5), add 1 [bless] token or remove 1 [curse] token from the chaos bag.

fhv/fhvp.flavor: Keep your eyes on the target.
fhv/fhvp.name: Hand-Eye Coordination
fhv/fhvp.text:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Resolve an [action] ability on a [[Tool]] or [[Weapon]] asset you control without paying its [action] cost.

fhv/fhvp.name: Strong-Armed
fhv/fhvp.text: While Strong-Armed is committed to an attack using a [[Melee]] or [[Ranged]] asset, this attack deals +1 damage. After revealing chaos token(s) for this skill test, you may take 1 damage to cancel that chaos token, return it to the chaos bag, and reveal a new one. (You may do this any number of times.)

fhv/fhvp.name: Second Wind
fhv/fhvp.text:
Play only as your first action.
Heal 2 damage (3 damage instead if you drew a treachery this round). Draw 1 card.

fhv/fhvp.name: Cleaning Kit
fhv/fhvp.text:
Uses (4 supplies).
Supplies on Cleaning Kit may be spent as if they were supplies or ammo on assets you control.
[reaction] When a supply is spent from Cleaning Kit, exhaust it: The performing investigator gets +2 skill value for this test.

fhv/fhvp.name: Blessed Blade
fhv/fhvp.text: [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. If this attack is successful, it deals +1 damage. Return each [bless] token revealed during this attack to the chaos bag. Before revealing chaos token(s) for this attack, you may exhaust Blessed Blade to add 2 [bless] tokens to the chaos bag.

fhv/fhvp.name: Eyes of Valusia
fhv/fhvp.text: [action]: Parley. Choose an enemy at your location. Until the end of the round, each investigator gets +1 skill value while fighting, evading, or parleying with the chosen enemy. Place 1 resource on Eyes of Valusia, as a charge. [fast]: Search your bonded cards for Blade of Yoth and swap it with Eyes of Valusia, moving all charges from Eyes of Valusia to Blade of Yoth.

fhv/fhvp.name: Blade of Yoth
fhv/fhvp.text: Bonded (Eyes of Valusia). [action] Spend 1-3 charges: Fight. For this attack, you may use [willpower] instead of [combat]. You get +2 skill value and deal +1 damage for each charge spent as part of this action's cost. [fast]: Search your bonded cards for Eyes of Valusia and swap it with Blade of Yoth, discarding all charges.

fhv/fhvp.name: Flurry of Blows
fhv/fhvp.text: Play only if you control a [[Melee]] asset. As an additional cost to play Flurry of Blows, spend an action. Fight. Choose a [[Melee]] asset you control and take an immediate fight action with that asset (without paying its [action] cost). You may repeat this effect up to three times. After the final attack resolves, if it is your turn, end your turn.

fhv/fhvp.name: Miracle Wish
fhv/fhvp.text:
Fast. Play after 1 or more [bless] tokens are revealed during a skill test at your location.
Search your bonded cards for Evanescent Ascension and put it into play. Place up to X resources on it, as wishes (to a maximum of the number of [bless] tokens revealed). Remove Miracle Wish from the game.

fhv/fhvp.name: Evanescent Ascension
fhv/fhvp.text: Bonded (Miracle Wish). If Evanescent Ascension has no wishes, set it aside, out of play. [reaction] When an investigator at your location would fail a skill test, spend 1 wish and exhaust Evanescent Ascension: Resolve that investigator's [elder_sign] effect (in addition to all other tokens revealed during this test).

fhv/fhvp.name: Chemistry Set
fhv/fhvp.text: [action] Exhaust Chemistry Set: Investigate. If you... - ...fail by exactly 2, discard Chemistry Set. - ...succeed by exactly 0, gain 2 resources. - ...succeed by exactly 2, draw 1 card. - ...succeed by exactly 4, discover 1 additional clue at your location.

fhv/fhvp.name: Dr. Charles West III
fhv/fhvp.text:
You have 1 additional hand slot, which can only be used to hold a [[Tool]] asset.
[reaction] After you successfully investigate by exactly 1 or 3, exhaust Dr. Charles West III: Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location.

fhv/fhvp.name: Microscope
fhv/fhvp.text: [reaction] After an enemy at your location is successfully evaded or defeated, exhaust Microscope: Place 1 resource on Microscope, as evidence. [action] [action]: Investigate. You get +1 [intellect] for this investigation for each evidence on Microscope (max +3 [intellect]). If you succeed, you may spend up to 2 evidence to discover that many additional clues at your location.

fhv/fhvp.name: Mouse Mask
fhv/fhvp.text:
Limit 1 [[Mask]] per investigator.
Uses (2 offerings). Replenish 1 of these offerings after you reveal a location or put a new location into play.
[fast] Spend 1 offering: You get +2 [willpower] or +2 [intellect] for this skill test. (Limit once per test.)

fhv/fhvp.name: Ravenous Myconid
fhv/fhvp.text:
Limit 1 per deck.
[action]: Search your bonded cards for Uncanny Growth and add it to your hand.
[action] If Ravenous Myconid has 3 or more growth on it: Move each growth to your resource pool, as resources. Record in your Campaign Log that "you have classified a new species."

fhv/fhvp.name: Uncanny Growth
fhv/fhvp.text: Bonded (Ravenous Myconid). Investigate. After this test resolves, place 1 resource on Ravenous Myconid, as growth, for each point you succeed by. Set Uncanny Growth aside, out of play. If you fail, return Uncanny Growth to your hand.

fhv/fhvp.flavor: "There was a solution which he injected into the veins of dead things, and if they were fresh enough they responded in strange ways." -H.P. Lovecraft, Herbert West - Reanimator
fhv/fhvp.name: Control Variable
fhv/fhvp.text:
Fast. Play after an investigator reveals a [curse] token during a skill test at your location.
Discover 1 clue at your location.

fhv/fhvp.name: Testing Sprint
fhv/fhvp.text: As an additional cost to play Testing Sprint, spend an action. Investigate. One at a time, investigate your location and each connecting location once each in ascending order of shroud, until you either fail to investigate or successfully investigate each eligible location.

fhv/fhvp.flavor: The truth is often hidden in plain sight.
fhv/fhvp.name: Thorough Inquiry
fhv/fhvp.text: As an additional cost to play Thorough Inquiry, spend an action. Investigators at your location draw a combined total of 5 cards (you decide how many cards each investigator draws).

fhv/fhvp.flavor: "Kid, you... you took that a lot more literally than I expected you to."
fhv/fhvp.name: "Throw the Book at Them!"
fhv/fhvp.text: Fight. Choose a [[Tome]] asset you control. You get +X [combat] for this attack, where X is that asset's printed cost. If you succeed, you may either automatically evade the attacked enemy, or after the attack ends, you may resolve an [action] or [fast] ability on the chosen asset (ignoring its [action] cost, if any).

fhv/fhvp.flavor: "I said 'blow it up,' not '<u>blow</u> it up!"
fhv/fhvp.name: Transmogrify
fhv/fhvp.text: Evade. You may use [intellect] instead of [agility] for this evasion attempt. If you succeed and the enemy is non-[[Elite]], attach Transmogrify to it. Attached enemy gains: "Massive. Cannot move. [reaction] After you evade this enemy: Discover 1 clue at its location. (Limit once per round.)"

fhv/fhvp.flavor: Every cent of that research grant counts.
fhv/fhvp.name: Well-Funded
fhv/fhvp.text: While you control a [[Science]] or [[Tool]] asset, Well-Funded gains [wild] (while you control 3 or more [[Science]] and/or [[Tool]] assets, Well-Funded gains [wild] [wild], instead).

fhv/fhvp.flavor: "Helping you is easier than teaching my students geometry."
fhv/fhvp.name: Gabriel Carillo
fhv/fhvp.text:
You get +1 [intellect].
[reaction] At the start of your turn, add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag: Draw 1 card.

fhv/fhvp.flavor: A nick can be the difference between life and death.
fhv/fhvp.name: Steady-Handed
fhv/fhvp.text:
Limit 1 per investigator.
[reaction] When you would succeed at a skill test, exhaust Steady-Handed: You either succeed by 1 more or 1 less. If you succeeded by exactly 2, heal 1 horror.

fhv/fhvp.flavor: "I assure you there's nothing to fear!"
fhv/fhvp.name: Fine Tuning
fhv/fhvp.text:
Attach to a [[Tool]] or [[Science]] asset you control. Limit 1 per asset.
[reaction] After attached asset exhausts, exhaust Fine Tuning: Ready attached asset.

fhv/fhvp.flavor: Rumor has it the university's last phrenology professor enjoyed an unnaturally long tenure.
fhv/fhvp.name: Esoteric Method
fhv/fhvp.text: After this skill test ends, add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag for each point the performing investigator either succeeded or failed by.

fhv/fhvp.name: Prismatic Spectacles
fhv/fhvp.text: [action] Add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag: Investigate. You get +2 skill value for this investigation. If a [curse] token is revealed during this investigation, you may exhaust Prismatic Spectacles to discover 1 additional clue at your location.

fhv/fhvp.flavor: "It'll never work, Herbert."
fhv/fhvp.name: Confound
fhv/fhvp.text: Parley. Choose an enemy at your location. Test [intellect] (X), where X is the chosen enemy's evade value. If you succeed, discover 2 clues at your location. Then, if the chosen enemy is non-[[Elite]], automatically evade it. It does not ready during the next upkeep phase.

fhv/fhvp.name: Microscope
fhv/fhvp.text: [reaction] After an enemy at your location is successfully evaded or defeated: Place 1 resource on Microscope, as evidence. [action] [action]: Investigate. You get +2 [intellect] for this investigation for each evidence on Microscope (max +6 [intellect]). If you succeed, you may spend up to 3 evidence to discover that many additional clues at your location.

fhv/fhvp.name: Ravenous Myconid
fhv/fhvp.text:
Researched. Limit 1 per deck.
[fast]: Search your bonded cards for Uncanny Growth and add it to your hand. (Limit once per round.)
[reaction] When an investigator draws a non-weakness treachery card, if their locations shroud is equal to or less than Ravenous Myconid's growth: Cancel that treachery's effects and discard it. Remove all growth from Ravenous Myconid.

fhv/fhvp.name: Ravenous Myconid
fhv/fhvp.text:
Researched. Limit 1 per deck.
[fast]: Search your bonded cards for Uncanny Growth and add it to your hand. (Limit once per round.)
[fast] Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location with equal or fewer remaining health than the amount of growth on Ravenous Myconid: Defeat that enemy. Remove all growth from Ravenous Myconid.

fhv/fhvp.name: Ravenous Myconid
fhv/fhvp.text:
Researched. Limit 1 per deck.
[fast]: Search your bonded cards for Uncanny Growth and add it to your hand. (Limit once per round.)
[fast] Remove all growth from Ravenous Myconid: Either heal that much damage/horror from Ravenous Myconid, or move that much damage/horror from investigators or [[Ally]] assets at your location to Ravenous Myconid.

fhv/fhvp.name: Bianca "Die Katz"
fhv/fhvp.text: Limit 1 per deck. Uses (10 resources). [action] Exhaust Bianca "Die Katz": Parley. Move X resources from Bianca "Die Katz" to your resource pool. X cannot be more than 5. Test [agility] (X). If you fail, remember "you owe Bianca X resources." Then, search your bonded cards for the Bianca "Die Katz" enemy and spawn her at your location. Remove this card from the game.

fhv/fhvp.name: Bianca "Die Katz"
fhv/fhvp.text: Bonded (Bianca "Die Katz"). Hunter. Prey - Bearer only. [action] If "you owe Bianca X resources," spend X resources: Parley. Add Bianca "Die Katz" to the victory display. Forced - When Bianca "Die Katz" leaves play (except by the above ability): Shuffle her into your deck.

fhv/fhvp.name: Blackmail File
fhv/fhvp.text: [action] Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location: Parley. Test [willpower] (X), where X is that enemy's printed health value. If you succeed, that enemy disengages from each investigator and gains aloof until the end of the round.

fhv/fhvp.name: British Bull Dog
fhv/fhvp.text: Uses (3 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You may use [agility] instead of [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. [reaction] After you fail a skill test while parleying with an enemy: Put British Bull Dog into play from your hand.

fhv/fhvp.name: Fake Credentials
fhv/fhvp.text: [action] Choose an enemy at your location and exhaust Fake Credentials: Parley. Test [intellect] (1). This test gets +1 difficulty for each suspicion on Fake Credentials. If you succeed, discover 1 clue at your location and place 1 resource on Fake Credentials, as suspicion. If you fail, you must either discard Fake Credentials, or the chosen enemy attacks you.

fhv/fhvp.name: Fox Mask
fhv/fhvp.text:
Limit 1 [[Mask]] per investigator.
Uses (2 offerings). Replenish 1 of these offerings after you move out of a location with an enemy.
[fast] Spend 1 offering: You get +2 [intellect] or +2 [agility] for this skill test. (Limit once per test.)

fhv/fhvp.flavor: "Let faith oust fact; let fancy oust memory; I look deep down and do believe." - Herman Melville, <u>Moby-Dick</u>
fhv/fhvp.name: Scrimshaw Charm
fhv/fhvp.text: [action] Add 1-3 [curse] tokens to the chaos bag and exhaust Scrimshaw Charm: Gain 1 resource. For each token added, gain 1 additional resource.

fhv/fhvp.flavor:
"No names, Skids."
"Sorry, Finn."
fhv/fhvp.name: Bank Job
fhv/fhvp.text:
As an additional cost to play Bank Job, spend an action.
Investigators at your location gain a total of 8 resources, distributed as you wish.

fhv/fhvp.flavor: "You'd have made a pretty good cowboy."
fhv/fhvp.name: False Surrender
fhv/fhvp.text: Parley. Choose an enemy at your location and play a [[Weapon]] asset from your hand, reducing its cost by 1. You may then take a fight action with that weapon against the chosen enemy, using [agility] instead of the skill indicated.

fhv/fhvp.flavor:
"Look! A dumb bird!"
"I don't see a bird."
"I do."
fhv/fhvp.name: Grift
fhv/fhvp.text: Parley. Choose an enemy at your location and test [agility] (0). For each point you succeed by, gain 1 resource (to a maximum of 6). If you fail, that enemy attacks you.

fhv/fhvp.name: "I'll Pay You Back!"
fhv/fhvp.text:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Choose another investigator at your location. Move all resources from that investigator's resource pool to your resource pool. At the end of the round, move all resources from your resource pool to that investigator's resource pool.

fhv/fhvp.flavor: "He <u>did</u> say something about your hair..."
fhv/fhvp.name: Stir the Pot
fhv/fhvp.text: Parley. Choose an enemy at your location and test [intellect] (X), where X is the chosen enemy's combined damage and horror values. If you succeed, deal 2 damage to each enemy at your location. If you succeed by 2 or more, after this effect resolves you may disengage from each enemy and move to a connecting location.

fhv/fhvp.name: Vamp
fhv/fhvp.text: Parley. Choose an enemy at your location and test any skill (3). If you succeed and you tested... - ...[willpower], remove 1 doom from that enemy. - ...[intellect], discover 1 clue at your location. - ...[agility], automatically evade that enemy. If it is non-[[Elite]], move it to a connecting location. - ...[combat], deal 2 damage to that enemy.

fhv/fhvp.flavor: "Shoggoths. Why did it have to be shoggoths?"
fhv/fhvp.name: Diabolical Luck
fhv/fhvp.text: When you reveal a [curse] token during a skill test you are performing, you may commit Diabolical Luck to that skill test from your hand. If you do, Diabolical Luck gains [wild][wild][wild].

fhv/fhvp.flavor: "I never ran from anything like that devil tonight, though. Hope I never have to again." -Rita Young, Investigators of Arkham Horror
fhv/fhvp.name: Lightfooted
fhv/fhvp.text: If this skill test is successful during an evasion attempt, you may automatically evade another enemy at your location.

fhv/fhvp.name: British Bull Dog
fhv/fhvp.text: Uses (3 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You may use [agility] instead of [combat] for this attack and you get +2 skill value. This attack deals +1 damage. Ignore the aloof keyword for this attack. [reaction] After you fail a skill test while parleying with an enemy: Put British Bull Dog into play from your hand.

fhv/fhvp.flavor: "I shouldn't be telling you this, but since you seem trustworthy..."
fhv/fhvp.name: Snitch
fhv/fhvp.text:
Fast. Play after you succeed at a skill test while parleying.
Discover 2 total clues from among your location and connecting locations.

fhv/fhvp.name: Bewitching
fhv/fhvp.text:
Permanent. Exceptional.
[reaction] Before you draw your opening hand: Search your deck for up to 3 different [[Trick]] cards, and attach them facedown to Bewitching. Shuffle your deck.
[reaction] When you engage an enemy, exhaust Bewitching: Either draw 1 attached card, or search the top 9 cards of your deck for a copy of an attached card, draw it, and shuffle your deck.

fhv/fhvp.name: Dirty Deeds
fhv/fhvp.text: As an additional cost to play Dirty Deeds, spend an action. Search your deck for an [[Illicit]] asset and play it, paying its cost. Then, you may resolve an [action] or [fast] ability on that asset, ignoring all costs (including its [action] cost, if any). Playing this card does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

fhv/fhvp.name: Vamp
fhv/fhvp.text: Parley. Choose an enemy at your location and any number of skills. One at a time, in any order, test each chosen skill (2). For each test you succeeded, if it was... - ...[willpower], remove 1 doom from that enemy. - ...[intellect], discover 1 clue at that enemy's location. - ...[agility], automatically evade that enemy. Move it to a connecting location if it is non-[[Elite]]. - ...[combat], deal 2 damage to that enemy.

fhv/fhvp.name: Fake Credentials
fhv/fhvp.text: [action] Choose an enemy at your location: Parley. Test [intellect](0). This test gets +1 difficulty for each suspicion on Fake Credentials. If you succeed, discover 1 clue at your location or a connecting location. If you did not succeed by 2 or more, place 1 resource on Fake Credentials, as suspicion. If you fail, return Fake Credentials to your hand.

fhv/fhvp.flavor: "...and I heard he called you stupid too!"
fhv/fhvp.name: Stir the Pot
fhv/fhvp.text: Parley. Choose an enemy at your location and test [intellect] (X), where X is the chosen enemy's combined damage/horror values. If you succeed, deal X damage to each enemy at your location. After this effect resolves, you may disengage from each enemy and move to a connecting location.

fhv/fhvp.name: Cat Mask
fhv/fhvp.text:
Limit 1 [[Mask]] per investigator.
Uses (2 offerings). Replenish 2 of these offerings after doom is placed on a card with no doom.
[fast] Spend 1 offering: You get +2 [willpower] or +2 [combat] for this skill test. (Limit once per test.)

fhv/fhvp.name: Rod of Carnamagos
fhv/fhvp.text:
Limit 1 per deck.
[fast] Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at any location and exhaust Rod of Carnamagos: Reveal 5 random chaos tokens from the chaos bag. If a [curse] token is revealed, search your bonded cards for a random [[Rot]] event and attach it to that enemy.

fhv/fhvp.name: Abyssal Rot
fhv/fhvp.text: Bonded (Rod of Carnamagos). Attached enemy cannot attack. Forced - When attached enemy leaves play: Set Abyssal Rot aside, out of play.

fhv/fhvp.name: Aember Rot
fhv/fhvp.text: Bonded (Rod of Carnamagos). Forced - When attached enemy is defeated: Gain resources equal to its printed health (to a maximum of 5). Forced - When attached enemy leaves play: Set Aember Rot aside, out of play.

fhv/fhvp.name: Putrescent Rot
fhv/fhvp.text: Bonded (Rod of Carnamagos). Attached enemy gets -1 fight and -1 evade. Forced - When attached enemy leaves play: Set Putrescent Rot aside, out of play.

fhv/fhvp.name: Scarlet Rot
fhv/fhvp.text: Bonded (Rod of Carnamagos). Forced - At the end of the round: Attached enemy takes 1 damage. Forced - When attached enemy leaves play: Set Scarlet Rot aside, out of play.

fhv/fhvp.name: Virescent Rot
fhv/fhvp.text: Bonded (Rod of Carnamagos). Attached enemy cannot move. Forced - When attached enemy leaves play: Set Virescent Rot aside, out of play.

fhv/fhvp.name: Speak to the Dead
fhv/fhvp.text: Uses (6 offerings). [action] Spend any number of offerings: Parley. Choose a [[Spell]] or [[Ritual]] event in your discard pile and reveal tokens from the chaos bag equal to the number of offerings spent. If at least 1 [skull] or [curse] token was revealed, return the chosen event to your hand.

fhv/fhvp.name: Wicked Athame
fhv/fhvp.text: [action] Add 1-3 [curse] tokens to the chaos bag: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack for each [curse] token added as part of this action's cost. If this attack defeats an enemy, replenish 1 charge or offering on an asset you control.

fhv/fhvp.name: Antediluvian Hymn
fhv/fhvp.text:
As an additional cost to play Antediluvian Hymn, spend an action.
Reveal the top 5 cards of the encounter deck. For each card revealed, you may add 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag to place that card on the bottom of the encounter deck. Return the rest to the top of the encounter deck in any order.

fhv/fhvp.flavor: What was yours is now mine.
fhv/fhvp.name: Drain Essence
fhv/fhvp.text: Parley. Choose an enemy at your location and test [willpower](X), where X is the chosen enemy's fight value. If you succeed, move 1 damage from your investigator to the chosen enemy (up to 2 damage instead if the chosen enemy is non-[[Elite]]).

fhv/fhvp.flavor: Not all who wander are lost.
fhv/fhvp.name: Accursed
fhv/fhvp.text: When you commit Accursed to a skill test, add up to 3 [curse] tokens to the chaos bag. During this skill test, treat the modifier of each [curse] token revealed as 0.

fhv/fhvp.flavor: The dreaming mind is as deep as any sea.
fhv/fhvp.name: Mesmeric Influence
fhv/fhvp.text: While this card is committed to a skill test, the performing investigator may ignore all keyword or location effects that would trigger during this test.

fhv/fhvp.flavor: You must invest yourself in every spell. Sometimes literally.
fhv/fhvp.name: Olive McBride
fhv/fhvp.text: [reaction] When you would reveal a chaos token, exhaust Olive McBride: Reveal 4 chaos tokens instead of 1. Choose 2 of those tokens to resolve, and ignore the rest.

fhv/fhvp.name: Rod of Carnamagos
fhv/fhvp.text: [fast] Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at any location and exhaust Rod of Carnamagos: Reveal 5 random chaos tokens from the chaos bag. For each [curse] token revealed, you may search your bonded cards for a [[Rot]] event and attach it to that enemy.

fhv/fhvp.name: Call the Beyond
fhv/fhvp.text:
As an additional cost to play Call the Beyond, add 3 [curse] tokens to the chaos bag.
Choose an asset you control with "uses (charges)" or "uses (secrets)". Replenish all of that asset's charges or secrets. Then, you may resolve an [action] or [fast] ability on that asset without paying its [action] cost, if any.

fhv/fhvp.name: Ethereal Form
fhv/fhvp.text: Evade. Add your [willpower] value to your skill value for this evasion attempt. If you succeed, disengage from each other enemy engaged with you, and for the remainder of the round, you are ethereal (enemies cannot engage or be engaged with you, and you cannot attack or deal damage to enemies). If a symbol was revealed during this evasion attempt, return Ethereal Form to your hand at the end of your turn.

fhv/fhvp.name: Read the Signs
fhv/fhvp.text: Investigate. Add your [willpower] value to your skill value for this investigation. You may ignore any effect or keyword on your location which would trigger during this investigation. If you succeed, discover 1 additional clue at this location. If a symbol was revealed during this investigation, return Read the Signs to your hand at the end of your turn.

fhv/fhvp.name: Spectral Razor
fhv/fhvp.text: Fight. Add your [willpower] value to your skill value for this attack. Immediately before this attack, you may engage the attacked enemy. This attack deals +1 damage (+2 damage instead if the enemy is non-[[Elite]]). If a symbol was revealed during this attack, return Spectral Razor to your hand at the end of your turn.

fhv/fhvp.name: Ethereal Weaving
fhv/fhvp.text:
As an additional cost to play Ethereal Weaving, spend an action.
Reveal up to 3 different [[Spell]] events from your hand. One at a time, play each revealed event, reducing its cost by 1. While resolving each of these events, you get +2 skill value.

fhv/fhvp.name: The Key of Solomon
fhv/fhvp.text:
[fast] If there are more [bless] than [curse] tokens in the chaos bag, remove 1 [bless] token from the chaos bag and exhaust The Key of Solomon: Heal up to 2 damage and/or horror from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset at your location.
[fast] If there are more [curse] than [bless] tokens in the chaos bag, remove 1 [curse] token from the chaos bag and exhaust The Key of Solomon: Gain 2 resources.

fhv/fhvp.name: Seal of the Elders
fhv/fhvp.text:
Fast. Play after a skill test at your location ends in which at least 2 [curse] tokens or 2 [bless] tokens were revealed.
If 2 [curse] tokens were revealed, search your bonded cards for 1 copy of Servant of Brass and put it into play. If 2 [bless] tokens were revealed, search your bonded cards for Keeper of the Key and put it into play. If 2 [curse] tokens and 2 [bless] tokens were revealed, do both instead. Remove Seal of the Elders from the game.

fhv/fhvp.name: Keeper of the Key
fhv/fhvp.text: Bonded (Seal of the Elders). [reaction] When a [bless] token is revealed during a skill test at your location: Deal 1 horror to Keeper of the Key and discover 1 clue at your location or a connecting location. Forced - When Keeper of the Key would leave play: Set it aside, out of play.

fhv/fhvp.name: Servant of Brass
fhv/fhvp.text: Bonded (Seal of the Elders). [reaction] When a [curse] token is revealed during a skill test at your location: Deal 1 damage to Servant of Brass and 2 damage to an enemy at your location or a connecting location. Forced - When Servant of Brass would leave play: Set it aside, out of play.

fhv/fhvp.name: Matchbox
fhv/fhvp.text:
Uses (3 supplies). If Matchbox has no supplies, discard it.
[fast] During any investigator's turn, exhaust Matchbox and spend 1 supply: Your location gets -1 shroud until the end of this turn.

fhv/fhvp.name: Pelt Shipment
fhv/fhvp.text:
While Pelt Shipment is in your hand, your maximum hand size is reduced by 3.
[reaction] When the game ends or you resign, if Pelt Shipment is in your hand: Reduce the experience cost of the next new card you purchase before the next scenario by 1.

fhv/fhvp.name: Pitchfork
fhv/fhvp.text: [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] and deal +2 damage for this attack. If this attack is successful, lose control of Pitchfork and attach it to your location. Your location gains: "[action]: Take control of Pitchfork. Any investigator at Pitchfork's location may trigger this ability."

fhv/fhvp.name: Sparrow Mask
fhv/fhvp.text:
Limit 1 [[Mask]] per investigator.
Uses (2 offerings). Replenish 1 of these offerings after you take 1 or more damage and/or horror.
[fast] Spend 1 offering: You get +2 [willpower] or +2 [agility] for this skill test. (Limit once per test.)

fhv/fhvp.name: Elaborate Distraction
fhv/fhvp.text: As an additional cost to play Elaborate Distraction, spend an action. Playing Elaborate Distraction does not provoke attacks of opportunity. For each enemy at your location and at each connecting location (choose one): - Automatically evade that enemy if it is non-[[Elite]]. - Deal 1 damage to that enemy.

fhv/fhvp.name: Pushed to the Limit
fhv/fhvp.text: Choose a [[Weapon]] or [[Tool]] asset in your discard pile. Resolve an [action] ability on that asset, ignoring all costs (including its [action] cost). After this effect resolves, shuffle the chosen asset into your deck. Playing this card does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

fhv/fhvp.name: Stall for Time
fhv/fhvp.text: Parley. Choose an enemy at your location. Test [willpower] (X), where X is the chosen enemy's fight or evade value, whichever is lower. If you succeed, exhaust the chosen enemy (but do not disengage from it). If it is non-[[Elite]], it does not ready during the next upkeep phase. If you fail, return Stall for Time to your hand.

fhv/fhvp.name: Wrong Place, Right Time
fhv/fhvp.text:
As an additional cost to play Wrong Place, Right Time, spend an action.
Move up to 5 damage and/or horror from your investigator to assets controlled by investigators at your location. For each asset defeated by this effect, draw 1 card. Remove Wrong Place, Right Time from the game.

fhv/fhvp.name: Long Shot
fhv/fhvp.text:
You may commit Long Shot to a fight or evasion test against an enemy at your location or a connecting location.
If this test is successful, deal 1 damage to that enemy.

fhv/fhvp.name: Hatchet
fhv/fhvp.text: [action]: Fight. Add your [agility] to your skill value for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. If this attack defeats an enemy, discard Hatchet. Otherwise, lose control of Hatchet and attach it to the attacked enemy. Attached enemy gains: "[reaction] When attached enemy is defeated: Take control of Hatchet. Any investigator at Hatchet's location may trigger this ability."

fhv/fhvp.flavor: "Anyone but a stolid farmer would have fainted or gone mad..." - H.P. Lovecraft, <u>The Colour Out of Space</u>
fhv/fhvp.name: Persistence
fhv/fhvp.text: You may commit Persistence to a skill test from your discard pile. If you do, shuffle it into your deck after this test ends.

fhv/fhvp.flavor: I will guide thy hand.
fhv/fhvp.name: "Devil"
fhv/fhvp.text: Forced - When your turn begins: Move 1 damage from your investigator to "Devil". Forced - When "Devil" is defeated: Deal 2 damage to each enemy and investigator at your location.

fhv/fhvp.name: Fire Axe
fhv/fhvp.text: Fast. [action]: Fight. If you have no resources in your resource pool, this attack deals +1 damage. [free] During an attack using Fire Axe, spend 1 resource: You get +2 [combat] for this skill test. (Limit three times per attack.)

fhv/fhvp.name: Hunting Jacket
fhv/fhvp.text:
[fast] Exhaust Hunting Jacket: Choose 1 non-weakness card in your hand and attach it facedown to Hunting Jacket (max 3 cards attached). Then, gain 1 resource for each attached card.
[reaction] When Hunting Jacket is defeated: Draw each attached card.

fhv/fhvp.name: Mariner's Compass
fhv/fhvp.text: [action] Exhaust Mariner's Compass: Investigate. If you fail, ready Mariner's Compass. If you succeed and have no resources in your resource pool, discover 1 additional clue at your location. [fast] During an investigation using Mariner's Compass, spend 1 resource: You get +1 [intellect] for this skill test. (Limit three times per investigation.)

fhv/fhvp.name: Survival Technique
fhv/fhvp.text:
[fast] Choose a card you own that is attached to your location and exhaust Survival Technique: Add that card to your hand.
[fast] During a skill test on a location or on a treachery attached to your location, exhaust Survival Technique: You get +2 skill value for this test.

fhv/fhvp.flavor: Those who walk in faith need not fear the dark.
fhv/fhvp.name: Keep Faith
fhv/fhvp.text:
Fast. Play during any [fast] window.
Add 4 [bless] tokens to the chaos bag.

fhv/fhvp.flavor: Courage is your best defense against whatever horrors lurk beyond.
fhv/fhvp.name: Providential
fhv/fhvp.text: If this skill test is successful, add 1 [bless] token to the chaos bag for each damage or horror on you (whichever is less).

fhv/fhvp.name: Token of Faith
fhv/fhvp.text: [reaction] After a skill test ends in which 1 or more [curse] or [auto_fail] tokens were revealed, exhaust Token of Faith: Add that many [bless] tokens to the chaos bag. If this skill test failed, after resolving all effects from the failed test, the performing investigator may attempt that test again. (Max once per test.)

fhv/fhvp.name: Dark Horse
fhv/fhvp.text:
Permanent. Limit 1 per deck.
During the upkeep phase, you may choose to not gain resources.
While you have no resources in your resource pool, you get +1 [willpower], +1 [intellect], +1 [combat], and +1 [agility].

fhv/fhvp.name: Eldritch Tongue
fhv/fhvp.text:
Uses (4 charges).
You may play events with "parley" from your discard pile as if they were in your hand. As an additional cost to play an event this way, spend 1 charge from Eldritch Tongue. After that event resolves, remove it from the game.

fhv/fhvp.flavor: It's half past midnight, and you're starting to wonder if the whole thing's a ruse.
fhv/fhvp.name: Bide Your Time
fhv/fhvp.text:
As an additional cost to play Bide Your Time, spend an action.
During your next turn, you may take two additional actions.

fhv/fhvp.flavor: The fine clothes do all the talking.
fhv/fhvp.name: Well-Dressed
fhv/fhvp.text: While Well-Dressed is committed to a skill test during a parley action, it gains [wild] [wild] [wild].

fhv/fhvp.flavor: Only the strongest spirit can sunder the dark.
fhv/fhvp.name: Dawn Star
fhv/fhvp.text:
Fast. Play after revealing chaos tokens during a skill test at your location.
Ignore the modifiers of each [curse] token revealed during this test. For each [curse] token ignored, deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location.

fhv/fhvp.flavor: "The price is but a pittance for what you will gain."
fhv/fhvp.name: Occult Reliquary
fhv/fhvp.text:
Permanent. Limit 1 per deck.
You have 1 additional hand, accessory, or arcane slot, which can only be used to hold a [[Blessed]] or [[Cursed]] asset.

fhv/fhvp.name: Broken Diadem
fhv/fhvp.text:
Limit 1 per deck. Limit 1 [[Mask]] per investigator.
[reaction] After a skill test at your location ends in which both a [bless] and [curse] token were revealed: Place 1 resource on this card, as an offering. Then, if there are 3 offerings on this card, search your bonded cards for Twilight Diadem and swap it with this card, moving all offerings from this card to Twilight Diadem.

fhv/fhvp.name: Twilight Diadem
fhv/fhvp.text:
Bonded (Broken Diadem). Limit 1 [[Mask]] per investigator.
[reaction] When you reveal either a [bless] or [curse] token during a skill test, spend 1 offering and exhaust this card: Treat the revealed token as an [elder_sign] token instead, returning it to the chaos bag. Then, if this card has no offerings, search your bonded cards for Broken Diadem and swap it with this card.

fhv/fhvp.name: Maimed Hand
fhv/fhvp.text: Revelation - You must either put Maimed Hand into play in your threat area, or take 1 damage and shuffle it into your deck. It cannot leave play except by the [action] [action] ability below. You get -1 health. [action] [action]: Discard Maimed Hand.

fhv/fhvp.name: Back Injury
fhv/fhvp.text: Revelation - You must either put Back Injury into play in your threat area, or take 1 damage and shuffle it into your deck. It cannot leave play except by the [action] [action] ability below. You get -1 health. [action] [action]: Discard Back Injury.

fhv/fhvp.name: The Silver Moth
fhv/fhvp.text: Revelation - You must either put The Silver Moth into play in your threat area, or take 1 horror and shuffle it into your deck. It cannot leave play except by the [action] [action] ability below. You get -1 sanity. [action] [action]: Discard The Silver Moth.

fhv/fhvp.name: Vow of Drzytelech
fhv/fhvp.text: Revelation - You must either put Vow of Drzytelech into play in your threat area, or take 1 horror and shuffle it into your deck. It cannot leave play except by the [action] [action] ability below. You get -1 sanity. [action] [action]: Discard Vow of Drzytelech.

tic/itd.flavor: "If you blow that thing one more time, I'm gonna make you eat it."
tic/itd.name: Riot Whistle
tic/itd.text: You may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used to engage.

tic/itd.flavor: Lita narrowed her eyes and tightened her grip. They wouldn't get away. Not this time. Not ever again.
tic/itd.name: Righteous Hunt
tic/itd.text: Engage. Choose an enemy up to 2 locations away. Move (one location at a time) to that enemy's location, engage it, and add [bless] tokens to the chaos bag equal to that enemy's horror value.

tic/itd.name: Sacred Covenant
tic/itd.text:
Permanent. Limit 1 [[Covenant]] per deck.
[reaction] After an investigator at any location performs the "reveal chaos token" step of a skill test, exhaust Sacred Covenant: Return any number of [bless] tokens revealed during this test to the chaos bag, ignoring their modifiers for this test.

tic/itd.flavor: Once you let go of your assumptions, anything is possible
tic/itd.name: Eldritch Sophist
tic/itd.text:
Uses (3 secrets).
[fast]: Exhaust Eldritch Sophist: Move 1 secret or charge from an asset you control to another asset controlled by an investigator at your location.

tic/itd.flavor: When you start following a thread, it's hard to say what you'll find at the other end.
tic/itd.name: Stirring Up Trouble
tic/itd.text:
As an additional cost to play Stirring Up Trouble, add [curse] tokens to the chaos bag equal to your location's shroud value.
Discover 2 clues at your location.

tic/itd.name: Blasphemous Covenant
tic/itd.text:
Permanent. Limit 1 [[Covenant]] per deck.
[reaction] When an investigator at your location reveals a [curse] token during a skill test, exhaust Blasphemous Covenant: Treat that token's modifier as +1 instead of its normal modifier. After this test ends, return that token to the chaos bag.

tic/itd.name: Breaking and Entering
tic/itd.text: Investigate. Add your [agility] value to your skill value for this investigation. If you succeed by 2 or more, you may automatically evade an enemy at this location. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

tic/itd.flavor: "Oh, hooey. What's the worst that could happen?"
tic/itd.name: Skeptic
tic/itd.text: During this skill test, treat the modifier of each [bless] and each [curse] token as +1 instead of its normal modifier.

tic/itd.name: False Covenant
tic/itd.text:
Permanent. Limit 1 [[Covenant]] per deck.
[reaction] When an investigator at your location reveals a [curse] token during a skill test, exhaust False Covenant: Cancel that chaos token, return it to the token pool, and reveal another token.

tic/itd.name: Armageddon
tic/itd.text: Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat] and deals +1 damage. If a [curse] token is revealed during this attack, you may deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location or place 1 charge on Armageddon.

tic/itd.name: Eye of Chaos
tic/itd.text: Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Investigate. Investigate using [willpower] instead of [intellect]. If you succeed, discover 1 additional clue at this location. If a [curse] token is revealed during this investigation, you may discover 1 clue at a connecting location or place 1 charge on Eye of Chaos.

tic/itd.name: Shroud of Shadows
tic/itd.text: Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Evade. This evasion uses [willpower] instead of [agility]. If you succeed and the evaded enemy is non-[[Elite]], you may move that enemy to a connecting location. If a [curse] token is revealed during this evasion attempt, you may move to a connecting location or place 1 charge on Shroud of Shadows.

tic/itd.name: Paradoxical Covenant
tic/itd.text: Permanent. Limit 1 [[Covenant]] per deck. [reaction] After an investigator at your location performs the "reveal the chaos token" step of a skill test, if both a [bless] token and a [curse] token were revealed during that test, exhaust Paradoxical Covenant: This test automatically succeeds. (Remove each [bless] and [curse] token revealed from the chaos bag after this test ends.)

tic/itd.name: Mariner's Compass
tic/itd.text: [action] Exhaust Mariner's Compass: Investigate. If you succeed and have no resources in your resource pool, discover 1 additional clue at your location. [fast] During an investigation using Mariner's Compass, spend 1 resource: You get +1 [intellect] for this skill test. (Limit three times per investigation.)

tic/itd.name: Ancient Covenant
tic/itd.text:
Permanent. Limit 1 [[Covenant]] per deck.
[reaction] When an investigator at your location resolves a [bless] token during a skill test, exhaust Ancient Covenant: Do not reveal another token as part of this [bless] token's effect.

tic/hhg.name: Enchanted Armor
tic/hhg.text: Play Enchanted Armor under the control of any investigator at your location. Forced - After damage and/or horror is placed on Enchanted Armor: The owner of Enchanted Armor tests [willpower] (X), where X is the total amount of damage and horror on it. If the test fails, discard Enchanted Armor and assign the damage and/or horror just placed on it elsewhere.

tic/hhg.name: Blessing of Isis
tic/hhg.text: [reaction] When a second [bless] token is revealed during a single skill test at your location, exhaust Blessing of Isis: Cancel that token and treat it as if it were a [elder_sign] token instead. Return both of those tokens to the chaos bag after this test ends.

tic/hhg.name: Cryptic Grimoire
tic/hhg.text:
Researched.
[reaction]: After you resolve 1 or more [curse] tokens during a skill test: Place that many secrets on Cryptic Grimoire.
[reaction] When you play an [[Insight]] event during your turn, spend 2 secrets: That event gains fast. Reduce its cost by 1.

tic/hhg.name: Cryptic Grimoire
tic/hhg.text:
Researched.
[reaction]: After you resolve 1 or more [curse] tokens during a skill test: Place that many secrets on Cryptic Grimoire.
[reaction] When you would draw the top card of the encounter deck, spend 5 secrets: Draw a card from your deck instead.

tic/hhg.name: Ríastrad
tic/hhg.text: Fight. When you initiate this attack, add up to 3 [curse] tokens to the chaos bag. For each [curse] token added to the chaos bag in this way, you get +1 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack.

tic/hhg.flavor: "Nothin's ever gonna be the same, Vito."
tic/hhg.name: Tristan Botley
tic/hhg.text:
[reaction] After your turn begins: Choose two skills. Until the start of your next turn, you get +1 to each of those skills.
[reaction] After any skill test ends in which a total of 3 or more [curse] or [bless] tokens were revealed: Play Tristan Botley from your hand, at no cost.

tic/hhg.name: Curse of Aeons
tic/hhg.text: [reaction] When a second [curse] token is revealed during a single skill test at your location, exhaust Curse of Aeons: Cancel that token and treat it as if it were a [skull] token instead. You may choose to remove both of those tokens from the chaos bag after the test ends.

tic/hhg.name: Unrelenting
tic/hhg.text:
Max 1 committed per test.
After you commit Unrelenting to a skill test, search the chaos bag for up to 3 non-[auto_fail] chaos tokens of your choice, and seal them on Unrelenting. If all 3 tokens sealed on Unrelenting are "+1,", "0," [bless], and/or [elder_sign] tokens, draw 2 cards. Release all tokens sealed here after this test ends.

tic/hhg.name: Signum Crucis
tic/hhg.text:
Commit only to a skill test you are performing, and only if the difficulty of that test is higher than your base skill value.
After you commit Signum Crucis to a skill test, add X [bless] tokens to the chaos bag. X is the difference between the test's difficulty and your base skill value.

tic/tic_encounter.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -2 (-3 instead if your location is partially flooded; -4 instead if your location is fully flooded).
[cultist]: -2. If your location is flooded, take 1 damage.
[tablet]: -2. If you control a key, take 1 horror.
[elder_thing]: -3. If The Amalgam is in the depths, put it into play engaged with you.
tic/tic_encounter.name: The Pit of Despair
tic/tic_encounter.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1 (-2 instead if your location is partially flooded; -3 instead if your location is fully flooded).
[cultist]: -2. If you fail and your location is flooded, take 1 damage.
[tablet]: -2. If you fail and you control a key, take 1 horror.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail and The Amalgam is in the depths, put it into play engaged with you.

tic/tic_encounter.back_flavor: Your worst fears are coming true. Puddles of water that had barely reached your ankles are rising and joining one another. You scramble to find higher ground, but your efforts are for naught. In a matter of minutes, the water level has risen to your knees and shows no sign of slowing.
tic/tic_encounter.back_text:
Increase the flood level of each revealed location.
Until the end of the game, each time a location is revealed, increase its flood level.
Keep this card next to the act deck as a reminder, and advance to agenda 2a.
tic/tic_encounter.flavor: A salmon lays dead on the ground nearby, its scaly flesh just starting to rot. You can tell from the kelp and the dripping-wet walls that this cavern was underwater not too long ago. How much time do you have before high tide?
tic/tic_encounter.name: Awakening
tic/tic_encounter.text: Forced - When your turn begins, if you are at a fully flooded location, you struggle for air: When your turn ends, if you did not enter an unflooded or partially flooded location during your turn, take 5 direct damage.

tic/tic_encounter.back_flavor: You panic as the water level continues to rise within the cavern. Before long, you are swimming instead of walking on the flooded cavern floor. Many of the tunnels are fully submerged. If you don't get out of here quickly, there will be nowhere safe to catch your breath.
tic/tic_encounter.back_text:
Each revealed location becomes fully flooded.
Until the end of the game, each time a location is revealed, it becomes fully flooded.
Keep this card next to the act deck as a reminder (replacing agenda 1b), and advance to agenda 3a.
tic/tic_encounter.flavor: Your every movement is coupled with the loud swashing of rippling water all around you. If the tide continues to rise, the cavern will be completely submerged in a matter of hours.
tic/tic_encounter.name: The Water Rises
tic/tic_encounter.text: Forced - When your turn begins, if you are at a fully flooded location, you struggle for air: When your turn ends, if you did not enter an unflooded or partially flooded location during your turn, take 5 direct damage.

tic/tic_encounter.back_flavor: Your lungs constrict. Your heart hammers in your chest. As the tide rolls in, the current tugs you deeper under the surface of the ice-cold water. Everything goes dark as you struggle to find air.
tic/tic_encounter.back_text: Each surviving investigator is defeated and takes 1 physical trauma.
tic/tic_encounter.flavor: Save for a few rocky perches, the entire cavern system is submerged in seawater. You have to find a way out of here, and soon...
tic/tic_encounter.name: Sacrifice for the Deep
tic/tic_encounter.text: Forced - When your turn begins, if you are at a fully flooded location, you struggle for air: When your turn ends, if you did not enter an unflooded or partially flooded location during your turn, take 5 direct damage.

tic/tic_encounter.back_flavor: You find a path that leads deeper into this strange cave system, but before you can follow it to see where it leads, the sound of water sloshing behind you sets your heart racing. When you turn to face the sound, what you see next nearly causes you to faint. It is an enormous hybrid of many faces and shapes - some human, some aquatic - all of them misshapen and revolting. As the thing draws closer, you meet the frozen gaze of one of the faces upon its body, and you realize that you recognize it.
tic/tic_encounter.back_text: Spawn the set-aside The Amalgam enemy engaged with the lead investigator. Shuffle each set-aside copy of Blindsense and From the Depths into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile. Shuffle each of the set-aside Tidal Tunnel locations together to form the Tidal Tunnel deck (including the set-aside Altar to Dagon, Idol Chamber, and Sealed Exit locations). Put locations from the top of the Tidal Tunnel deck into play below, to the left, and to the right of each revealed location. Read Flashback I in the Campaign Guide.
tic/tic_encounter.flavor: You have awakened in a waterlogged cavern, your mind robbed of its memories... and you are not alone. Whatever else lives in this cavern, it can't possibly be friendly. You have to get out of this place and back to civilization.
tic/tic_encounter.name: The Pit

tic/tic_encounter.back_flavor:
The tunnel continues onward with no end in sight. Your lungs heave with pain. You have held your breath far longer than you ever thought possible. For a moment you wonder if you shouldn't turn back, but by now the entire cavern must be completely submerged. Even if it weren't, you couldn't hope to outlast the creatures that dwell inside for very long. No, there is no going back. Your only hope is to press forward.
Another minute passes. The current seems to grow stronger as the tunnel narrows ahead. Your chest feels as though it is about to burst. Finally, you emerge from ice-cold seawater and tumble out of the cavern, landing hard on a rocky shore.
tic/tic_encounter.flavor: What in the hell is this place, and why have you been trapped here? You have to find a way out, but more of your memories might be tucked away in this pit...
tic/tic_encounter.name: The Escape
tic/tic_encounter.text: Forced - After a location is revealed: Put locations from the top of the Tidal Tunnel deck into play below, to the left, and to the right of that location. Objective - There must be a way out of here somewhere. If each surviving investigator has resigned, advance.

tic/tic_encounter.back_flavor: Three branching tunnels open before you, each swathed in darkness. A foul odor like that of decaying fish permeates the tunnels.
tic/tic_encounter.name: Unfamiliar Chamber
tic/tic_encounter.text: Forced - After Unfamiliar Chamber is revealed: Randomly choose 1 of the set-aside facedown keys and place it on Unfamiliar Chamber without looking at it.

tic/tic_encounter.back_flavor: The air is frigid here, and there is no sound but the faint plinking of water dripping onto the rough stone ground. You shudder and proceed onward...
tic/tic_encounter.name: Bone-Ridden Pit
tic/tic_encounter.text: For each key controlled by an investigator at Bone-Ridden Pit, it gets -1 shroud. [free] If there are no clues on Bone-Ridden Pit and you control the yellow key: You notice an odd joint socket near the skeleton's midsection that matches the shape of the yellow key. Read Flashback II in the Campaign Guide.

tic/tic_encounter.back_flavor: The air is frigid here, and there is no sound but the faint plinking of water dripping onto the rough stone ground. You shudder and proceed onward...
tic/tic_encounter.name: Fish Graveyard
tic/tic_encounter.text: Forced - After you end your turn at Fish Graveyard, if you do not control a key: Take 1 horror. [free] If there are no clues on Fish Graveyard and you control the red key: Inside a pile of half-rotten fish guts, you find a strange figurine the red key fits into perfectly. Read Flashback III in the Campaign Guide.
