Cancel that card's revelation effect. Then, take 1 horror.

core/core.name: Blinding Light
core/core.text: Evade. This evasion attempt uses [willpower] instead of [agility]. If you succeed, deal 1 damage to the enemy just evaded. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this evasion attempt, lose 1 action this turn.

core/core.flavor: Only by standing firm against the darkness can we live to see the light of another day.
core/core.name: Fearless
core/core.text: If this skill test is successful, heal 1 horror.

core/core.name: Mind Wipe
core/core.text:
Fast. Play after a phase begins.
Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location. Treat the chosen enemy's printed text box as if it were blank (except for [[Traits]]) until the end of the phase.

core/core.name: Blinding Light
core/core.text: Evade. This evasion attempt uses [willpower] instead of [agility]. If you succeed, deal 2 damage to the enemy just evaded. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this evasion attempt, lose 1 action this turn and take 1 horror.

core/core.name: Book of Shadows
core/core.text:
You have 1 additional arcane slot.
[action] Exhaust Book of Shadows: Add 1 charge to a [[Spell]] asset you control.

core/core.name: Grotesque Statue
core/core.text:
Uses (4 charges). If Grotesque Statue has no charges, discard it.
[reaction] When you would reveal a chaos token, spend 1 charge: Reveal 2 chaos tokens instead of 1. Choose 1 of those tokens to resolve, and ignore the other.

core/core.flavor: The coat was not the most fashionable choice, but it did feel warm and reassuring in its bulk.
core/core.name: Leather Coat
Scavenging
core/core.text: [reaction] After you successfully investigate by 2 or more, exhaust Scavenging: Choose an [[Item]] card in your discard pile and add it to your hand.

core/core.name: Baseball Bat
core/core.text: [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. If a [skull] or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this attack, discard Baseball Bat after the attack resolves.

core/core.flavor: They claimed it would bring me good luck. I wouldn't say that's true. But now I feel like it would be even worse luck to get rid of it.
core/core.name: Rabbit's Foot
core/core.text: [reaction] After you fail a skill test, exhaust Rabbit's Foot: Draw 1 card.

core/core.flavor: He never came if you called for him. It always seemed like he had his own agenda.
core/core.name: Stray Cat
core/core.text: [free] Discard Stray Cat: Automatically evade a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location.

core/core.name: Dig Deep
core/core.text:
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [willpower] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [agility] for this skill test.

core/core.flavor: That should buy us some time.
core/core.name: Cunning Distraction
core/core.text: Evade. Automatically evade all enemies at your location.

core/core.name: "Look what I found!"
core/core.text:
Fast. Play after you fail a skill test by 2 or less while investigating.
Discover 2 clues in your location.

core/core.name: Lucky!
core/core.text:
Fast. Play when you would fail a skill test.
Get +2 to your skill value for that test.

core/core.name: Survival Instinct
core/core.text: If this skill test is successful during an evasion attempt, the evading investigator may immediately disengage from each other enemy engaged with him or her, and may move to a connecting location.

core/core.flavor: "Do not be frightened by what you see. Be frightened by what you cannot see."
core/core.name: Aquinnah
core/core.text: [reaction] When an enemy attacks you, exhaust Aquinnah and deal 1 horror to her: Deal that enemy's damage to another enemy at your location, instead. (You still take horror dealt by the attack.)

core/core.name: Close Call
core/core.text:
Fast. Play after a non-weakness, non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location is evaded.
Shuffle that enemy into the encounter deck.

core/core.name: Lucky!
core/core.text:
Fast. Play when you would fail a skill test.
Get +2 to your skill value for that test. Draw 1 card.

core/core.name: Will to Survive
core/core.text:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Until the end of your turn, do not reveal chaos tokens for any skill tests you perform.

core/core.name: Knife
core/core.text: [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. [action] Discard Knife: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage.

core/core.name: Flashlight
core/core.text: Uses (3 supplies). [action] Spend 1 supply: Investigate. Your location gets -2 shroud for this investigation.

core/core.flavor: You can never be too prepared.
core/core.name: Emergency Cache
core/core.text: Gain 3 resources.

core/core.flavor: Stay back! I'll handle this.
core/core.name: Guts
core/core.text:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this test is successful, draw 1 card.

core/core.flavor: At last, I've found it!
core/core.name: Perception
core/core.text:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this test is successful, draw 1 card.

core/core.flavor: Die, you beast!
core/core.name: Overpower
core/core.text:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this test is successful, draw 1 card.

core/core.flavor: Too easy.
core/core.name: Manual Dexterity
core/core.text:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
If this test is successful, draw 1 card.

core/core.flavor: Sometimes, the most selfless acts can come from the strangest places
core/core.name: Unexpected Courage
core/core.text: Max 1 committed per skill test.

core/core.flavor: Bullets are one thing... twelve-inch fangs quite another.
core/core.name: Bulletproof Vest

core/core.flavor: This has been in my family for generations. Take care of it, and it will take care of you.
core/core.name: Elder Sign Amulet

core/core.flavor: Wait... where am I? What was I doing?
core/core.name: Amnesia
core/core.text: Revelation - Choose and discard all but 1 card from your hand.

core/core.flavor: What was that noise?
core/core.name: Paranoia
core/core.text: Revelation - Discard all your resources.

core/core.name: Haunted
core/core.text: Revelation - Add Haunted to your threat area. You get -1 to each of your skills. [action] [action]: Discard Haunted.

core/core.name: Psychosis
core/core.text: Revelation - Add Psychosis to your threat area. Forced - After you take 1 or more horror: Take 1 direct damage. [action] [action]: Discard Psychosis.

core/core.name: Hypochondria
core/core.text: Revelation - Add Hypochondria to your threat area. Forced - After you take 1 or more damage: Take 1 direct horror. [action] [action]: Discard Hypochondria.

core/core.flavor: You knew you shouldn't have borrowed money from the O'Bannion gang. It seems like they're always looking to collect at the worst times.
core/core.name: Mob Enforcer
core/core.text: Prey - Bearer only. Hunter. [action] Spend 4 resources: Parley. Discard Mob Enforcer.

core/core.flavor: You'll never forget the day you learned the true secret of the Silver Twilight Lodge's inner circle. The truth is too terrible for the Lodge to let you live.
core/core.name: Silver Twilight Acolyte
core/core.text: Prey - Bearer only. Hunter. Forced - After Silver Twilight Acolyte attacks: Place 1 doom on the current agenda.

core/core.flavor: Despite everything, he still won't believe you had nothing to do with those murders.
core/core.name: Stubborn Detective
core/core.text: Prey - Bearer only. Hunter. While Stubborn Detective is at your location, treat your investigator as if his or her printed text box were blank (except for [[Traits]]).

core/core_encounter.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull] -2. If you fail, after this skill test, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Ghoul]] enemy, and draw it. Shuffle the encounter deck.
[cultist] Reveal another token. If you fail, take 2 horror.
[tablet] -4. If there is a [[Ghoul]] enemy at your location, take 1 damage and 1 horror.
core/core_encounter.name: The Gathering
core/core_encounter.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull] -X. X is the number of [[Ghoul]] enemies at your location.
[cultist] -1. If you fail, take 1 horror.
[tablet] -2. If there is a [[Ghoul]] enemy at your location, take 1 damage.

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: Your house continues to change before your very eyes. The walls have decayed, and the ground in many rooms has turned to dirt. It is almost as if you have been transported somewhere else entirely, although every now and again you recognize elements of your former home.
core/core_encounter.back_text: The lead investigator must decide (choose one): Either each investigator discards 1 card at random from his or her hand, or the lead investigator takes 2 horror.
core/core_encounter.flavor: It is late at night. You are holed up in your study, researching the bloody disappearances that have been taking place in the region. A few hours into your research, you hear the sound of strange chanting coming from your parlor, down the hall. At the same time, you hear dirt churning, as if something were digging beneath the floor.
core/core_encounter.name: What's Going On?!

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: A feral beast, roughly humanoid with a canine cast and hooves for feet, tears through the ground in front of you. Below the floor, you can see vast tunnels beneath your house. Fiendish howling echoes from deep within the underground caverns.
core/core_encounter.back_text: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a [[Ghoul]] enemy is discarded. The lead investigator draws that enemy.
core/core_encounter.flavor: The floor beneath you is giving way, and you see a vast network of tunnels, twisting into the darkness below. Shapes and silhouettes of strange creatures move swiftly through the tunnels, trying to find a way up. You probably don't want to be here when they do...
core/core_encounter.name: Rise of the Ghouls

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: The ground begins to shake and you can see claws rising up from the dirt as uncanny creatures desperately try to claw their way out of the ground all around you. Everywhere you turn, you see monsters rising from the earth. Terrified, you flee as fast as you can.
core/core_encounter.back_text: - If the investigators are at Act 1 or 2, they are trapped inside the house as the ghouls tear them apart. (→R3) - If the investigators are at Act 3, they barely escape with their lives, allowing the ghouls to run rampant. Each investigator that has not resigned is defeated and suffers 1 physical trauma.
core/core_encounter.flavor: You hear a crazed howl outside, and suddenly all the creatures turn their attention to that sound. They rush to escape the house, breaking down doors and clawing at everything in their way.
core/core_encounter.name: They're Getting Out!
core/core_encounter.text: Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Each unengaged [[Ghoul]] enemy moves 1 location towards the Parlor. Forced - At the end of the round: Place 1 doom on this agenda for each [[Ghoul]] enemy in the Hallway or Parlor.

core/core_encounter.back_flavor:
You notice that the edges of your newly purchased rug are tattered and mud-stained. Finding this odd, you shift the furniture aside and pull back the rug. To your surprise, you see the door leading out of your study. You slowly turn the knob, and the door swings open, revealing your hallway below.
You jump through the doorway, landing on your feet on soft dirt. The door to the study slams shut above you. The smell of burning wood fills the narrow hall, intermingled with the scent of rot and decay.
core/core_encounter.back_text:
Put into play the set-aside Hallway, Cellar, Attic, and Parlor.
Discard each enemy in the Study.
Place each investigator in the Hallway.
Remove the Study from the game.
core/core_encounter.flavor: As you leap to investigate, the door to your study vanishes before your eyes, leaving behind only solid wall. You're trapped inside your study until you can find another way out.
core/core_encounter.name: Trapped

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: Using the barrel from the attic, you carry ice and snow from the cellar and hurl it at the barrier. The barrier sparks and shudders as it consumes the ice, then hisses and fades out of existence.
core/core_encounter.back_text:
The barrier blocking passage into the parlor has vanished. Reveal the Parlor.
Put the set-aside Lita Chantler into play in the Parlor.
Spawn the set-aside Ghoul Priest in the Hallway.
core/core_encounter.flavor: A glowing barrier blocks the path to your parlor. As you move toward it, intense heat forces you to back away. Picking up a handful of dirt, you toss it as the barrier and watch in horror as the dirt incinerates. Perhaps there's something in the cellar or attic that can help.
core/core_encounter.name: The Barrier
core/core_encounter.text: Objective - When the round ends, investigators in the hallway may, as a group, spend the requisite number of clues to advance.

core/core_encounter.back_flavor:
When the robed creature falls, the fiendish swarm burrows back into the ground and the chaos of the house quiets. But the stranger in your parlor chamber doesn't seem relieved.
"You broke my seal that was set to trap the ghouls within." She raises her torch. "Now, we must take more direct measures and burn this hell-pit to the ground!"
core/core_encounter.back_text: The lead investigator must decide (choose one): - It was never much of a home. Burn it down! (→R1) - This hell-pit is my home! No way are we burning it! (→R2)
core/core_encounter.flavor: A woman with a torch stands in your parlor, a glimmer of hatred in her eyes. "What have you done to my barrier?" she screams, furious. Before you can enter, a ghastly wail sounds behind you, and a creature wearing robes and a deer skull mask tears through the wall, advancing towards you.
core/core_encounter.name: What Have You Done?
core/core_encounter.text: Objective - If the Ghoul Priest is Defeated, advance.

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: You've been investigating the strange events occurring in Arkham for several days now. Your deck in covered in newspaper articles, police reports, and witness accounts.
core/core_encounter.flavor: The door to your study has vanished.
core/core_encounter.name: Study

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: A moment of panic and disorientation strikes as you land upon the floor of the hallway. The world spins, as if turned on its head.
core/core_encounter.flavor: The walls of your house are splattered with mud, and your hardwood floor is gone, replaced with a dirt path.
core/core_encounter.name: Hallway

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: The smell of rotten meat assaults your nostrils as you approach the attic stairs.
core/core_encounter.flavor: The bloody carcass of a malformed beast swings from a meat hook chained to the ceiling. Blood drains slowly from the carcass, dripping into a small barrel.
core/core_encounter.name: Attic
core/core_encounter.text: Forced - After you enter the Attic: Take 1 horror.

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: The stairs leading down to your cellar are slick, and they glisten with a thin layer of ice...
core/core_encounter.flavor: Your cellar seems to have been replaced with an underground network of icy tunnels and caverns. The cold chills you to the bone.
core/core_encounter.name: Cellar
core/core_encounter.text: Forced - After you enter the Cellar: Take 1 damage.

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: You're unsure what would happen if you tried to cross the threshold of the strange barrier, but based on its extreme heat, you sure as hell don't want to try.
core/core_encounter.back_text: The entrance to the Parlor is blocked by a darkly glowing unfathomable barrier. You cannot move into the Parlor.
core/core_encounter.name: Parlor
core/core_encounter.text: [action] Resign. "This is too much for me!" You run out the front door, fleeing in panic. While Lita Chantler is not controlled by a player, she gains: "[action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (4). If you succeed, take control of Lita Chantler."

core/core_encounter.flavor: A figure in red robes wearing a bone mask. It gibbers and snarls before leaping to attack.
core/core_encounter.name: Ghoul Priest
core/core_encounter.text: Prey - Highest [combat]. Hunter. Retaliate.

core/core_encounter.name: Lita Chantler
core/core_encounter.text:
While you control Lita Chantler, she gains:
"Each investigator at your location gets +1 [combat].
[reaction] When an investigator at your location successfully attacks a [[Monster]] enemy: That investigator deals +1 damage."

core/core_encounter.flavor: A monstrous creature feeds from the rotting carcass in the attic.
core/core_encounter.name: Flesh-Eater
core/core_encounter.text: Spawn - Attic.

core/core_encounter.flavor: Inside the tunnels beneath the house, a massive beast tears its way out of the ice. It is covered in a think layer of frost, its breath visible in the bitter cold.
core/core_encounter.name: Icy Ghoul
core/core_encounter.text: Spawn - Cellar.

core/core_encounter.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is the total number of doom in play.
[cultist]: -2. Place 1 doom on each [[Cultist]] enemy in play. If there are no [[Cultist]] enemies in play, reveal another token.
[tablet]: -4. If you fail, place all your clues on your location.
core/core_encounter.name: The Midnight Masks
core/core_encounter.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the highest number of doom on a [[Cultist]] enemy in play.
[cultist]: -2. Place 1 doom on the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location.

core/core_encounter.flavor: Lita seems convinced of a conspiracy within the city of Arkham. She believes that a secret cult serves the ghouls that live in the crypts beneath the city, and that several of the cult's prominent members are scattered throughout Arkham. As you begin searching for them, you can't shake the feeling that you, too, are being hunted.
core/core_encounter.name: Predator or Prey?
core/core_encounter.text: [action]: Resign. You don't want to risk taking too long, so you head to safety with the information you've gathered.

core/core_encounter.name: The Masked Hunter
core/core_encounter.text: Spawn - Engaged with Prey. Prey - Most clues. Hunter. The Masked Hunter gets +2 health per investigator. While you are engaged with The Masked Hunter, you cannot discover or spend clues.

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: Twelve bells ring out across the town. It is midnight. There is no time left to investigate the city; you must act based on the information you've collected from the cultists you've found.
core/core_encounter.flavor: The minutes pass quickly as your investigation continues.
core/core_encounter.name: Time Is Running Short
core/core_encounter.text: [action]: Resign. You don't want to risk taking too long, so you head to safety with the information you've gathered.

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: You've successfully uncovered the identities of all of the cult's high-ranking members within Arkham. The man who had stalked you throughout the city was dedicated in his conviction, as was Herman, the undertaker of the graveyard. Others seemed to have been coerced to aid the cult. Ruth, the mortician, had been told that her family would be killed if she did not supply the ghouls with fresh corpses. Thankfully, you managed to help her escape the hospital safely. Peter, the professor, had to be convinced that his involvement with the cult would do more harm than good. Victoria's obsession with occult artifacts had landed her deep within the cult's web. When you confronted Drew in the asylum, he attacked you - but interestingly, he did so because he thought you were part of the cult. The deeper you delve into this conspiracy, the clearer it becomes that many lives have been ruined by it.
core/core_encounter.flavor: You have one night to find the members of this cult and unveil their plan. The more members of the cult you can find and interrogate before midnight, the better.
core/core_encounter.name: Uncovering the Conspiracy
core/core_encounter.text: [action] The investigators spend 2 clues per investigator, as a group: Draw the top card of the Cultist deck. Objective - Find as many unique [[Cultist]] enemies as you can and add them to the victory display. If there are 6 unique [[Cultist]] enemies in the victory display, advance. (Note: Not all 6 of them are in the Cultist deck.)

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: Despite what happened, you just couldn't bring yourself to destroy your home.
core/core_encounter.flavor: You still feel uneasy about going back.
core/core_encounter.name: Your House
core/core_encounter.text: Forced - When the Ghoul Priest spawns: Spawn it here instead of at its normal location. [action]: Draw 1 card and gain 1 resource. (Limit once per turn.)

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: The banks of the Miskatonic River are lined with docks, warehouses and small shops in a district aptly named Rivertown.
core/core_encounter.flavor: There is something unsettling about the water of the Miskatonic River tonight. It ripples and bubbles as though something is moving beneath the surface.
core/core_encounter.name: Rivertown

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: Middle-class houses with gambrel roofs crowd together between the streets of Southside. The neighborhood is known for its cultural and social landmarks, such as South Church, Ma's Boarding House, and the Historical Society.
core/core_encounter.flavor: The Georgian manor housing the Historical Society is well known for its private library, where local records, maps, and artifacts from Arkham's past hint at secrets better left alone.
core/core_encounter.name: Southside
core/core_encounter.text: [action]: Draw 3 cards. (Limit once per game.)

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: Middle-class houses with gambrel roofs crowd together between the streets of Southside. The neighborhood is known for its cultural and social landmarks, such as South Church, Ma's Boarding House, and the Historical Society.
core/core_encounter.flavor: Ma's is famous for its cheap rooms and Mystery Meat Mondays. A motley variety of characters can be found coming and going at all times of day.
core/core_encounter.name: Southside
core/core_encounter.text: [action]: Search your deck for an [[Ally]] asset and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck. (Limit once per game.)

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: Arkham's only hospital, St. Mary's has a twenty-four-hour receiving room and is busy at all hours of the night. Doctor Mortimore and Nurse Sharon have been particularly stressed lately, thanks in part to recent events.
core/core_encounter.flavor: An extended stay at St. Mary's can do wonders for the body, but its effect on one's psyche is unclear.
core/core_encounter.name: St. Mary's Hospital
core/core_encounter.text: [action]: Heal 3 damage. (Limit once per game.)

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: Miskatonic University is one of the most prestigious colleges in the Northeast. The university library is famous for its collection of occult books maintained by the esteemed Dr. Henry Armitage.
core/core_encounter.flavor: The campus is quiet and lonely. Several of the buildings have been left unlocked for students and faculty working late into the night.
core/core_encounter.name: Miskatonic University
core/core_encounter.text: [action]: Search the top 6 cards of your deck for a [[Tome]] or [[Spell]] card and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: The Downtown area of Arkham is filled with government buildings, including City Hall. The First Bank of Arkham, Independence Square, and Arkham Asylum can also be found in this area. It is the busiest district in the city.
core/core_encounter.flavor: We'll call this a "loan."
core/core_encounter.name: Downtown
core/core_encounter.text: [action]: Gain 3 resources. (Limit once per game.)

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: The Downtown area of Arkham is filled with government buildings, including City Hall. The First Bank of Arkham, Independence Square, and Arkham Asylum can also be found in this area. It is the busiest district in the city.
core/core_encounter.flavor: A refuge for the mind, or a prison for the soul?
core/core_encounter.name: Downtown
core/core_encounter.text: [action]: Heal 3 horror. (Limit once per game.)

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: The Easttown neighborhood, situated on the northern banks of the Miskatonic River, contains lower-class housing, the Arkham Police Station, and popular eateries like Velma's Diner.
core/core_encounter.name: Easttown
core/core_encounter.text: While you are in Easttown, reduce the cost of each [[Ally]] asset you play by 2.

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: The graveyard lies at the foot of French Hill. Some of the headstones date back to the seventeenth century, when the earliest colonists came to Arkham. Considering what happened in your house, you're not completely keen on heading there.
core/core_encounter.name: Graveyard
core/core_encounter.text: Forced - After you enter the Graveyard: Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, you must either take 2 horror or move to Rivertown.

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: Northside is a commercial district that contains many offices and factories, as well as the train station.
core/core_encounter.flavor: In Northside, nothing gets people talking faster than a piece of dough.
core/core_encounter.name: Northside
core/core_encounter.text: [action] Spend 5 resources: Gain 2 clues from the token pool. (Group limit once per game.)

core/core_encounter.flavor: A shadowy figure follows you in the rain. When you look back, your head pounds in agony and your vision blurs.
core/core_encounter.name: Hunting Shadow
core/core_encounter.text: Peril. Revelation - You must choose either (choose one): Spend 1 clue or take 2 damage.

core/core_encounter.name: False Lead
core/core_encounter.text: Revelation - If you have no clues, False Lead gains surge. If you have 1 or more clues, test [intellect] (4). For each point you fail by, place 1 of your clues on your location.

core/core_encounter.flavor: Drew is a longtime patient at Arkham Asylum. Rumor has it he was locked up for committing cannibalism several years ago. He is considered extremely dangerous.
core/core_encounter.name: "Wolf-Man" Drew
core/core_encounter.text: Spawn - Downtown. Forced - When "Wolf-Man" Drew attacks: Heal 1 damage from him.

core/core_encounter.flavor: The undertaker in the local graveyard has been digging strange tunnels underneath the mausoleum... but for what purpose?
core/core_encounter.name: Herman Collins
core/core_encounter.text: Spawn - Graveyard. [action] Choose and discard 4 cards from your hand: Parley. Add Herman Collins to the victory display.

core/core_encounter.flavor: A professor of the occult has been seen reading strange books that relate to cannibalism. Maybe he knows something we don't?
core/core_encounter.name: Peter Warren
core/core_encounter.text: Spawn - Miskatonic University. [action] Spend 2 clues: Parley. Add Peter Warren to the victory display.

core/core_encounter.flavor: Oliver Thomas, the proprietor of the Curiositie Shoppe, has informed you that a new client has taken a keen interest in a mysterious mask...
core/core_encounter.name: Victoria Devereux
core/core_encounter.text: Spawn - Northside. [action] Spend 5 resources: Parley. Add Victoria Devereux to the victory display.

core/core_encounter.flavor: Bodies from the morgue have mysteriously gone missing. Perhaps the mortician in St. Mary's had something to do with these disappearances.
core/core_encounter.name: Ruth Turner
core/core_encounter.text: Spawn - St. Mary's Hospital. Forced - After Ruth Turner is evaded: Add her to the victory display.

core/core_encounter.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -3. If you fail, after this skill test, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Monster]] enemy, and draw it. Shuffle the encounter deck.
[cultist]: -4. Place 2 doom on the nearest enemy.
[tablet]: -5. If there is a [[Monster]] enemy at your location, take 1 damage and 1 horror.
[elder_thing]: -7. If there is an [[Ancient One]] enemy in play, reveal another token.
core/core_encounter.name: The Devourer Below
core/core_encounter.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the number of [[Monster]] enemies in play.
[cultist]: -2. Place 1 doom on the nearest enemy.
[tablet]: -3. If there is a [[Monster]] enemy at your location, take 1 damage.
[elder_thing]: -5. If there is an [[Ancient One]] enemy in play, reveal another token.

core/core_encounter.back_flavor:
Throughout the woods, a shrieking cry echoes. From somewhere deeper in the forest, a score of hideous voices answer the call, inhuman as the baying of hounds and yet articulate, repeating a singular name:
"Umôrdhoth... Umôrdhoth... Umôrdhoth..."
core/core_encounter.back_text: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck and discard cards from the top until a [[Monster]] enemy is discarded. Spawn that enemy in the Main Path. Then, place 1 doom on that enemy.
core/core_encounter.flavor: After interrogating members of the conspiracy within Arkham, you have learned that they are performing a rite of vengeance in response to the destruction of one of their master's lairs. You have entered the woods outside Arkham to try and stop them. The woods seem unnaturally cold, and filled with a deathly silence.
core/core_encounter.name: The Arkham Woods

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: A dark presence approaches, and you are assaulted by invisible pressures that bring you to your knees. A terrible force threatens to invade your mind and soul. Your throat clenches and your eyes water as the sensation burns through you.
core/core_encounter.back_text: In player order, each investigator must test [willpower] (6). Each investigator who fails must search his or her collection for a random basic [[Madness]] weakness and add it to his or her hand.
core/core_encounter.flavor:
"Umôrdhoth... Umôrdhoth... Umôrdhoth..."
The chanting builds in intensity, echoing into the cold air of the night. The sparse clouds in the sky coalesce above the Arkham woods, blotting out the faint light of the stars.
core/core_encounter.name: The Ritual Begins
core/core_encounter.text: Each enemy gets +1 fight and +1 evade.

core/core_encounter.back_text: Revelation - Replace the current Act and Agenda with The Devourer Below. This card is both the current Act and the current Agenda. Objective - If Umôrdhoth is defeated, (→R2)
core/core_encounter.flavor: The world begins to shift and change as the ritual nears its conclusion. The air grows chilly, and the entire forest is covered in a layer of rime. The trees bend unnaturally, and their shadows lengthen into weird shape.
core/core_encounter.name: Vengeance Awaits
core/core_encounter.text: Forced - When this agenda advances: - If the investigators are at Act 1, put the set-aside Ritual Site into play and spawn the set-aside Umôrdhoth there. - If the investigators are at Act 2 or 3, discard all enemies at the Ritual Site and spawn the set-aside Umôrdhoth there.

core/core_encounter.back_flavor:
Scattered throughout the forest you've seen glyphs and arcane sigils in various places - etched into the bark of trees, carved upon the faces of stones, and dripped in blood upon the ground. Though you cannot decipher these glyphs, you notice that most of them tend to face south. Following these signs leads you by twists and turns towards a cave in the darkest and coldest part of the forest.
As you advance, shadowy figures emerge from the trees, blocking the only path to the cave.
core/core_encounter.back_text:
Put the set-aside Ritual Site into play if it is not already in play.
Search the collection for each enemy recorded in your Campaign Log under "Cultists Who Got Away," and spawn those enemies at the Main Path.
core/core_encounter.flavor: The evidence you've gathered has led you to the woods south of Arkham, where you believe a ritual to summon a being called "Umôrdhoth" is about to take place. Steeling your resolve, you set forth deeper into the woods, hoping to find the site of this ritual.
core/core_encounter.name: Investigating the Trail

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: When you enter the cave, the air grows cold, and your nostrils are assaulted by the pungent smell of blood and rot.
core/core_encounter.back_text: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until 1 enemy is discarded (2 enemies instead if there are 3 or more players in the game). Spawn each discarded enemy at the Ritual Site.
core/core_encounter.flavor: The remaining cultists have followed you into the woods to try to stop you, and now they block the path to your objective. They stand ominously beneath the overhanging trees, silent sentinels in the night. You must defeat them or sneak past if you are to gain access to the site of their ritual.
core/core_encounter.name: Into the Darkness
core/core_encounter.text: Objective - If an investigator enters the Ritual Site, advance.

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: You brave the unnatural chill and weave through arcane symbols, crossing the threshold of the circle. You smother the markings on the ground, covering them with dirt, breaking apart the carefully constructed pattern of smooth rocks. A shrill noise pierces your ears as the air grows suddenly warmer, and the world distorts around you, settling into normality.
core/core_encounter.flavor: The site of the cult's ritual is inside a large cavern in a dark corner of the woods. In the center of the chamber is a candlelit circle marked by rocks and arcane runes.
core/core_encounter.name: Disrupting the Ritual
core/core_encounter.text: [action] Spend 1 clue: Test [willpower] (3) or [agility] (3). If you succeed, place 1 clue on this Act. Objective - If there are 2 clues per investigator on this Act, advance.

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: Hangman's Brook separates Uptown from the woods south of Arkham. Passing over the small bridge, you follow the main path deeper into the trees.
core/core_encounter.name: Main Path
core/core_encounter.text: The Main Path is connected to each other [[Woods]] location. [action]: Resign. "There's nothing we can do to stop them!" You flee from the woods, leaving Arkham to its grisly fate.

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: Growing up, you were always warned to stay out of the woods at night. Now you know why.
core/core_encounter.flavor: This clearing has been the site of dark rites since colonists first came to the area over two centuries ago.
core/core_encounter.name: Arkham Woods
core/core_encounter.text: Forced - After you enter this location: Test [willpower] (4). If you fail, take 1 horror and 1 damage.

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: Growing up, you were always warned to stay out of the woods at night. Now you know why.
core/core_encounter.flavor: This path seems to twist and turn upon itself, almost as if it were alive.
core/core_encounter.name: Arkham Woods
core/core_encounter.text: Forced - When you move out of this location: Test [intellect] (3). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move.

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: Growing up, you were always warned to stay out of the woods at night. Now you know why.
core/core_encounter.flavor: A house at the edge of the trail, covered in vines. Inside, the walls and floors are bloodstained and littered with dirt, mud, and discarded bones.
core/core_encounter.name: Arkham Woods
core/core_encounter.text: This location is investigated using [willpower] instead of the skill indicated by the investigation attempt.

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: Growing up, you were always warned to stay out of the woods at night. Now you know why.
core/core_encounter.flavor: Atop a nearby plateau, you can see signs of cultist activity. You will have to climb the cliff in order to reach the top.
core/core_encounter.name: Arkham Woods
core/core_encounter.text: This location is investigated using [agility] instead of the skill indicated by the investigation attempt.

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: Growing up, you were always warned to stay out of the woods at night. Now you know why.
core/core_encounter.flavor: An old horse trail in colonial days, this overgrown path hasn't been used in over a decade.
core/core_encounter.name: Arkham Woods
core/core_encounter.text: This location is investigated using [combat] instead of the skill indicated by the investigation attempt.

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: Growing up, you were always warned to stay out of the woods at night. Now you know why.
core/core_encounter.flavor: This would be a nice picnic spot, if it weren't for all the monsters.
core/core_encounter.name: Arkham Woods
core/core_encounter.text: [action]: Heal 1 damage or heal 1 horror. (Limit once per turn.)

core/core_encounter.back_flavor: The large central chamber of a cold, dark cavern, adorned with arcane markings and dimly lit by candlelight.
core/core_encounter.flavor: The sigils on the wall begin to flicker in and out of focus, and the air grows heavy with the smell of death.
core/core_encounter.name: Ritual Site
core/core_encounter.text: Forced - At the end of the round, if there are fewer than 2 clues per investigator on Ritual Site: Add clues to it until it has 2 clues per investigator on it.

core/core_encounter.name: Umôrdhoth
core/core_encounter.text: Hunter. Massive. Umôrdhoth gets +4 health per investigator. Forced - At the end of each investigator's turn: Ready Umôrdhoth. [action] If you control Lita Chantler: "It's only after her!" You throw Lita to Umôrdhoth in order to spare your lives. (→R3)

core/core_encounter.flavor: A deathly chill from below engulfs you, attempting to suck your life force away.
core/core_encounter.name: Umôrdhoth's Wrath
core/core_encounter.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (5). For each point you fail by, you must either (choose one): Choose and discard a card from your hand, or take 1 damage and 1 horror.

core/core_encounter.flavor: A horde of cruel rats skitters forth in an undulating wave of claws, teeth, and mottled fur.
core/core_encounter.name: Swarm of Rats
core/core_encounter.text: Hunter.

core/core_encounter.flavor: It was a colossal and nameless blasphemy with glaring red eyes, and it held in bony claws a thing that had been a man, gnawing at the head as a child nibbles at a stick of candy. <cite>H. P. Lovecraft, "Pickman's Model"</cite>
core/core_encounter.name: Ghoul Minion

core/core_encounter.flavor: The sight of the thing raised the question: Do we eat to live, or do we live to eat?
core/core_encounter.name: Ravenous Ghoul
core/core_encounter.text: Prey - Lowest remaining health.

core/core_encounter.flavor: Decaying hands rise up from below and grasp and claw at your ankles.
core/core_encounter.name: Grasping Hands
core/core_encounter.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). For each point you fail by, take 1 damage.

core/core_encounter.flavor: A sickening display of gore causes you to retch. You're glad this wasn't you.
core/core_encounter.name: Rotting Remains
core/core_encounter.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, take 1 horror.

core/core_encounter.name: Frozen in Fear
core/core_encounter.text: Revelation - Put Frozen in Fear into play in your threat area. The first time you perform one of the following actions (move, fight, or evade) each round, it costs 1 additional action. Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Frozen in Fear.

core/core_encounter.name: Dissonant Voices
core/core_encounter.text: Revelation - Put Dissonant Voices into play in your threat area. You cannot play assets or events. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard Dissonant Voices.

core/core_encounter.flavor: Dark forces stir against you. If you do not act quickly, a sinister plot will be fulfilled.
core/core_encounter.name: Ancient Evils
core/core_encounter.text: Revelation - Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance.

core/core_encounter.flavor: The supernatural cold threatens to freeze your soul.
core/core_encounter.name: Crypt Chill
core/core_encounter.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (4). If you fail, choose and discard 1 asset you control (if you cannot, take 2 damage instead).

core/core_encounter.name: Obscuring Fog
core/core_encounter.text: Revelation - Attach to your location. Limit 1 per location. Attached location gets +2 shroud. Forced - After attached location is successfully investigated: Discard Obscuring Fog.

core/core_encounter.flavor: It was only a small sacrifice.
core/core_encounter.name: Acolyte
core/core_encounter.text: Spawn - Any empty location. Forced - After Acolyte enters play: Place 1 doom on it.

core/core_encounter.name: Wizard of the Order
core/core_encounter.text: Spawn - Any empty location. Retaliate. Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: Place 1 doom on Wizard of the Order.

core/core_encounter.name: Mysterious Chanting
core/core_encounter.text: Revelation - Place 2 doom on the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy. If there are no [[Cultist]] enemies in play, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Cultist]] enemy and draw it. Shuffle the encounter deck.

core/core_encounter.flavor: ... they had no faces at all to smile with, but only a suggestive blankness where a face ought to be. <cite>H. P. Lovecraft</cite>
core/core_encounter.name: Hunting Nightgaunt
core/core_encounter.text:
Hunter.
While attempting to evade Hunting Nightgaunt, double the negative modifier of each revealed chaos token.

core/core_encounter.flavor: A nightgaunt swoops down from the sky and grabs you with its clawed hands, carrying you off into the night.
core/core_encounter.name: On Wings of Darkness
core/core_encounter.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (4). If you fail, take 1 horror and 1 damage. Then, disengage with each non-[[Nightgaunt]] enemy engaged with you and move to a [[Central]] location.

core/core_encounter.name: Locked Door
core/core_encounter.text: Revelation - Attach to the location in play with the most clues, and without a Locked Door attached. The attached location cannot be investigated. [action]: Test [combat] (4) to break down the door or [agility] (4) to pick the lock. If you succeed, discard Locked Door.

core/core_encounter.name: Screeching Byakhee
core/core_encounter.text: Prey - Lowest remaining sanity. Hunter. While engaged with an investigator with remaining sanity 4 or fewer, Screeching Byakhee gets +1 fight and +1 evade.

core/core_encounter.flavor: They came to me slowly as if I had forgotten them, and at last I could make some sense out of the sounds. It was this: "Have you found the Yellow Sign?" <cite>Robert W. Chambers, "The Yellow Sign"</cite>
core/core_encounter.name: The Yellow Sign
core/core_encounter.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (4). If you fail, take 2 horror and search your deck for a [[Madness]] weakness. Draw that card and shuffle your deck.

core/core_encounter.name: Yithian Observer
core/core_encounter.text: Prey - Fewest cards in hand. Forced - When Yithian Observer attacks you: Discard 1 card at random from your hand. If you cannot, Yithian Observer deals +1 damage and +1 horror for this attack.

core/core_encounter.flavor: A voice inside your head offers you power... For a price.
core/core_encounter.name: Offer of Power
core/core_encounter.text: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): draw 2 cards and place 2 doom on the current agenda (this effect can cause the current agenda to advance), or take 2 horror.

core/core_encounter.flavor: The trees trembled, leaves fluttering around us. The earth shook as the thuds of giant hooved feet grew ever closer...
core/core_encounter.name: Relentless Dark Young
core/core_encounter.text: Prey - Lowest [agility]. Forced - At the end of the round: Heal 2 damage from Relentless Dark Young.

core/core_encounter.flavor: The creature was at once terrible and graceful, the result of blasphemous trafficks with some otherworldly horror.
core/core_encounter.name: Goat Spawn
core/core_encounter.text: Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - After Goat Spawn is defeated: Each investigator at this location takes 1 horror.

core/core_encounter.name: Young Deep One
core/core_encounter.text: Prey - Lowest [combat]. Hunter. Forced - After Young Deep One engages you: Take 1 horror.

core/core_encounter.name: Dreams of R'lyeh
core/core_encounter.text: Revelation - Put Dreams of R'lyeh into play in your threat area. You get -1 [willpower] and -1 sanity. [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, Discard Dreams of R'lyeh.

ptc/dca.name: "Eat lead!"
ptc/dca.text: Fast. Play when you activate the Fight ability on a [[Firearm]] asset. You may spend X additional ammo tokens from that asset. When you reveal chaos tokens for this attack, reveal X additional chaos tokens. Choose one to resolve and ignore the rest.

ptc/dca.name: Armor of Ardennes
ptc/dca.text: [reaction] When damage is assigned to Armor of Ardennes, exhaust Armor of Ardennes: Cancel 1 of that damage.

ptc/dca.name: Eidetic Memory
ptc/dca.text: Play Eidetic Memory as an exact copy of an [[Insight]] event in any investigator's discard pile (including its resource cost). Remove that event from the game. Remove Eidetic Memory from the game instead of discarding it.

ptc/dca.name: No Stone Unturned
ptc/dca.text:
Fast. Play during any [free] player window.
Choose an investigator at your location. That investigator searches his or her deck for a card, draws it, and shuffles his or her deck.

ptc/dca.name: Charon's Obol
ptc/dca.text: Permanent. Exceptional. When earning experience during the resolution of a scenario, if you were not defeated during that scenario, you earn 2 additional experience. If you were defeated during that scenario, you are killed.

ptc/dca.name: Lupara
ptc/dca.text: Uses (2 ammo). Playing Lupara does not provoke attacks of opportunity. [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +1 [combat] and deal +1 damage for this attack. If Lupara entered play this turn, you get an additional +1 [combat] and deal an additional +1 damage for this attack.

ptc/dca.name: Cheat Death
ptc/dca.text:
Fast. Play when you would be defeated.
Disengage from each enemy engaged with you, discard all cards in your threat area, heal 2 horror and 2 damage, and move to any revealed location with no enemies. If it is your turn, end your turn. Remove Cheat Death from the game.

ptc/dca.name: Time Warp
ptc/dca.text: Fast. Play immediately after an investigator at your location finishes resolving an action during his or her turn. Undo that action (return the game state to exactly the way it was before that action was performed, except for the playing of Time Warp and its costs).

ptc/dca.name: Seal of the Elder Sign
ptc/dca.text:
Do not reveal chaos tokens from the chaos bag for this test. Treat the chaos token revealed for this test as an [elder_sign].
When this test ends, remove Seal of the Elder Sign from the game.

ptc/dca.flavor: There's nothing in the headlines about the horrors you've witnessed. But the obituaries section is disturbingly long.
ptc/dca.name: Newspaper
ptc/dca.text:
You get +2 [intellect] while investigating if you have no clues.
[reaction] When you would discover 1 or more clues at your location, if you have no clues: Discover an additional clue at your location.

ptc/dca.name: Infighting
ptc/dca.text:
Fast. Play after the enemy phase begins.
Cancel all attacks made by non-[[Elite]] enemies against you this phase.

ptc/dca.name: Key of Ys
ptc/dca.text: You get +1 to each of your skills for each horror on Key of Ys. Forced - When any amount of horror would be placed on you: Place 1 of that horror on Key of Ys. Forced - When Key of Ys leaves play: Discard the top 10 cards of your deck.

ptc/bsr.name: On the Hunt
ptc/bsr.text: Fast. Play when you would draw an encounter card during the mythos phase. Instead, search the top 9 cards of the encounter deck for an enemy, spawn it engaged with you (instead of its normal spawn location), and shuffle the encounter deck. If you cannot, draw the top card of the encounter deck.

ptc/bsr.name: Stick to the Plan
ptc/bsr.text:
Permanent. Exceptional.
[reaction] Before you draw your opening hand: Search your deck for up to 3 different [[Tactic]] and/or [[Supply]] events, and attach them facedown to Stick to the Plan. Shuffle your deck.
Cards attached to Stick to the Plan may be played as if they were in your hand. As an additional cost to play an attached card, exhaust Stick to the Plan.

ptc/bsr.name: Guidance
ptc/bsr.text: Choose another investigator at your location who has yet to take his or her turn this round. That investigator may take an additional action during his or her turn this round.

ptc/bsr.name: Arcane Insight
ptc/bsr.text:
Uses (3 charges).
[free] While an investigator is taking his or her turn, spend 1 charge: Your location gets -2 shroud until the end of this turn. (Limit once per turn.)

ptc/bsr.name: Narrow Escape
ptc/bsr.text:
Fast. Play when an enemy makes an attack of opportunity against you.
Cancel that attack. You get +2 skill value for the next skill test you perform this turn.

ptc/bsr.name: Suggestion
ptc/bsr.text: Uses (3 charges). [action] Exhaust Suggestion: Evade. Add your [willpower] value to your skill value for this evasion attempt. If you do not succeed by at least 2, remove 1 charge from Suggestion. [reaction] When a non-[[Elite]] enemy would attack you, spend 1 charge: Cancel that attack.

ptc/bsr.name: St. Hubert's Key
ptc/bsr.text:
You get +1 [willpower], +1 [intellect], and -2 sanity.
[reaction] When you would be defeated by horror, discard St. Hubert's Key: Immediately heal 2 horror.

ptc/bsr.name: Ward of Protection
ptc/bsr.text:
Fast. Play when an investigator at any location draws a non-weakness treachery card.
Cancel that card's revelation effect. Then, take 1 horror.

ptc/bsr.name: Arcane Initiate
ptc/bsr.text: Forced - After Arcane Initiate enters play: Place 1 doom or 2 horror on it. [free] Exhaust Arcane Initiate: Search the top 3 cards of your deck for a [[Spell]] card and draw it. Shuffle your deck.

ptc/bsr.name: "Not without a fight!"
ptc/bsr.text:
Commit to a skill test only if you are engaged with an enemy.
For each enemy engaged with you, "Not without a fight!" gains [willpower] [combat] [agility].

ptc/bsr.name: True Survivor
ptc/bsr.text: Return 3 [[Innate]] skills from your discard pile to your hand.

ptc/tpm.flavor: "Anderson's a hard-ass, sure. Always locking up the rum and waking us up at the crack of dawn. But out here in the middle of nowhere, he's definitely the one I want taking point."
ptc/tpm.name: Inspiring Presence
ptc/tpm.text: If this skill test is successful, ready an [[Ally]] asset at your location and heal 1 damage or 1 horror from it.

ptc/tpm.name: Mano a Mano
ptc/tpm.text:
Play only as your first action.
Deal 1 damage to an enemy engaged with you. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

ptc/tpm.name: First Aid
ptc/tpm.text:
Uses (4 supplies). If First Aid has no supplies, discard it.
[action] Spend 1 supply: Heal 1 damage and 1 horror from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset in your location.

ptc/tpm.name: Eureka!
ptc/tpm.text: If this skill test is successful, the investigator performing this test searches the top 3 cards of his or her deck for a card, draws it, and shuffles his or her deck.

ptc/tpm.flavor: You know this town like the back of your hand.
ptc/tpm.name: Shortcut
ptc/tpm.text: Fast. Play only during your turn. Attach to your location. Attached location gains: "[free] Exhaust Shortcut: Move (to a connecting location). Any investigator at this location may trigger this ability."

ptc/tpm.name: "Watch this!"
ptc/tpm.text:
Commit only to a skill test you are performing. As an additional cost to commit "Watch this!" to a skill test, spend up to 3 resources.
If you succeed by 1 or more, gain twice that many resources.

ptc/tpm.name: .41 Derringer
ptc/tpm.text: Uses (3 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. If you succeed by 1 or more, this attack deals +1 damage. Once per turn, if you succeed by 3 or more, you may take an additional action this turn.

ptc/tpm.name: Torrent of Power
ptc/tpm.text:
As an additional cost to commit Torrent of Power to a skill test, spend up to 3 charges from among assets you control.
For each charge spent in this way, Torrent of Power gains [willpower] [wild].

ptc/tpm.name: Scrying
ptc/tpm.text:
Uses (3 charges).
[free] Exhaust Scrying and spend 1 charge: Look at the top 3 cards of any investigator's deck, or the encounter deck. Return them to the top of that deck, in any order. If a [[Terror]] or [[Omen]] card is among the looked-at cards, take 1 horror.

ptc/tpm.flavor: "Is… is it over?" Her hands shook, and she fell to her knees. "Is it finally over?"
ptc/tpm.name: Waylay
ptc/tpm.text: Choose an exhausted non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location and test [agility] (X), where X is that enemy's evade value. If you succeed, defeat that enemy.

ptc/tpm.name: A Chance Encounter
ptc/tpm.text: Choose an [[Ally]] asset with printed resource cost X in any player's discard pile. Put that asset into play under your control.

ptc/tpm.flavor: You can never be too prepared.
ptc/tpm.name: Emergency Cache
ptc/tpm.text: Gain 4 resources or place 4 supply tokens among assets controlled by investigators at your location, or any combination thereof.

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is the total amount of doom on agendas in play.
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If there is an enemy with 1 or more doom on it at your location, this test automatically fails instead.
[tablet]: Reveal another token. If you do not succeed by at least 1, place 1 doom on each agenda.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Byakhee]] enemy and draw it.
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: Black Stars Rise
ptc/bsr_encounter.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the highest amount of doom on an agenda in play.
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If this token is revealed during an attack or evasion attempt against an enemy with doom on it, this skill test automatically fails instead.
[tablet]: Reveal another token. If you fail, place 1 doom on each agenda.
[elder_thing]: -2. If you fail, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Byakhee]] enemy and draw it.

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_flavor: The tide continues to rise rapidly, the outer walls of the village assaulted by hurricane-force winds and freezing rain. The storm only grows in intensity as the evening turns to night. Soon, the tidewater will completely flood the city.
ptc/bsr_encounter.back_text: Shuffle the encounter discard pile and both set-aside copies of Tidal Terror into the encounter deck. Check the current "c" agenda. - If agenda 1c has 2 or fewer doom on it, mark one Conviction in your Campaign Log. - If agenda 1c has 3 or more doom on it, mark one Doubt in your Campaign Log. - If agenda 1c is not the current "c" agenda, do not mark any Conviction or Doubt.
ptc/bsr_encounter.flavor: Your boat docks at Porte de l’Avancée, but with the rising tide and torrential rain flooding the street, the boat’s captain isn’t keen on sticking around. He tells you he will come back for you in the morning. You tell him not to bother; you probably won’t be around by then.
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: The Tide Rises
ptc/bsr_encounter.text: [free] The investigators spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Place 1 doom on this agenda (this effect can cause this agenda to advance). Each investigator gains 2 resources. (Group limit once per round.)

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_flavor:
Something is wrong. The flood must have triggered the gate by now. You researched this ritual to the best of your abilities, but for some reason, it isn't working.
Desperate, you look up at the heavens for a sign. Lightning courses through the vortex of black clouds above. Figures robed in yellow search through the sky on the backs of monstrous winged creatures. Suddenly, you realize your error - the tide wasn't the key, it was the sky!
ptc/bsr_encounter.back_text: Spawn the set-aside Beast of Aldebaran enemy in the Abbey Tower. Check Campaign Log. If Ashleigh Clarke is not listed under "VIPs Slain," search the collection for Ashleigh Clarke (Songs Die Unheard) and spawn her at Porte de l'Avancée. Remove the set-aside act 3a card from the game. Advance to agenda 3a. Your objective lies within the other agenda deck.
ptc/bsr_encounter.flavor: The angry sea continues to barrage the island. Waves crash against the walls, and rain pelts the rooftops. Is the rising sea the key to opening the path? If so, you have no choice but to let the storm rage on…
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: Let The Storm Rage
ptc/bsr_encounter.text:
Each copy of Ancient Evils gains surge.
[free] The investigators spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Place 1 doom on this agenda (this effect can cause this agenda to advance). Each investigator gains 2 resources. (Group limit once per round.)

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_flavor: The ritual is almost complete. All that is left is to find the gate and step through.
ptc/bsr_encounter.back_text: Remove the remainder of this agenda deck from the game and replace it with the set-aside act 3a card. Advance to that act card.
ptc/bsr_encounter.flavor: The angry sea continues to barrage the island. Waves crash against the walls, and rain pelts the rooftops. Is the rising sea the key to opening the path? If so, you have no choice but to let the storm rage on…
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: Let The Storm Rage
ptc/bsr_encounter.text:
Each copy of Ancient Evils gains surge.
[free] The investigators spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Place 1 doom on this agenda (this effect can cause this agenda to advance). Each investigator gains 2 resources. (Group limit once per round.)

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_flavor:
The sea swallows Mont Saint-Michel whole. Seawater pours over the walls and crashes through the lower half of the city. The abbey is the only refuge from the flood, but even that will be consumed in time. The vortex above - your only hope for escaping this doom - suddenly fades into wisps of gray cloud.
You sit on a slab of wet rock outside the abbey and contemplate the madness all around you. How has it come to this? Is all of this even truly happening? Or will you awaken in an asylum like Daniel Chesterfield, a victim of some cruel cosmic joke?
ptc/bsr_encounter.flavor: The water level continues to rise. The outer walls cannot stop the tide from swallowing the island. The streets flood with ice cold water, and powerful waves demolish buildings where they stand. If you do not act soon, the path will be forever lost, and nobody will be able to prevent Hastur’s agents from releasing his bonds.
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: The City Floods
ptc/bsr_encounter.text: Each copy of Ancient Evils gains surge.

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_flavor: As the vortex grows in size and force, so too does its pull on reality. Debris and rubble start to float upwards, pulled into the terrible void. A thunderous crash shakes the island to its very core. Soon, the whole city will be destroyed by the maelstrom.
ptc/bsr_encounter.back_text: Shuffle the encounter discard pile and both set-aside copies of Rift Seeker into the encounter deck. Check the current "a" agenda. - If agenda 1a has 2 or fewer doom on it, mark one Conviction in your Campaign Log. - If agenda 1a has 3 or more doom on it, mark one Doubt in your Campaign Log. &- If agenda 1a is not the current "a" agenda, do not mark any Conviction or Doubt.
ptc/bsr_encounter.flavor: Dark storm clouds swirl overhead. A vortex of eldritch energy rages in the center of the storm. The ritual has begun. The gate may appear above the abbey, or below it. You must choose which route to pursue and reach the gate before Hastur’s agents do.
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: The Ritual Begins
ptc/bsr_encounter.text: [free] The investigators spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Place 1 doom on this agenda (this effect can cause this agenda to advance). Each investigator draws 1 card. (Group limit once per round.)

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_flavor:
Something is wrong. The vortex must have triggered the gate by now. You researched this ritual to the best of your abilities, but for some reason, it isn't working.
Desperate, you examine your surroundings. Waves crash just over the outer walls of the village, flooding the streets. Figures robed in yellow search through the streets, their hooded lamps illuminating the floodwater. Suddenly, you realize your error - the vortex wasn't the key, it was the sea!
ptc/bsr_encounter.back_text: Spawn the set-aside Beast of Aldebaran enemy in the Chapel of St. Aubert. Check Campaign Log. If Ashleigh Clarke is not listed under "VIPs Slain," search the collection for Ashleigh Clarke (Songs Die Unheard) and spawn her at Porte de l'Avancée. Remove the set-aside act 3c card from the game. Advance to agenda 3c. Your objective lies within the other agenda deck.
ptc/bsr_encounter.flavor: The whirlwind over the island continues to rage. Blinding flashes of lightning and deafening thunder assault your senses. Is the vortex above the key to opening the path? If so, you have no choice but to beckon the entity closer…
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: The Entity Above
ptc/bsr_encounter.text:
Each [[Monster]] enemy gets +1 fight.
[free] The investigators spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Place 1 doom on this agenda (this effect can cause this agenda to advance). Each investigator draws 1 card. (Group limit once per round.)

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_flavor: The ritual is almost complete. All that is left is to find the gate and step through.
ptc/bsr_encounter.back_text: Remove the remainder of this agenda deck from the game and replace it with the set-aside act 3c card. Advance to that act card.
ptc/bsr_encounter.flavor: The whirlwind over the island continues to rage. Blinding flashes of lightning and deafening thunder assault your senses. Is the vortex above the key to opening the path? If so, you have no choice but to beckon the entity closer…
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: The Entity Above
ptc/bsr_encounter.text:
Each [[Monster]] enemy gets +1 fight.
[free] The investigators spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Place 1 doom on this agenda (this effect can cause this agenda to advance). Each investigator draws 1 card. (Group limit once per round.)

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_flavor:
The vortex consumes the abbey of Mont Saint-Michel, shattering it into a thousand shards of reality. Gravity's hold on the island is released, and debris begins to lift into the air. The lower streets of the island are the only refuge from the angry sky, but even they will be consumed in time. The tidewater - your only hope for escaping this doom - suddenly recedes, and floodwater seeps into the earth below.
You sit at the edge of the north tower below the abbey and contemplate the madness all around you. How has it come to this? Is all of this even truly happening? Or will you awaken in an asylum like Daniel Chesterfield, a victim of some cruel cosmic joke?
ptc/bsr_encounter.flavor: The maelstrom in the sky envelops the horizon. The island starts to break into pieces. The screeches of uncanny creatures fill the air, an unholy choir praying to a force beyond your comprehension. If you do not act soon, the path will be forever lost, and nobody will be able to prevent Hastur’s agents from releasing his bonds.
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: Swallowed Sky
ptc/bsr_encounter.text: Each [[Monster]] enemy gets +1 fight.

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_flavor:
Only you can stop Hastur from escaping his prison.
You dive into the churning waters and open the path to Carcosa, the realm of madness.
ptc/bsr_encounter.flavor: Tidewater churns around the walls of the city. Layers of reality unfold. Reflected in the depths below, you can see the twisted spires of Carcosa. You have no choice but to dive in.
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: Open The Path Below
ptc/bsr_encounter.text: Objective - If each undefeated investigator is at the Chapel of St. Aubert and there are no clues on that location, advance.

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_flavor:
Only you can stop Hastur from escaping his prison.
You leap into the churning maelstrom and open the path to Carcosa, the realm of madness.
ptc/bsr_encounter.flavor: Clouds churn over the abbey tower. Layers of reality unfold. Through the dark storm clouds, you can see the twisted spires of Carcosa. You have no choice but to make the leap.
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: Open The Path Above
ptc/bsr_encounter.text: Objective - If each undefeated investigator is at the Abbey Tower and there are no clues on that location, advance.

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_flavor: This gateway serves as an entrance to the Grand Rue during high tide, when a boat is the only means of reaching the city.
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: Porte de l'Avancée
ptc/bsr_encounter.text: [action] [action]: Move 1 doom from one agenda deck to the other. Then, place 2 clues on Porte de l'Avancée (from the token bank).

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_flavor: Mont Saint-Michel’s main road courses around the abbey, lined with shops and homes for fishermen and farmers.
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: Grand Rue
ptc/bsr_encounter.text: Forced - After you succeed at a skill test by 1 or less while investigating Grand Rue: Place 1 doom on the agenda with the most doom (if they are tied for the most doom, choose one to place 1 doom on).

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_flavor: The outer wall of the city defends it from the wrath of the tides, and also from conquering invaders.
ptc/bsr_encounter.flavor: Waves slam against the stone walls, water spraying onto the pathways above. If you don't act quickly, even these stalwart walls won't be able to stop the rising tide.
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: Outer Wall
ptc/bsr_encounter.text: Forced - After 1 or more doom is placed on the "a" agenda deck: Each investigator at the Outer Wall takes 1 damage.

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_flavor: The outer wall of the city defends it from the wrath of the tides, and also from conquering invaders.
ptc/bsr_encounter.flavor: Waves slam against the stone walls, water spraying onto the pathways above. If you don't act quickly, even these stalwart walls won't be able to stop the rising tide.
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: Outer Wall
ptc/bsr_encounter.text: While the current "c" agenda has more doom on it than the current "a" agenda, double the number of skill icons on cards committed to skill tests at the Outer Wall.

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_flavor: The north tower along the outer wall overlooks the town on one side and the tumultuous waters on the other. Freezing rain has made this path slippery and dangerous to follow.
ptc/bsr_encounter.flavor: Wet, stone steps lead higher up the path, toward the abbey. Above, black storm clouds threaten to overtake the island.
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: North Tower
ptc/bsr_encounter.text: Forced - After 1 or more doom is placed on the "c" agenda deck: Each investigator at North Tower takes 1 horror.

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_flavor: The north tower along the outer wall overlooks the town on one side and the tumultuous waters on the other. Freezing rain has made this path slippery and dangerous to follow.
ptc/bsr_encounter.flavor: Wet, stone steps lead higher up the path, toward the abbey. Above, black storm clouds threaten to overtake the island.
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: North Tower
ptc/bsr_encounter.text: While the current "a" agenda has more doom on it than the current "c" agenda, reduce the difficulty of each skill test at North Tower by 1.

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_flavor: Bolts of lightning silhouette the abbey above. A path of long, winding steps leads up the hill, branching into multiple routes as you draw nearer to the abbey.
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: Broken Steps
ptc/bsr_encounter.text: Forced - After you enter Broken Steps: You must either lose 1 action or draw the topmost [[Omen]] treachery in the encounter discard pile.

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_flavor: Bolts of lightning silhouette the abbey above. A path of long, winding steps leads up the hill, branching into multiple routes as you draw nearer to the abbey.
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: Broken Steps
ptc/bsr_encounter.text: Forced - After you enter Broken Steps: You must either discard an asset you control or draw the topmost [[Cultist]] enemy in the encounter discard pile.

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_flavor: You’ll have to find a path not blocked by debris and rubble in order to reach the abbey.
ptc/bsr_encounter.back_text: The path leading to the Abbey Church is blocked. As an additional cost for you to enter the Abbey Church, investigators at Broken Steps must spend 3 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: Abbey Church
ptc/bsr_encounter.text: If there are two agendas in play with different agenda numbers, Abbey Church gets +2 shroud. Forced - When Abbey Church is revealed: Put the set-aside Chœur Gothique, Knight's Hall, Cloister, Chapel of St. Aubert, and Abbey Tower locations into play.

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_flavor: A long pool of blood spreads slowly across the floor, leading toward the chœur gothique.
ptc/bsr_encounter.flavor: Lightning flashes through the windows of the abbey, thunder quickly answering in a booming voice all around the island.
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: Chœur Gothique
ptc/bsr_encounter.text: [action] Place 1 doom on the current "a" agenda: Heal 2 damage. (Group limit once per game).

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_flavor: A long pool of blood spreads slowly across the floor, leading toward the chœur gothique.
ptc/bsr_encounter.flavor: Lightning flashes through the windows of the abbey, thunder quickly answering in a booming voice all around the island.
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: Chœur Gothique
ptc/bsr_encounter.text: [action] Place 1 doom on the current "c" agenda: Heal 2 horror. (Group limit once per game).

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_flavor: The open arcade of the cloister is normally restricted to the monastery’s monks and religious leaders, but with the abbey seemingly abandoned, it takes little effort for you to sneak your way in.
ptc/bsr_encounter.flavor: A lone monk patrols the covered walk, surrounding himself in whispered prayer. He doesn't seem to notice the storm threatening to tear the abbey down.
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: Cloister
ptc/bsr_encounter.text: [action] If there are no clues on Cloister: Parley. Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, remember that you have "found a guide."

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_flavor: Rows of symmetrical stone pillars give this hall a sense of calm serenity that clashes with the torrent outside.
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: Knight's Hall
ptc/bsr_encounter.text: [action] If there are no clues on Knight's Hall: Investigate. Investigate using [agility] instead of [intellect]. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, remember that you have "found the tower key."

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_flavor: Waves crash violently upon the rocks. The chapel stands lonely against the rain, barely able to survive the storm’s onslaught.
ptc/bsr_encounter.back_text: The way to the Chapel of St. Aubert is hidden. You cannot enter the Chapel of St. Aubert unless you have "found a guide."
ptc/bsr_encounter.flavor: In the water below, you can see the spires of Carcosa. You are almost there - you need only open the gate.
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: Chapel of St. Aubert
ptc/bsr_encounter.text:
You can only discover clues in the Chapel of St. Aubert if you have 3 or fewer remaining sanity.
[action]: Take up to 3 horror.

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_flavor: Waves crash violently upon the rocks. The chapel stands lonely against the rain, barely able to survive the storm’s onslaught.
ptc/bsr_encounter.back_text: The way to the Chapel of St. Aubert is hidden. You cannot enter the Chapel of St. Aubert unless you have "found a guide."
ptc/bsr_encounter.flavor: As you peer into the water below, you can see the hooded shape of Hastur looming beyond, hand outstretched. His laughter echoes throughout your mind.
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: Chapel of St. Aubert

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_flavor: Dark lightning crashes throughout the air. Surrounding the top of the tower is a whirlwind of black clouds and bellowing wind.
ptc/bsr_encounter.back_text: The door leading up to the Abbey Tower is locked. You cannot enter the Abbey Tower unless you have "found the tower key."
ptc/bsr_encounter.flavor: In the vortex above, you can see the spires of Carcosa. You are almost there - you need only open the gate.
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: Abbey Tower
ptc/bsr_encounter.text:
You can only discover clues in the Abbey Tower if you have no cards in your hand.
[action]: Discard up to 3 cards from your hand.

ptc/bsr_encounter.back_flavor: Dark lightning crashes throughout the air. Surrounding the top of the tower is a whirlwind of black clouds and bellowing wind.
ptc/bsr_encounter.back_text: The door leading up to the Abbey Tower is locked. You cannot enter the Abbey Tower unless you have "found the tower key."
ptc/bsr_encounter.flavor: As you peer into the vortex above, you can see the hooded shape of Hastur looming beyond, hand outstretched. His laughter echoes throughout your mind.
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: Abbey Tower

ptc/bsr_encounter.flavor: When the tide is high, they emerge from the sea to feed.
ptc/bsr_encounter.name: Tidal Terror
ptc/bsr_encounter.text: Spawn - Porte de l'Avancée or Chapel of St. Aubert. Hunter.

ptc/bsr_encounter.name: Rift Seeker
ptc/bsr_encounter.text: Forced - After Rift Seeker attacks you: You must either take 1 additional damage and 1 additional horror, or place 1 doom on each agenda in play. [action] Place 1 doom on each agenda in play and take 2 horror: Parley. Discard Rift Seeker.

ptc/bsr_encounter.name: Crashing Floods
ptc/bsr_encounter.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (3). If you fail: - If agenda 1a is in play, take 1 damage and lose 1 action. - If agenda 2a is in play, take 2 damage and lose 2 actions. - If act 3a or agenda 3a is in play, take 3 damage and lose 3 actions.

ptc/bsr_encounter.name: Worlds Merge
ptc/bsr_encounter.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail: - If agenda 1c is in play, take 1 horror and discard 1 card from your hand. - If agenda 2c is in play, take 2 horror and discard 2 cards from your hand. - If act 3c or agenda 3c is in play, take 3 horror and discard 3 cards from your hand.

ptc/dca_encounter.back_text: Hard / Expert [skull]: -X. X is the amount of horror on you. [cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail, take 2 horror. [tablet]: -5. If you fail and Hastur is in play, place 1 clue on your location (from the token bank). [elder_thing]: -5. If this token is revealed during an attack or evasion attempt against a [[Monster]] or [[Ancient One]] enemy, lose 1 action.
ptc/dca_encounter.name: Dim Carcosa
ptc/dca_encounter.text: Easy / Standard [skull]: -2 (-4 instead if you have no sanity remaining). [cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail, take 1 horror. [tablet]: -3. If you fail and Hastur is in play, place 1 clue on your location (from the token bank). [elder_thing]: -3. If this token is revealed during an attack or evasion attempt against a [[Monster]] or [[Ancient One]] enemy, lose 1 action.

ptc/dca_encounter.back_flavor: Turning a corner, you nearly bump into a nurse with light brown hair and sharp features. You tell her about the violent patients and the strange things you've seen, but she doesn't listen. When you inquire about Daniel, she informs you that he is a friend of the King and that he resides in the palace.
ptc/dca_encounter.back_text:
The investigators must decide (choose one):
 - Any investigator tests [willpower] (4) to snap out of it. If successful, advance to agenda 2a. If failed, you must choose an option you have yet to choose.
 - Any investigator tests [intellect] (4) to remember that you've done this before. If successful, advance to agenda 2a. If failed, you must choose an option you have yet to choose.
 - This can't be real. This can't be real. This can't be real. Each investigator takes 2 horror. Advance to agenda 2a.
 - The investigators faint and awaken some time later. Advance to agenda 2a and place 1 doom on it.
ptc/dca_encounter.flavor:
And now, far away, over leagues of tossing cloud-waves, I saw the moon dripping with spray; and beyond, the towers of Carcosa rose behind the moon.
 - Robert W. Chambers, "In the Court of the Dragon," <u>The King in Yellow</u>
ptc/dca_encounter.name: Madness Coils
ptc/dca_encounter.text: Hastur cannot be defeated. Forced - If there is at least 3 [per_investigator] damage on Hastur: Advance this agenda.

ptc/dca_encounter.back_flavor:
"Ah, if it isn't our final guest," the doorman announces. "Miss Devine, your presence here has been long awaited." The creature slithers up the side of the palace. You swear you've seen the symbol on her amulet before. Wait, that can't be right.
"Well, now the <u>real</u> party can begin," it roars.
ptc/dca_encounter.back_text:
Spawn the set-aside Beast of Aldebaran enemy at the Palace of the King.
Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
ptc/dca_encounter.flavor:
I thought, too, of The King in Yellow wrapt in the fantastic colors of his tattered mantle, and that bitter cry of Cassilda, "Not upon us, oh King, not upon us!"
- Robert W. Chambers, "The Mask," <u>The King in Yellow</u>
ptc/dca_encounter.name: Madness Drowns
ptc/dca_encounter.text: Hastur gets +1 fight and cannot be defeated. Forced - If there is at least 5 [per_investigator] damage on Hastur: Advance this agenda.

ptc/dca_encounter.back_flavor: The sky falls. Cloud-wisps lash into the earth, and the dozens of moons in the sky shatter. Shards of the cosmic entities above plunge into the ground and assault the city. The dark reflections of Mont Saint-Michel which floats upside down above you starts to descend. They abbey crashes into the king's palace, launching ebony debris in all directions. Hastur's hideous echoing laughter haunts your mind. It is done.
ptc/dca_encounter.back_text: Check Campaign Log. - If you have more (or equal) Conviction than Doubt, proceed to (→R4). - If you have more Doubt than Conviction, proceed to (→R5).
ptc/dca_encounter.flavor:
...I cannot forget Carcosa, where black stars hang in the heavens, where the shadows of men’s thoughts lengthen in the afternoon, when the twin suns sink into the Lake of Hali, and my mind will bear forever the memory of the Pallid Mask.
 - Robert W. Chambers, "The Repairer of Reputations," <u>The King in Yellow</u>
ptc/dca_encounter.name: Madness Dies
ptc/dca_encounter.text:
Hastur gets +2 fight.
Hastur cannot be defeated unless an investigator "know the secret."

ptc/dca_encounter.back_flavor:
A shadow creeps along the wall beside you, and your heart leaps into your throat. You turn, and a figure flits away just out of sight. Either your mind is playing tricks on you, or someone else is in the theatre.
You follow the direction of the shadow, rounding a nearby corner. At the far end of the hall, he stands awaiting you: the man who wears the Pallid Mask, the Stranger whose steps you have haunted for so many weeks. You remember that you have been here before.
The theatre dissolves around you. The bright glare of two suns pierce into your eyes from above. "Do you remember now?" he asks. He turns and vanishes into the aether, as if taunting you to follow.
ptc/dca_encounter.back_text: Spawn the set-aside The Man in the Pallid Mask enemy at the Palace of the King.
ptc/dca_encounter.flavor: You have opened the path to Carcosa in order to stop those who wish to free Hastur from his prison in the stars. Only you can put an end to this madness!
ptc/dca_encounter.name: In Lost Carcosa
