If The Man in the Pallid Mask is not in play, search his bearer's deck and discard pile for him, draw him, and shuffle his bearer's deck (resolve this effect even if his bearer is currently eliminated, searching all out-of-play areas).

return/rtptc.name: .32 Colt
return/rtptc.text: Uses (6 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You deal +1 damage for this attack. [free] Spend 1 resource: Return .32 Colt to your hand.

return/rtptc.name: "Eat lead!"
return/rtptc.text: Fast. Play when you activate the Fight ability on a [[Firearm]] asset. Spend 1 additional ammo token from that asset. When you reveal chaos tokens for this attack, reveal 1 additional chaos token. Choose one to resolve and ignore the other.

return/rtptc.flavor:
"I am the wisest man alive, for I know one thing, and that is that I know nothing."
- Plato, <u>The Republic</u>
return/rtptc.name: Logical Reasoning
return/rtptc.text: For each clue you have (to a maximum of 3), either heal 2 horror from an investigator at your location or discard a [[Terror]] card at your location.

return/rtptc.name: Archaic Glyphs
return/rtptc.text: Researched. Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Investigate. If you succeed, you may put an asset with printed cost of X or lower into play from your hand. X is the amount you succeeded by.

return/rtptc.name: Stealth
return/rtptc.text: [free] During your turn, exhaust Stealth: Evade. The chosen enemy gets -2 evade for this evasion attempt. If you successfully evade the enemy, disengage with it but do not exhaust it. Until the end of your turn, that enemy cannot engage you.

return/rtptc.name: Suggestion
return/rtptc.text: Uses (3 charges). If Suggestion has no charges, discard it. [action] Exhaust Suggestion: Evade. Add your [willpower] value to your skill value for this evasion attempt. If you do not succeed by at least 2, remove 1 charge from Suggestion.

return/rtptc.name: Alchemical Transmutation
return/rtptc.text:
Uses (4 charges).
[action] Exhaust Alchemical Transmutation, spend 1 charge: Test [willpower] (0). For each point you succeed by, gain 1 resource (to a maximum of 4). If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this test, take 1 damage.

return/rtptc.name: Storm of Spirits
return/rtptc.text: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat]. You get +2 [willpower] for this attack. If you succeed, instead of its standard damage, this attack deals 3 damage to each enemy at the attacked enemy's location (any additional damage is dealt to the attacked enemy). If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] token is revealed during this attack, deal 2 damage to each investigator at the attacked enemy's location.

return/rtptc.name: Lantern
return/rtptc.text: [action]: Investigate. Your location gets -1 shroud for this investigation. [action] Discard Lantern: Deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location (or remove Lantern from the game to deal 2 damage, instead). This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

return/rtptc.flavor: I knew I should have, but I couldn't stop digging.
return/rtptc.name: Gravedigger's Shovel
return/rtptc.text: [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. [action] Discard Gravedigger's Shovel: Discover 1 clue at your location (or remove Gravedigger's Shovel from the game to discover 2 clues, instead).

return/rtptc.name: Unspeakable Oath
return/rtptc.text: Campaign Mode only. Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - When the game ends or you are eliminated, if this card is in your hand: You earn 2 fewer experience. [reaction] When you deal damage to an enemy in excess of its remaining health: Discard this card from your hand.

return/rtptc.name: Unspeakable Oath
return/rtptc.text: Campaign Mode only. Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - When the game ends or you are eliminated, if this card is in your hand: You earn 2 fewer experience. [reaction] After you successfully investigate a location with no clues on it: Discard this card from your hand.

return/rtptc.name: Unspeakable Oath
return/rtptc.text: Campaign Mode only. Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add this card to your hand. Forced - When the game ends or you are eliminated, if this card is in your hand: You earn 2 fewer experience. [action]: Evade. Use only on an exhausted unengaged enemy at your location. If you succeed, discard this card from your hand.

return/rtnotz_encounter.back_text:
- Remove the original Study location from the game and replace it with the new Study (Aberrant Gateway). Put the Study (Aberrant Gateway) into play. Each investigator begins play in the Study (Aberrant Gateway).
- Put the new Guest Hall, Bedroom, and Bathroom locations into play.
- Remove the original Hallway location from the game.
- Choose one of the two Attic locations and one of the two Cellar locations at random, and set them aside, out of play. Remove the other versions of Attic and Cellar from the game.
- Set each other location aside, out of play.
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Return to The Gathering
return/rtnotz_encounter.text:
Perform the setup as indicated in the Night of the Zealot Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions:
- When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The Gathering shown here.
- Remove Act 1a- "Trapped" from the game and replace it with the new Act 1a- "Mysterious Gateway."
(Continued on reverse side.)

return/rtnotz_encounter.back_flavor:
The layout of your home is vastly different from its usual structure. Somehow, your guest hall seems to have looped around on itself, and you are stuck with no way to enter the main hallway near the front of the house.
You notice that the wall between the guest bedroom and the bathroom is rotted and stained with what appears to be old blood. With no other way to proceed, you have no choice but to bust through the weak, rotted wall.
return/rtnotz_encounter.back_text:
Put into play the set-aside Hole in the Wall location.
Choose an investigator in the Guest Hall. The chosen investigator immediately moves into the Hole in the Wall and reveals it. Then, he or she must test [willpower] (4). For each point that investigator fails by, he or she must discard a random card from his or her hand.
return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: As you leap to investigate, the door to your study vanishes before your eyes, leaving behind a strange gateway to another part of your house. There must be a reason why this is happening…
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Mysterious Gateway
return/rtnotz_encounter.text: Objective - Only investigators in the Guest Hall may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

return/rtnotz_encounter.back_flavor: You’ve been investigating the strange events occurring in Arkham for several months now. Your desk is covered in newspaper articles, police reports, and witness accounts.
return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: The door to your study has vanished, leaving in its wake a gateway to another part of your house.
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Study
return/rtnotz_encounter.text:
[action] [action]: Draw 3 cards. Only the lead investigator can activate this ability.
Forced - When an enemy attempts to spawn at a location that is not in play: Put that location into play and spawn that enemy there.

return/rtnotz_encounter.back_flavor: Somehow you’ve ended up in a completely different part of your house.
return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: How did you end up here… ?
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Guest Hall
return/rtnotz_encounter.text: Investigators in this location cannot take draw actions.

return/rtnotz_encounter.back_flavor: A shadow dances across the floor beneath the bedroom door as you approach.
return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: The bedsheets are tattered, and a strange symbol is drawn on the fabric. Blood pools at the foot of the closet door, and you can hear something chewing inside.
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Bedroom
return/rtnotz_encounter.text: Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating the Bedroom: Discard 1 card at random from your hand.

return/rtnotz_encounter.back_flavor: As you approach the bathroom door, the weight of the putrid, unnatural air causes you to gag.
return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: The guest bathroom looks as though it hasn't been cleaned in years. A viscous green liquid fills the bathtub in the far corner of the room, and mold has grown across the walls.
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Bathroom
return/rtnotz_encounter.text: Forced - After you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [auto_fail] symbol while investigating the Bathroom: Lose all remaining actions and end your turn.

return/rtnotz_encounter.back_flavor: I need this like I need a hole in my wall.
return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: The walls of your house are splattered with mud, and your hardwood floor is gone, replaced with a dirt path.
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Hallway
return/rtnotz_encounter.text: Forced - After you reveal this location: Put the set-aside Attic, Cellar, and Parlor locations into play.

return/rtnotz_encounter.back_flavor: The smell of rotten meat assaults your nostrils as you approach the attic stairs.
return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: The bloody carcass of some sort of beast swings from a meat hook chained to the ceiling. Blood drains slowly from the carcass, dripping into a small barrel. To your surprise, a wooden ladder at the far end of the attic ascends through your roof, to an even higher area
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Attic
return/rtnotz_encounter.text: Forced - After you reveal the Attic: Put the set-aside Far Above Your House location into play.

return/rtnotz_encounter.back_flavor: You struggle to believe this is even possible, considering the attic is the highest point in your home. Or at least…was.
return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: You climb the ladder and emerge from a pit in the ground amidst an endless field of graves. Each bears a branch from your family tree.
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Field of Graves
return/rtnotz_encounter.text: Forced - After you reveal Field of Graves: Test [willpower] (4). For each point you fail by, discard 1 card at random from each player's hand.

return/rtnotz_encounter.back_flavor: The stairs leading down to your cellar are slick, and glisten with a thin layer of ice…
return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: Your cellar seems to have been replaced with an underground network of icy tunnels and caverns. The tunnels continue for miles, deeper and deeper beneath the surface.
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Cellar
return/rtnotz_encounter.text: Forced - After you reveal the Cellar: Put the set-aside Deep Below Your House location into play.

return/rtnotz_encounter.back_flavor: The tunnels extend for miles in every direction. Everywhere you look, strange canine creatures skitter on all fours in the distance, scrambling from one shadow to the next.
return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: These pits seem to be the creatures' lairs. They are ice-cold and filled with the decaying remains of humans and other animals.
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Ghoul Pits
return/rtnotz_encounter.text: Forced - After you reveal Ghoul Pits: Test [agility] (3). For each point you fail by, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a copy of Swarm of Rats and draw it. Shuffle the encounter deck.

return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: Behind the door to your closet, the creature finishes its meal. Its appetite insatiable, it quickly turns its attention to you.
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Corpse-Hungry Ghoul
return/rtnotz_encounter.text:
Spawn - Bedroom.
Hunter.

return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: Tearing its way out of the floor, a crazed beast emerges from the tunnels below. Its eyes are red with hunger and hate.
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Ghoul from the Depths
return/rtnotz_encounter.text:
Spawn - Bathroom.
Retaliate.

return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: The third seal will be the last.
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: The Zealot's Seal
return/rtnotz_encounter.text: Revelation - Each investigator with 3 or fewer cards in hand must take 1 damage and 1 horror. Each investigator with 4 or more cards in hand tests [willpower] (2). Each investigator who fails must discard 2 cards at random from his or her hand.

return/rtnotz_encounter.back_text:
- Choose one of the two Easttown locations, one of the two Northside locations, one of the two Rivertown locations, and one of the two Miskatonic University locations at random. Put those locations into play. Remove the other versions of Easttown, Northside, Rivertown, and Miskatonic University from the game.
- When creating the "Cultist deck," include the 3 new Cult of Umôrdhoth cards included in this expansion. Shuffle the Cultist deck and remove 3 random cards from it, without looking at them. (You should be left with a 5-card Cultist deck.)
- If you are instructed to search the encounter deck for an Acolyte, search the encounter deck for any 1-health [[Cultist]] enemy, instead.
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Return to The Midnight Masks
return/rtnotz_encounter.text:
Perform the setup as indicated in the Night of the Zealot Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions:
- When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to the Midnight Masks shown here.
- Construct the act deck using one of the two copies of Agenda 1a- "Predator or Prey" at random, without looking at their other sides. Remove the other version of Agenda 1a from the game.
(Continued on reverse side.)

return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: Lita seems convinced of a conspiracy within the city of Arkham. She believes that a secret cult serves the ghouls that live in the crypts beneath the city, and that several of the cult’s prominent members are scattered throughout Arkham. As you begin searching for them, you can’t shake the feeling that you, too, are being hunted.
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Predator or Prey?
return/rtnotz_encounter.text: [action]: Resign. You don't want to risk taking too long, so you head to safety with the information you've gathered.

return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Narôgath
return/rtnotz_encounter.text:
Spawn - Engaged with Prey.
Prey - Nearest to another [[Cultist]] enemy.
Hunter.
Narôgath gets +3 health per investigator.
While Narôgath is ready, each investigator at its location or a connecting location cannot Parley with [[Cultist]] enemies.

return/rtnotz_encounter.back_flavor: The Easttown neighborhood, situated on the northern banks of the Miskatonic River, contains lower-class housing, the Arkham Police Station, and popular eateries like Velma’s Diner.
return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: You doubt that Sheriff Engle will believe your story, but you might be able to convince some of the other officers to assist in your investigation.
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Easttown
return/rtnotz_encounter.text: [action]: Add 2 supply tokens or ammo tokens to an asset you control. (Limit once per game.)

return/rtnotz_encounter.back_flavor: Northside is a commercial district that contains many offices and factories, as well as the train station.
return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: The train has many stops throughout Arkham, and many more beyond. You are tempted to leave all of this behind.
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Northside
return/rtnotz_encounter.text: [action]: Move to any [[Arkham]] location. (Limit once per game.)

return/rtnotz_encounter.back_flavor: Miskatonic University is one of the most prestigious colleges in the Northeast. The university library is famous for its collection of occult books maintained by the esteemed Dr. Henry Armitage.
return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: The university's museum holds many peculiar exhibits and ominous relics from expeditions all over the world.
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Miskatonic University
return/rtnotz_encounter.text: [action] Take 2 horror: Gain 1 clue from the token pool. (Limit once per game.)

return/rtnotz_encounter.back_flavor: The banks of the Miskatonic River are lined with docks, warehouses and small shops in a district aptly named Rivertown.
return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: The lone warehouse next to the river is quiet and secluded: an ideal venue for unsavory dealings.
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Rivertown
return/rtnotz_encounter.text: [action] Discard a card with X [willpower] icons: Remove X doom from a [[Cultist]] enemy in play. (Group limit once per game.)

return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Masked Horrors
return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: "Umôrdhoth…Umôrdhoth…Umôrdhoth…"
return/rtnotz_encounter.text: Revelation - Each investigator with 2 or more clues takes 2 horror. If no horror is dealt by this effect, place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance.

return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Return to The Devourer Below
return/rtnotz_encounter.text:
Perform the setup as indicated in the Night of the Zealot Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions:
- When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The Devourer Below shown here.
- When choosing 4 Arkham Woods locations to put into play at random, include the 4 new Arkham Woods locations included in this encounter set, for a total of 10 possibilities.
- After setting the Umôrdhoth enemy aside, flip this card over and attach it to Umôrdhoth.

return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Vault of Earthly Demise
return/rtnotz_encounter.text:
Vault of Earthly Demise cannot leave play.
Umôrdhoth gets +X health per investigator and gets +X fight, where X is the number of resources on this card.
Forced - When Umôrdhoth enters play, place 1 resource on this card for each act remaining in the act deck.

return/rtnotz_encounter.back_flavor: Growing up, you were always warned to stay out of the woods at night. Now you know why.
return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: It seems to groan and twist in the chill wind, as though alive.
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Arkham Woods
return/rtnotz_encounter.text: Forced - After an investigator at this location succeeds at a skill test on a treachery: That treachery gains surge. (Group limit once per round.)

return/rtnotz_encounter.back_flavor: Growing up, you were always warned to stay out of the woods at night. Now you know why.
return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: This used to be a popular spot for fishing, but it doesn't look like anybody has fished here in years.
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Arkham Woods
return/rtnotz_encounter.text: Forced - After you reveal a chaos token from the chaos bag while investigating this location: Reveal and resolve an additional chaos token. (Limit once per test.)

return/rtnotz_encounter.back_flavor: Growing up, you were always warned to stay out of the woods at night. Now you know why.
return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: The remains of half-eaten animal corpses litter this section of the woods, befouling the air with their stench.
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Arkham Woods
return/rtnotz_encounter.text: Each enemy at this location cannot take more than 1 damage from each attack performed against it.

return/rtnotz_encounter.back_flavor: Growing up, you were always warned to stay out of the woods at night. Now you know why.
return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: Not even on a dare would you attempt to cross this rotted, rickety bridge.
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Arkham Woods
return/rtnotz_encounter.text: Forced - After you reveal a chaos token from the chaos bag during an evasion attempt at this location: Reveal and resolve an additional chaos token. (Limit once per test.)

return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: It prefers to feast on the rot of the deceased, but when the hunger is overpowering, the living will suffice.
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Umôrdhoth's Hunger
return/rtnotz_encounter.text: Revelation - Each investigator must discard 1 card at random from his or her hand. Each investigator who has no cards in his or her hand is killed. Heal 1 damage from each enemy in play.

return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor:
Its position was a kind of crouch, and as one looked one felt that at any moment it might drop its present prey and seek a juicier morsel.
-H. P. Lovecraft, “Pickman’s Model”
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Grave-Eater
return/rtnotz_encounter.text: Forced - After Grave-Eater attacks you: Discard 1 card at random from your hand.

return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: Its dreadful mask conceals the true horror beneath.
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Acolyte of Umôrdhoth
return/rtnotz_encounter.text:
Prey - Fewest cards in hand.
While engaged with an investigator with no cards in his or her hand, Acolyte of Umôrdhoth cannot be evaded.

return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: The ground is covered in ice and frost, and a deep chill courses through the air.
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Chill from Below
return/rtnotz_encounter.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, you must discard 1 card at random from your hand. For each card you cannot discard, take 1 damage.

return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: Placate the beast, and we are allowed to live. When we die, it will feast on our remains.
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Disciple of the Devourer
return/rtnotz_encounter.text:
Spawn - Farthest empty location.
Forced - After you spawn Disciple of the Devourer: You must either place 1 doom on it or place 1 of your clues on its location. If the current agenda is not agenda 1, do both instead.

return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Corpse-Taker
return/rtnotz_encounter.text:
Spawn - Farthest empty location.
Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: Place 1 doom on Corpse-Taker.
Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Corpse-Taker moves once toward Rivertown or Main Path. If Corpse-Taker is already at Rivertown or Main Path, move all doom from Corpse-Taker to the current agenda, instead.

return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Mask of Umôrdhoth
return/rtnotz_encounter.text:
Revelation - Attach to the farthest [[Cultist]] enemy and place 1 doom on that enemy. If there are no [[Cultist]] enemies in play, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Cultist]] enemy, draw it, and attach Mask of Umôrdhoth to it. Shuffle the encounter deck.
Attached enemy gets +2 health. If attached enemy is unique, it gains retaliate. If it is non-unique, it gains aloof instead.

return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: He seems a little too interested in what you’ve been up to these days.
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Jeremiah Pierce
return/rtnotz_encounter.text:
Spawn - Your House. Otherwise, Rivertown.
[action]: Parley. Add Jeremiah Pierce to the victory display. Then, test [willpower] (4). Place 1 doom on the current agenda for each point you fail by (this can cause the current agenda to advance).

return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: The cops have been writing off these disappearances as animal attacks. One cop, in particular…
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Billy Cooper
return/rtnotz_encounter.text:
Spawn - Easttown.
Forced - After a [[Monster]] enemy is defeated at Billy Cooper's location: Add Billy Cooper to the victory display.

return/rtnotz_encounter.flavor: Miss Hill has been preventing other members of the Historical Society from researching similar disappearances. What is she afraid of?
return/rtnotz_encounter.name: Alma Hill
return/rtnotz_encounter.text:
Spawn - Southside.
[action]: Parley. Draw the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. Then, add Alma Hill to the victory display.

return/rttcu.name: The Star • XVII
return/rttcu.text:
Each asset you control with health gets +1 health.
Each asset you control with sanity gets +1 sanity.
[reaction] When the game begins, if The Star • XVII is in your opening hand: Put it into play.

return/rttcu.name: Hallowed Mirror
return/rttcu.text: Limit 1 per deck. [reaction] When you play a copy of Soothing Melody: Either change each "2" on it to a "3," or shuffle it into your deck instead of discarding it. Forced - After Hallowed Mirror enter play: Search your bonded cards for 3 copies of Soothing Melody. Add 1 to your hand and shuffle the other 2 into your deck.

return/rttcu.name: The World • XXI
return/rttcu.text:
[fast] If you have 8 or more cards in your hand, exhaust The World • XXI: Draw 1 card.
[reaction] When the game begins, if The World • XXI is in your opening hand: Put it into play.

return/rttcu.name: Occult Lexicon
return/rttcu.text: Limit 1 per deck. [reaction] When you play a copy of Blood-Rite: Either change each "2" on it to a "3," or shuffle it into your deck instead of discarding it. Forced - After Occult Lexicon enters play: Search your bonded cards for 3 copies of Blood-Rite. Add 1 to your hand and shuffle the other 2 into your deck.

return/rttcu.name: Knight of Swords
return/rttcu.text:
[reaction] When you would succeed at a skill test: You get +1 skill value for this test. You may discard Knight of Swords to get +3 instead.
[reaction] When the game begins, if Knight of Swords is in your opening hand: Put it into play.

return/rttcu.name: Well Connected
return/rttcu.text:
Limit 1 per investigator.
[fast] Exhaust Well Connected: You get +1 skill value for this skill test for every 4 resources you have.
[fast] Spend 2 resources: Ready Well Connected. (Limit once per round.)

return/rttcu.name: The Hierophant • V
return/rttcu.text:
You have 1 additional arcane slot.
Your arcane slots can be used to hold cards that take up accessory slots, and vice versa.
[reaction] When the game begins, if The Hierophant • V is in your opening hand: Put it into play.

return/rttcu.name: Sign Magick
return/rttcu.text: Fast. You have 1 additional arcane slot, which can only be used to hold a [[Spell]] or [[Ritual]] asset. [reaction] After you activate an [action] ability on a [[Spell]] or [[Ritual]] asset, exhaust Sign Magick: Activate an [action] ability on a different [[Spell]] or [[Ritual]] asset you control (without paying its [action] cost).

return/rttcu.name: Nine of Rods
return/rttcu.text:
[reaction] When you draw a non-weakness encounter card, exhaust Nine of Rods: Cancel all of that card's effects and shuffle it into the encounter deck. Then, draw another card from the top of the encounter deck.
[reaction] When the game begins, if Nine of Rods is in your opening hand: Put it into play.

return/rttcu.flavor: You never really know what you are capable of until something is trying to eat you.
return/rttcu.name: Trial by Fire
return/rttcu.text:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Until the end of your turn, set the base value of each of your skills to 5, or the base value of one of your skills to 7.

return/rttcu.name: The Fool • 0
return/rttcu.text:
[reaction] When you play a card, exhaust The Fool • 0: Reduce that card's cost by 1.
[reaction] When the game begins, if The Fool • 0 is in your opening hand: Put it into play.

return/rttcu.name: Moon Pendant
return/rttcu.text:
You have 1 additional tarot slot.
Each non-weakness [[Tarot]] asset in your hand or committed to a skill test gains [wild] [wild].
[reaction] When the game begins, if Moon Pendant is in your opening hand: Put it into play.

return/rttcu.name: Observed
return/rttcu.text:
Permanent. Limit 1 per investigator.
Before setting up each game, draw 3 random cards from the tarot deck and choose 1. Place the chosen card in front of you, in the upright position. Each other investigator ignores its effects. Shuffle the rest back into the tarot deck.

return/rttcu.name: Damned
return/rttcu.text:
Permanent.
Before setting up each game, draw a random card from the tarot deck and place the chosen card in front of you, in the reverse position. Each other investigator ignores its effects.

return/rttcu.name: The Devil • XV
return/rttcu.text: You cannot play assets other than The Devil • XV while it is in your hand. If The Devil • XV is drawn in your opening hand during setup (before or after taking a mulligan), you cannot replace it. It must stay in your opening hand.

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_text: - Randomly choose between Orne Library and Warren Observatory. Put the chosen location into play, along with the rest of the starting locations. Remove the other location from the game. - If you have completed Return to The House Always Wins, search the encounter sets for 1 copy of Enthralled Security Guard, and spawn it at the Administration Building.
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Return to Extracurricular Activities
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Perform the setup as indicated in The Dunwich Legacy Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Extracurricular Activities shown here. (Continued on reverse side.)

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_flavor: The latest addition to the Miskatonic University campus is the Gerald Warren Astronomical Observatory, which sits high atop Crane Hill and overlooks all of Arkham. Built in the latest Art Nouveau style, the observatory stands out distinctly from the rest of the buildings of the university.
return/rtdwl_encounter.flavor: As you traverse the observatory's new halls, you wonder whether its state-of-the-art astronomical equipment will offer answers about the universe or will only raise more questions.
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Warren Observatory
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Forced - After you discover 1 or more clues at Warren Observatory: Discard 3 cards from the top of your deck for each clue just discovered.

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Enthralled Security Guard
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - After Enthralled Security Guard attacks you: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck. Forced - After Enthralled Security Guard is evaded: It is defeated.

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_text:
- Set the Clover Club Stage aside, out of play.
- Choose one of the two Clover Club Lounge locations at random. Put the chosen location into play along with the rest of the starting locations. Remove the other version of Clover Club Lounge from the game.
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Return to The House Always Wins
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Perform the setup as indicated in The Dunwich Legacy Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The House Always Win shown here. (Continued on reverse side.)

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_flavor: Comfortable leather couches, mahogany furniture, and an array of beautiful art greets gamblers, tempting them into the life of the would-be affluent.
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Clover Club Lounge
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Forced - After Clover Club Lounge is revealed: Put the set-aside Clover Club Stage into play. While it is Act 1, Clover Club Lounge gains: "[action]: Look at the top card of your deck. If it is an [[Ally]] asset, you may put it into play. Otherwise, draw it. (Limit once per round.)"

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_flavor: The mesmerizing melody of a torch singer and her band grows louder as you approach the stage near the club's lounge. Mobsters and business-types chatter quietly over the music, wheeling and dealing the night away.
return/rtdwl_encounter.back_text: Clover Club Bar is connected to Clover Club Stage.
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Clover Club Stage
return/rtdwl_encounter.text:
Clover Club Bar is connected to Clover Club Stage.
While it is Act 1, Clover Club Stage gains: "[action] Spend 1 resource: Place that resource on Clover Club Stage.
[free] If there are 1 [per_investigator] resources on Clover Club Stage: Gain 1 [per_investigator] clues from the token pool. (Group limit once per game.)"

return/rtdwl_encounter.flavor: "Think you can pull one over us, eh?"
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Caught Cheating
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Surge. Revelation - Each player who has "cheated" must lose 2 resources and take 1 damage.

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Raise the Stakes
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Revelation - You must (choose one): - Remember that you have "cheated." - Lose 5 resources. - Put Raise the Stakes into play in your threat area. It gains: "Each [[Criminal]] enemy at your location loses aloof. If it is Act 2 or 3, each [[Criminal]] enemy engaged with you gets +1 fight and +1 evade."

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_text:
- Before creating the "Exhibit Deck," add the 2 new Exhibit Hall locations to the original 6 Exhibit Hall locations. Set Exhibit Hall (Restricted Hall) aside and randomly remove 2 Exhibit Hall locations from the game. Then, continue creating the Exhibit Deck as normal.
For the duration of this scenario, the following additional rule applies: "While an investigator is resolving the text on agenda 1b and agenda 2b, the Forced ability on the next agenda in the agenda deck is considered to be active." Attach this card to the scenario reference card as a reminder.
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Return to The Miskatonic Museum
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Perform the setup as indicated in The Dunwich Legacy Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The Miskatonic Museum shown here. (Continued on reverse side.)

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_flavor:
What alluring artifacts are displayed inside?
Do they, too, hold a sinister secret?
return/rtdwl_encounter.flavor: Rows of armor line the hall, while instruments of war and torture hang from the walls. You should watch your step in here…
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Exhibit Hall
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating this location: Take 1 damage.

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_flavor:
What alluring artifacts are displayed inside?
Do they, too, hold a sinister secret?
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Exhibit Hall
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: [action] [action]: Gain 2 clues (from the token bank). Then, if Hunting Horror is in play, place 1 resource on Shadow-spawned. Otherwise, search the encounter deck, discard pile, and the void for Hunting Horror and spawn it in the Museum Halls. Shuffle the encounter deck.

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Dark Bidding
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Revelation - Attach Dark Bidding to Hunting Horror, even if it is out of play. Dark Bidding remains attached to Hunting Horror if it enters the void. Forced - When Hunting Horror attacks an investigator: That investigator must take 1 additional damage and 1 additional horror. Heal 2 damage from Hunting Horror. Discard Dark Bidding. (Max once per attack.)

return/rtdwl_encounter.flavor: All was blackness beneath as the fluttering legions surged northward amidst rushing winds and invisible laughter in the aether… - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath</u>
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Night Beyond Void
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Revelation - Place 1 resource on Shadow-spawned, even if it is out of play.

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_text:
- Remove Agenda 1a - "A Tear in Reality," from the game and replace it with the new Agenda 0a - "Where There's Smoke" and the new agenda 1a - "A Tear in Reality (v.II)." (When you construct the agenda deck, agenda 0a should be on top.)
- When choosing 6 Train Car locations to put into play at random, include the 2 new Train Car locations in this encounter set, for a total of 10 possible cards.
- When choosing an Engine Car location to put into play at random, include the new Engine Car location in this encounter set, for a total of 4 possible cards.
Set the Engineer story asset aside, out of play.
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Return to The Essex County Express
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Perform the setup as indicated in The Dunwich Legacy Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The Essex County Express shown here. (Continued on reverse side.)

return/rtdwl_encounter.flavor: As the train to Dunwich comes to a jarring stop, you look out the window behind you and see an immense tear in the sky, like a rip in a piece of cloth. From this tear, a winged beast emerges. It lets out a painful screech and descends upon the train.
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Where There's Smoke
The Conductor
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Spawn - Leftmost location. Hunter. Massive. Forced - When The Conductor is defeated: Attach it to the current agenda. After you advance the attached agenda, draw The Conductor. Forced - When The Conductor's location leaves play: Instead of discarding The Conductor, move it one location to the right.

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_flavor: The rearmost car of the train detaches as it is pulled backward. To your horror, it rises off the tracks and is consumed by the gate above you.
return/rtdwl_encounter.back_text:
Remove the leftmost location from the game (or place it in the victory display if it has Victory X and no clues on it). Each investigator at that location is defeated. Each enemy and asset at that location is discarded.
Discard all clues controlled by the investigators.
return/rtdwl_encounter.flavor: The force of the gate grows with the presence of the winged beast. Several of the rearmost train cars are pulled backward, and there is a dreadful metallic crunch as they are detached. The train cars topple upward and into the rift in the sky. Nearby passengers are panicking, others are cowering in their seats, and one elderly man has fainted in fear.
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: A Tear in Reality (v.II)

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_text:
Engine Car is connected to the location to the left of it.
You cannot enter Engine Car unless all of the clues on the location to its left have been discovered.
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Engine Car
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Engine Car is connected to the location to the left of it. Engine Car cannot be investigated. Forced - After you reveal Engine Car: Put the set-aside Engineer into play at the Engine Car.

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_text:
Train Car is connected to the locations to the left and right of it.
You cannot enter Train Car unless all of the clues on the location to its left have been discovered.
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Freight Car
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Freight Car is connected to the locations to the left and right of it. Forced - At the end of the round: Each investigator on the Freight Car must test [agility] (1). Each investigator who fails must test [agility] (1) again. each investigator who fails this second test is pulled into the vortex above and is defeated.

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_text:
Train Car is connected to the locations to the left and right of it.
You cannot enter Train Car unless all of the clues on the location to its left have been discovered.
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Baggage Car
return/rtdwl_encounter.text:
Baggage Car is connected to the locations to the left and right of it.
Baggage Car cannot be investigated.
[action] Choose and discard a card from your hand: Discover 1 clue in the Baggage Car.

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Engineer
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: [action] If Engineer is ready: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you succeed, take control of Engineer. If you already control Engineer, discover 1 clue from your location instead. Any investigator at Engineer's location may trigger this action. Forced - When Engineer would be discarded: Instead, heal all damage and horror from it, lose control of it, and exhaust it.

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_text: - Add the new locations to the original locations from the Blood on the Altar encounter set. Remove 1 of the 3 copies of each of these locations from the game at random. Then, choose 1 of the 6 remaining locations at random and remove it from the game as well. Put the remaining locations into play. - When placing encounter cards underneath locations, do not include the 6 cards from the Naomi's Crew encounter set. - Check Campaign Log. If the O'Bannion gang has a bone to pick with the investigators: Spawn one set-aside Hired Gun at one of the locations not connected to Village Commons. Shuffle the other set-aside Hired Gun into the encounter deck.
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Return to Blood on the Altar
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Perform the setup as indicated in The Dunwich Legacy Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Blood on the Altar shown here. - Set each copy of Hired Gun aside, out of play. - Remove the original Village Commons location from the game and replace it with the new Village Commons (Silent Decay). (Continued on reverse side.)

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_flavor:
…it is hard to prevent the impression of a faint, malign odour about the village street, as of the massed mould and decay of centuries.
-H. P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Village Commons
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Each investigator at Village Commons cannot take draw or resource actions. [action]: Resign. "This is suicide! We're better off hiding out the night."

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_flavor:
One dreads to trust the tenebrous tunnel of the bridge, yet there is no way to avoid it.
-H. P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Bishop's Brook
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Forced - After you reveal Bishop's Brook: Test [agility] (4). If you fail, take 2 damage. [free] If there are no clues here: Draw the encounter card underneath Bishop's Brook. (Group limit once per game.)

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_flavor:
It is not reassuring to see, on a closer glance, that most of the houses are deserted and falling to ruin…
-H. P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Burned Ruins
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Forced - After you successfully investigate Burned Ruins: Take 1 damage. [free] If there are no clues here: Draw the encounter card underneath Burned Ruins. (Group limit once per game.)

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_flavor:
From the air of hushed fright at Osborn’s store they knew something hideous had happened…
-H. P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Osborn's General Store
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Forced - After you reveal Osborn's General Store: Gain 2 resources. [free] If there are no clues here: Draw the encounter card underneath Osborn's General Store. (Group limit once per game.)

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_flavor:
"I my self did not more than a Fortnight ago catch a very plain Discourse of evill Powers in the Hill behind my House; wherein there were a Rattling and Rolling, Groaning, Screeching, and Hissing, such as no Things of this Earth cou’d raise up…"
-H. P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Congregational Church
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Forced - After you reveal Congregational Church: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a copy of Kidnapped! and draw it. Shuffle the encounter deck. [free] If there are no clues here: Draw the encounter card underneath Congregational Church. (Group limit once per game.)

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_flavor: Even the locals stay away from this half-sunken hovel.
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: House in the Reeds
return/rtdwl_encounter.text:
While you are in the House in the Reeds, you cannot play assets.
[free] If there are no clues here: Draw the encounter card underneath House in the Reeds. (Group limit once per game.)

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_flavor: With its crumbling rooftop and rat-infested walls, this is hardly even a house, let alone a schoolhouse.
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Schoolhouse
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Forced - After you discover a clue from this location: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a copy of Servant of Many Mouths and draw it. Shuffle the encounter deck. [free] If there are no clues here: Draw the encounter card underneath Schoolhouse. (Group limit once per game.)

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Hired Gun
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Each [[Criminal]] enemy (including Hired Gun) gains: "Hunter. Prey - Most resources." Each copy of Hunted Down gains peril and surge.

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_text:
- Remove 4 copies of Brood of Yog-Sothoth from the original scenario and replace them with the 4 new versions of Brood of Yog-Sothoth from the Return to Undimensioned and Unseen encounter set.
For the duration of this scenario, the following additional rule applies: "If a Brood of Yog-Sothoth would be put into play, it is chosen at random from among the set-aside versions of Brood of Yog-Sothoth." Attach this card to the scenario reference card as a reminder.
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Return to Undimensioned and Unseen
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Perform the setup as indicated in The Dunwich Legacy Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Undimensioned and Unseen shown here. (Continued on reverse side.)

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Brood of Yog-Sothoth
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Massive. Brood of Yog-Sothoth gets +1 [per_investigator] health and cannot be damaged or attacked except using the ability on Esoteric Formula. Forced - After Brood of Yog-Sothoth moves for the first time each round, if it is unengaged: It immediately moves again toward a random location.

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Brood of Yog-Sothoth
return/rtdwl_encounter.text:
Massive.
Brood of Yog-Sothoth gets +2 [per_investigator] health and cannot be damaged or attacked except using the ability on Esoteric Formula.

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Brood of Yog-Sothoth
return/rtdwl_encounter.text:
Massive. Retaliate.
Brood of Yog-Sothoth gets +1 [per_investigator] health and cannot be damaged or attacked except using the ability on Esoteric Formula.

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Brood of Yog-Sothoth
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Massive. Retaliate. Brood of Yog-Sothoth gets +1 [per_investigator] health and cannot be damaged or attacked except using the ability on Esoteric Formula. Forced - After Brood of Yog-Sothoth enters your location, or vice versa: Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take 1 horror.

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Imperceptible Creature
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Surge. Revelation - Attach to a Brood of Yog-Sothoth enemy in play without a copy of Imperceptible Creature attached. Remove 1 clue from that enemy. Attached enemy gains [[Elite]].

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_text: - Replace the original Base of the Hill and Ascending Path with the new Base of the Hill (Warped and Twisted) and Ascending Path (Warped and Twisted). - Add the new Diverging Path and Altered Path to the original Diverging Paths and Altered Paths. Then, randomly remove 1 of each from the game. (You will remove an additional copy of each during standard setup.) - Check Campaign Log. If Naomi has your back: Instead of gaining clues from the token bank via the effect from Part 1 in the Campaign Guide, the lead investigator may choose an investigator to add the set-aside Naomi O'Bannion to his or her deck. This card does not count toward that investigator's deck size.
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Return to Where Doom Awaits
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Perform the setup as indicated in The Dunwich Legacy Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Where Doom Awaits shown here. - Set Naomi O'Bannion aside, out of play. (Continued on reverse side.)

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_flavor: The long slope of Sentinel Hill rises before you, cresting in the jagged edges of Sentinel Peak.
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Base of the Hill
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Base of the Hill is connected to each copy of Diverging Path. Forced - After you discover 1 or more clues from Base of the Hill: Spend those clues and put that many random set-aside Diverging Path locations into play. [action]: Resign. "This is more than I signed up for!"

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_flavor: When you try to follow the path leading farther up Sentinel Hill, you somehow end up walking in a perpetual loop. Each time you stop to get your bearings, you find yourself back at the base of the hill again.
return/rtdwl_encounter.back_text: The path leading farther up the hill is masked. You cannot move into Ascending Path.
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Ascending Path
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Ascending Path is connected to each copy of Altered Path. Forced - After you discover 1 or more clues from Ascending Path: Spend those clues and put that many random set-aside Altered Path locations into play.

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_flavor: A path off the beaten trail leads deeper into the woods surrounding Sentinel Hill.
return/rtdwl_encounter.flavor:
Someone was definitely here,
but there's nothing of any use left…
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Abandoned Camp
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Forced - After you reveal Abandoned Camp: Lose 2 resources for each action you have performed this round (including this one, if applicable).

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_flavor: A shiver courses up your spine as you step forth onto the path, its route touched by a bizarre arcane power.
return/rtdwl_encounter.flavor: There has to be a bottom…
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Fathomless Lake
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Forced - After you reveal Fathomless Lake: If you have 2 or more actions remaining, place 1 doom on the current agenda.

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Naomi O'Bannion
return/rtdwl_encounter.text:
You get +1 [intellect] and +1 [combat].
[reaction] When an investigator at your location reveals a non-[auto_fail] chaos token during an [intellect] or [combat] test, exhaust Naomi O'Bannion: Cancel that chaos token and reveal a new chaos token. For the remainder of this test, if another copy of the canceled chaos token is revealed, cancel it and reveal a new chaos token.

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_text: - Check Campaign Log. If the Ritual was completed: Replace Act 2a - "Into the Beyond" with the new Act 2a - "Into the Beyond (v. II)" included in this encounter set. - Replace Agenda 3a - "Breaking Through" with the new Agenda 3a - "Breaking Through (v. II)" included in this encounter set. - Put the single-sided Realms Beyond location into play and spawn Yog-Sothoth there.
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Return to Lost in Time and Space
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Perform the setup as indicated in The Dunwich Legacy Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Lost in Time and Space shown here. - Set Seth Bishop (Thrall of Yog-Sothoth) aside, out of play. (Continued on reverse side.)

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_name: The Key and the Gate (v. II)
return/rtdwl_encounter.back_text: Revelation - Move Yog-Sothoth to The Edge of the Universe (or Another Dimension if The Edge of the Universe is not in play). Remove Realms Beyond from the game and advance to agenda 4a. Ignore the text on Realms Beyond while resolving this ability.
return/rtdwl_encounter.flavor: Throughout this warped dimension, no matter where you travel, there is a haunting shape in the distance. At first, it appears as a disc, like a black moon with many wriggling arms. But as time passes, you can tell it is growing larger and larger…
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Breaking Through (v. II)
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Forced - After you are moved to a location by an encounter card effect: Take 1 horror.

return/rtdwl_encounter.back_flavor:
You reach an impossibly dense pitch-black void, and realize that this place is where all of reality - all that is and all that ever will be - ends. In its center, you see a minuscule rift, suspended just out of reach. Somehow, you've reached the other side of the gateway above Sentinel Hill.
Just then, a voice from the darkness beyond calls to you. "Git out." The wisp of light you've been following flits into the darkness. Moments later, the warped, twisted face of Seth Bishop emerges. His skin crawls with an unnatural mutation. His eyes are wide, filled with a wicked malice. "Git out! I am his vessel now! I'ave the knowledge of the elders! Now, leave… or die!" He cackles madly as his enthralled, misshapen body limps forward
You must find a way to close the rift for good, but first you must deal with Seth - that is, with the creature he has become.
return/rtdwl_encounter.back_text: Spawn the set-aside Seth Bishop (Thrall of Yog-Sothoth) enemy at The Edge of the Universe.
return/rtdwl_encounter.flavor: You continue to follow the wisp of light, though the treacherous landscape makes it a difficult quarry to chase.
return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Into the Beyond (v. II)
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: [action]: Discard the top 3 cards of the encounter deck. Choose a location discarded by this effect and resolve its 'revelation' ability. Objective - If an investigator enters The Edge of the Universe, advance.

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Seth Bishop
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Retaliate. Forced - When Seth Bishop attacks you during the enemy phase: Either move to Another Dimension after this attack, or Seth Bishop deals +2 damage for this attack. Forced - After Yog-Sothoth enters Seth Bishop's location (or vice versa): Seth is devoured whole. Remove Seth Bishop from the game. Heal 6 damage from Yog-Sothoth.

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Realms Beyond
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Yog-Sothoth is immune to player card effects, cannot take damage, and cannot leave Realms Beyond. As an additional cost for you to leave Realms Beyond, test [willpower] or [agility] (3). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move. Forced - When a forced effect would move an investigator or enemy to Another Dimension: Move them here instead. Cannot be canceled.

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Indecipherable Stairs
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Revelation - Put Indecipherable Stairs into play and discard the top 3 cards of your deck. Forced - After you leave Indecipherable Stairs: You must either take 2 horror, or discard Indecipherable Stairs.

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Towering Luminosity
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Revelation - Put Towering Luminosity into play and either place 1 doom on it or take 2 damage. Forced - After you fail a test while at this location: You must either flip 1 clue on Towering Luminosity to its doom side, or discard Towering Luminosity.

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Unstable Vortex
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Revelation - Put Unstable Vortex into play and discard 1 copy of Tear Through Space, if able. Forced - At the end of your turn, if you are at Unstable Vortex: You must either draw the top card of the encounter deck, or shuffle Unstable Vortex into the encounter deck.

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Haunting Recollections
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Revelation - For each card in your hand, if there is a copy of that card in your discard pile, take 1 horror (to a maximum of 3 horror). If you take no horror from this effect, discard the top 3 cards of your deck.

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: A Baleful Welcome
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Peril. Revelation - Choose two of the following actions (investigate, fight, evade, move, or play). For the remainder of the round, each investigator cannot perform each chosen action. If this is not the first copy of A Baleful Welcome drawn this phase, choose three of those actions instead.

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Infinite Doorway
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Revelation - Attach to your location. As an additional cost to move into or out of attached location, discard the top card of your deck. If the discarded card is a weakness, draw it. Otherwise, for each copy of the discarded card in your hand or play area, you must either take 1 horror or discard that card.

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Resurgent Evils
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Draw the top 2 cards of the encounter deck. - Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance.

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Secret Door
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Revelation - Attach to the location with the most investigators, and without a Secret Door attached. Investigators cannot leave this location. [action]: Test [willpower] (3) to search for the passage or [intellect] (3) to discern the way out. If you succeed, discard Secret Door.

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Inexplicable Cold
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (4). For each point you fail by, you must either choose and discard 1 card from your play area or from your hand, or take 1 damage.

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Oppressive Mists
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Revelation - Attach to your location. Limit 1 per location. Forced - After an investigator at this location draws 1 or more cards, that investigator must test [willpower] (3). If that investigator fails, he or she chooses and discards an equal number of cards. [action] [action]: Discard Oppressive Mists.

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Violent Commands
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Revelation - Put Violent Commands into play in your threat area. [action]: Deal 2 damage to an investigator at your location and discard Violent Commands. Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take 1 horror.

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Idle Hands
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Revelation - Put Idle Hands into play in your threat area. [free] If Idle Hands is in your threat area, during your turn, take 2 damage and discard Idle Hands: You may take an additional action this turn. Forced - At the end of your turn: Take 1 horror.

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Need for Knowledge
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Revelation - If you have no clues, Need for Knowledge gains surge. Otherwise, test [intellect] (X), where X equals the number of clues you have (to a maximum of 5). For each point you fail by, you must either take 1 horror or place 1 of your clues on your location.

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Vassal of the Lurker
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Hunter. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Each investigator at Vassal of the Lurker's location discards 1 card from the top of his or her deck.

return/rtdwl_encounter.name: Eldritch Accord
return/rtdwl_encounter.text: Peril. Revelation - You may draw 1 card. You may choose and discard up to 2 cards from your hand. Test [willpower] (X). If you fail, take 2 horror. X equals the number of cards in your hand when this test begins.

return/rttcu_encounter.back_text:
- Put the [[Spectral]] version of the Wine Cellar (card #28) into play.
For the duration of this scenario, the following additional rule applies: "While resolving The Watcher's Grasp treachery, The Spectral Watcher does not exhaust after it attacks.". Attach this card to the scenario reference card as a reminder.
return/rttcu_encounter.name: Return to Disappearance at the Twilight Estate
return/rttcu_encounter.text: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Disappearance at the Twilight Estate shown here. (Continued on reverse side.)

return/rttcu_encounter.back_text: - When choosing 5 Witch-Haunted Woods locations to put into play at random, include the 2 new Witch-Haunted Woods included in this encounter set, for a total of 9 possibilities. - Set each of the new Arkham Woods locations aside, out of play. (You may optionally gather the Arkham Woods locations included in the Return to The Devourer Below and set those aside, as well, if your collection includes them. This encounter set can be found in the Return to the Night of the Zealot expansion.) - When building the act deck, include both versions of act 4. When advancing to act 4a, put both act cards into play; the text on both cards is active.
return/rttcu_encounter.name: Return to The Witching Hour
return/rttcu_encounter.text: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The Witching Hour shown here. - Remove Arkham Woods (Quiet Glade) from the game. (Continued on reverse side.)

return/rttcu_encounter.back_flavor:
The hooded figures stand down once they realize you are not fighting them or working to disrupt their ritual. "They are not the ones from before - the interlopers who interfered with our ritual," one of them says, pulling off her hood to reveal striking red hair that glows in the firelight. Embers dance around her fingers. "Are you of the same mind as us, then?" she asks.
"nNo, Erynn," the leader of the coven answers for you. "They are lost." She studies you with harsh eyes. "How came you here?"
You explain how you awoke in the woods, how you were attacked by terrible creatures, and how you came to the center of this circle to discover the truth behind your ordeal.
"Anette, I think someone delivered them here," the red-haired witch named Erynn whispers, mystified.
"We should finish here while the circle remains closed. There may be others in these woods. Come, sisters. Let us continue our work," Anette says.
return/rttcu_encounter.flavor: For what purpose have these people gathered? Are they the cause of the disturbances in these woods? And if so, what is their true goal?
return/rttcu_encounter.name: A Circle Unbroken
return/rttcu_encounter.text: Objective - "Perhaps we can learn more from them..." If there are more than 1 [per_investigator] exhausted [[Witch]] enemies at the Witches' Circle, investigators at the Witches' Circle may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

return/rttcu_encounter.back_flavor: The frigid wind howls around you as you venture deeper into the haunted woods beyond Arkham.
return/rttcu_encounter.name: Witch-Haunted Woods
return/rttcu_encounter.text: [free] Take 1 direct damage and 1 direct horror: Choose an investigator at a different Witch-Haunted Woods. That investigator heals 1 damage and 1 horror. (Group limit once per round.)

return/rttcu_encounter.back_flavor: The frigid wind howls around you as you venture deeper into the haunted woods beyond Arkham.
return/rttcu_encounter.name: Witch-Haunted Woods
return/rttcu_encounter.text: Forced - When you discover the last clue from this location: Draw the topmost [[Hex]] treachery in the encounter discard pile. (If you cannot, instead discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a [[Hex]] treachery is discarded, and draw it.)

return/rttcu_encounter.back_flavor: Growing up, you were always warned to stay out of the woods at night. Now you know why.
return/rttcu_encounter.name: Arkham Woods
return/rttcu_encounter.text: During the "enemy attacks" step of the enemy phase, instead of their standard attack, each ready [[Witch]] enemy at this location attacks each investigator in play. Attacks made in this way do not cause the enemy to exhaust.

return/rttcu_encounter.back_flavor: Growing up, you were always warned to stay out of the woods at night. Now you know why.
return/rttcu_encounter.name: Arkham Woods
return/rttcu_encounter.text: While you are at this location, you cannot cancel or ignore card or game effects, and each encounter card you draw gains peril.

return/rttcu_encounter.back_flavor: Growing up, you were always warned to stay out of the woods at night. Now you know why.
return/rttcu_encounter.name: Arkham Woods
return/rttcu_encounter.text: Forced - After you successfully investigate this location: Discard 1 card from the top of the encounter deck for each point you succeeded by. Forced - When the encounter deck runs out of cards: Each investigator at this location takes 2 damage.

return/rttcu_encounter.back_text:
- Put the Senator Nathaniel Rhodes enemy into play in the Entry Hall, with 1 [per_investigator] clues on him. - Put the Wine Cellar location into play. - Set the [[Spectral]] version of the Wine Cellar aside, out of play. - Set the Unstable Realm encounter set aside, out of play, instead of the Realm of Death encounter set. Likewise, when act 1b instructs the players to shuffle the Realm of Death encounter set into the encounter deck, shuffle in the Unstable Realm encounter set instead.
For the duration of this scenario, the following additional rule applies: "While resolving The Watcher's Grasp treachery, The Spectral Watcher does not exhaust after it attacks." Attach this card to the scenario reference card as a reminder.
return/rttcu_encounter.name: Return to At Death's Doorstep
return/rttcu_encounter.text: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to At Death's Doorstep shown here. (Continued on reverse side.)

return/rttcu_encounter.flavor: "Change is what the people demand, and change is what I aim to give them!"
return/rttcu_encounter.name: Senator Nathaniel Rhodes
return/rttcu_encounter.text: Aloof. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (2) to speak with the Senator. If you succeed, either take control of 1 of his clues, or flip 1 doom on him to its clue side. If you fail, flip one of his clues to its doom side.

return/rttcu_encounter.flavor: "Do you understand who you are meddling with?"
return/rttcu_encounter.name: Dmitri Konstantinov
return/rttcu_encounter.text: Spawn - The location with no other [[Silver Twilight]] enemies farthest from you. Forced - After Dmitri Konstantinov enters play: Place 2 doom on him. [reaction] After you evade Dmitri Konstantinov: For every 2 points you succeeded by, remove 1 doom from him.

return/rttcu_encounter.back_flavor: A long, darkened stairway leads down into Josef Meiger's cellar. If you're careful, maybe you can take a gander at what he keeps down there...
return/rttcu_encounter.back_text: Victorian Halls is connected to Wine Cellar.
return/rttcu_encounter.name: Wine Cellar
return/rttcu_encounter.text: Victorian Halls is connected to Wine Cellar. [action]: You disturb the tranquility of this quiet place in search of evidence. Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a [[Monster]] enemy is discarded. Set that enemy aside, out of play. Then gain 2 clues (from the token pool). (Group limit once per game.)

return/rttcu_encounter.back_flavor: The stench of blood and decaying wood emanates from behind the door at the bottom of the dark, dank staircase.
return/rttcu_encounter.back_text: Victorian Halls is connected to Wine Cellar.
return/rttcu_encounter.name: Wine Cellar
return/rttcu_encounter.text: Victorian Halls is connected to Wine Cellar. [reaction] After you successfully investigate the Wine Cellar: Either discover 1 additional clue, or remove 1 doom from a [[Silver Twilight]] enemy in play. Haunted - You must either place 1 doom on a [[Silver Twilight]] enemy in play, or take 1 direct horror.

return/rttcu_encounter.back_text: - Before creating the "Unknown Places" deck, add the 4 new Unknown Places locations to the original 7 Unknown Places locations. Set the Witch House Ruins aside and randomly remove 4 Unknown Places locations from the game. Then, continue creating the Unknown Places deck as normal.
return/rttcu_encounter.name: Return to The Secret Name
return/rttcu_encounter.text: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The Secret Name shown here. (Continued on reverse side.)

return/rttcu_encounter.back_flavor:
It was also possible that the inhabitants of a given dimensional realm could survive entry to many unknown and incomprehensible realms of additional or indefinitely multiplied dimensions - be they within or outside the given space-time continuum - and that the converse would be likewise true.
- H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dreams in the Witch House</u>
return/rttcu_encounter.name: Temple of R'lyeh
return/rttcu_encounter.text: Forced - After you reveal Temple of R'lyeh: Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, draw the top card of the encounter deck. If you fail by 3 or more, that card gains surge.

return/rttcu_encounter.back_flavor:
It was also possible that the inhabitants of a given dimensional realm could survive entry to many unknown and incomprehensible realms of additional or indefinitely multiplied dimensions - be they within or outside the given space-time continuum - and that the converse would be likewise true.
- H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dreams in the Witch House</u>
return/rttcu_encounter.name: The Price Manor
return/rttcu_encounter.text: [action]: Test [combat] (5) to topple the strange, eldritch statue. If you succeed, remove 1 doom from Nahab, even if she is out of play. (Group limit one success per game.) Haunted - Place 1 doom on Nahab (even if she is out of play).

return/rttcu_encounter.back_flavor:
It was also possible that the inhabitants of a given dimensional realm could survive entry to many unknown and incomprehensible realms of additional or indefinitely multiplied dimensions - be they within or outside the given space-time continuum - and that the converse would be likewise true.
- H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dreams in the Witch House</u>
return/rttcu_encounter.name: The 9th Ward
return/rttcu_encounter.text: [action]: Investigate. Investigate using [agility] instead of [intellect]. If you succeed, after discovering clues, you may move to any [[Extradimensional]] location. Haunted - You cannot leave The 9th Ward this round. During your turn, reduce the shroud value of The 9th Ward by 1.

return/rttcu_encounter.back_flavor:
It was also possible that the inhabitants of a given dimensional realm could survive entry to many unknown and incomprehensible realms of additional or indefinitely multiplied dimensions - be they within or outside the given space-time continuum - and that the converse would be likewise true.
- H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dreams in the Witch House</u>
return/rttcu_encounter.name: Library of Ebla
return/rttcu_encounter.text: [action]: Test [willpower] (5) to search the library for arcane lore. If you succeed, deal 3 damage to Nahab, even if she is out of play. (Group limit one success per game.)

return/rttcu_encounter.back_text:
- Check the Campaign Log. If Erynn wants to meet, when building the act deck, use the new Act 1a - "In Pursuit of Answers" instead of the original act 1, and include both versions of act 2. When advancing to act 2a, put both act cards into play; the text on both cards is active. - Randomly choose one of the two Hangman's Brook locations to use during this scenario's setup. Remove the other version from the game. - When randomly choosing 4 Heretic enemies to set aside, shuffle the 2 new Heretic enemies in with the original 6, for a total of 8 possibilities.
For the duration of this scenario, the following additional rule applies: "While resolving The Watcher's Grasp treachery, The Spectral Watcher does not exhaust after it attacks." Attach this card to the scenario reference card as a reminder.
return/rttcu_encounter.name: Return to The Wages of Sin
return/rttcu_encounter.text: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The Wages of Sin shown here. - Set the Erynn MacAoidh story asset aside, out of play. (Continued on reverse side.)

return/rttcu_encounter.back_flavor: Soft chanting guides you to a gloomy clearing near the abandoned chapel. A circle of witchweed surrounds the clearing, swaying gently in the breeze. At the center of the clearing, a cloaked woman kneels before an unmarked grave, far from the rest of the graveyard. You watch in quiet for a few minutes while the woman sings an old, somber melody. It reminds you somewhat of a child's lullaby, with a dark gravity that betrays its purpose. As soon as the song ends, she turns to face you. You recognize Erynn by her crimson red hair and the dark circles that hang beneath her eyes. "You again." She rises. "Have you come here for answers, as I have?"
return/rttcu_encounter.back_text:
Spawn 1 set-aside Heretic enemy at each of the following locations: The Gallows, Heretics' Graves, Chapel Attic, and Chapel Crypt. Add 2 [per_investigator] clues to each location.
Put the set-aside Erynn MacAoidh story asset into play at the Haunted Fields, under no player's control.
Each investigator puts into play 1 set-aside Spectral Web asset, under their control.
return/rttcu_encounter.flavor: You have come to Hangman's Hill to investigate reports over the last few nights of ghost sightings and strange activities in the woods. The witch named Erynn told you to meet her here...but for what purpose?
return/rttcu_encounter.name: In Pursuit of Answers
return/rttcu_encounter.text: Locations cannot be flipped to their [[Spectral]] side.

return/rttcu_encounter.back_flavor:
"I...I do not know what to make of this," Erynn says as you ruminate on the discoveries you've made. The spirits were indeed roused by the presence of the creature in the mist, but it almost seemed to be guiding them. Commanding them. You ask Erynn what kind of creature could do such a thing.
"She was one of us, once. The greatest of us. And perhaps the most dangerous." She sighs. It all makes sense now. There is only one witch you know of who would inspire such reverence and such fear: Keziah Mason.
"Now Anette grasps at the forbidden knowledge she once held. This ritual... I am no longer sure we should go through with it. I fear I have been a fool this whole time." Her dark gaze meets yours, unwavering. "Let me come with you. Perhaps together we can put a stop to this."
return/rttcu_encounter.flavor: "The spirits of my kin are restless," Erynn explains. "But the knowledge they possess is too great to ignore. Please, help me learn from them."
return/rttcu_encounter.name: In Pursuit of the Beyond
return/rttcu_encounter.text: [reaction] When you would "banish" a ghost: You may instead place it beneath Erynn MacAoidh, Heretic side faceup. [action] If you are at Erynn MacAoidh's location, spend 1 [per_investigator] clues: Parley. Choose a Heretic beneath her and place it beneath this act. Objective - Help Erynn find answers by placing Heretics beneath this act. If there are 3 beneath this act, advance.

return/rttcu_encounter.name: Hangman's Brook
return/rttcu_encounter.text: [action]: Resign. "Whose bright idea was this, anyway?" Haunted - Place 1 clue from the supply on Hangman's Brook.

return/rttcu_encounter.flavor: Originating from a natural spring near the peak of Hangman’s Hill, the narrow, shallow brook fills the surrounding woods with a quiet, peaceful babbling. The brook winds down the hill southward, forming the western border of Arkham's Uptown district.
return/rttcu_encounter.name: Hangman's Brook
return/rttcu_encounter.text: [action]: Resign. "Whose bright idea was this, anyway?"

return/rttcu_encounter.name: Heretic
return/rttcu_encounter.text: Heretic gets +2 [per_investigator] health. While Heretic is at a non-[[Spectral]] location, it gains aloof and cannot be engaged or damaged. [free] Spend 1 clue: Parley. Look at Heretic's other side (without resolving its text). Forced - After Heretic is defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.

return/rttcu_encounter.name: Unfinished Business
return/rttcu_encounter.text:
The drowned spirit lunges for you, croaking with the garbled sounds of torment. Sodden weeds are tangled through its hair.
Keep this card in your threat area (this side faceup). If you are eliminated, flip it over. Forced - At the end of the round: You must either discard an asset you control or flip this card back to its enemy side. [action] If you are at Hangman's Brook and it has no clues on it: Test a skill of your choice (5). If you succeed, the ghost is "banished" (resolve the text below).
Do not read until this ghost is "banished."
At the bottom of the riverbank, you find the spirit's remains. You dig a shallow grave beside the brook and there you lay its body to rest, dry and safe at long last.
Add this card to the victory display.

return/rttcu_encounter.name: Heretic
return/rttcu_encounter.text: Heretic gets +2 [per_investigator] health. While Heretic is at a non-[[Spectral]] location, it gains aloof and cannot be engaged or damaged. [free] Spend 1 clue: Parley. Look at Heretic's other side (without resolving its text). Forced - After Heretic is defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.

return/rttcu_encounter.name: Unfinished Business
return/rttcu_encounter.flavor: IT'S COMING! IT'S COMING FOR US BOTH!
return/rttcu_encounter.text:
The wraith is in a panic, casting its gaze into the dark woods in search of some enigmatic predator. What could something that is dead possibly fear?
Keep this card in your threat area (this side faceup). If you are eliminated, flip it over. Forced - At the start of the enemy phase: If The Spectral Watcher is in play, ready it. [action]: Evade. Use only on The Spectral Watcher. Use your lowest skill for this evasion attempt. If you succeed, the ghost is "banished" (resolve the text below) (in addition to evading The Spectral Watcher).
Do not read until this ghost is "banished."
You force the spectral horror back, buying enough time to calm the spirit down. As it dissolves into the night, its gaze never wanders from the watcher's form.
Add this card to the victory display.

return/rttcu_encounter.name: Witchweed
return/rttcu_encounter.text: Peril. Revelation - If Witchweed is drawn... - ...from the standard encounter deck, shuffle it into the spectral encounter deck. - ...from the spectral encounter deck, trigger each haunted ability on your location twice. You may give Witchweed surge to place it in the standard encounter discard pile. Otherwise, place it in the spectral encounter discard pile.

return/rttcu_encounter.name: Erynn MacAoidh
return/rttcu_encounter.text:
Uses (3 secrets).
You get +1 [willpower].
[reaction] When you draw a non-weakness [[Curse]] or [[Power]] treachery, spend 1 secret and exhaust Erynn MacAoidh: Cancel that card's revelation effect.

return/rttcu_encounter.back_text:
- Choose 1 of the 2 Lounge locations at random. Put it into play along with the rest of the starting locations. Remove the other version of the Lounge from the game.
For the duration of this scenario, the following additional rules apply: "The Objective on Act 3a is optional. After all other ([skull]/[cultist]/[tablet]/[elder_thing]) keys have been put into play, if another effect would cause a set-aside key to be put into play, use another unused (+/-) chaos token instead of putting no key into play. At the end of the scenario, add each (+/-) chaos token controlled by an investigator to the victory display. Each one is worth Victory 1." Attach this card to the scenario reference card as a reminder.
return/rttcu_encounter.name: Return to For the Greater Good
return/rttcu_encounter.text: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: - When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to For the Greater Good shown here. - Set the new Hidden Passageway and Sanctum Doorway locations aside, out of play. (Continued on reverse side.)

return/rttcu_encounter.back_flavor: As you approach the staircase leading to the second floor of the mansion, you smell burning candle wax. It is quiet enough that you can hear the gentle crinkling of a page being turned.
return/rttcu_encounter.flavor: The lounge is warm, cozy, and surprisingly empty. There's got to be something else here...right?
return/rttcu_encounter.name: Lounge
