dwl/bota_encounter.back_text:
Reveal each unrevealed location. 
Move all clues in play (including those on each investigator) to The Hidden Chamber.
Spawn the set-aside Silas Bishop enemy in The Hidden Chamber.
dwl/bota_encounter.flavor: The disappearances in town may be related to the events in Arkham. You suspect that something awful is afoot. You must find where the missing townsfolk are being held in order to unveil this conspiracy.
dwl/bota_encounter.name: Searching for Answers
dwl/bota_encounter.text: Objective - When an investigator enters The Hidden Chamber, advance.

dwl/bota_encounter.back_flavor: Despite the danger, you brave the beast's horrifying presence and investigate further before killing it. What you find confirms your worst suspicions. Several journal entries written by a "Seth Bishop" describe the process of feeding the creature in horrifying detail - tomatoes at first, then small game, then cattle, and then finally 'human sacrifices'. But the most disturbing part is that Seth calls the creature by name: 'Silas.'
dwl/bota_encounter.back_text: If The Necronomicon is in play: (→R2) Otherwise: (→R3)
dwl/bota_encounter.flavor: The pitiful beast lunges to grab you with slimy arms, its many jaws snapping in hunger. Killing it would be merciful. But perhaps there is something else to discover about this creature…
dwl/bota_encounter.name: The Chamber of the Beast
dwl/bota_encounter.text: Objective - If Silas Bishop is defeated: (→R1) Objective - If there are no clues in the Hidden Chamber, advance.

dwl/bota_encounter.flavor:
...the sparsely scattered houses wear a surprisingly uniform aspect of age, squalor, and dilapidation.
-H. P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/bota_encounter.back_flavor:
...it is hard to prevent the impression of a faint, malign odour about the village street, as of the massed mould and decay of centuries.
-H. P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/bota_encounter.name: Village Commons
dwl/bota_encounter.text: [action] Resign. "This is suicide! We're better off hiding out the night."

dwl/bota_encounter.back_flavor:
One dreads to trust the tenebrous tunnel of the bridge, yet there is no way to avoid it.
-H. P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/bota_encounter.name: Bishop's Brook
dwl/bota_encounter.text:
Each enemy at Bishop's Brook deals +1 horror while it is attacking.
[free] If there are no clues here: Draw the encounter card underneath Bishop's Brook. (Group limit once per game).

dwl/bota_encounter.back_flavor:
One dreads to trust the tenebrous tunnel of the bridge, yet there is no way to avoid it.
-H. P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/bota_encounter.name: Bishop's Brook
dwl/bota_encounter.text:
If there is an investigator at Bishop's Brook, other investigators cannot enter Bishop's Brook.
[free] If there are no clues here: Draw the encounter card underneath Bishop's Brook. (Group limit once per game).

dwl/bota_encounter.back_flavor:
It is not reassuring to see, on a closer glance, that most of the houses are deserted and falling to ruin...
-H. P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/bota_encounter.name: Burned Ruins
dwl/bota_encounter.text:
Each enemy in the Burned Ruins gets +1 evade.
[free] If there are no clues here: Draw the encounter card underneath Burned Ruins. (Group limit once per game).

dwl/bota_encounter.back_flavor:
It is not reassuring to see, on a closer glance, that most of the houses are deserted and falling to ruin...
-H. P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/bota_encounter.name: Burned Ruins
dwl/bota_encounter.text: Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating the Burned Ruins: Flip 1 clue token on the Burned Ruins to its doom side. [free] If there are no clues here: Draw the encounter card underneath Burned Ruins. (Group limit once per game).

dwl/bota_encounter.back_flavor:
From the air of hushed fright at Osborn’s store they knew something hideous had happened...
-H. P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/bota_encounter.name: Osborn's General Store
dwl/bota_encounter.text:
You cannot gain resources while you are in Osborn's General Store.
[free] If there are no clues here: Draw the encounter card underneath Osborn's General Store. (Group limit once per game).

dwl/bota_encounter.back_flavor:
From the air of hushed fright at Osborn’s store they knew something hideous had happened...
-H. P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/bota_encounter.name: Osborn's General Store
dwl/bota_encounter.text:
[action]Spend 1 resource: Search the top 3 cards of your deck for an [[Item]] card and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.
[free] If there are no clues here: Draw the encounter card underneath Osborn's General Store. (Group limit once per game).

dwl/bota_encounter.back_flavor:
"I my self did not more than a Fortnight ago catch a very plain Discourse of evill Powers in the Hill behind my House; wherein there were a Rattling and Rolling, Groaning, Screeching, and Hissing, such as no Things of this Earth cou’d raise up..."
-H.P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/bota_encounter.name: Congregational Church
dwl/bota_encounter.text: Forced - After Congregational Church is revealed: Search the encounter deck for a [[Humanoid]] enemy and spawn it at the Village Commons. Shuffle the encounter deck. [free] If there are no clues here: Draw the encounter card underneath Congregational Church. (Group limit once per game).

dwl/bota_encounter.back_flavor:
"I my self did not more than a Fortnight ago catch a very plain Discourse of evill Powers in the Hill behind my House; wherein there were a Rattling and Rolling, Groaning, Screeching, and Hissing, such as no Things of this Earth cou’d raise up..."
-H.P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/bota_encounter.name: Congregational Church
dwl/bota_encounter.text:
[action] Choose and discard a card from your hand: Gain 2 resources.
[free] If there are no clues here: Draw the encounter card underneath Congregational Church. (Group limit once per game).

dwl/bota_encounter.back_flavor: Even the locals stay away from this half-sunken hovel.
dwl/bota_encounter.name: House in the Reeds
dwl/bota_encounter.text:
While you are in the House in the Reeds, you cannot play events.
[free] If there are no clues here: Draw the encounter card underneath House in the Reeds. (Group limit once per game).

dwl/bota_encounter.back_flavor: Even the locals stay away from this half-sunken hovel.
dwl/bota_encounter.name: House in the Reeds
dwl/bota_encounter.text: Forced - After House in the Reeds is revealed: Search the encounter deck for a [[Nightgaunt]] enemy and spawn it in the Village Commons. Shuffle the encounter deck. [free] If there are no clues here: Draw the encounter card underneath House in the Reeds. (Group limit once per game).

dwl/bota_encounter.back_flavor: With its crumbling rooftop and rat-infested walls, this is hardly even a house, let alone a schoolhouse.
dwl/bota_encounter.name: Schoolhouse
dwl/bota_encounter.text:
While you are in the Schoolhouse, you cannot commit skill cards to skill tests.
[free] If there are no clues here: Draw the encounter card underneath Schoolhouse. (Group limit once per game).

dwl/bota_encounter.back_flavor: With its crumbling rooftop and rat-infested walls, this is hardly even a house, let alone a schoolhouse.
dwl/bota_encounter.name: Schoolhouse
dwl/bota_encounter.text:
You cannot discover clues here except by investigating.
[free] If there are no clues here: Draw the encounter card underneath Schoolhouse. (Group limit once per game).

Revelation - Put The Hidden Chamber into play. The Hidden Chamber and the location from which it was drawn are connected to one another. The door to The Hidden Chamber is locked. You cannot enter The Hidden Chamber unless Key to the Chamber is attached to The Hidden Chamber.
dwl/bota_encounter.name: The Hidden Chamber

dwl/bota_encounter.flavor: This tarnished silver key was hidden and kept safe out of sight. It must lead somewhere important.
dwl/bota_encounter.name: Key to the Chamber
dwl/bota_encounter.text: Revelation - Take control of Key to the Chamber. [free] If The Hidden Chamber is connected to your location: Attach Key to the Chamber to The Hidden Chamber.

dwl/bota_encounter.flavor:
What walked on the mountains that May-Night?
What Roodmas horror fastened itself on the world in half human flesh and blood?
-H. P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/bota_encounter.name: Silas Bishop
dwl/bota_encounter.text:
Massive.
Silas Bishop cannot make attacks of opportunity.

dwl/bota_encounter.flavor:
...His memories of chantings in the great stone circles were not altogether connected with Wilbur and his grandfather.
-H. P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/bota_encounter.name: Zebulon Whateley
dwl/bota_encounter.text:
You get +1 [willpower].
[reaction] After you succeed at a [willpower] test on a treachery card, exhaust Zebulon Whateley: Draw 1 card.

dwl/bota_encounter.flavor:
Earl Sawyer, who tended the horse and cattle during Wilbur’s absence, had developed a woefully acute case of nerves.
-H. P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/bota_encounter.name: Earl Sawyer
dwl/bota_encounter.text:
You get +1 [agility].
[reaction] After you evade an enemy, exhaust Earl Sawyer: Draw 1 card.

dwl/bota_encounter.name: Powder of Ibn Ghazi
dwl/bota_encounter.text:
Powder of Ibn Ghazi enters play with X clues on it, where X is the number of characters who "survived the Dunwich Legacy" in your Campaign Log.
[free]: Move 1 clue from Powder of Ibn Ghazi to an exhausted Brood of Yog-Sothoth at your location.

dwl/bota_encounter.name: Kidnapped!
dwl/bota_encounter.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (4) or [agility] (4). If you fail, add an [[Ally]] asset you control to the pool of potential sacrifices. Then, attach Kidnapped! to the current agenda. If you have no [[Ally]] assets, take 2 damage and discard Kidnapped! instead. Forced - When attached agenda advances: Choose a potential sacrifice at random and place it underneath the agenda deck.

dwl/bota_encounter.name: Psychopomp's Song
dwl/bota_encounter.text: Surge. Peril. Revelation - Add Psychopomp's Song to any investigator's threat area. Forced - When you would take 1 or more damage: Take 2 additional damage and discard Psychopomp's Song.

dwl/bota_encounter.name: Strange Signs
dwl/bota_encounter.text: Revelation - Test [intellect] (3). If you fail, add 1 clue from the token pool to your location (2 clues instead if there are 3 or 4 investigators in the game).

dwl/bota_encounter.flavor: A sickening display of gore causes you to retch. You’re glad this wasn’t you.
dwl/bota_encounter.name: Rotting Remains
dwl/bota_encounter.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, take 1 horror.

dwl/bota_encounter.name: Servant of Many Mouths
dwl/bota_encounter.text: Spawn - Any empty location. Retaliate. [reaction] After you defeat Servant of Many Mouths: Discover 1 clue at any location.

dwl/tmm_encounter.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -2 (-4 instead if Hunting Horror is at your location.)
[cultist]: -3. If you fail, search the encounter deck, discard pile, and the void for Hunting Horror and spawn it at your location, if able.
[tablet]: -4. If Hunting Horror is at your location, it immediately attacks you.
[elder_thing]: -5. If you fail, discard an asset you control.
dwl/tmm_encounter.name: The Miskatonic Museum
dwl/tmm_encounter.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1 (-3 instead if Hunting Horror is at your location.)
[cultist]: -1. If you fail, search the encounter deck, discard pile, and the void for Hunting Horror and spawn it at your location, if able.
[tablet]: -2. Return 1 of your clues to your current location.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, discard an asset you control.

dwl/tmm_encounter.back_flavor: From the shadows of the museum halls, a terrible creature slithers forth, long and serpentine, and propelled by black leathery wings.
dwl/tmm_encounter.back_text:
If Hunting Horror is in play, add 1 doom to it.
If Hunting Horror is not in play, search the encounter deck, discard pile, and the void for Hunting Horror and spawn it in Museum Halls, if able. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
dwl/tmm_encounter.flavor: Dr. Armitage has given the university’s Latin translation of The Necronomicon to his associate, Harold Walsted, the curator of the Miskatonic University Museum. Worried that someone might still be after the book, you have gone to the museum to recover it.
dwl/tmm_encounter.name: Restricted Access
dwl/tmm_encounter.text: Forced - When Hunting Horror enters play: Attach the set-aside copy of Shadow-spawned to it, or add 1 resource to Shadow-spawned if it is already attached.

dwl/tmm_encounter.back_flavor: The creature does not relent, pursuing you throughout the museum.
dwl/tmm_encounter.back_text:
If Hunting Horror is in play, add 1 doom to it.
If Hunting Horror is not in play, search the encounter deck, discard pile, and the void for Hunting Horror and spawn it in Museum Halls, if able. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
dwl/tmm_encounter.flavor: The shadows in the museum grow and become darker. As the shadows lengthen and shift, they begin to suggest the sinewy body of an uncanny creature darting at the periphery of your awareness...
dwl/tmm_encounter.name: Shadows Deepen
dwl/tmm_encounter.text: Forced - When Hunting Horror enters play: Attach the set-aside copy of Shadow-spawned to it, or add 1 resource to Shadow-spawned if it is already attached.

dwl/tmm_encounter.back_flavor: With no way of defeating the creature in the museum, you flee. In every shadow of every corridor, the serpentine horror’s slithering body can be seen, the museum halls growing darker with the creature’s presence. As you reach the entrance, it blocks the doorway and attacks you with its terrible fangs. You barely manage to escape the building with your life, though the effects of the creature’s venom will scar you forever.
dwl/tmm_encounter.back_text: Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated and suffers 1 physical trauma.
dwl/tmm_encounter.flavor: The creature in the museum grows larger and more terrifying with each passing moment. Its body slithers from shadow to shadow, every corner of every room a potential hiding place for the hideous beast.
dwl/tmm_encounter.name: In Every Shadow
dwl/tmm_encounter.text: Forced - When Hunting Horror enters play: Attach the set-aside copy of Shadow-spawned to it, or add 1 resource to Shadow-spawned if it is already attached.

dwl/tmm_encounter.back_text:
If you spent clues to advance:
You find the window nearest to the guard and tap it loud enough to get his attention. He gives a startled jump, then shifts open the window. “What do you want?” he asks timidly. You explain the situation to him and tell him he is in grave danger. He warily opens the front door to the Museum, shaking his head. “I wasn’t even supposed to be here today...”
Choose an investigator to take control of the set-aside Adam Lynch asset. Reveal the Museum Halls. Advance to Act 2a - "Night at the Museum."
If you successfully performed the [action] ability on the Museum Halls to advance:
With great strength, you break down the door to the Museum, making considerable noise as you do. The security guard sees you enter, cries out in fear, and rushes toward the back of the museum.
The door leading into the Museum Halls is broken. Reveal the Museum Halls. Advance to Act 2a - "Breaking and Entering."
dwl/tmm_encounter.flavor: Unfortunately, the entrance to the Museum is kept locked at this late hour. A security guard is visible through the building’s front windows, oblivious to his surroundings. Perhaps you can find a way to get his attention and convince him to let you in.
dwl/tmm_encounter.name: Finding A Way Inside

dwl/tmm_encounter.back_flavor: When you enter the restricted hall, you find the curator of the museum lying in a pool of blood, his intestines strewn about in a grotesque display. Your stomach turns over and you resist the urge to vomit. Whatever did this, it’s still nearby...
dwl/tmm_encounter.back_text: Search the encounter deck, discard pile, the void, and all play areas for Hunting Horror, and place it in the Exhibit Hall (Restricted Hall), ready. Advance to Act 3a.
dwl/tmm_encounter.flavor: The Necronomicon is being kept in a Restricted Hall somewhere in the museum. Adam barely knows his way around, and gives a startled jump at every creak of the old building. "I just started here last week," he explains. "What sort of trouble did you say was going on?" You haven’t the heart to give him the full story.
dwl/tmm_encounter.name: Night at the Museum
dwl/tmm_encounter.text: Objective - If an investigator enters the Exhibit Hall (Restricted Hall), advance.

dwl/tmm_encounter.back_flavor: When you enter the Restricted Hall, you find the curator of the museum clutching an ornate statue as if it were a club, his suit stained with blood, a panicked expression on his face. The security guard you saw earlier lies in a pool of blood nearby, his intestines strewn about in a grotesque display. Your stomach turns and you resist the urge to vomit. "I tried to stop it, but..." the curator says quietly, his voice quivering. Whatever did this, it’s still nearby...
dwl/tmm_encounter.back_text: Choose an investigator to take control of the set-aside Harold Walsted asset. Search the encounter deck, discard pile, the void, and all play areas for Hunting Horror, and place it in the Exhibit Hall (Restricted Hall), ready. Advance to Act 3a.
dwl/tmm_encounter.flavor: The Necronomicon is being kept in a Restricted Hall somewhere in the museum.
dwl/tmm_encounter.name: Breaking and Entering
dwl/tmm_encounter.text: Objective - If an investigator enters the Exhibit Hall (Restricted Hall), advance.

dwl/tmm_encounter.back_flavor:
At last, you find the locked case containing the Necronomicon.
The tome, over eight hundred pages in length, is filled with all manner of macabre imagery, formulae, spells, prophecies, and descriptions of creatures from beyond the threshold of space.
Without a doubt, it is a dangerous book... But its secrets could be very useful.
dwl/tmm_encounter.back_text: The investigators must decide (choose one): - It's too dangerous to keep around. We must destroy it. (→R1) - It's too valuable to destroy. We must keep it safe.(→R2)
dwl/tmm_encounter.flavor: Somewhere in this area is Olaus Wormius’s Latin translation of the Necronomicon. You must find it and escape while you can!
dwl/tmm_encounter.name: Searching for the Tome
dwl/tmm_encounter.text: Objective - If there are no clues remaining in the Exhibit Hall (Restricted Hall), advance.

dwl/tmm_encounter.back_flavor: The Miskatonic Museum is an opulent and stately building, supported by expeditions funded by the university. Its sizable collection of exotic artifacts, curios, and art has drawn visitors from all over the country.
dwl/tmm_encounter.flavor: As you approach the museum, you draw your coat tighter around your body to keep the wintry air away. The full moon drapes the building in ominous bright moonlight.
dwl/tmm_encounter.name: Museum Entrance
dwl/tmm_encounter.text: Investigators at the Museum Entrance cannot gain resources. [action] Resign. "Eh. How important can a book really be, anyway?"

dwl/tmm_encounter.back_text:
The entrance to the Museum Halls is locked. You cannot move into the Museum Halls.
Museum Entrance gains: "[action]: Test [combat] (5) to attempt to break down the door to the Museum. If you are successful, immediately advance to Act 1b."
dwl/tmm_encounter.name: Museum Halls
dwl/tmm_encounter.text:
Museum Halls is connected to each copy of Exhibit Hall.
[action] Investigators in the Museum Halls spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Put the top card of the Exhibit deck into play, unrevealed.

dwl/tmm_encounter.back_flavor: A plaque next to this doorway reads: "Security." The door is ajar, and inside you catch the scent of blood.
dwl/tmm_encounter.flavor: Somebody must have left the security office in a hurry. Blood stains the floor under the desk nearby. Thankfully, there are some useful supplies here you may be able to use.
dwl/tmm_encounter.name: Security Office
dwl/tmm_encounter.text: [action] [action]: Search the top 6 cards of your deck for a card and add it to your hand. Shuffle the rest back into your deck. (Limit once per turn.)

dwl/tmm_encounter.back_flavor: A plaque next to this doorway reads: "Security." The door is ajar, and inside you catch the scent of blood.
dwl/tmm_encounter.flavor: Somebody must have left the security office in a hurry. Blood stains the floor under the desk nearby. There are some maps of the Museum in here, as well.
dwl/tmm_encounter.name: Security Office
dwl/tmm_encounter.text: [action] [action]: Look at the revealed side of an Exhibit Hall in play, or the top card of the Exhibit deck. (Limit once per turn.)

dwl/tmm_encounter.back_flavor: A sturdy wooden door with a plaque next to it reads: "Administration." In the hall outside the doorway, you see a row of paintings depicting the museum’s many curators through the years, each adorned with their name and years of employment. Perhaps it’s just your imagination, but they look more distressed in recent years.
dwl/tmm_encounter.name: Administration Office
dwl/tmm_encounter.flavor: This office is meticulously organized, from the books in alphabetical order on the shelves to the stacks of forms organized by category on each desk. A coat is draped over one of the nearby chairs; perhaps somebody other than the security guard is still here at this late hour.
dwl/tmm_encounter.text: You cannot investigate Administration Office while you have 4 or fewer resources.

dwl/tmm_encounter.flavor: This office is meticulously organized, from the books in alphabetical order on the shelves to the stacks of forms organized by category on each desk. A coat is draped over one of the nearby chairs; perhaps somebody other than the security guard is still here at this late hour.
dwl/tmm_encounter.back_flavor: A sturdy wooden door with a plaque next to it reads: "Administration." In the hall outside the doorway, you see a row of paintings depicting the museum’s many curators through the years, each adorned with their name and years of employment. Perhaps it’s just your imagination, but they look more distressed in recent years.
dwl/tmm_encounter.name: Administration Office
dwl/tmm_encounter.text: You cannot investigate Administration Office while you have 4 or fewer cards in your hand.

dwl/tmm_encounter.back_flavor:
What alluring artifacts are displayed inside?
Do they, too, hold a sinister secret?
dwl/tmm_encounter.flavor: A strange chill fills this hall, as if the climate of Alaskan wilderness has traveled along with the artifacts on display.
dwl/tmm_encounter.name: Exhibit Hall
dwl/tmm_encounter.text: Forced - After you enter this location: Lose all of your remaining actions and immediately end your turn. While you are in this location, you get +2 [agility].

dwl/tmm_encounter.back_flavor:
What alluring artifacts are displayed inside?
Do they, too, hold a sinister secret?
dwl/tmm_encounter.flavor: Who would immortalize such a terrible fate?
dwl/tmm_encounter.name: Exhibit Hall
dwl/tmm_encounter.text: Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating this location: Discard an asset you control.

dwl/tmm_encounter.back_flavor:
What alluring artifacts are displayed inside?
Do they, too, hold a sinister secret?
dwl/tmm_encounter.flavor: Nothing about this exhibit is natural.
dwl/tmm_encounter.name: Exhibit Hall
dwl/tmm_encounter.text: Forced - After you enter this location: Discard 2 cards from your hand at random.

dwl/tmm_encounter.back_flavor:
What alluring artifacts are displayed inside?
Do they, too, hold a sinister secret?
dwl/tmm_encounter.flavor: Sandstone sculptures and bejeweled artifacts from another era clutter this exhibit, like the tomb of an ancient pharaoh.
dwl/tmm_encounter.name: Exhibit Hall
dwl/tmm_encounter.text: Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating this location: Lose 1 action.

dwl/tmm_encounter.flavor:
I need no reminder of my mortality.
I know my death is imminent.
dwl/tmm_encounter.back_flavor:
What alluring artifacts are displayed inside?
Do they, too, hold a sinister secret?
dwl/tmm_encounter.name: Exhibit Hall
dwl/tmm_encounter.text: Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating this location: Take 1 horror.

dwl/tmm_encounter.back_flavor:
What alluring artifacts are displayed inside?
Do they, too, hold a sinister secret?
dwl/tmm_encounter.flavor: Exhibit Not Yet Open For Viewing.
dwl/tmm_encounter.name: Exhibit Hall
dwl/tmm_encounter.text: While Hunting Horror is at this location, this location cannot be investigated.

dwl/tmm_encounter.name: Harold Walsted
dwl/tmm_encounter.text: You get +2 [intellect] while investigating [[Miskatonic]] locations. Forced - When Harold Walsted leaves play: Remove him from the game and add 1 [tablet] token to the chaos bag for the remainder of the campaign.

dwl/tmm_encounter.name: Adam Lynch
dwl/tmm_encounter.text: While you control Adam Lynch, treat the "[action] [action]" ability on the Security Office as if it were an "[action]" ability. Forced - When Adam Lynch leaves play: Remove him from the game and add 1 [tablet] token to the chaos bag for the remainder of the campaign.

dwl/tmm_encounter.flavor: It was Abdul Alhazred’s magnum opus.
dwl/tmm_encounter.name: The Necronomicon
dwl/tmm_encounter.text:
You get +1 [intellect].
[action]: Gain 2 resources.

dwl/tmm_encounter.name: Hunting Horror
dwl/tmm_encounter.text: Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - At the start of the enemy phase: Reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If the revealed token has a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol, ready Hunting Horror. Forced - When Hunting Horror leaves play, place it in the void.

dwl/tmm_encounter.name: Shadow-spawned
dwl/tmm_encounter.text:
Shadow-spawned remains attached to Hunting Horror if it enters the void.
Hunting Horror gets +1 fight, +1 health, and +1 evade for each resource on Shadow-spawned. If there are 3 resources on Shadow-spawned, Hunting Horror also gains Massive.

dwl/tmm_encounter.flavor:
...viperine creatures, which had curiously distorted heads, and grotesquely great clawed appendages...
-H.P. Lovecraft & August Derleth, The Lurker at the Threshold
dwl/tmm_encounter.name: Stalked in the Dark
dwl/tmm_encounter.text: Revelation - If Hunting Horror is in play, it readies, engages you, and attacks each investigator at your location. Otherwise, Stalked in the Dark gains surge.

dwl/tmm_encounter.name: Passage into the Veil
dwl/tmm_encounter.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). This test has +2 difficulty if Hunting Horror is at your location. If you fail you must either (choose one): discard the top 5 cards of your deck, or take 1 direct damage and deal 1 damage to each of your [[Ally]] assets.

dwl/tmm_encounter.flavor: Are you watching the exhibits, or are the exhibits watching you?
dwl/tmm_encounter.name: Ephemeral Exhibits
dwl/tmm_encounter.text: Revelation - Test [intellect] (3). If you fail, lose 1 action for each point you failed by.

dwl/tmm_encounter.name: Slithering Behind You
dwl/tmm_encounter.text: Revelation - If Hunting Horror is in play, add 1 doom to it. If Hunting Horror is not in play, search the encounter deck, discard pile, and the void for Hunting Horror and spawn it at your location, engaged with you. Shuffle the encounter deck.

dwl/bota.name: Prepared for the Worst
dwl/bota.text: Search the top 9 cards of your deck for a [[Weapon]] asset and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

dwl/bota.name: Keen Eye
dwl/bota.text:
Permanent.
[free] Spend 2 resources: You get +1 [intellect] until the end of the phase.
[free] Spend 2 resources: You get +1 [combat] until the end of the phase.

dwl/bota.name: Preposterous Sketches
dwl/bota.text:
Play only if there is a clue on your location.
Draw 3 cards.

dwl/bota.name: Higher Education
dwl/bota.text:
Permanent.
While you have 5 or more cards in your hand, Higher Education gains:
"[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +2 [willpower] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +2 [intellect] for this skill test."

dwl/bota.flavor: “I never mind being on my own. That’s when I do my best work.”
dwl/bota.name: Lone Wolf
dwl/bota.text:
Limit 1 per investigator.
[reaction] When your turn begins, if there are no other investigators at your location: Gain 1 resource.

dwl/bota.name: Streetwise
dwl/bota.text:
Permanent.
[free] Spend 2 resources: You get +3 [intellect] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 2 resources: You get +3 [agility] for this skill test.

dwl/bota.name: Defiance
dwl/bota.text: Before revealing chaos tokens for this test, choose one of the following symbols: ([skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing]). Ignore the effects of the chosen symbol during this test (including its modifier).

dwl/bota.name: Blood Pact
dwl/bota.text:
Permanent.
[free] Add 1 doom to Blood Pact: You get +3 [willpower] for this skill test. (Limit once per test.)
[free] Add 1 doom to Blood Pact: You get +3 [combat] for this skill test. (Limit once per test.)

dwl/bota.name: Rise to the Occasion
dwl/bota.text: Commit only to a skill test you are performing, and only if the difficulty of that test is at least 2 higher than your base skill value.

dwl/bota.name: Scrapper
dwl/bota.text:
Permanent.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [combat] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [agility] for this skill test.

dwl/bota.flavor: You can never be too prepared.
dwl/bota.name: Emergency Cache

dwl/tmm.name: Emergency Aid
dwl/tmm.text: Choose an investigator at your location. Heal 2 damage from that investigator or from an [[Ally]] asset he or she controls.

dwl/tmm.name: Brother Xavier
dwl/tmm.text:
You get +1 [willpower].
Brother Xavier may be assigned damage and/or horror dealt to other investigators at your location.
[reaction] When Brother Xavier is defeated: Deal 2 damage to an enemy at your location.

dwl/tmm.flavor: "That's the worst plan I've ever heard. Well, what are we waiting for?"
dwl/tmm.name: "I've got a plan!"
dwl/tmm.text: Fight. This attack uses [intellect]. You deal +1 damage for this attack for each clue you have (max +3 damage).

dwl/tmm.flavor: Searchers after horror haunt strange, far places. - H. P. Lovecraft, "The Picture in the House"
dwl/tmm.name: Pathfinder
dwl/tmm.text: [free]During your turn, if you are not engaged with any enemies, exhaust Pathfinder: Move to a connecting location.

dwl/tmm.flavor: It may not be legal, but it gets the job done.
dwl/tmm.name: Contraband
dwl/tmm.text: Choose an asset controlled by an investigator at your location. Double the number of ammo or supply tokens on that asset.

dwl/tmm.name: Adaptable
dwl/tmm.text:
Permanent.
In between each game of a campaign, you may swap up to two level 0 cards out of your deck in exchange for an equal number of level 0 cards. (You must still follow all deckbuilding rules for your investigator).

dwl/tmm.flavor: Some things, once seen, can't be unseen.
dwl/tmm.name: Delve Too Deep
dwl/tmm.text: In player order, each investigator draws 1 card from the top of the encounter deck. Then, add Delve Too Deep to the victory display.

dwl/tmm.name: Song of the Dead
dwl/tmm.text: Uses (5 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat]. You get +1 [willpower] for this attack. If a [skull] symbol is revealed during this attack, this attack deals +2 damage.

dwl/tmm.name: Oops!
dwl/tmm.text:
Fast. Play after you fail a skill test by 2 or less while attacking an enemy engaged with you.
Deal this attack's damage to a different enemy at your location.

dwl/tmm.name: Fire Extinguisher
dwl/tmm.text: [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. [action] Exile Fire Extinguisher: Evade. You get +3 [agility] for this test. If you are successful, evade each other enemy engaged with you, as well.

dwl/tmm.name: Flare
dwl/tmm.text: Either (choose one): - Fight. You get +3 [combat] and deal +2 damage for this attack. Exile Flare. - Search the top 9 cards of any investigator's deck for an [[Ally]] asset and put it into play under your control. Then, exile Flare. Shuffle the searched deck.

dwl/tmm.flavor: A good pipe can calm the most frazzled of nerves.
dwl/tmm.name: Smoking Pipe
dwl/tmm.text:
Uses (3 supplies).
[free] Spend 1 supply, exhaust Smoking Pipe, and take 1 damage: Heal 1 horror.

dwl/tmm.flavor: Do not exceed the recommended dosage.
dwl/tmm.name: Painkillers
dwl/tmm.text:
Uses (3 supplies).
[free] Spend 1 supply, exhaust Painkillers, and take 1 horror: Heal 1 damage.

dwl/dwl.back_flavor: Zoey had known that she was special ever since God spoke to her one night when she was six years old... the night that terrible fire took away her parents. He told her that He had chosen her from among all the people of the world to be His agent. She would protect the innocent and punish the wicked. Since then, He comes to her in times of trouble, offering guidance and comfort. Zoey now travels from city to city, taking work as a chef to support herself. When she isn't working, she stalks the night, guided by the Lord's voice. Wherever she finds wickedness, she strikes it down without remorse or hesitation.
dwl/dwl.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to five other level 0 cards from any other class. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Zoey's Cross, Smite the Wicked, 1 random basic weakness.

deck_options.error: You cannot have more than 5 cards that are not Guardian or Neutral

dwl/dwl.flavor: "God has spoken. I will do His work without hesitation."
dwl/dwl.name: Zoey Samaras
dwl/dwl.text:
[reaction] After you become engaged with an enemy: Gain 1 resource.
[elder_sign] effect: +1. If this skill test is successful during an attack, that attack deals +1 damage.

dwl/dwl.back_flavor: When disaster strikes, Rex Murphy is usually on hand, suffering the consequences. After spending a day with Rex, even the most hardened skeptic will concede that the man is cursed. Anytime he had a lead on a good story, something would go wrong. That business in Innsmouth with the photographs that had blown out to sea. The tracks in Dunwich that had washed away in the rain just before he'd brought the sheriff. His terrible fortune has more than once exposed him to gruesome beasts and occult conspiracies. To survive, Rex has developed an inquisitive mind, keeping one step ahead of the next disaster.
dwl/dwl.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to five other level 0 cards from any other class. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Search for the Truth, Rex's Curse, 1 random basic weakness. Deckbuilding Restrictions: No [[Fortune]] cards.

deck_options.error: You cannot have more than 5 cards that are not Seeker or Neutral

dwl/dwl.flavor: "This time, nothing will stop me from getting at the truth!"
dwl/dwl.name: Rex Murphy
dwl/dwl.text:
[reaction] After you succeed at a skill test by 2 or more while investigating: Discover 1 clue at your location.
[elder_sign] effect: +2. You may instead choose to automatically fail this skill test to draw 3 cards.

dwl/dwl.back_flavor: Jenny Barnes has spent the majority of her young life in pursuit of creature comforts, fine dining, and the latest fashions. That all changed when she received a letter from her sister, Isabelle. In this letter, Isabelle confessed that mysterious forces were aligning against her and that she feared she may fall victim to some paranormal threat. It was the last letter Jenny received from her beloved sister. Jenny has since returned to the States to track down and investigate all occult occurrences she can find. Hardly a wilting flower, she has proven herself a crack shot as well as a fearless and clever investigator of the unknown. Until Isabelle's disappearance is explained, Jenny will never relent in her search.
dwl/dwl.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to five other level 0 cards from any other class. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Jenny's Twin .45s, Searching for Izzie, 1 random basic weakness.

deck_options.error: You cannot have more than 5 cards that are not Rogue or Neutral

dwl/dwl.flavor: "No more 'Miss Barnes' from you. My friends call me Jenny."
dwl/dwl.name: Jenny Barnes
dwl/dwl.text:
You collect 1 additional resource during each upkeep phase.
[elder_sign] effect: +1 for each resource you have.

dwl/dwl.back_flavor: Jazz has been nothing but trouble for Jim since the day he picked up his daddy's trumpet. There was something weird and otherworldly about the writing on the inside of the bell, but the tones from it were smooth and dark, like good coffee. That trumpet landed Jim a lot of gigs until the time it made Widow Jenkins get up and dance, the day he played at her funeral. After that, it was kind of hard to find work. Since then, Jim has learned a lot about jazz - and the things the graveyard ghouls talk about on cold autumn nights. Lately, they've been talking about The End, as in the end of everything that is and could be. The Final Rhapsody. The fact is, Jim isn't too keen on that idea.
dwl/dwl.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to five other level 0 cards from any other class. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Jim's Trumpet, Final Rhapsody, 1 random basic weakness.

deck_options.error: You cannot have more than 5 cards that are not Mystic or Neutral

dwl/dwl.flavor: "No, not quiet at all. Dead folks get downright rambunctious when I play my horn."
dwl/dwl.name: Jim Culver
dwl/dwl.text:
Treat the modifier on [skull] tokens you reveal as "0."
Anytime you reveal a [elder_sign] token, you may choose to instead treat it as a [skull] token.
[elder_sign] effect: +1.

dwl/dwl.back_flavor: At night, "Ashcan" Pete sleeps wherever his travels take him: in a field, on a train, or maybe, if he's lucky, in a barn. He bunks with his loyal hound dog, Duke, on one side and his beat-up guitar on the other. And sometimes when Pete sleeps, he dreams. He dreams of haunted, tortured places and of horrible creatures. When he wakes up, he knows that someone needs his help, because his dreams are true. He could not say how long he has been on the road, living by his wits, but he can say for certain no place is too far to go to help someone in need. And as long as Pete can help people, he is not likely to stop wandering any time soon.
dwl/dwl.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to five other level 0 cards from any other class. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Duke, Wracked by Nightmares, 1 random basic weakness.

deck_options.error: You cannot have more than 5 cards that are not Survivor or Neutral

dwl/dwl.flavor: "C'mere, boy. We got work to do."
dwl/dwl.name: "Ashcan" Pete
dwl/dwl.text:
You begin the game with Duke in play.
[free] Discard a card from your hand: Ready an asset you control. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +2. Ready Duke.

dwl/dwl.name: Zoey's Cross
dwl/dwl.text:
Zoey Samaras deck only.
[reaction] After an enemy becomes engaged with you, exhaust Zoey's Cross and spend 1 resource: Deal 1 damage to that enemy.

dwl/dwl.name: Smite the Wicked
dwl/dwl.text: Revelation - Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. Attach Smite the Wicked to that enemy and spawn it at the location farthest from you. Forced - When the game ends, if attached enemy is in play: Zoey Samaras suffers 1 mental trauma.

dwl/dwl.flavor: When things went his way, which wasn't often these days, Rex was a good reporter, with a nose for a story and an eye for detail... <cite>Graham McNeill, Ghouls of the Miskatonic,</cite>
dwl/dwl.name: Search for the Truth
dwl/dwl.text:
Rex Murphy deck only.
Draw X cards, where X is the number of clues on Rex Murphy (to a maximum of 5).

dwl/dwl.name: Rex's Curse
dwl/dwl.text: Revelation - Put Rex's Curse into play in your threat area. Forced - When you would succeed at a skill test: Return the revealed chaos token to the bag and reveal a new chaos token. If this effect causes you to fail the test, shuffle Rex's Curse into your deck. (Limit once per test.)

dwl/dwl.flavor: "...Say, are those Mr. Donohue's guns?" Jenny held a pistol over her shoulder and struck a pose. "I think they suit me better than him. Don't you agree?"
dwl/dwl.name: Jenny's Twin .45s
dwl/dwl.text: Jenny Barnes deck only. Uses (X ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage.

dwl/dwl.name: Searching for Izzie
dwl/dwl.text: Revelation - Attach Searching for Izzie to the location farthest from you. [action] [action]: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, discard Searching for Izzie. Forced - When the game ends, if Searching for Izzie is in play: Jenny Barnes suffers 1 mental trauma.

dwl/dwl.flavor: Daddy used to say, "Jazz is a lot like liquor, it makes everything go down a little smoother." Daddy used to say a lot of stupid things.
dwl/dwl.name: Jim's Trumpet
dwl/dwl.text:
Jim Culver deck only.
[reaction] When a [skull] token is revealed during a skill test, exhaust Jim's Trumpet: Heal 1 horror from an investigator at your location or a connecting location.

dwl/dwl.flavor: When the dead start talking about what scares them, that's when it's time to listen.
dwl/dwl.name: Final Rhapsody
dwl/dwl.text: Revelation - Reveal 5 chaos tokens from the chaos bag. For each [skull] and [auto_fail] token revealed, take 1 damage and 1 horror.

dwl/dwl.name: Duke
dwl/dwl.text: "Ashcan" Pete deck only. [action] Exhaust Duke: Fight. You attack with a base [combat] skill of 4. This attack deals +1 damage. [action] Exhaust Duke: Investigate. You investigate with a base [intellect] skill of 4. You may move to a connecting location immediately before investigating with this effect.

dwl/dwl.name: Wracked by Nightmares
dwl/dwl.text: Revelation - Exhaust all assets you control and put Wracked by Nightmares into play in your threat area. Assets you control cannot ready. [action] [action]: Discard Wracked by Nightmares.

dwl/dwl.name: Blackjack
dwl/dwl.text: [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. If you perform this attack against an enemy engaged with another investigator and you fail, you deal no damage.

dwl/dwl.flavor: You steel your nerves and shout into the darkness. "Come and get me!"
dwl/dwl.name: Taunt
dwl/dwl.text:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Engage any number of enemies at your location.

dwl/dwl.flavor: It's dangerous to go alone.
dwl/dwl.name: Teamwork
dwl/dwl.text: Investigators at your location may give or trade any number of [[Item]] assets, [[Ally]] assets, or resources among one another.

dwl/dwl.flavor: You steel your nerves and shout into the darkness. "Come and get me!"
dwl/dwl.name: Taunt
dwl/dwl.text:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Engage any number of enemies at your location. Draw 1 card for each enemy engaged in this way.

dwl/dwl.name: Laboratory Assistant
dwl/dwl.text:
Your maximum hand size is increased by 2.
[reaction] After Laboratory Assistant enters play: Draw 2 cards.

dwl/dwl.flavor: By all accounts, it should not even exist.
dwl/dwl.name: Strange Solution
dwl/dwl.text: [action] Test [intellect] (4). If you succeed, discard Strange Solution and draw 2 cards. Record in your Campaign Log that "you have identified the solution."

dwl/dwl.flavor: You know this town like the back of your hand.
dwl/dwl.name: Shortcut
dwl/dwl.text:
Fast. Play only during your turn.
Choose an investigator at your location. Move that investigator to a connecting location.

dwl/dwl.flavor: Some people need to know the truth at any cost. Some truths can cut like knives.
dwl/dwl.name: Seeking Answers
dwl/dwl.text: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering a clue at your location, discover a clue at a connecting location.

dwl/dwl.name: Liquid Courage
dwl/dwl.text:
Uses (4 supplies).
[action] Spend 1 supply: Choose an investigator at your location to heal 1 horror. Then, that investigator tests [willpower] (2). If the test succeeds, he or she heals 1 additional horror. If the test fails, he or she discards 1 card at random from his or her hand.

dwl/dwl.name: Think on Your Feet
dwl/dwl.text:
Fast. Play when an enemy would spawn at your location.
Immediately move to a connecting location. (The enemy still spawns at your previous location.)

dwl/dwl.name: Double or Nothing
dwl/dwl.text:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
Double the difficulty of this skill test. If this skill test is successful, resolve the effects of the successful test twice.

dwl/dwl.name: Hired Muscle
dwl/dwl.text: You get +1 [combat]. Forced - At the end of the upkeep phase: You must either pay 1 resource or discard Hired Muscle.

dwl/dwl.name: Rite of Seeking
dwl/dwl.text: Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Investigate. Investigate using [willpower] instead of [intellect]. If you succeed, discover 1 additional clue at this location. If a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol is revealed during this test, after this test resolves lose all remaining actions and immediately end your turn.

dwl/dwl.flavor: The wax tapers give off an eerie glow, and the flames move as if they are alive.
dwl/dwl.name: Ritual Candles
dwl/dwl.text: [reaction] After a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing] symbol is revealed during a test you are performing: You get +1 skill value for this test.

dwl/dwl.flavor:
From the unreal lead me to the real
From the darkness lead me to the light
From the dead lead me to the immortal
dwl/dwl.name: Clarity of Mind
dwl/dwl.text:
Uses (3 charges).
[action] Spend 1 charge: Heal 1 horror from an investigator at your location.

dwl/dwl.name: Bind Monster
dwl/dwl.text: Evade. This evasion attempt uses [willpower] instead of [agility]. If you succeed and the enemy is non‑[[Elite]], evade it and attach Bind Monster to it. [reaction] When attached enemy would ready: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, attached enemy does not ready. If you fail, discard Bind Monster.

dwl/dwl.name: Fire Axe
dwl/dwl.text: [action]: Fight. If you have no resources in your resource pool, this attack deals +1 damage. [free] During an attack using Fire Axe, spend 1 resource: You get +2 [combat] for this skill test. (Limit three times per attack.)

dwl/dwl.flavor: The broad-shouldered young man exudes the sort of confidence one only finds in youth.
dwl/dwl.name: Peter Sylvestre
dwl/dwl.text:
You get +1 [agility].
[reaction] After your turn ends: Heal 1 horror from Peter Sylvestre.

dwl/dwl.name: Bait and Switch
dwl/dwl.text: Evade. If you succeed, if the enemy is non-[[Elite]], evade the enemy and move it to a connecting location.

dwl/dwl.flavor: The broad-shouldered young man exudes the sort of confidence one only finds in youth.
dwl/dwl.name: Peter Sylvestre
dwl/dwl.text:
You get +1 [agility] and +1 [willpower].
[reaction] After your turn ends: Heal 1 horror from Peter Sylvestre.

dwl/dwl.name: Kukri
dwl/dwl.text: [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. If you succeed, you may spend 1 additional action to deal +1 damage for this attack.

dwl/dwl.flavor: One man's loan is another man's treasure.
dwl/dwl.name: Indebted
dwl/dwl.text:
Permanent.
You start each game with 2 fewer resources.

dwl/dwl.name: Internal Injury
dwl/dwl.text: Revelation - Place Internal Injury into play in your threat area. Forced - At the end of your turn: Take 1 direct damage. [action] [action]: Discard Internal Injury.

dwl/dwl.name: Chronophobia
dwl/dwl.text: Revelation - Place Chronophobia into play in your threat area. Forced - At the end of your turn: Take 1 direct horror. [action] [action]: Discard Chronophobia.

dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: Armitage knew he would be meddling with terrible powers, yet saw that there was no other way to annul the deeper and more malign meddling which others had done before him. - H. P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Dr. Henry Armitage
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: [reaction] After you draw a non-weakness card, discard that card and exhaust Dr. Henry Armitage: Gain 3 resources.

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -2. If you fail, discard the top 5 cards of your deck.
[cultist]: -1 (-5 instead if there are 10 or more cards in your discard pile).
[elder_thing]: -X. Discard the top 3 cards of your deck. X is the total printed cost of those discarded cards.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Extracurricular Activity
dwl/dwl_encounter.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1. If you fail, discard the top 3 cards of your deck.
[cultist]: -1 (-3 instead if there are 10 or more cards in your discard pile).
[elder_thing]: -X. Discard the top 2 cards of your deck. X is the total printed cost of those discarded cards.

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: The university is dead silent. The shadows coil about your feet as you walk, and you swear there is something following you with each step you take. Is it just your imagination? Or is there really someone - or something - stalking you?
dwl/dwl_encounter.back_text:
Each investigator with 5 or more cards in his or her discard pile takes 1 horror. Each investigator with 10 or more cards in his or her discard pile takes 2 horror, instead.
If the players have completed The House Always Wins, advance directly to agenda 2b. If Extracurricular Activity is the first scenario in the campaign, advance to agenda 2a.
dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: You have arrived at the Miskatonic University campus in search of Professor Warren Rice. Classes are over, and a mysterious silence hangs in the air over the quad.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Quiet Halls

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: A cry of fear echoes through the campus, and several students flee from the eastern side of the university, where the Science building can be found. Could this commotion be linked to Professor Rice's disappearance?
dwl/dwl_encounter.back_text:
If the Dormitories location is not in play, put it into play.
If The Experiment is in play, move it 1 location towards the Dormitories.
If The Experiment is not in play, spawn it in the Science Building.
dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: Professor Rice's disappearance isn't the only thing amiss at the university. You're unsure exactly what is going on, but you're starting to believe Armitage was right in asking for your help.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Dead of Night
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Each investigator's maximum hand size is reduced by 3 while checking his or her hand size during the upkeep phase.

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: Before you are able to act, you hear screaming from the northern side of the campus. You begin to make your way toward the screaming, your vision darkening with each step. As soon as the creature enters sight, you feel the darkness overtake you, and a force pulls you out of your consciousness. Everything goes black, and you pass out.
dwl/dwl_encounter.back_text: Each investigator immediately takes 3 horror. Then, proceed to (→R4).
dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: Some kind of wild creature is on the loose. Whatever it is, it appears to be headed toward the university dormitories.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: The Beast Unleashed
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Forced - When this agenda would advance by reaching its doom threshold: Instead, remove all doom in play and move The Experiment 1 location toward the Dormitories. Objective - If The Experiment enters the Dormitories, advance.

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: You were unable to find Professor Rice, but one of the students you spoke with mentioned a strange man entering Rice's office. Unfortunately, the door leading to the faculty offices is locked at this late hour. The student says that the head janitor, "Jazz", might be able to let you in, if you can find him.
dwl/dwl_encounter.back_text: Shuffle the encounter discard pile and the set-aside "Jazz" Mulligan into the encounter deck.
dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: Professor Rice was last seen several hours ago by one of Armitage's students, in the Humanities building.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: After Hours

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor:
You convince "Jazz" that something strange is going on, and that Professor Rice may be in danger. He doesn't trust you enough to hand you his keys, but agrees to come with you.
All of a sudden, you hear a crash coming from the Science building, and a student rushes toward you. "Help!" he cries. "There's some kind of animal loose in the chem labs! I only barely caught a glimpse of it, but..." He shudders. "I think it's heading to the dorms! You've got to do something!"
dwl/dwl_encounter.back_text:
If the Alchemy Labs location is not in play, put it into play. If you are at Agenda 1 or 2, spawn The Experiment in the Alchemy Labs.
If you have completed The House Always Wins, put the set-aside Alchemical Concoction into play underneath the Alchemy Labs. If Extracurricular Activity is the first scenario of the campaign, remove the set-aside Alchemical Concoction from the game, instead.
dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: Concerned for Professor Rice's safety, you seek out the head janitor, who can let you into the locked sections of the campus.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Rice's Whereabouts
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: [action] Spend 1 clue: Discard the top 5 cards of the encounter deck (top 10 instead if there is only 1 player in the game). Forced - If you discard "Jazz" Mulligan for any reason, resolve his revelation effect. Objective - When you take control of "Jazz" Mulligan, advance.

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: The monstrous creature lets out a terrible shriek as it succumbs to its wounds and collapses onto the ground. A foul odor emanates from the corpse as its flesh begins to bubble and froth. Your relief turns to disgust as the body begins to shrink and disintegrate. Minutes later, the body has almost entirely evaporated into a sticky mass, and the awful odor has vanished. Inside the remnants of the creature's body, all you can find is a set of bones - the skeletal structure of a canine.
dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: You have only moments to react. You could warn the students in the dormitories and escort them to safety, or continue your task of searching the faculty offices for Professor Rice. Or, perhaps you could try to slay the beast that threatens the campus.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Campus Safety
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Objective - Find and complete an objective on another encounter card.

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: A too-early winter has stripped the trees bare. Their dead branches whistle as a sharp, cold wind cuts across the empty quad.
dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: Surrounded by fences and gates of wrought iron, you can't help but feel as much a prisoner here as a guest.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Miskatonic Quad
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: [action]: Resign. "We can't find Rice anywhere..." You leave the campus, hoping Armitage will forgive you.

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: Professor Rice was last seen in the humanities building, teaching one of his Latin classes. The murky windows of the weatherworn structure emit no light, and the night is silent around you.
dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: The power is out, plunging the building's halls into heavy darkness. There is no sign of Professor Rice.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Humanities Building
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Forced - At the end of your turn, if you are in the Humanities Building: Discard the top X cards of your deck, where X is the amount of horror on you.

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: Three floors of weathered grey granite, the library looks more like a reliquary than a place of learning. Stone gargoyles snarl down from above arched windows, and Latin script winds around the double doors at the top of a wide set of stone steps.
dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: The Orne Library is a labyrinth of dusty bookshelves and poorly lit halls.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Orne Library
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: You must spend 1 additional action to investigate the Orne Library.

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: Even at this late hour, you can hear a muffled chatter from inside the student union. Perhaps one of the students will know where Professor Rice is.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Student Union
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Forced - After Student Union is revealed: Put the set-aside Dormitories into play. [action] [action]: Heal 1 damage and 1 horror.

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor:
The red brick form of the west dormitory could be seen through the trees...
Graham McNeill, Ghouls of the Miskatonic
dwl/dwl_encounter.back_text: The door leading into the Dormitories is locked. You cannot move into the Dormitories.
dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: As you explore these old, well-kept buildings, you find yourself wondering whether the beds are comfortable...
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Dormitories
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Objective - If investigators in the Dormitories spend 3 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: (→R2)

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: Around the aged administration building, creepers of ivy climb from the ground in an effort to claim it. The old hall stands alone in an isolated section of the campus, apart from the day-to-day bustle of students.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Administration Building
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Forced - After Administration Building is revealed: Put the set-aside Faculty Offices into play. Forced - At the end of your turn, if you are in the Administration Building: Discard the top card of your deck.

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: You come to a locked door at the top of the stairs leading to the third floor of the administration building. Through its frosted window, you glimpse a shadow darting across the hall.
dwl/dwl_encounter.back_text: The door leading into the Faculty Offices is locked. You cannot move into the Faculty Offices.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Faculty Offices
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Forced - After Faculty Offices is revealed: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Humanoid]] enemy and spawn it here. Shuffle the encounter deck. Objective - If investigators in the Faculty Offices spend 2 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: (→R1)

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: You come to a locked door at the top of the stairs leading to the third floor of the administration building. Through its frosted window, you glimpse a shadow darting across the hall... or maybe it's just your imagination.
dwl/dwl_encounter.back_text: The door leading into the Faculty Offices is locked. You cannot move into the Faculty Offices.
dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: There is no sign of Professor Rice in his office. You call his name, and it echoes fruitlessly through the hall.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Faculty Offices

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: The Science building dominates the eastern side of the campus. Its windows are dark, save for a lone window shining faintly in the corner of the basement.
dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: A trail of viscous ooze snakes through the halls of the Science building's first floor, leading down into the basement.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Science Building
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Forced - After Science Building is revealed: Put the set-aside Alchemy Labs into play. Forced - When you fail a [willpower] test in the Science Building: Take 1 damage.

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: A pungent stench rises from the laboratory downstairs. The silence of the hall is broken by the unmistakable hiss of a burner.
dwl/dwl_encounter.back_text: The door leading into the Alchemy Labs is locked. You cannot move into the Alchemy Labs.
dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: Peculiar concoctions and obscure reagents line the shelves of the laboratory. What manner of science is going on down here?
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Alchemy Labs
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: [action]: Investigate. If you are successful, instead of discovering clues, take the Alchemical Concoction from underneath this location if able.

dwl/dwl_encounter.name: The Experiment
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Massive. The Experiment gets +3 [per_investigator] health. Forced - When the enemy phase begins: Ready The Experiment. Objective - If The Experiment is defeated, advance to act 3b.

dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Alchemical Concoction
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: [action]: Fight. This attack uses [intellect] instead of [combat]. If used to attack The Experiment, this attack deals +6 damage. If you succeed, remove Alchemical Concoction from the game.

dwl/dwl_encounter.name: "Jazz" Mulligan
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Revelation - Put "Jazz" Mulligan into play at your location. While "Jazz" Mulligan is not controlled by a player, he gains: "[action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (3). If successful, take control of "Jazz" Mulligan." While you control "Jazz" Mulligan, you ignore the text on each unrevealed [[Miskatonic]] location.

dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Professor Warren Rice
dwl/dwl_encounter.text:
You get +1 [intellect].
[reaction] After you discover the last remaining clue in your location, exhaust Professor Warren Rice: Draw 1 card.

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -3. You may spend 3 resources to treat this token as a 0, instead.
[cultist]: -3. If you fail, discard 3 resources.
[tablet]: -2. Discard 3 resources.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: The House Always Wins
dwl/dwl_encounter.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -2. You may spend 2 resources to treat this token as a 0, instead.
[cultist]: -3. If you succeed, gain 3 resources.
[tablet]: -2. If you fail, discard 3 resources.

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: Your questioning has drawn the attention of several men - hired thugs, by the look of them. "Francis doesn't want to be bothered," one of them says. "We suggest you leave the premises before we force you to leave."
dwl/dwl_encounter.back_text:
Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
If the players have completed Extracurricular Activity, advance directly to agenda 2b. If The House Always Wins is the first scenario in the campaign, advance to agenda 2a.
dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: You have entered the Clover Club Casino in search of Dr. Morgan. The club is bustling at this late hour, filled with patrons looking to relax and drink, or make it big. You don't appear to be in much danger.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: The Clover Club
dwl/dwl_encounter.text:
Each [[Criminal]] enemy gains Aloof.
If an investigator deals damage to a [[Criminal]] enemy: Immediately advance.

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: You hear a crash from somewhere outside and screams of pain in the lounge. A terrible monstrosity smashes through the entrance to the club, crushing the stairwell and knocking over gangsters and patrons alike.
dwl/dwl_encounter.back_text: Spawn a random enemy from the set-aside Hideous Abominations encounter set in Clover Club Lounge. Shuffle the rest of that encounter set, the set-aside Striking Fear encounter set, and the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Move all investigators and unengaged enemies from La Bella Luna to the Clover Club Lounge. Remove La Bella Luna from the game.
dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: Most of the other patrons seem oblivious to the mobsters and goons closing in around you. But you recognize this for what it really is - you're about to get roughed up.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Underground Muscle

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: As the strange abominations continue to rampage through the club, the building's foundations shake and tremble. You flee toward the exit, but you are caught in the collapsing rubble as the club is destroyed.
dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: Amidst the chaos and confusion, the strange abominations attack everyone in the club. Screams echo through the halls as the blood begins to spray.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Chaos in the Clover Club
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Forced - At the start of the enemy phase: Discard each [[Criminal]] enemy in the same location as an [[Abomination]] enemy.

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: After speaking to a number of gamblers and servers, it seems as though Dr. Morgan has had quite the run lately. Instead of cashing out his winnings, he was convinced to double down. He was last seen entering the guarded hall near the back of the cardroom.
dwl/dwl_encounter.back_text:
Put the set-aside Darkened Hall into play.
If it is Agenda 1, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a [[Criminal]] enemy is discarded, and spawn that enemy in the Darkened Hall.
dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: You need to find Dr. Morgan. The club is packed; perhaps somebody knows where he is.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Beginner's Luck
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: [reaction] When you reveal a chaos token: You may treat that token as if it were any other token in the chaos bag. If you do, remember that you have "cheated." (Group limit once per round.) Objective - When the investigators have collected the requisite number of clues, they must immediately spend them and advance.

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_text:
If the players have not yet completed Extracurricular Activity:
You find Dr. Morgan gambling in one of the VIP rooms... but he appears to be playing cards with two unconscious bodies, his pupils dilated as though in a trance. He can't seem to stop laughing, smiling, and chatting with the other "players."
Put the set-aside Dr. Morgan into play in the VIP Area. Advance to Act 3a - "All In."
If the players have completed Extracurricular Activity:
The VIP rooms are filled with the mangled and bloody bodies of unfortunate patrons. There doesn't appear to be any trace of Dr. Morgan. You hear screaming and gunfire from the main area of the club.
Put the set-aside Peter Clover into play in the Clover Club Bar. Search the encounter deck (or out of play) for an [[Abomination]] enemy, and spawn it in the Clover Club Bar. Advance to Act 3a - "Fold."
dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: Dr. Morgan is somewhere in the private section of the club, where only VIPs and the club's managers are allowed. If you are to find him, you're going to have to sneak or even fight your way in.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Skin Game
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Objective - Only investigators in the VIP Area may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: You escape the club, doing your best to look inconspicuous as several cars pull up near the street. A handful of grim-faced men and women exit, running toward the restaurant's entrance to take control of the situation. One of them catches your eye, his hand on the grip of his .38, but thankfully he turns his attention back to the rest of his crew and follows them into the club. You breathe a sigh of relief...
dwl/dwl_encounter.back_text: - If an investigator resigned with Dr. Francis Morgan under his or her control, (→R2) - Otherwise, (→R1)
dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: With or without Dr. Morgan, you have to get out of here. Fast.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: All In
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: While Dr. Morgan is not controlled by a player, he gains "[action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (3) to shake Dr. Morgan out of his daze. If you succeed, place 1 clue from the token bank on him. If there are 1 [per_investigator] clues on Dr. Morgan, take control of him." Objective - If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: You make your way toward the rain-slicked streets of Arkham.
dwl/dwl_encounter.back_text: - If an investigator resigned with Peter Clover under his or her control, (→R3) - Otherwise, (→R1)
dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: "Free drinks for whoever gets me the hell out of here!" A man exclaims from the bar.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Fold
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: While Peter Clover is not controlled by a player, he gains "[action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (3) to convince Peter to follow you. If you succeed, place 1 clue from the token bank on him. If there are 1 [per_investigator] clues on Peter Clover, take control of him." Objective - If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: La Bella Luna was a "multi-purpose" establishment.
dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: The music is cliché and they only serve spaghetti. As far as covers for underground speakeasies go, it's not particularly creative.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: La Bella Luna
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: [action]: Resign. This was a bust.

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: Comfortable leather couches, mahogany furniture, and an array of beautiful art greets gamblers, tempting them into the life of the would-be affluent.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Clover Club Lounge
dwl/dwl_encounter.text:
While it is Act 1, Clover Club Lounge gains:
"[action] Discard an [[Ally]] asset from your hand: Gain 2 clues from the token pool. (Limit once per game.)"

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: The shelves behind the bar sag beneath the weight of all manner of bootlegged drinks: cheap ales, moonshine, expensive bottles of wine, aged whiskey. If only you had a couple hours to kill...
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Clover Club Bar
dwl/dwl_encounter.text:
While it is Act 1, Clover Club Bar gains:
"[action] Spend 2 resources: Gain 2 clues from the token pool and draw 2 cards. Remember that you have 'had a drink.' (Limit once per game.)"

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: As you approach the cardroom, the clinking of poker chips and the shuffling of cards is punctuated by shouts of revelry and frustration. Your thoughts are nearly drowned out by the racket.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Clover Club Cardroom
dwl/dwl_encounter.text:
While it is Act 1, Clover Club Cardroom gains:
"[action] Spend 2 resources: Reveal a random chaos token.
If it is a [elder_sign] symbol, gain 2 clues and 2 resources from the token bank.
If it is an even number, gain 2 clues from the token bank.
If it is an odd number or a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol, nothing happens."

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: A heavy oak door stands in a secluded corner of the club. As you approach it, the air grows heavy and the clamor of the cardroom fades behind you.
dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: The door slams shut behind you, and you stand in sudden silence. This area of the club is lonesome and devoid of warmth and color. Somehow, the spotless floor and walls seem more sinister than inviting.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Darkened Hall
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Forced - When Darkened Hall is revealed: Put into play the 3 set-aside Back Hall Doorway locations.

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: You approach an unmarked door toward the back of the Clover Club.
dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: Exotic art and antiques adorn the walls of Peter Clover's private gallery. An evening breeze rustles the worn pages of a ledger back and forth.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Art Gallery
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating the Art Gallery: Lose 2 resources.

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: You approach an unmarked door toward the back of the Clover Club.
dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: The coppery smell of blood assaults your senses. The floor is littered with broken glass, and the upholstery has been torn to shreds. Where is Dr. Morgan?
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: VIP Area
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: While you are in the VIP Area, you cannot draw cards or gain resources during the upkeep phase.

dwl/dwl_encounter.back_flavor: You approach an unmarked door toward the back of the Clover Club.
dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: A steep, narrow staircase ascends to a second unmarked door. To your surprise, it leads into a back alley behind La Bella Luna. This must be where they smuggle in their "goods."
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Back Alley
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: [action]: Resign. We can get out this way!

dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Clover Club Pit Boss
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Prey - Highest [intellect]. Hunter. Forced - After an investigator at Clover Club Pit Boss's location gains any number of clues: Clover Club Pit Boss readies, engages that investigator, and makes an immediate attack.

dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Peter Clover
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Forced - At the start of the enemy phase, if no investigator controls Peter Clover: Deal 1 damage to him. [free]Exhaust Peter Clover: Automatically evade a [[Criminal]] enemy in your location.

dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Dr. Francis Morgan
dwl/dwl_encounter.text:
You get +1 [combat].
[reaction] After you defeat an enemy, exhaust Dr. Francis Morgan: Draw 1 card.

dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: An unpleasant warmth fills your body, and you sluggishly look at your empty glass.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Something in the Drinks
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Surge. Revelation - Each player who has "had a drink" loses 1 action.

dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: Eyes are all around you, watching your every move.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Arousing Suspicions
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Revelation - Place 1 doom on each [[Criminal]] enemy at your location. If no doom was placed by this effect, lose 2 resources.

dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: Are these visions of things to be, or things as they might be? Or could these horrors have already happened?
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Visions of Futures Past
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (5). For each point you fail by, discard the top card of your deck.

dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Beyond the Veil
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Surge. Revelation - Put Beyond the Veil into play in your threat area if there is no copy of Beyond the Veil in your threat area. Forced - If your deck has no cards in it: Take 10 damage and discard Beyond the Veil.

dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Light of Aforgomon
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Peril. Revelation - You must attach Light of Aforgomon to either the current agenda or the current act. Limit 1 per agenda/act. Treat all damage as direct damage and all horror as direct horror.

dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: A malevolence has overtaken their minds, turning them into soulless puppets.
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Thrall
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Spawn - Location with the most clues. Retaliate.

dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Wizard of Yog-Sothoth
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Prey - Least cards in hand. Hunter. Forced - When the engaged investigator draws a [[Hex]] or [[Pact]] card: Wizard of Yog-Sothoth attacks that investigator.

dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Unhallowed Country
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Revelation - Put Unhallowed Country into play in your threat area. You cannot play [[Ally]] assets. Treat the printed text box of each [[Ally]] asset you control as if it were blank. Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Unhallowed Country.

dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Sordid and Silent
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Revelation - Attach Sordid and Silent to your location. Forced - At the end of the round: Each investigator at attached location takes 1 horror. Forced - When the agenda advances: Discard Sordid and Silent.

dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: "It is vowed that the birds are psychopomps lying in wait for the souls of the dying..." <cite>H. P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"</cite>
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Whippoorwill
dwl/dwl_encounter.text:
Aloof. Hunter.
Each investigator at Whippoorwill's location gets -1 [willpower], -1 [intellect], -1 [combat], and -1 [agility].

dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: "If they can catch the fleeing soul when it leaves the body, they instantly flutter away chittering in daemonic laughter..." <cite>H. P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"</cite>
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Eager for Death
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (2). Increase this skill test's difficulty by 1 for each damage on you. If you fail, take 2 horror.

dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Cursed Luck
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Revelation - Put Cursed Luck into play in your threat area. You get -1 skill value during skill tests. Forced - After you succeed at a skill test by 1 or more: Discard Cursed Luck.

dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Twist of Fate
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Revelation - Reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If you reveal a [elder_sign] symbol or positive number, nothing happens. If you reveal any other number, take 1 damage. If you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] symbol, take 2 horror.

dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Avian Thrall
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Prey - Lowest [intellect]. Hunter. While Avian Thrall is being attacked using a [[Ranged]], [[Firearm]], or [[Spell]] asset, it gets -3 fight.

dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: What manner of wolf has that many teeth?
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Lupine Thrall
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Spawn - Farthest location from you. Prey - Lowest [agility]. Hunter. Retaliate.

dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Altered Beast
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Revelation - If there are no [[Abomination]] enemies in play, Altered Beast gains surge. Otherwise, choose an [[Abomination]] enemy. Heal all damage from that enemy and attached Altered Beast to it. Forced - When you enter attached enemy's location (or vice-versa): Take 1 horror.

dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: "Are we going to have a problem here?"
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: O'Bannion's Thug
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: While O'Bannion's Thug is engaged with you, you cannot gain resources.

dwl/dwl_encounter.flavor: "You better scram, pal, unless you're hungry for boot leather and lead."
dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Mobster
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Retaliate. Forced - After Mobster attacks you: Lose 1 resource.

dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Hunted Down
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Revelation - If there are no unengaged [[Criminal]] enemies in play, Hunted Down gains surge. If there are 1 or more unengaged [[Criminal]] enemies in play, each of them moves 1 location toward you. Each [[Criminal]] enemy that engages you as a result of this effect makes an immediate attack.

dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Pushed into the Beyond
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Revelation - Choose and shuffle a non-story asset you control into your deck and discard the top 3 cards of your deck. If a copy of that asset is discarded, take 2 horror.

dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Terror from Beyond
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Peril. Revelation - Choose one of the following cardtypes (asset, event, or skill). Each player must discard each card in his or her hand that is of the chosen cardtype. If this is not the first copy of Terror from Beyond drawn this phase, choose two cardtypes instead.

dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Arcane Barrier
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Revelation - Attach to your location. As an additional cost to move into or out of attached location, test [willpower] (4). If successful, discard Arcane Barrier. Otherwise, you must either cancel the effects of the move or discard the top 5 cards of your deck.

dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Conglomeration of Spheres
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Prey - Lowest [willpower]. Hunter. Forced - After you perform an attack against the Conglomeration of Spheres using a [[Melee]] card: Discard that card.

dwl/dwl_encounter.name: Servant of the Lurker
dwl/dwl_encounter.text: Prey - Lowest [agility]. Hunter. Forced - When Servant of the Lurker attacks you: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck.

dwl/uau_encounter.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -2 for each Brood of Yog-Sothoth in play.
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail this test, take 1 horror and 1 damage.
[tablet]: 0. You must either remove all clue tokens from a Brood of Yog-Sothoth in play, or this test automatically fails.
[elder_thing]: -5. If this token is revealed during an attack or evasion attempt against a Brood of Yog-Sothoth, it immediately attacks you.
dwl/uau_encounter.name: Undimensioned and Unseen
dwl/uau_encounter.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1 for each Brood of Yog-Sothoth in play.
