[cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail this test, take 1 horror.
[tablet]: 0. You must either remove all clue tokens from a Brood of Yog-Sothoth in play, or this token's modifier is -4 instead.
[elder_thing]: -3. If this token is revealed during an attack or evasion attempt against a Brood of Yog-Sothoth, it immediately attacks you.

dwl/uau_encounter.back_flavor:
An old pickup truck rolls to a stop along the weathered trails of Dunwich. The driver - Joe Osborn - calls out to you through a shattered driver-side window, the truck's engine still running. "IT's over at the Ericks' farm!" he shouts. "Done blasted their place apart. Poor Henry and Martha..."
You ask Osborn for the location of the Ericks' homestead, and it confirms your worst fear. For that attack to have occurred recently, there must be more of the monsters on the loose.
dwl/uau_encounter.back_text:
Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
Spawn 1 of the set-aside Brood of Yog-Sothoth enemies at a random location, if able.
dwl/uau_encounter.flavor: Reports of terrifying entities wreaking havoc across the countryside have caused the citizens of Dunwich to panic. Worse, the creatures seem to be invisible to the naked eye.
dwl/uau_encounter.name: Rampaging Creatures
dwl/uau_encounter.text: Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Move each Brood of Yog-Sothoth enemy once toward a random location.

dwl/uau_encounter.back_text: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. If there is a set-aside Brood of Yog-Sothoth, the lead investigator reads the following (out loud): Bleak storm clouds churn overhead and a blanket of rain pelts the countryside. As the downpour grows in intensity, you take refuge in a half-ruined shack nearby. There is a flash of lightning, and in the brief illumination, you spot the outline of something large in the rain. Without warning, the distant trees bend, though nothing seems to be bending them. Moments later, a force with the strength of a truck crashes into your refuge. Spawn 1 of the set-aside Brood of Yog-Sothoth enemies at the lead investigator's location, if able. Then, each investigator at that location tests [agility] (4). The newly spawned Brood of Yog-Sothoth makes an attack against each investigator who fails this skill test.
dwl/uau_encounter.flavor:
Once in a while a wind, sweeping up out of Cold Spring Glen, would bring a touch of ineffable foetor to the heavy night air... But the looked-for terror did not appear. Whatever was down there in the glen was biding its time, and Armitage told his colleagues it would be suicidal to try to attack it in the dark.
-H.P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/uau_encounter.name: Biding Its Time
dwl/uau_encounter.text: Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Move each Brood of Yog-Sothoth enemy once toward a random location.

dwl/uau_encounter.back_flavor: There is a monstrous rumbling throughout the countryside, though it is impossible to tell whether its source is the creatures you hunt or the very mountains themselves. Soon after, you find more of the creatures' tracks leading up toward the hills: a thirty-foot path of crushed underbrush and trees snapped like twigs. Exhausted from battle, and with night fast approaching, you decide to head to safety rather than follow these hellish tracks.
dwl/uau_encounter.flavor:
It was no joke tracking down something as big as a house that one could not see, but that had all the vicious malevolence of a daemon.
-H.P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/uau_encounter.name: Horrors Unleashed
dwl/uau_encounter.text: Each [[Abomination]] enemy gets +1 fight and +1 evade. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Move each Brood of Yog-Sothoth enemy once toward a random location.

dwl/uau_encounter.back_text:
Check Campaign Log. If Dr. Armitage survived The Dunwich Legacy:
"There!" Armitage sighs a breath of relief, jotting down the last phrases of the formula. "I have translated the last of it." He shudders as he hands you the script, the words conjuring forth memories of his battle with the creature. "I hope this is the last time I'll have to read it," he admits. "But if we do nothing, the end result will be much, much worse."
Each investigator puts into play 1 set-aside Esoteric Formula. If Dr. Armitage is listed under "Sacrificed to Yog-Sothoth":
Using the information contained within the ruins of the Whateley homestead, you are able to transcribe the remainder of the formula previously used by Dr. Armitage to destroy the beast that plagued Dunwich. However, the endeavor sets you back several hours.
Each investigator puts into play 1 set-aside Esoteric Formula. Place 1 doom on the current agenda.
dwl/uau_encounter.flavor: The monsters tearing through Dunwich county are immune to traditional weapons. Only by reciting a particular incantation can the creatures be defeated. First you must search the ruins of Wilbur Whateley’s home in order to find the final sections of the otherworldly script.
dwl/uau_encounter.name: Saracenic Script
dwl/uau_encounter.text: Objective - Only investigators at Whateley Ruins may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

dwl/uau_encounter.back_flavor: As you complete the incantation, the foul creature cries out with a raucous, inhuman voice. It rumbles and cracks, the syllables of its croaking far from English. As its cry plays out, the creature shrinks upon itself, and then, with little warning, it is gone. All that remains is a foul stench and a repulsive mark that mars the vegetation where the beast once stood.
dwl/uau_encounter.flavor: With the formula in hand, you finally have the means to destroy the creatures wreaking havoc in Dunwich... but only if you can survive long enough.
dwl/uau_encounter.name: They Must Be Destroyed!
dwl/uau_encounter.text: Objective - Defeat as many Brood of Yog-Sothoth enemies as you can. If there are no copies of Brood of Yog-Sothoth in play or set aside, advance.

dwl/uau_encounter.back_flavor:
It is always a relief to get clear of the place, and to follow the narrow road around the base of the hills and across the level country beyond till it rejoins the Aylesbury pike. Afterward one sometimes learns that one has been through Dunwich.
-H.P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/uau_encounter.name: Dunwich Village
dwl/uau_encounter.text: [action]: Resign. You hide from the rampaging creatures. [free]: You borrow some hounds to track the creatures by scent. An investigator in Dunwich Village may place 1 of his or her clues on any [[Abomination]] enemy in play. (Group limit once per game).

dwl/uau_encounter.flavor: Ringing the church bell may draw the monsters toward the village, if you are brave enough to face them.
dwl/uau_encounter.back_flavor:
It is always a relief to get clear of the place, and to follow the narrow road around the base of the hills and across the level country beyond till it rejoins the Aylesbury pike. Afterward one sometimes learns that one has been through Dunwich.
-H.P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/uau_encounter.name: Dunwich Village
dwl/uau_encounter.text: [action]: Resign. You hide from the rampaging creatures. [action]: Move a Brood of Yog-Sothoth enemy once toward Dunwich Village.

dwl/uau_encounter.back_flavor:
"Gawd," he gasped, "I telled 'em not ter go daown into the glen, an' I never thought nobody'd dew it with them tracks an' that smell an' the whippoorwills a-screechin' daown thar in the dark o' noonday...”
-H.P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/uau_encounter.name: Cold Spring Glen
dwl/uau_encounter.text:
Each enemy in Cold Spring Glen gets -1 evade.
[free]: You lure the creature into the dense tree cover, and it becomes tangled. Investigators in Cold Spring Glen may, as a group, place up to 2 of their clues on an [[Abomination]] enemy in Cold Spring Glen. (Group limit once per game).

dwl/uau_encounter.flavor: The thick shadows and crowded trees make these woods a good hiding place.
dwl/uau_encounter.back_flavor:
"Gawd," he gasped, "I telled 'em not ter go daown into the glen, an' I never thought nobody'd dew it with them tracks an' that smell an' the whippoorwills a-screechin' daown thar in the dark o' noonday...”
-H.P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/uau_encounter.name: Cold Spring Glen
dwl/uau_encounter.text:
Each enemy in Cold Spring Glen gets -1 evade.
[reaction] After Cold Spring Glen is chosen as a random location: An investigator in Cold Spring Glen tests [agility] (3). If successful, choose a different random location.

dwl/uau_encounter.back_flavor:
The trees of the frequent forest belts seem too large, and the wild weeds, brambles, and grasses attain a luxuriance not often found in settled regions. At the same time the planted fields appear singularly few and barren...
-H.P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/uau_encounter.name: Ten-Acre Meadow
dwl/uau_encounter.text: [free]: You lure the monster into the rain. Place 1 clue from the token bank on an [[Abomination]] enemy in Ten-Acre Meadow. At the end of the round, remove 1 clue from that enemy. (Group limit once per game).

dwl/uau_encounter.back_flavor:
The trees of the frequent forest belts seem too large, and the wild weeds, brambles, and grasses attain a luxuriance not often found in settled regions. At the same time the planted fields appear singularly few and barren...
-H.P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/uau_encounter.name: Ten-Acre Meadow
dwl/uau_encounter.text: [free]: You set a bait using a live animal. Each investigator in Ten-Acre Meadow may place 1 of his or her clues on an [[Abomination]] enemy in Ten-Acre Meadow. (Group limit once per game).

dwl/uau_encounter.flavor: The ground here is loose and barely supports your weight.
dwl/uau_encounter.back_flavor:
The summits are too rounded and symmetrical to give a sense of comfort and naturalness, and sometimes the sky silhouettes with especial clearness the queer circles of tall stone pillars with which most of them are crowned.
-H.P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/uau_encounter.name: Blasted Heath
dwl/uau_encounter.text: [free]: You lure the creature into a patch of sand. Investigators in Blasted Heath may, as a group, place up to 2 of their clues on an [[Abomination]] enemy in Blasted Heath. (Group limit once per game).

dwl/uau_encounter.flavor: A dense yellow mist, like a terrible miasma, permeates through this region. It crawls around your skin and causes your lungs to tighten.
dwl/uau_encounter.back_flavor:
The summits are too rounded and symmetrical to give a sense of comfort and naturalness, and sometimes the sky silhouettes with especial clearness the queer circles of tall stone pillars with which most of them are crowned.
-H. P. Lovecraft, “The Dunwich Horror”
dwl/uau_encounter.name: Blasted Heath
dwl/uau_encounter.text: Forced - At the end of your turn, if you are in Blasted Heath: Take 1 damage.

dwl/uau_encounter.back_flavor:
It was as though a house, launched by an avalanche, had slid down through the tangled growths of the almost vertical slope.
-H.P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/uau_encounter.name: Whateley Ruins
dwl/uau_encounter.text:
Each investigator in Whateley Ruins gets -1 [willpower].
[free]: You hurl a nearby canister of paint at the monster. An investigator in Whateley Ruins may place up to 3 of his or her clues on an [[Abomination]] enemy in Whateley Ruins. (Group limit once per game).

dwl/uau_encounter.flavor: The ancient and arcane tomes found within the Whateley Ruins hold the secrets to manipulating the monsters.
dwl/uau_encounter.back_flavor:
It was as though a house, launched by an avalanche, had slid down through the tangled growths of the almost vertical slope.
-H.P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/uau_encounter.name: Whateley Ruins
dwl/uau_encounter.text:
Each investigator in Whateley Ruins gets -1 [willpower].
[action]: Test [intellect] (4). If you are successful, move a Brood of Yog-Sothoth enemy 1 location in any direction.

dwl/uau_encounter.back_flavor:
...still others try to explain the Devil’s Hop Yard - a bleak, blasted hillside where no tree, shrub, or grass-blade will grow.
-H.P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/uau_encounter.name: Devil's Hop Yard
dwl/uau_encounter.text: [free]: You lure the creature into the thick fog. An investigator in Devil's Hop Yard may place up to 2 of his or her clues on an [[Abomination]] enemy in Devil's Hop Yard. (Group limit once per game).

dwl/uau_encounter.flavor: A recent downpour has made the hop yard muddy and difficult to slog through.
dwl/uau_encounter.back_flavor:
...still others try to explain the Devil’s Hop Yard - a bleak, blasted hillside where no tree, shrub, or grass-blade will grow.
-H.P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/uau_encounter.name: Devil's Hop Yard
dwl/uau_encounter.text: [free]: The creature follows you into the mud. Each investigator in Devil's Hop Yard may place 1 of his or her clues on an [[Abomination]] enemy in Devil's Hop Yard. (Group limit once per game).

dwl/uau_encounter.name: Esoteric Formula
dwl/uau_encounter.text: [action] Fight. This attack uses [willpower] instead of [combat]. You get +2 [willpower] for this attack for each clue on the attacked enemy. Use this ability only on an [[Abomination]] enemy.

dwl/uau_encounter.flavor:
"I believe there’s a chance of putting it out of business."
-H.P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/uau_encounter.name: Brood of Yog-Sothoth
dwl/uau_encounter.text:
Massive.
Brood of Yog-Sothoth gets +1 [per_investigator] health and cannot be damaged or attacked except using the ability on Esoteric Formula.

dwl/uau_encounter.name: Towering Beasts
dwl/uau_encounter.text: Peril. Revelation - Attach to a Brood of Yog-Sothoth enemy in play. If that enemy is at your location, take 1 damage. Attached enemy gets +1 fight and +1 health.

dwl/uau_encounter.name: Ruin and Destruction
dwl/uau_encounter.text: Revelation - If there are no investigators at the same location as a Brood of Yog-Sothoth, Ruin and Destruction gains surge. Otherwise, each investigator at the same location as a Brood of Yog-Sothoth tests [agility] (3). For each point he or she fails by, he or she takes 1 damage.

dwl/uau_encounter.name: Attracting Attention
dwl/uau_encounter.text: Surge. Revelation - Each Brood of Yog-Sothoth enemy in play moves once toward you.

dwl/uau_encounter.flavor:
...the sides of the road shewed a bruising indicative of the blasphemously stupendous bulk of the horror...
-H.P. Lovecraft, "The Dunwich Horror"
dwl/uau_encounter.name: The Creatures' Tracks
dwl/uau_encounter.text: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): Take 2 horror, or spawn a set aside Brood of Yog-Sothoth at a random location.

tsk/tskc.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –2 (-4 instead if you have 2 or more clues).
[tablet]: –2. If there is a concealed mini-card at your location, reveal another chaos token.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, you must either spend 1 clue or place 1 doom on an enemy in the shadows.
tsk/tskc.name: Riddles and Rain
tsk/tskc.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –1 (-3 instead if you have 2 or more clues).
[tablet]: –1. If there is a concealed mini-card at your location, reveal another chaos token.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, you must either spend 1 clue or place 1 doom on an enemy in the shadows.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: Eventually, you notice the tail. The figure stalks you through the rainy streets, pretending to have some other pressing task at hand. For once, you believe your paranoia may have paid off. But there is only one way to know for sure. So you test your theory - walking faster, moving aimlessly through the streets, and doubling back to see what they do. Every time, there they are. Watching you. It's a tail, all right. You flip the script and begin to give chase, instead. If they work for the man with the red gloves, you are going to find out.
tsk/tskc.back_text: Each investigator takes 1 horror. Put the set-aside Kensington Gardens, Westminster Abbey, and Big Ben locations into play. The lead investigator draws the set-aside The Red-Gloved Man enemy and resolves his concealed keyword. (Spawn The Red-Gloved Man in the shadows. Take his mini-card and 1 [per_investigator] decoys, shuffle them facedown, and put them into play divided as evenly as possible among the locations nearest to the lead investigator.) Each investigator loses each of their clues. Advance the act directly to act 2a (do not resolve act 1b).
tsk/tskc.flavor: Arriving in London, you patiently await your contact... but none arrives. Inspector Flint - or one of his proxies - was supposed to meet you at a quiet teahouse tucked away in a narrow storefront just outside Trafalgar Square. Wondering what could have gone wrong, and suspecting the worst, you set off to investigate.
tsk/tskc.name: When It Rains...
tsk/tskc.text: Forced - When this agenda advances: Move all doom on it to the next agenda.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: Through the rainy streets and dense fog you give chase, but no matter what you do, the man you seek constantly eludes your grasp. All you catch is the barest hint of the color red as he slips out of view once more. Then, fast as a flash of lightning and gone just as swiftly, a formless shape ducks out of view. A chunk of a nearby telephone booth goes along with it. After a moment of trepidation, you inch forward and examine what remains of the booth. All that remains is an ectoplasmic substance, appearing like the negative of an undeveloped photo. It takes you a while to pick up the trail once more. When you do, you find that your quarry has fled to the east, where the Tower Bridge looms over the skyline.
tsk/tskc.back_text: Mark 1 time in your Campaign Log. Set The Red-Gloved Man enemy and each concealed mini-card aside, out of play. Put the set-aside Tower Bridge and Tower of London locations into play. Shuffle the encounter discard pile and the set-aside Crimson Conspiracy and Outsiders encounter sets into the encounter deck. Each investigator loses each of their clues. Advance the act directly to act 3a (do not resolve act 2b).
tsk/tskc.flavor: Your mind must be playing tricks on you. Misshapen figures dance through the dense London fog whenever the rain lets up. Are these distortions, like the one in the photograph Inspector Flint showed you? Or is it your quarry hiding in the mist and gloom?
tsk/tskc.name: Figures in the Fog
tsk/tskc.text: Forced - When this agenda advances: Move all doom on it to the next agenda.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor:
As the night grows deeper and the rain becomes a torrent, you flinch at every moving shadow, every sound, every shape. You wonder if perhaps this investigation is getting the best of you.
Or maybe there are more of them than you thought, watching you. Lying in wait for the perfect opportunity to strike.
tsk/tskc.back_text:
The lead investigator must decide (choose one):
- Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Coterie Agent enemy and draw it. Shuffle the encounter deck.
- Each investigator takes 1 damage and 1 horror.
tsk/tskc.flavor: It is clear now that Inspector Flint's hunches were correct. The man in the red gloves is not operating alone, and whatever he is up to, it has something to do with the recent vanishings. You could wait to report what you have seen, but by then the man and his cohorts may have already put into motion whatever scheme the planning. No - you have only one choice. You must find the man with the red gloves, at all costs.
tsk/tskc.name: The Connection

tsk/tskc.back_text:
If it is act 1, 2, or 3:
Despite your best efforts, the trail has gone cold. You cannot find any sign of the man with the red gloves or his cohorts. What's worse, you have no idea what their goal was in London to begin with. You have no choice but to report back to Inspector Flint with what little you have learned.
(→R4) (page 8) If it is act 4:
Your search for the man with the red gloves has led you into a hidden section of the tower prison. You duck under stone archways and sneak through dank, forgotten halls until finally, you find him: the man with the red gloves. He has lifted the lid from a stone crypt and is studying the corpse inside. The moment he sees you enter, he pulls a small ruby marble from the eyesocket of the unfortunate soul, then slips back into the shadows.
(→R3) (page 8)
tsk/tskc.flavor: Deep fog blots out the moonlight, bathing the city in utter darkness. From the rooftops, ravens watch your progress with inhuman intelligence. Every moving shadow sets your mind racing. If you don't find the man with the red gloves and stop his plans, who knows what he will do next?
tsk/tskc.name: Plots and Panic

tsk/tskc.back_flavor:
You spot the figure on the other side of the street just as a bright red bus approaches. You are certain whoever was there was staring directly at you. The bus cuts a swath through the foggy street, and when it has passed, the figure is gone.
Perhaps it is just your paranoia at work, but it cannot be a coincidence. It must have either been your contact, or one of their foes. Perhaps even the reason they are missing. Steeling yourself for any possibility, you set off in chase.
tsk/tskc.back_text: Put the set-aside Kensington Gardens, Westminster Abbey, and Big Ben locations into play. The lead investigator draws the set-aside The Red-Gloved Man enemy and resolves his concealed keyword. (Spawn The Red-Gloved Man in the shadows. Take his mini-card and 1 [per_investigator] decoys, shuffle them facedown, and put them into play divided as evenly as possible among the locations nearest to the lead investigator.) Advance the agenda directly to agenda 2a (do not resolve agenda 1b).
tsk/tskc.flavor: You draw your umbrella closer, using it to obscure your identity. Each person you pass on the street could be your contact... or be out to get you.
tsk/tskc.name: Clues and Capers
tsk/tskc.text: Objective – As a group, spend the requisite number of clues to advance before the agenda advances.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: After much toil and pursuit, you finally catch up to the figure you've been chasing. A feeling of vindication washes over you as you spot the red gloves the man wears. It was no phantom you chased; this is the one you have sought all along. You corner him in a narrow alleyway, sheets of rain and fog masking your approach. Several more figures flank the man- a meeting, perhaps? To your surprise, he casts an expressionless glance in your direction. Then, fast as a flash of lightning and gone just as swiftly, a formless shape ducks out of view. A chunk of a nearby building goes along with it. When you turn to question your quarry about what happened, they have all fled east. You inch forward and examine the partially-excised wall, covered in an ectoplasmic substance, like the negative of an undeveloped photo.
tsk/tskc.back_text: Set The Red-Gloved Man aside, out of play. Put the set-aside Tower Bridge and Tower of London locations into play. Shuffle the set-aside Crimson Conspiracy and Outsiders encounter sets into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile. Advance the agenda directly to agenda 3a (do not resolve agenda 2b).
tsk/tskc.flavor: You chase a shadow shrouded by night. It might as well be a needle in a haystack. But still you search, hoping for any clue that may lead you to the truth...
tsk/tskc.name: The Game is Afoot!
tsk/tskc.text: Objective – Chase down the mysterious figure before the agenda advances. If an investigator engages The Red-Gloved Man, advance.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor:
Quietly and cautiously, you follow the figure from a distance. With measured haste, he darts to and fro inside the ominous tower. Searching for something.
Finally, while you watch from the shadows, the man with the red gloves finds what he is looking for: a loose brick along one of the candlelit hall's many columns. He casually rotates the stone back into place with the kind of nonchalance as if he were dealing with a piece of misplaced laundry. To your surprise, a section of the nearby wall rotates in turn, revealing a secret passageway. He ascends into darkness, and you follow in secret.
tsk/tskc.back_text:
Put the set-aside Tower Prison location into play. Attach the set-aside The Eye of Ravens key to the Tower Prison, not controlled by anyone.
Move all concealed mini-cards in play to the Tower Prison.
Draw the set-aside The Red-Gloved Man enemy and resolve his concealed keyword, putting all of those concealed mini-cards into play at the Tower Prison.
tsk/tskc.flavor: Your gaze turns eastward, in the direction you last saw the man heading. Over the Tower Bridge lies the famed Tower of London, where even more eyes watch your approach, these belonging to a conspiracy of dark and brooding ravens. For what reason could he be heading there...?
tsk/tskc.name: Eyes in the Tower
tsk/tskc.text: Objective – Only investigators at the Tower of London may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

tsk/tskc.back_text:
If you defeated The Red-Gloved Man:
The figure reels backward, grasping at his wound. Something small clatters to the ground. The man says nothing - only glares at you fromthe darkness. His gloves seem to ripple around his hands, like the disturbed surface of a deep crimson pool, and after a moment, he straightens himself. Then, blending into the shadows, he tips his hat and is gone.
Add The Red-Gloved Man to the victory display. (→R1) (page 7) If there are 1 [per_investigator] resources on The Red-Gloved Man:
The man stops and faces you, seemingly intrigued by your line of questioning, although in the darkness you cannot study his expression. "... interesting," he whispers. "Very interesting." His voice has a strange, uneven quality, like he is testing the tone of each word. Like one unaccustomed to speaking.
Add The Red-Gloved Man to the victory display. (→R2) (page 7)
tsk/tskc.flavor: Somewhere in these forgotten crypts, the man with the red gloves is searching for something... but for what purpose?
tsk/tskc.name: Caught Red-Handed
tsk/tskc.text: The Red-Gloved Man gains: "[action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (5) to interrogate The Red-Gloved Man. If you succeed, place 1 resource on him." Objective – - Stop The Red-Gloved Man from stealing The Eye of Ravens. If he is defeated, or if there are 1 [per_investigator] resources on him, advance.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: Cold rain pelts the dreary streets in a rhythmic pitter-patter. Despite the hour, the square is bustling with automobiles, carriages, and pedestrians. Somewhere in this crowded city is the man you seek…. or are you already too late?
tsk/tskc.name: Rainy London Streets
tsk/tskc.text: Rainy London Streets gets +X shroud. X is the current act number. Forced - If there are no clues on Rainy London Streets: Add clues to it until it has 1 [per_investigator] clues on it. [action]: Resign. "We should wait for Inspector Flint..."

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: A fixture of the London skyline, the clock tower at the north end of the Palace of Westminster looms over the city, its face like the eye of a watchful guardian.
tsk/tskc.name: Big Ben
tsk/tskc.text: [fast]: Choose a concealed mini-card at Big Ben or a connecting location and test [agility] (2). If you succeed, look at the revealed side of that concealed mini-card (without exposing it). If you fail, take 1 horror. (Limit once per turn.)

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: The Gothic abbey near the palace is both a place of religious significance and a traditional burial site for English royals. Lights flicker in the windows as the gentle rain turns to an ominous downpour. You would not be the first to seek guidance on such hallowed ground, but you wonder what else may be at work within its aged walls.
tsk/tskc.name: Westminster Abbey
tsk/tskc.text: [action]: Parley. Choose a location and test [willpower] (1) to ask around the abbey. For each point you succeed by, look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card at the chosen location (without exposing it). (Group limit once per game.)

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: The night's unusually somber mood is enough to drown out even the beauty of the royal park. The Round Pond threatens to flood as the downpour continues. This place has been a popular meeting ground for many years- perhaps the man with the red gloves and his cohorts are here?
tsk/tskc.name: Kensington Gardens
tsk/tskc.text: [reaction] After you expose a decoy at Kensington Gardens: Heal 1 horror. Forced - After you expose an enemy at Kensington Gardens: Take 1 horror.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: Spanning the River Thames, the newly built Tower Bridge has quickly become a cultural icon, connecting Central London with the East End, which has seen much growth in recent years. To the north, just over the bridge, a dark cloud encircles the Tower of London.
tsk/tskc.flavor: Stories have been told of the prisoners who were brought to the Tower of London by barge along the River Thames. Perhaps you could follow their morbid example.
tsk/tskc.name: The Tower Bridge
tsk/tskc.text: [action]: "Maybe there is another way in..." Test [willpower] or [intellect] (5). If you succeed, put the set-aside Traitors' Gate location into play.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: Although the original entrance to the water gate has long since been bricked up, you commandeer a small vessel and make your way along the river anyway. Perhaps there is still a secret route one might take from here to infiltrate the Tower of London.
tsk/tskc.flavor: Finding a way in through here will be tricky, but if your hunch is right, you might be able to slip in without anyone suspecting your approach. You prepare yourself for an underwater excursion, hoping the gate wasn't fully blocked off...
tsk/tskc.name: Traitors' Gate
tsk/tskc.text: [action]: Test [combat] or [agility] (5). If you succeed, reveal the Tower of London. If you fail, take 1 damage.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: A conspiracy of ravens circle ominously over the castle walls. Far too many to be a coincidence.
tsk/tskc.back_text: The main gate into the Tower is locked and securely guarded. As an additional cost to enter the Tower of London, investigators at The Tower Bridge must spend 2 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
tsk/tskc.name: Tower of London
tsk/tskc.text: Forced - After you end your turn at the Tower of London: You must either lose 2 resources, or each enemy in the shadows attacks you.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: What could the man with the red gloves possibly want in this place?
tsk/tskc.back_text: Forced - When a concealed mini-card would enter play anywhere other than Tower Prison: Put it into play at Tower Prison, instead.
tsk/tskc.name: Tower Prison
tsk/tskc.text: [fast] While an investigator at Tower Prison is performing a skill test, spend 1 clue: That investigator gets +2 skill value for this test. Forced - When a concealed mini-card would enter play anywhere other than Tower Prison: Put it into play at Tower Prison, instead.

tsk/tskc.flavor: "The only detail I could remember was his gloves; red, red as blood."
tsk/tskc.name: The Red-Gloved Man
tsk/tskc.text: Concealed 1 [per_investigator]. Retaliate.

tsk/tskc.flavor: File #5-A19 / Subject Class: Yellow / Key appears as small red marble found lodged in eyesocket of deceased Coterie operative. Paradimensional capabilities unknown.
tsk/tskc.name: The Eye of Ravens
tsk/tskc.text: Shift - During a skill test at your location, the performing investigator sets their base skill value for this test to 6. Flip this key to its [[Unstable]] side.

tsk/tskc.flavor: ...completely impregnable despite all piercing and crushing attempts. What could possibly be inside? A device? Or another world entirely?
tsk/tskc.name: The Eye of Ravens
tsk/tskc.text: Shift - Draw the top card of the encounter deck. Then, if an investigator shifted this key, flip it to its [[Stable]] side.

tsk/tskc.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –2 for every 1 [per_investigator] civilians slain.
[cultist]: -6. Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location. That enemy readies and attacks you.
[tablet]: –2. Take 1 damage. A civilian at your location is slain.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, discard 1 card from your hand at random.
tsk/tskc.name: Dead Heat
tsk/tskc.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –1 for every 1 [per_investigator] civilians slain.
[cultist]: -4. If you fail, choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location. That enemy readies and attacks you.
[tablet]: –1. You may take 1 damage. If you do not, a civilian at your location is slain.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, choose and discard 1 card from your hand.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: As night falls, your sense of being followed only grows. Turning around, you see a trio of tall, lanky figures moving slowly. The shadows obscure their features, but a glint of light reflects on wet, red jaws and hollow eyes. When you quicken your pace, they quicken theirs. As the group bears down on you, you duck into a nearby alleyway and sprint away from them. After several minutes of running, you hear a rasping, gutteral howl followed by a sound like ripping cloth behind you.
tsk/tskc.back_text:
For every 1 [per_investigator] civilians slain, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Risen]] or [[Ghoul]] enemy and spawn it at a random location. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
Each investigator decides (choose one):
- Heal 2 damage from each [[Elite]] enemy in play.
- 1 civilian at your location is slain.
tsk/tskc.flavor: Everywhere you go, you have the distinct feeling of being followed, as though the shadows themselves move of their own accord. In nearby alleyways and backroads, you hear the gnashing of teeth and the tearing of meat. The palpable sense of unease only grows stronger as night falls.
tsk/tskc.name: Gnashing Teeth
tsk/tskc.text: Each [[Risen]] enemy and each [[Ghoul]] enemy gains "Spawn - Random location."

tsk/tskc.back_flavor:
A crimson sunrise casts the ruined city in an awful glow: cars overturned, stalls rared, cobblestones covered in blood smears. What few civilians remain cower behind boarded up windows, fearfully praying for their lives. Whatever terrible thing Amaranth aimed to do here, she has succeeded. The city's ruin is a grim testament to her awful power.
Heart heavy with the weight of such great loss, you make a path through the devastation. A pack of the hungering dead catch wind of your scent and pursue you relentlessly to the city limits, picking at you with sharp, hungry claws. You barely escape with your life.
tsk/tskc.back_text: Each investigator suffers 1 physical trauma. Check which enemies are in play. - If Razin Farhi is in play, proceed to (→R1) (page 13). - Otherwise, proceed to (→R2) (page 13).
tsk/tskc.flavor: The city grows quieter as more and more civilians disappear each night. The soul-deadening heat of the day sees more hollow-eyed figures walk the streets. Once a thriving oasis of life and culture, Marrakesh now feels like an empty echo of its former self.
tsk/tskc.name: Empty Streets
tsk/tskc.text: Each [[Risen]] enemy and each [[Ghoul]] enemy gains hunter and "Spawn - Random location."

tsk/tskc.back_flavor:
Showing the photograph of Amaranth to several locals, they direct you to the verdant Bahia Palace Gardens. Approaching carefully, you find the woman with the red flower standing at the edge of a ritual circle, candles lit at each point, with gleaming offerings gathered around a corpse laid on an altar in the center. On either side of the corpse, two dead warriors are laid on the ground, bedecked in ancient finery.
"Soon, my love," Amaranth strokes the cheek of the corpse as the blossom in her hair unfurls. Tenebrous vines radiate out from the circle and creep across the garden. The grass and greenery shrivel under their touch, and eerie green light shimmers up the black vines, drinking the life around it. "It appears we have guests," Amaranth smirks.
tsk/tskc.back_text: Spawn the set-aside Amaranth enemy at Bahia Palace Gardens, (Lurking Corruption) side faceup, and attach the set-aside The Last Blossom key to her. Put the set-aside Save the Civilians story card into play next to the agenda deck. Shuffle the set-aside Khalid enemy into the encounter deck.
tsk/tskc.flavor: Strange happenings are afoot. A tomb robbery of an ancient philosopher. Rumors of the dead walking the streets. A string of disappearances. If you can gather information on Amaranth's whereabouts, you may be able to get to the bottom of things.
tsk/tskc.name: Find Amaranth
tsk/tskc.text: Objective - At the end ot the round, investigators at a [[Ritual Site]] location may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

tsk/tskc.back_text:
If this act advanced because of its forced ability:
"Razin, my love!" exclaims Amaranth. The body in the ritual circle rises to stand, along with two newly-resurrected warriors. Amaranth embraces the ancient philosopher, the two of them entwined with awful black tendrils. She speaks softly: "Let me make this place a paradise for you, my love. A true paradise."
Spawn the set-aside Razin Farhi enemy at Bahia Palace Gardens. Shuffle both copies of the set-aside Ancient Raider enemy into the encounter deck.
If this act advanced because Amaranth would be defeated:
Your final blow knocks Amaranth back, toppling an ancient brazier. As hungry flames consume the remnants of the ritual and the corpses, she screeches in anguish. "Do you have any idea what you have done? Razin, my love..."
Flip Amaranth to her (Corruption Revealed) side, keeping all tokens and attachments on her, and move her to a random location with no investigators. Shuffle both copies of the set-aside Ancient Raider enemy into the encounter deck.
tsk/tskc.flavor: A network of necrous vines has grown through the city, spurred on by Amaranth. The woman with the red flower is conducting strange rites upon a stolen corpse in the Bahia Palace Gardens. You must stop her at any cost.
tsk/tskc.name: Ritual of Life and Death
tsk/tskc.text: Forced - After a civilian is slain, if 4[per_investigator] or more civilians have been slain: Advance this act. Objective - If Amaranth would be defeated, advance.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor:
Amaranth's tortured cry resounds through the streets as she collapses. A heady wind picks up, whipping the dust in the street into a frantic dervish as the hot sun beats down overhead. Black ichor pools around Amaranth's body as the nexus of vines begins to wither and dessicate around you. The hordes of risen dead stop in their tracks, as if waiting for your move. You can see the remaining civilians of Marrakesh flee the city beyond them.
Standing over the beautiful, terrible woman, you feel a pang of pity. As you turn her over, you notice the voluptuous flower behind her ears has wilted in the heat. She lets out a primal scream as you pull the blossom from her ear: the stem is several inches longer than you expected, and sticky with blood.
tsk/tskc.back_text: Check your Campaign Log. - If the cell knows Amaranth's real name, proceed to (→R3) (page 13). - Otherwise, proceed to (→R4) (page 13).
tsk/tskc.flavor: Unnatural vines choke the city streets as Amaranth pursues you, drunk with power. The blossom in her hair stretches wide like a garnet maw as she laughs cruelly.
tsk/tskc.name: Queen of Nothing at All
tsk/tskc.text: Objective - If neither Amaranth nor Razin Farhi are in play, advance.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: Your initial impression of Marrakesh seems pleasant, from the gentle, dry heat to the striking Moorish architecture and colorful tilework. However, you also sense an unspoken fear among those around you.
tsk/tskc.back_text: Forced - If Marrakesh Railway Station has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.
tsk/tskc.name: Marrakesh Railway Station
tsk/tskc.text: [fast]: Move (to a connecting location). (Group limit once per turn.) [action]: Resign. You flee the city. (Note: If there are no investigators in play, all remaining civilians in play will be slain.) Forced - If Marrakesh Railway Station has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: The center of commerce in Marrakesh, this huge open-air market is the go-to place for acquiring food and supplies. The air is thick with the music of buskers and the smell of spices and roasted meats.
tsk/tskc.back_text: Forced - If Jemaa el-Fnaa Square has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.
tsk/tskc.name: Jemaa el-Fnaa Square
tsk/tskc.text: [action] If 1 or more civilians are on this location: Reveal the top 6 cards of your deck. You may play an asset from among those cards (paying its cost). Shuffle the rest into your deck. (Limit once per game.) Forced - If Jemaa el-Fnaa Square has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: The royal necropolis of the Saadian dynasty, this is the final resting place for much of Morocco's 16th-century royalty. Some of its beautiful tilework was destroyed with the recent theft.
tsk/tskc.back_text: Forced - If Saadian's Tombs has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.
tsk/tskc.name: Saadian's Tombs
tsk/tskc.text: Saadian's Tombs gets +1 shroud for each civilian on it. Forced - When a non-[[Elite]] enemy enters or spawns at Saadian's Tombs, before it engages any investigators: Exhaust it. Forced - If Saadian's Tombs has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: You have heard reports of strange disappearances near the tanneries, where leather is processed in large vats of pungent chemicals and dyes.
tsk/tskc.back_text: Forced - If Tanneries has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.
tsk/tskc.name: Tanneries
tsk/tskc.text: [fast] Choose a [[Risen]] enemy from the encounter discard pile and spawn it engaged with you: Place clues on Tanneries (from the token pool) equal to that enemy's health. Forced - If Tanneries has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: The sprawling and opulent palace draws many admirers. The jewel of the palace is its courtyard garden: an oasis of lush vegetation amidst a harsh desert.
tsk/tskc.back_text: Forced - If Bahia Palace Gardens has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.
tsk/tskc.name: Bahia Palace Gardens
tsk/tskc.text: [reaction] After you rescue a civilian on Bahia Palace Gardens: Heal 1 damage or 1 horror. Forced - If Bahia Palace Gardens has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: The once-bustling station is now quiet and lonely. The attendants in charge have delayed the train until tomorrow; news of what is happening in Marrakesh seems to have spread quickly.
tsk/tskc.name: Marrakesh Railway Station
tsk/tskc.text: As an additional cost for you to move out of Marrakesh Railway Station, you must spend 1 resource. [action]: Resign. You run for your life. (Note: If there are no investigators in play, all remaining civilians in play will be slain.)

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: Wind whistles through the empty square, accompanied by the sound of slow footsteps and low groans of the risen.
tsk/tskc.flavor: Stalls and tables are tipped over and merchandize is ruined. The entire square is devoid of both patrons and merchants. You won't be buying anything here anytime soon.
tsk/tskc.name: Jemaa el-Fnaa Square
tsk/tskc.text: While you are at Jemaa el-Fnaa Square, increase the cost of each asset you play by 2.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: This once-holy place is now desecrated and overrun with figures that reek of death and fresh blood.
tsk/tskc.flavor: Do the risen throngs still fear the tombs? Or do they merely resent death?
tsk/tskc.name: Saadian's Tombs
tsk/tskc.text: Forced - When a non-[[Elite]] enemy enters Saadian's Tombs, before it engages any investigators: Heal all damage from it.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: For some reason, the risen dead have been especially active near the old tanneries. Why congregate here?
tsk/tskc.flavor: You watch the risen intentionally submerge themselves into pools of chemicals and swallow great mouthfuls of the foul liquid. Amaranth's power can only stave off decomposition so long. Perhaps this strange ritual preserves their rotting tissue.
tsk/tskc.name: Tanneries
tsk/tskc.text: Each [[Risen]] enemy at Tanneries gets +1 fight and +1 evade.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: The once-vibrant gardens are choked with black, thorned vines. The remaining trees are frail and flake under your touch, and the fountains run dry.
tsk/tskc.flavor: "Man selects only for his own good: Nature only for that of the being which she tends." -- Charles Darwin, The Origin of Species
tsk/tskc.name: Bahia Palace Gardens
tsk/tskc.text: Forced - When you end your turn at Bahia Palace Gardens: Take 1 damage or 1 horror.

tsk/tskc.flavor: A piercing howl resounds through the dusty streets, accompanied by the sound of feeding. Bystanders flee packs of the hungry dead as you traverse the city. All around you is the scent of rot and blood. Only you can save the people of this city from a terrible fate.
tsk/tskc.name: Save the Civilians
tsk/tskc.text: The civilians of Marrakesh are under attack! By getting them out of harm's way, you may be able to avert a massacre. (Note: Civilians still on locations are neither rescued nor slain.) [action] Spend 1 clue: Rescue a civilian from your location (place it on this card). Forced - When the game ends: flip this card (keep all tokens on it).

tsk/tskc.flavor: As day breaks, the remaining survivors in Marrakesh emerge and the morbid arithmetic of counting survivors begins.
tsk/tskc.name: Aftermath
tsk/tskc.text: Compare the number of rescued civilians on Aftermath with the number of slain civilians on the Scenario Reference card. (Note: Civilians still on locations are neither rescued nor slain.) - If the number of rescued civilians is more than the number of slain civilians, each investigator earns 2 bonus experience. If the number of rescued civilians is more than twice the number of slain civilians, each investigator earns 2 additional bonus experience. - If the number of slain civilians is more than the number of rescued civilians, each investigator suffers 1 mental trauma. If the number of is more than twice the number of rescued civilians, each investigator suffers 1 additional mental trauma. - If it is a tie, nothing happens.

tsk/tskc.flavor: "Many say they would do anything for love. But I actually mean it."
tsk/tskc.name: Amaranth
tsk/tskc.text: Hunter. Forced - When damage or horror from Amaranth's attack is assigned to an asset: Defeat that asset and Amaranth shifts each of her attached keys.

tsk/tskc.flavor: "All of you are just weeds in my garden."
tsk/tskc.name: Amaranth
tsk/tskc.text: Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - When Amaranth attacks: She shifts each of her attached keys. If damage and/or horror from this attack is assigned to an asset, defeat that asset.

tsk/tskc.flavor: "I have not crossed vast oceans of time only to be defeated by the likes of you!"
tsk/tskc.name: Razin Farhi
tsk/tskc.text: Alert. Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - After any key is shifted: If Razin Farhi is exhausted, read him. Otherwise, he makes an immediate attack against the engaged investigator.

tsk/tskc.flavor: With dim light and thick clothing they can clumsily pass for living, but by daylight their unnatural pallor, glassy eyes, and gruesome wounds are impossible to hide.
tsk/tskc.name: Thrall
tsk/tskc.text:
The first copy of Thrall drawn each round gains surge.
[fast] During your turn: Attempt to evade Thrall. It gains alert for this evasion attempt. (Limit once per turn).

tsk/tskc.flavor: The former vanguard of Razin Farhi, these soldiers now serve Amaranth with an unnatural fervor.
tsk/tskc.name: Ancient Raider
tsk/tskc.text: Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - After Ancient Raider attacks you: 1 civilian at your location is slain.

tsk/tskc.flavor: "They say cats have nine lives, but my sweet Khalid is already on his tenth."
tsk/tskc.name: Khalid
tsk/tskc.text: Hunter. Forced - After Khalid enters play: Move each other non-[[Elite]] enemy and civilian from its location to a connecting location (distributed as evenly as possible).

tsk/tskc.flavor: Those that ate the blighted crop died even faster than those who chose to starve.
tsk/tskc.name: Famine
tsk/tskc.text: Revelation - Put Famine into play next to the agenda deck. Increase the cost of each card you play by 1. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard Famine from play.

tsk/tskc.flavor: Although the risen move slowly, they hunt like wolves, surrounding their prey before they pounce.
tsk/tskc.name: Cornered!
tsk/tskc.text: Revelation - Test [combat] (3). If you fail, either (choose one): - 1 civilian at your location is slain. - Take 1 damage for each point you fail by.

tsk/tskc.flavor: File #11-B31 / Subject Class: Red / Key appears as flora of extraterrestrial origin, with long, black prehnsile vines that attach intravenously with host.
tsk/tskc.name: The Last Blossom
tsk/tskc.text: Shift - Heal 1 damage and 1 horror from each investigator at your location. Flip this key to its [[Unstable]] side.

tsk/tskc.flavor: ...forming a neural link with host, much like the symbiotic relationship of a parasite, with access to host's thoughts and memories.
tsk/tskc.name: The Last Blossom
tsk/tskc.text: Shift - Heal 1 damage from each enemy in play. Then, if an investigator shifted this key, flip it to its [[Stable]] side.

tsk/tskc.back_text: Hard / Expert [skull]: –X. X is 1 more than the number of targets on this card. [cultist]: –7. If you fail by 2 or more, shuffle each concealed mini-card at your location and at each connecting location facedown, then place them at random in the positions they were in. [tablet]: –2. Cancel the effects and icons of each card committed to this skill test. [elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, you must either place 1 doom on the current agenda, or the nearest [[Coterie]] enemy attacks you (even if its in the shadows).
tsk/tskc.name: Sanguine Shadows
tsk/tskc.text: Easy / Standard [skull]: –X. X is the number of targets on this card. [cultist]: –5. If you fail by 2 or more, shuffle each concealed mini-card at your location and at each connecting location facedown, then place them at random in the positions they were in. [tablet]: –1. Cancel the effects and icons of each card committed to this skill test. [elder_thing]: -2. If you fail, you must either place 1 doom on the current agenda, or the nearest [[Coterie]] enemy attacks you (even if its in the shadows).

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: Hot on the thief's heels, you bust through the door leading to her current target, only to find her already leaving with a piece of the statuette. She gives you a mischievous smirk before escaping through a nearby window.
tsk/tskc.back_text: Reveal each concealed mini-card in play and set each decoy aside, out of play. Find the location with a target on it nearest to La Chica Roja (or her mini-card). La Chica Roja collects that target (place it on her). If there are 3 targerts on La Chica Roja, proceed to (→R3). Otherwise, resolve La Chica Roja's concealed keyword, distributing each of those concealed mini-cards as evenly as possible among each location with a target. Reset the act and agenda decks to agenda 1 and act 1. Add clues to each location until it has clues equal to its clue value.
tsk/tskc.flavor: La Chica Roja is stealing pieces divided up from an old art collection, which you believe are parts of an ancient Key.
tsk/tskc.name: Where is She...?
tsk/tskc.text: Forced - At the start of the game, or after the agenda deck resets: Set the amount of doom on this agenda to 1 [per_investigator]. Forced - After you expose a decoy: La Chica Roja attacks you. (Hint - when this agenda advances, La Chica Roja will collect one of the pieces she seeks!)

tsk/tskc.back_text:
If this is the first time this act has been advanced:
Following all of your leads, you manage to beat La Chica Roja to her target and lie in ambush. She arrives soon after and sets to work, but it's not long before she realizes something is wrong. She hums a jazzy improvisation and saunters around the room, scanning for something. "Come on out," she says at last, a smirk on her lips. You reveal yourself and tell her to stop what she is doing. "Or what?" she grins. "You gonna make me?"
Otherwise:
Once again, you beat your rival to the punch, and she spots you immediately. "You again?" she says dismissively. "Don't you have anything better to do? I'm quite busy, as you can see."
tsk/tskc.flavor: Thanks to Officer Bolívar, you believe you know which buildings might hold the pieces La Chica Roja is after. All that is left is to catch her in the act.
tsk/tskc.name: The Scarlet Shadow
tsk/tskc.text: Objective – Expose the thief's whereabouts. If an investigator engages La Chica Roja, advance.

tsk/tskc.back_text:
Find the location with a target on it nearest to La Chica Roja. Place that target on the scenario reference card. Then, if there are 3 targets on the scenario reference card, skip the rest of this act and instead proceed to Scenario Interlude: Cast a Light. Otherwise, continue reading the following.
"Fine, you can have this one," the mysterious thief calls to you as she makes her escape. "There's more where that came from, anyway!" Before you can catch her, with a twirl of her stark red coat, she vanishes into the shadows without a trace.
Heal all damage from La Chica Roja, return her to the shadows, and resolve her concealed keyword, distributing each of those concealed mini-cards as evenly as possible among each location with a target. Reset the act and agenda decks to agenda 1 and act 1. Each investigator loses each of their clues. Add clues to each location until it has clues equal to its clue value.
tsk/tskc.flavor: You finally have her in your sights!
tsk/tskc.name: In the Searchlight
tsk/tskc.text: La Chica Roja gains: "[action] Parley. Test [intellect] or [agility] (6) to outsmart the thief. You may spend 1 clue to reduce this test's difficulty by 2. If you fail, La Chica Roja attacks you." Objective – If La Chica Roja would be defeated, instead advance. Objective - If an investigator successfully parleys with La Chica Roja, advance.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: You step out onto the broad avenue, eyes darting to every alleyway and rooftop. This street connects with the Plaza de Mayo and many of the buildings which Officer Bolívar marked as potential targets for La Chica Roja's campaign of thievery. It's as good a place as any to start your search.
tsk/tskc.name: Avenida de Mayo
tsk/tskc.text: If your difficulty level is... - ...Easy, X is 2. - ...Standard, X is 3. - ...Hard, X is 4. - ...Expert, X is 5. [action]: Resign. Looks like La Chica Roja wins this game.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: Serving as the office of the President of Argentina, the Rose House is also home to several antiques and curios inherited from past leaders. One might be a piece of the Key your quarry seeks.
tsk/tskc.name: Casa Rosada
tsk/tskc.text: [action] Spend 1 clue: Test [intellect](4) to observe the staff. You may spend 1 additional clue to reduce the difficulty of this test by 2. If you succeed, look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card at this location (without exposing it). For every 2 points you succeed by, look at an additional mini-card at this location.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: Overlooking the Plaza de Mayo looms the impressive façade of the Metropolitan Cathedral. In addition to the usual trappings of the church, Bolívar has informed you that it houses many magnificent pieces of art, as well as a mausoleum. It seems a likely target for La Chica Roja.
tsk/tskc.name: Catedral Metropolitana
tsk/tskc.text: [action] Spend 1 clue: Test [agility](4) to watch the rooftops of the cathedral. You may spend 1 additional clue to reduce the difficulty of this test by 2. If you succeed, look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card at this location (without exposing it). For every 2 points you succeed by, look at an additional mini-card at this location.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: Robbing the dead has long been a crime reserved for only the foulest of thieves, so naturally, Officer Bolívar believes Recoleta Cemetery is on the list of potential targets. Who knows what valuables may be locked with the dead in the cemetery's countless marble vaults and mausoleums?
tsk/tskc.name: Cementario de la Recoleta
tsk/tskc.text: [action] Spend X clues and take X horror: Look at the revealed side of X concealed mini-cards at this location (without exposing them).

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: This privately-owned mansion contains many pieces of art that fit the profile of your mark's past robberies. Judging from the ornate architecture, its owners must be important high society types. You're unlikely to be allowed to patrol the area, so you'll have to resort to La Chica Roja's own methods if you play on watching for her here.
tsk/tskc.name: Palacio Errázuriz
tsk/tskc.text: [action] Spend 1 clue: Test [combat](4) to break into the mansion. You may spend 1 additional clue to reduce the difficulty of this test by 2. If you succeed, look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card at this location (without exposing it). For every 2 points you succeed by, look at an additional mini-card at this location.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: Officer Bolívar has marked this public administrative building as a potential target for La Chica Roja. Steeped in history, the Cabildo de Buenos Aires likely houses artifacts from the city's colonial era. Perhaps one is a piece of the Key she is assembling?
tsk/tskc.name: The Cabildo
tsk/tskc.text: [fast]: Look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card at this location (without exposing it). Then, draw the top card of the encounter deck. You may spend 2 clues to cancel this card's effects and discard it.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: While you know La Chica Roja isn't after money, Officer Bolívar insists that the largest bank in the city is a prime target.
tsk/tskc.name: Banco de la Provincia
tsk/tskc.text: Spend X clues and thrice as many resources: Look at the revealed side of X concealed mini-cards at this location (without exposing them).

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: Many prolific figures of opera, including the famed Arturo Toscanini, have laid their mark on this gorgeous opera house - easily one of the best in the world. Bolívar can provide you with tickets to the current showing of Aida, but you're probably going to stand out like a sore thumb.
tsk/tskc.name: Teatro Colón
tsk/tskc.text: [action] Spend 1 clue: Test [willpower](4) to stake out the rafters of the opera house. You may spend 1 additional clue to reduce the difficulty of this test by 2. If you succeed, look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card at this location (without exposing it). For every 2 points you succeed by, look at an additional mini-card at this location.

tsk/tskc.flavor: "Think out your plan like a woman of action. Then act out your plan like a woman of thought."
tsk/tskc.name: La Chica Roja
tsk/tskc.subname: The Girl in the Carmine Coat
tsk/tskc.text: Concealed 5. Forced - When an investigator engaged with La Chica Roja moves: Disengage her from that investigator.

tsk/tskc.name: La Chica Roja
tsk/tskc.text: [reaction] When your turn ends, exhaust La Chica Roja: Place your investigator mini-card in the shadows. While you are in the shadows, you are not at any location. Enemies that would spawn engaged with you instead spawn at your previous location. At the start of your turn, move back to your previous location (or any revealed location if you cannot).

tsk/tskc.flavor: "He had learned that they are bound by solemn treaties..."-H. P. Lovecraft, "The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath"
tsk/tskc.name: Bound Nightgaunt
tsk/tskc.text:
Hunter.
While attacking Bound Nightgaunt, double the negative modifier of each revealed chaos token.

tsk/tskc.name: Cat and Mouse
tsk/tskc.text: Peril. Surge. Revelation - If there is a concealed mini-card at your location, you may expose it. If an enemy's mini-card would be exposed by this effect, instead flip it back over and shuffle it facedown with the concealed mini-cards at your location.

tsk/tskc.name: Calling Card
tsk/tskc.text: Revelation - Attach to a location without a target, and without a copy of Calling Card attached. While Calling Card is in play, clues cannot be spent (at any location). [reaction] After you successfully investigate attached location by 2 or more: Discard Calling Card. Look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card at any location (without exposing it).

tsk/tskc.flavor: "Better luck next time!"
tsk/tskc.name: Outsmarted
tsk/tskc.text: Revelation - Test [intellect](4). If you fail, you must decide (choose one): - Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effect can cause the agenda to advance. - The nearest [[Coterie]] enemy attacks you.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor:
It has taken much investigative work and even more toil, but you and your new ally have finally managed to confront the Coterie elder known only as The Sanguine Watcher. The spell protecting his body has faltered, and he is at your mercy. Heartless, empty eyes gaze back at you from behind his ruby spectacles. "I knew we never should have let you into our fold," he scolds the girl in red. "You are young and insolent. A jester who dons the clothes of a queen. A mockery of our great circle."
"You are the one who gives us a bad name," she barks back. "We are supposed to protect humanity, not torment it. If it were up to me, you would be driven out."
"We shall see." He pulls his ruby glasses down, revealing dark empty sockets where his eyes should be. Scarlet light bounces off the ominous rims resting on the tip of his nose. "Watch your step, girl. Not even your tricks can save you from me." Then, with a thrashing of dark, nightmarish wings, he is snatched from above and carried into the night.
tsk/tskc.flavor: Scarlet light drowns the city. Somewhere, La Chica Roja's rival lies in wait, hoping to claim the final pieces of the Key for himself.
tsk/tskc.name: Seeing Red
tsk/tskc.text: Forced - After a decoy is exposed: Place 1 doom on this agenda. Forced – When this agenda would advance by reaching its doom threshold: Each investigator is defeated and suffers 1 mental trauma. Objective - If the Sanguine Watcher is defeated, advance.

tsk/tskc.flavor: "You dare get in my way, girl?"
tsk/tskc.name: The Sanguine Watcher
tsk/tskc.text: Retaliate. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if The Sanguine Watcher is ready: Each investigator must either take 2 damage or 2 horror.

tsk/tskc.name: Apportioned Ka
tsk/tskc.text: Concealed 4. Forced - After Apportioned Ka is exposed: Deal 5 damage to the Sanguine Watcher. Return Apportioned Ka to the shadows and resolve its concealed keyword, distributing those concealed mini-cards as evenly as possible among each non-[[Central]] location without a target.

tsk/tskc.flavor: File #16-D25 / Subject Class: Green / Once assembled, Key appears as small statuette of unidentified woman, weeping trandimensional, red flue ("tears?") of unknown origin.
tsk/tskc.name: The Weeping Lady
tsk/tskc.text: Shift - Discover 1 clue at your location or a connecting location. Flip this key to its [[Unstable]] side.

tsk/tskc.flavor: ...emergence of unknown substance does not cease despite external manipulation. Fluid pH 11. Constains no impurities or known bacteria of any kind.
tsk/tskc.name: The Weeping Lady
tsk/tskc.text: Shift - Each investigator must discard an asset they control, if able. Then, if an investigator shifted this key, flip it to its [[Stable]] side.

tsk/tskc.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is the total number of clues on [[Cultist]] enemies in play, to a maximum of 4. (If it is act 3, X is 4.)
[cultist]: –7. You may place 1 doom on the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy to change this token's modifier to a -3.
[tablet]: –4. If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location.
[elder_thing]: -2. Place 1 doom on the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy.
tsk/tskc.name: Dealings in the Dark
tsk/tskc.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is the highest number of clues on a [[Cultist]] enemy in play, to a maximum of 3. (If it is act 3, X is 3.)
[cultist]: –5. You may place 1 doom on the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy to change this token's modifier to a -1.
[tablet]: –3. If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location.
[elder_thing]: -2. If you fail, place 1 doom on the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: The daylight dims, and you strain your eyes to examine why. A strange, black shape has begun to crawl its way over the outline of the sun. An eclipse? Whatever the cult is up to, you better stop it soon...
tsk/tskc.back_text: In player order, each investigator must choose: Either place 1 clue (from the token pool) on Clues Unveiled, or search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Cultist]] enemy and draw it; it gains concealed 1 (if no [[Cultist]] enemy is found, place 1 clue on Clues Unveiled, instead). Shuffle the encounter deck if it is searched. For each eclipse that was on the agenda when it advanced, an investigator must resolve the above effect an additional time. Flip this agenda back over, adding 1 resource to it, as an eclipse. (It keeps each other eclipse it had, as well.)
tsk/tskc.flavor: The cult operating in Istanbul is secretive and deadly, with eyes everywhere and ears in every dark corner of the city.
tsk/tskc.name: Agents of the Dark
tsk/tskc.text: Each non-weakness [[Cultist]] enemy gains concealed 1. Forced - After you evade a [[Cultist]] enemy, return it to the shadows and resolve its concealed keyword: Take control of 1 of its clues.

tsk/tskc.back_text:
If the investigators reached the clue threshold first:
You discover what you believe to be the talisman's resting place and scramble to find the Key before your adversaries find you. But to your surprise, inside is only an ancient manuscript.
If the cult reached the clue threshold first:
You discover what you believe to be the talisman's resting place and find it already torn apart. Resting on the ground nearby is a torn-up manuscript, which you hastily begin to restore.
In either case: Resolve the concealed keyword on each non-weakness [[Cultist]] enemy not already in the shadows (as granted by agenda la). Shuffle the encounter discard pile and the set-aside Umbral Harbinger and Emissary from Yuggoth enemies into the encounter deck. Proceed to Act 2 Setup in the Campaign Guide.
tsk/tskc.flavor: According to Ms. Şahin, the talisman has been hidden somewhere in the city for many hundreds of years. You must not let it fall into the cult's hands!
tsk/tskc.name: Search for the Manuscript
tsk/tskc.text: Objective - Find the talisman before the cult does! If either the cult, or investigators at any location(s), possess the requisite number of clues as a group, advance. (Do not spend any clues when you advance.)

tsk/tskc.back_text:
If the investigators reached the clue threshold first, attach The Twisted Antiprism key to any investigator at the east gate.
If the cult reached the clue threshold first, attach The Twisted Antiprism key to the [[Cultist]] enemy with the most clues.
Reveal each concealed mini-card in play. For each enemy's mini-card, move that enemy from the shadows to that location. Set each concealed mini-card aside, out of play.
Put the locations from act 1 that were previously set aside back into play, with Hagia Sophia to the left of the entrance to the Grand Bazaar. These two locations are connected to one another for the rest of the scenario. Put Galata Docks into play.
If the cult reached the clue threshold first, for every 1 [per_investigator] more clues they had than the investigators, move the [[Cultist]] enemy with The Twisted Antiprism once toward Galata Docks.
Each investigator and [[Cultist]] enemy loses each of their clues. Flip The Unveiling story card over to its other side, removing all clues from it. Advance the act and agenda deck directly to "The Chase." It is both the current act and the current agenda.
tsk/tskc.flavor: According to the manuscript, the talisman was discovered somewhat recently by a third party, and brought to the Grand Bazaar as a valuable item to be sold. You can't let that happen!
tsk/tskc.name: Search for the Talisman
tsk/tskc.text: Objective - Find the talisman before the cult does! If either the cult, or investigators at the location designated as the east gate, possess the requisite number of clues as a group, advance. (Do not spend any clues when you advance.)

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: In the dark light of an alien moon, your enemies work tirelessly to escape with the talisman in their possession.
tsk/tskc.back_text: Each enemy in play moves and attacks as if it were the enemy phase (without exhausting). If there are fewer enemies in play than the number of investigators, in player order, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a [[Cultist]] enemy is discarded, and draw it (shuffling the encounter discard pile to form a new encounter deck if necessary). Repeat this until there are enemies in play equal to the number of investigators. Flip this card back over.
tsk/tskc.name: The Chase
tsk/tskc.text: Objective - "Get this thing out of here!" If an investigator with The Twisted Antiprism is at Galata Docks, you may proceed to (→R1) (page 25). Objective - "Don't let them get away with the Key!" If an enemy with The Twisted Antiprism is at Galata Docks, or if the investigator with The Twisted Antiprism is defeated, proceed to (→R6) (page 25).

tsk/tskc.name: The Unveiling
tsk/tskc.text: Forced - After 1 or more doom is placed on a [[Cultist]] enemy: Flip them to their clue side. If an enemy has more than 3 clues on it, move the clues in excess of 3 to Clues Unveiled, below. The number of clues possessed by the cult is equal to the total number of clues on [[Cultist]] enemies in play plus the number of clues on Clues Unveiled, below.

tsk/tskc.name: The Unsealing
tsk/tskc.text: Each non-weakness enemy gains: "Hunter. Prey - Investigator with The Twisted Antiprism." If The Twisted Antiprism is attached to that enemy, it instead gains "Patrol (Galata Docks)." Forced - When 1 or more doom would be placed on an enemy: It instead moves and attacks as if it were the enemy phase (without exhausting). Forced - After a non-weakness enemy attacks the investigator with The Twisted Antiprism: Attach The Twisted Antiprism to that enemy, [[Unstable]] side faceup. Then, that enemy shifts it. [reaction] After you evade or defeat the enemy with The Twisted Antiprism: Take control of The Twisted Antiprism, attaching it to your investigator.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: The Galata Bridge spans over the Golden Horn, separating the piers from the rest of the city.
tsk/tskc.back_text: You can only enter Galata Docks from Galata. As an additional cost for you to do so, you must discard any combination of cards from your hand or assets from your play area with at least 3 matching skill icons.
tsk/tskc.flavor: With the Foundation's travel documents, you should be able to charter a ship out of the city with ease.
tsk/tskc.name: Galata Docks
tsk/tskc.text: You can only enter Galata Docks from Galata. As an additional cost for you to do so, you must discard any combination of cards from your hand or assets from your play area with at least 3 matching skill icons.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: The ancient Galata Tower looms over this well-traveled district, where tourists and residents intermingle. You pass several embassies, warehouses, and commercial buildings for businesses both local and foreign. One of the district's older buildings may have once hid the talisman. Perhaps even the famed Galata Tower itself?
tsk/tskc.name: Galata
tsk/tskc.text: [fast] Spend 3 resources: Parley. Expose a concealed mini-card at any location. (Group limit once per round.)

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: Originally brought to the city from Egypt by the Romans, the Obelisk looms ominously over Sultanahmet Square. Its inscription commemorates the triumphs of conquerors past.
tsk/tskc.name: Obelisk of Theodosius
tsk/tskc.text: Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating the Obelisk of Theodosius: Move 1 of your clues to the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: Housing faculties of theology, arts, mathematics, and science, as well as other recent additions, the newly reconstituted university is as prestigious as its campus is beautiful. If there's anywhere in the city you'll be able to find information regarding relics from its past, it's here.
tsk/tskc.name: Istanbul University
tsk/tskc.text: [action]: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (6). If you succeed, take control of 1 clue on Clues Unveiled. (Max one success per game.)

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: Originally built as a cathedral, the Hagia Sophia Grand Mosque is one of the most iconic buildings in the entire world and the epitome of Byzantine architecture. Having survived the city's numerous transformations throughout the ages, this holy place may contain a wealth of information pertinent to your investigation, if you know where to look.
tsk/tskc.name: Hagia Sophia
tsk/tskc.text: Hagia Sophia gets +3 shroud for each study token on it. [action]: Place 1 [per_investigator] clues on Hagia Sophia (from the token pool). Place 1 resource on Hagia Sophia (also from the token pool), as a study token.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: The bustling streets of the bazaar's domed interior are dense with stalls and traders selling all manner of goods, from jewelry and clothes to carpets and furniture. Somewhere in this labvrinthine market lies the Key you and your enemies search tor... but where?
tsk/tskc.name: Grand Bazaar
tsk/tskc.text: Increase the difficulty to fight or evade each concealed mini-card at this location by 2.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: The bustling streets of the bazaar's domed interior are dense with stalls and traders selling all manner of goods, from jewelry and clothes to carpets and furniture. Somewhere in this labvrinthine market lies the Key you and your enemies search tor... but where?
tsk/tskc.name: Grand Bazaar
tsk/tskc.text: While you are at this location, treat the text box of each [[Weapon]] asset you control as if it were blank (except for [[Traits]]).

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: The bustling streets of the bazaar's domed interior are dense with stalls and traders selling all manner of goods, from jewelry and clothes to carpets and furniture. Somewhere in this labvrinthine market lies the Key you and your enemies search tor... but where?
tsk/tskc.name: Grand Bazaar
tsk/tskc.text: [fast]: Parley. Take control of 1 clue from a [[Cultist]] enemy at this location. Then, return that enemy to the shadows and resolve its concealed keyword. (Limit once per round.)

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: The bustling streets of the bazaar's domed interior are dense with stalls and traders selling all manner of goods, from jewelry and clothes to carpets and furniture. Somewhere in this labvrinthine market lies the Key you and your enemies search tor... but where?
tsk/tskc.name: Grand Bazaar
tsk/tskc.text: Forced - After you expose a decoy at this location: Move 1 clue from this location to the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: The bustling streets of the bazaar's domed interior are dense with stalls and traders selling all manner of goods, from jewelry and clothes to carpets and furniture. Somewhere in this labvrinthine market lies the Key you and your enemies search tor... but where?
tsk/tskc.name: Grand Bazaar
tsk/tskc.text: Forced - When you would move out of this location: Test [agility] (3). If you fail, you must either lose 1 action or cancel the effects of the move.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: The bustling streets of the bazaar's domed interior are dense with stalls and traders selling all manner of goods, from jewelry and clothes to carpets and furniture. Somewhere in this labvrinthine market lies the Key you and your enemies search tor... but where?
tsk/tskc.name: Grand Bazaar
tsk/tskc.text: [reaction] After you move to this location from a connecting location: Test [agility] (4). If you succeed, move again. Forced - After an enemy moves to this location via hunter or patrol: Resolve that keyword again.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: The bustling streets of the bazaar's domed interior are dense with stalls and traders selling all manner of goods, from jewelry and clothes to carpets and furniture. Somewhere in this labvrinthine market lies the Key you and your enemies search tor... but where?
tsk/tskc.name: Grand Bazaar
tsk/tskc.text: [action]: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, you may play a [[Charm]] or [[Relic]] asset from your hand, reducing its cost by 1 for each point you succeeded by (to a minimum of 0).

tsk/tskc.flavor: "Why do you suppose the keys have not been erased?"
tsk/tskc.name: Ece Şahin
tsk/tskc.text: [fast] Exhaust Ece Şahin: Look at the top card of any investigator's deck. If it is not a weakness, you may place it facedown beneath Ece Sahin (limit 5 cards beneath her). Forced - After any key is shifted: The owner of each card beneath Ece Şahin draws that card.

tsk/tskc.flavor:
"Trouble with memory. I see things I never knew before. Other worlds and other galaxies….. Dark. The lightning seems dark and the darkness seems light.
-- H. P. Lovecraft, "The Haunter of the Dark"
tsk/tskc.name: Umbral Harbinger
tsk/tskc.text: Hunter. Forced - When Umbral Harbinger is dealt damage: Place 1 doom on the [[Cultist]] enemy nearest to it.

tsk/tskc.flavor:
I have seen the dark universe yawning
Where the black planets roll without aim.
-- H. P. Lovecraft, "The Haunter of the Dark"
tsk/tskc.name: Sinister Aspirant (A)
tsk/tskc.text: Alert. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Sinister Aspirant is ready: Place 1 doom on it.

tsk/tskc.flavor:
I have seen the dark universe yawning
Where the black planets roll without aim.
-- H. P. Lovecraft, "The Haunter of the Dark"
tsk/tskc.name: Sinister Aspirant (B)
tsk/tskc.text: Alert. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Sinister Aspirant is ready: Place 1 doom on it.

tsk/tskc.flavor:
I have seen the dark universe yawning
Where the black planets roll without aim.
-- H. P. Lovecraft, "The Haunter of the Dark"
tsk/tskc.name: Sinister Aspirant (C)
tsk/tskc.text: Alert. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Sinister Aspirant is ready: Place 1 doom on it.

tsk/tskc.name: Shadowed
tsk/tskc.text: Revelation - If there are no [[Cultist]] enemies in play, take 1 horror and Shadowed gains surge. Otherwise, find the [[Cultist]] enemy nearest to you. Place 1 doom on that enemy and test [willpower] (X), where X is that enemy's fight value. If you fail, take 2 horror.

tsk/tskc.name: Accosted
tsk/tskc.text: Revelation - If there are no [[Cultist]] enemies in play, take 1 damage and Accosted gains surge. Otherwise, find the [[Cultist]] enemy nearest to you. Place 1 doom on that enemy and test [agility] (X), where X is that enemy's evade value. If you fail, take 2 damage.

tsk/tskc.name: Light Out of Void
tsk/tskc.text: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Place 1 doom on the [[Cultist]] enemy in play with the highest evade. - Take 1 damage and 1 horror. If the investigators possess more clues than the cult, or if it is act 3, resolve this revelation ability a second time.

tsk/tskc.flavor: File #21-F30 / Subject Class: Red / Key is a trapezohedron-shaped crystal of unknown mineral, roughly 19 cm in length, impervious to both matter and light.
tsk/tskc.name: The Twisted Antiprism
tsk/tskc.text: Shift - Look at the top 3 cards of your deck. Draw 1 of those cards and shuffle the rest back into your deck. Flip this key to its [[Unstable]] side.

tsk/tskc.flavor: ...do not store in darkness under any circumstances.
tsk/tskc.name: The Twisted Antiprism
