You step closer and realize with horror that you recognize the covered figure upon the altar - or, at least, you recognize its stark red gloves.
tsk/tskc.back_text: Spawn the set-aside Mimetic Nemesis enemy at Outsiders' Lair, exhausted. Each investigator chooses 2 non-weakness cards in their discard pile and sets them aside, out of play, as hollows. Find the set-aside The Red-Gloved Man story asset and place him with the other set-aside hollows, as a hollow. He is considered to be owned by all of the investigators. If he is the bearer of any keys, do not attach those keys to him.
tsk/tskc.flavor: Somewhere in this strange otherworld lies a secret so vital, an ages-old member of the Red Coterie was willing to reach out to you personally to have you help her find this place - the world where all things stolen from memory end up. If the truth is anywhere, it must be here.
tsk/tskc.name: Traversing the Outside
tsk/tskc.text: Objective - Find the heart of the Outsiders' domain. When the Outsiders' Lair is revealed, advance.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor:
You finally manage to pry the body of the Red-Gloved Man away from the creature's flashing tendrils and drag him off of the altar. He drifts in and out of consciousness as you carry him out of the entity's lair, speaking only nonsense words in an unearthly language. The moment his eyelids open before the alien skies of the Outside, he shudders awake in agony, letting out gasping, pained breaths and clutching the very spot on his forehead where the creature had latched onto him.
You give him a moment to recover before asking him how he got here and what it was doing to him. To his credit, the man does not take long to return to his usual stoic demeanor, adjusting the cuffs of his suit and lowering the brim of his hat to obscure the sweat dripping down his forehead. "Not here," he says. As if on cue, the structure of glass and onyx shudders into ruin and the entity emerges, its tendrils unfolding into a massive, eldritch shape of luminous distortion. "I don't suppose you know a way out of here?" the man asks.
tsk/tskc.flavor: You don't truly know what's going on, but you know it can't be good. You have to stop whatever process is happening here - only then can you learn the truth from the man in the red gloves.
tsk/tskc.name: Red Ruin
tsk/tskc.text: The Red-Gloved Man cannot be discarded or drawn. [action] If Mimetic Nemesis is at your location, spend 1 clue: Deal 2 damage to it. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity from Mimetic Nemesis. Objective - When The Red-Gloved man enters play, advance.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: You stand at the edge of the platform upon which you arrived in this realm, wondering how to return to your own. There is no sign whatsoever of the ship that fell into the pit below. Perhaps it made its way back. Or perhaps its still falling. You have no way to know for sure, but very few alternatives. Holding your breath, you look away from the bottomless pit, and take a leap of faith...
tsk/tskc.back_text: Check which [[Conspirator]] assets are in the victory display. - If both The Red-Gloved Man and Aliki Zoni Uperetria are in the victory display, proceed to (→R1) (page 57). - If The Red-Gloved Man is in the victory display, proceed to (→R2) (page 58). - If Aliki Zoni Uperetria is in the victory display, proceed to (→R3) (page 58). - If neither The Red-Gloved Man nor Aliki Zoni Uperetria are in the victory display, proceed to (→R4) (page 58).
tsk/tskc.flavor: The Red-Gloved Man is on your side and answers are finally within reach. But first you must find a way back home... because if you can't, this might become your new home.
tsk/tskc.name: Escaping the Otherworld
tsk/tskc.text: Each [[Outsider]] enemy loses aloof. Forced - If The Red-Gloved Man is defeated: Remove him from the game. Objective - Time to get the hell out of here! If each surviving investigator has resigned, advance.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: Before you lies an otherworldly landscape unlike anything you have ever seen - the twisting, jumbled structures, the alien flora and strange effigies, all of it against a backdrop of familiar architecture and gadgetry both modern and ancient. The ship that led you here teeters on the brink of this eldritch platform for a moment, and then, with a deafening ruckus, plunges into the endless oblivion below.
tsk/tskc.name: Court of the Outsiders
tsk/tskc.text: [action]: Resign. Test [willpower] or [agility] (4). If you succeed, you resign, adding each [[Conspirator]] asset you control to the victory display. If you fail, you remain trapped here, and this test gets -1 difficulty until the end of your turn. If each surviving investigator has resigned, immediately advance to act 3b.

tsk/tskc.back_text: Concealed 1. Forced - When you expose this location: - If it is in the left position in the shadows, take 1 damage. - If it is in the middle position in the shadows, choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. - If it is on the right position in the shadows, take 1 horror.
tsk/tskc.name: Outsiders' Lair
tsk/tskc.text:
Each [[Outsider]] enemy at this location loses aloof and gets +1 fight and +1 evade.
[fast] If The Red-Gloved Man is the only set-aside hollow: Put him into play under the control of any investigator at Outsiders' Lair.

tsk/tskc.name: Mimetic Nemesis
tsk/tskc.text: Alert. Hunter. Massive. Retaliate. Forced - When you would deal damage to this enemy: Instead, choose and discard that many set-aside hollows. Forced - At the end of the round: Each investigator at this enemy's location must either choose a non-weakness card in their hand and set it aside, as a hollow, or this enemy attacks them.

tsk/tskc.name: Protoplasmic Reassembler
tsk/tskc.text: Massive. Spawn - Location farthest from all investigators. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if this enemy is ready: Spawn the top card of the nearest investigator's deck facedown at its location as a Golem enemy. Golems have: "[[Monster. Outsider.]]\ Hunter. 1 fight, 1 health, 1 evade, 1 damage value. If Golem is defeated, set it aside, out of play, as a hollow."

tsk/tskc.flavor: "The final shift - has it told you what it means?"
tsk/tskc.name: The Red-Gloved Man
tsk/tskc.text: [reaction] After you successfully fight or evade an [[Outsider]] enemy by 2 or more, exhaust The Red-Gloved Man: Deal 1 damage to that enemy and discover 1 clue at your location.

tsk/tskc.name: Aliki Zoni Uperetria
tsk/tskc.subname: The Maid with the Scarlet Sash
tsk/tskc.text: [reaction] After a concealed mini-card is exposed, exhaust Aliki Zoni Uperetria: Choose a set-aside hollow. Its owner draws it.

tsk/tskc.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is 1 more than the current act number.
[cultist]: –7. You may flip a [[Stable]] key you control to its [[Unstable]] side to treat this token's modifier as –4, instead.
[tablet]: –2. If there is a ready [[Outsider]] enemy at your location, you automatically fail, instead.
[elder_thing]: –4. Cancel the effects and icons of each card committed to this test and set each of them aside, out of play, as hollows.
tsk/tskc.name: Congress of the Keys
tsk/tskc.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is the current act number.
[cultist]: –5. You may flip a [[Stable]] key you control to its [[Unstable]] side to treat this token's modifier as –2, instead.
[tablet]: –2. If this is an attack against a ready [[Outsider]] enemy, you automatically fail, instead.
[elder_thing]: –3. Cancel the effects and icons of each card committed to this test and set each of them aside, out of play, as hollows.

tsk/tskc.back_text:
If the current act is Secrets and Lies (v. I):
Leylines of paradimensional energy surround you, threatening to tear you apart.
Each enemy shifts each of their attached keys. Immediately resolve an additional enemy phase (then resume the current phase).
If the current act is Secrets and Lies (v. II):
The portal the red-gloved man opened is almost shut! With no time left to prepare, you leap inside just before it closes.
Place 4 doom on agenda 2a. Advance the act.
If the current act is Secrets and Lies (v. III):
Extradimensional entities surround you, threatening to erase your very existence.
Flip 1 [per_investigator] keys from their [[Stable]] side to their [[Unstable]] side. Immediately resolve an additional enemy phase (then resume with the current phase).
tsk/tskc.flavor: A coded message...
tsk/tskc.name: Conflux of Consequence
tsk/tskc.text: Forced – When this agenda advances, if it is act 2, 3, or 4: Skip the "b" side of this agenda and proceed directly to agenda 2a.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: A peal of thunder resounds across dimensions. In the deep recesses of your mind, the building pressure of infinite forgotten worlds crushes your every sense. Your keys, surging with paradimensional energy, rattle and hum in your hands. Without them, you could scarcely withstand the strain of this realm.
tsk/tskc.back_text:
Flip each decoy over. Shuffle all concealed mini-cards in play, then place them at random in the positions they were in.
Each investigator takes 2 damage and 2 horror but may either (choose one, or neither):
- Shift an [[Unstable]] key they control without flipping it to its [[Stable]] side to cancel all of the damage and horror just dealt to them by the above effect.
- Flip any number of [[Stable]] keys they control to their [[Unstable]] side to cancel that much damage/horror just dealt to them by the above effect.
tsk/tskc.flavor: A coded message...
tsk/tskc.name: The World Unbidden

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: A coded message...
tsk/tskc.back_text: Each investigator is defeated.
tsk/tskc.flavor: A coded message...
tsk/tskc.name: Running Red

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: Finally, you spot the man with the red gloves just before he ducks into a shimmering, extradimensional portal. There is no time to lose — it's now or never! You follow swiftly as the portal closes...
tsk/tskc.back_text: Remove each location from the game. (Investigators are not defeated during this process. Other enemies and attachments at those locations are discarded, and concealed mini-cards are set aside.) Put The Knotted Tower, Gravity-Defying Climb, and The Towering Vertex locations into play in a straight vertical line, with The Towering Vertex at the top and The Knotted Tower at the bottom. Take the top 3 locations in the Otherworld deck and place them in the shadows, arranged in a line from left to right. Take the 3 City of Remnants mini-cards, shuffle them facedown, and arrange them around The Knotted Tower as follows: One to its left, one to its right, and one below. Place each investigator at The Knotted Tower and The Red-Gloved Man enemy at the Towering Vertex. Remove the encounter deck and encounter discard pile from the game, replacing them with the second encounter deck.
tsk/tskc.flavor: You have to find the man with the red gloves and discover what his plan is, but the remainder of the Red Coterie stands in your way. Don't they realize the true threat here?
tsk/tskc.name: Secrets and Lies (v. I)
tsk/tskc.text: The Red-Gloved Man gains concealed 1 [per_investigator] and cannot be damaged. Objective – At the end of the round, if each investigator is at the same location as The Red-Gloved Man, they may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: You step through the portal, uncertain if you will ever return...
tsk/tskc.back_text: Remove agenda 1a from the game, moving all of its doom to agenda 2a. Remove each location from the game. (Investigators are not defeated during this process. Other enemies and attachments at those locations are discarded, and concealed mini-cards are set aside.) Put The Knotted Tower, Gravity-Defying Climb, and The Towering Vertex locations into play in a straight vertical line, with The Towering Vertex at the top and The Knotted Tower at the bottom. Take the top 3 locations in the Otherworld deck and place them in the shadows, arranged in a line from left to right. Take the 3 City of Remnants mini-cards and X decoys, where X is the amount of doom on agenda 2a, shuffle them facedown, and distribute them as evenly as possible around The Knotted Tower to its left, right, and below. Place each investigator at The Knotted Tower and The Red-Gloved Man enemy at the Towering Vertex. Shuffle each other set-aside [[Coterie]] enemy into the encounter deck. (Note: From now on, draw cards from the encounter deck during each mythos phase, as normal.)
tsk/tskc.flavor: You have one last chance to explore the Red Coterie's hideout before you depart. But time is of the essence!
tsk/tskc.name: Secrets and Lies (v. II)
tsk/tskc.text: Do not draw cards from the encounter deck during the mythos phase. Objective – Prepare for your journey into the Outside, and proceed when you are ready. At the end of any round, if each investigator is at the same location, they may advance. The sooner, the better. (Hint — You will also be forced to advance automatically when the agenda advances.)

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: Finally, you spot the man with the red gloves just before he ducks into a shimmering, extradimensional portal. There is no time to lose — it's now or never! You follow swiftly as the portal closes...
tsk/tskc.back_text: Remove each location from the game. (Investigators are not defeated during this process. Other enemies and attachments at those locations are discarded, and concealed mini-cards are set aside.) Put The Knotted Tower, Gravity-Defying Climb, and The Towering Vertex locations into play in a straight vertical line, with The Towering Vertex at the top and The Knotted Tower at the bottom. Take the top 3 locations in the Otherworld deck and place them in the shadows, arranged in a line from left to right. Take the 3 City of Remnants mini-cards, shuffle them facedown, and arrange them around The Knotted Tower as follows: One to its left, one to its right, and one below. Place each investigator at The Knotted Tower and The Red-Gloved Man enemy at the Towering Vertex.
tsk/tskc.flavor: Outsiders have attacked the Red Coterie's hideout! Only one among them has the answers you seek. You must find the "Red-Gloved Man" — or the entity that wears his face — and follow it back to the world whence it came.
tsk/tskc.name: Secrets and Lies (v. III)
tsk/tskc.text: The Red-Gloved Man gains concealed 1 [per_investigator] and cannot be damaged. Objective – At the end of the round, if each investigator is at the same location as The Red-Gloved Man, they may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: Seven forgotten locks grant entry to the tower, each one a piece of history from a realm long since erased from time. You forget they exist the moment the gates open. On the other side, steps course their way up the spire's baffling length. Winding, perplexing, and seemingly infinite, the ascent to the apex of the tower that binds this world together is paradoxical, a Gordian knot twisted far too many times. Even if you make it to the top, you doubt you will ever find a way back.
tsk/tskc.back_text:
Set each concealed mini-card aside, out of play. Remove each City of Remnants in the shadows and the remainder of the Otherworld deck from the game.
Take the 3 City of Remnants concealed mini-cards and 1 [per_investigator] decoys, shuffle them facedown, and arrange them around Gravity-Defying Climb in a random order.
tsk/tskc.flavor: Beyond all of known reality, in the dimension known only to the forgotten and the forsaken, lies the preposterous City of Remnants — the home world of the Outsiders themselves. Looming before you, a terrifying, twisted tower of jumbled architecture is a nexus of roiling mist and clouds across an alien sky.
tsk/tskc.name: To the Tower
tsk/tskc.text: Locations and concealed mini-cards cannot be placed adjacent to [[Tower]] locations. Objective – Find a way into the tower where the infiltrator lies in wait. If an investigator enters the Gravity-Defying Climb, advance.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: With herculean effort, you practically crawl from the final step to the tower's pinnacle. Twisting clouds of crimson and violet clash in a multidimensional sky, infinite gateways to infinite worlds, all of them oblivious, all of them blind, all of them theirs for the taking. You look out upon the world of the Outsiders with both awe and pity, upon the countless worlds' worth of ruin they have collected, discarded, forsaken, lost to all time. It is a garbage heap of cosmic proportions. At the very center lies your foe who has orchestrated humanity's erasure. Its body only scarcely resembles that of the Red-Gloved Man now. With no human face to wear, its gaze is empty, its expression unknowable.
tsk/tskc.back_text:
Set each concealed mini-card aside, out of play.
Swap the set-aside Mimetic Nemesis enemy with The Red-Gloved Man enemy at The Towering Vertex.
Take the Mimetic Nemesis's mini-card and 2 [per_investigator] decoys, shuffle them facedown, and arrange them around The Towering Vertex in a random order.
tsk/tskc.flavor:
A terrible feeling of vertigo washes over you as you begin to scale the cyclopean, Escheresque steps.
Only one way to go now.
tsk/tskc.name: The Ascent
tsk/tskc.text: Objective – Ascend. If an investigator enters The Towering Vertex, advance.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor:
The entity collapses upon itself, its wordless screech washing over the world and worlds beyond, reverberating through your skull, tearing you apart molecule by molecule. You remain tethered to reality only by the energy of your keys, which endure even as all else implodes around you. There is a sensation of tugging at the back of your skull, a feeling of being yanked by a fishhook out of ravaged waters.
Then, darkness.
tsk/tskc.flavor: You brandish the keys you have collected and brace yourself. If you cannot expel this entity and collapse this dimension, it will be the end of you all — and none will ever be the wiser. This is it. Your last chance before there is nothing of you left. nothing of you left nothing
tsk/tskc.name: The Final Err
tsk/tskc.text: [action] Flip a [[Stable]] key you control to its [[Unstable]] side: Remove an exposed decoy from the game. Objective – If Mimetic Nemesis is defeated, advance.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: The halls of the Red Coterie's secret hideout celebrate its long history of meddling with humanity, its walls adorned with ancient relics from past civilizations, scarlet-red tapestries, and numerous portraits of important-looking people, all clad in red.
tsk/tskc.flavor: Perhaps if you had a guide, these labyrinthine halls would not be so perplexing.
tsk/tskc.name: Scarlet Halls
tsk/tskc.text: [fast] Exhaust a [[Conspirator]] asset you control: Move (to a connecting location).

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: The halls of the Red Coterie's secret hideout celebrate its long history of meddling with humanity, its walls adorned with ancient relics from past civilizations, scarlet-red tapestries, and numerous portraits of important-looking people, all clad in red.
tsk/tskc.name: Scarlet Halls
tsk/tskc.text: Forced – After you enter Scarlet Halls: For the remainder of your turn, as an additional cost for you to move from Scarlet Halls to a connecting location, you must either exhaust a [[Conspirator]] asset you control or spend an additional action.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: The Red Coterie's inner sanctum is steeped in ancient tradition and ceremony, welcoming and sinister all at once.
tsk/tskc.flavor: The ceremonial chamber where your trial took place is dominated by an enormous table and lit by candlelight. Extravagant decorations adorn the walls, crimson in color.
tsk/tskc.name: Congress Chamber
tsk/tskc.text: [action] Exhaust a [[Conspirator]] asset you control: Search the top 6 cards of your deck for an asset, draw it, and shuffle the rest into your deck.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: The Red Coterie's inner sanctum is steeped in ancient tradition and ceremony, welcoming and sinister all at once.
tsk/tskc.flavor: The ceremonial chamber where your trial took place is dominated by an enormous table and lit by candlelight. Extravagant decorations adorn the walls, crimson in color.
tsk/tskc.name: Congress Chamber
tsk/tskc.text: While there is a ready [[Coterie]] enemy at Congress Chamber, increase the cost of each asset played by each investigator at Congress Chamber by 2.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: The Red Coterie's inner sanctum is steeped in ancient tradition and ceremony, welcoming and sinister all at once.
tsk/tskc.flavor: A treasure trove of aged books, preserved scrolls and dusty tomes fills this ancient hall, centuries of knowledge hidden away for only the Coterie to see.
tsk/tskc.name: Coterie Library
tsk/tskc.text: [action]: Reduce the cost of the next asset you play this round by 2. You may exhaust a [[Conspirator]] asset to treat this ability as a [fast] ability instead of an [action] ability for this activation.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: The Red Coterie's inner sanctum is steeped in ancient tradition and ceremony, welcoming and sinister all at once.
tsk/tskc.flavor: A treasure trove of aged books, preserved scrolls and dusty tomes fills this ancient hall, centuries of knowledge hidden away for only the Coterie to see.
tsk/tskc.name: Coterie Library
tsk/tskc.text: Forced – After you fail a skill test while investigating Coterie Library: The nearest [[Coterie]] enemy with an attached key shifts each of their attached keys.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: The Red Coterie's inner sanctum is steeped in ancient tradition and ceremony, welcoming and sinister all at once.
tsk/tskc.name: The Key Reliquary
tsk/tskc.text: [reaction] After you successfully investigate The Key Reliquary: Instead of discovering clues, choose an unempowered key attached to an investigator at your location. Place a resource (from the token pool) on that key, as an empowerment; that key is empowered (if it is shifted, its controller may spend the empowerment instead of flipping it to its [[Unstable]] side).

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: The Red Coterie's inner sanctum is steeped in ancient tradition and ceremony, welcoming and sinister all at once.
tsk/tskc.flavor: How many Keys have been tucked away here for years, lost to history? How many more were used as tools of oppression?
tsk/tskc.name: The Key Reliquary
tsk/tskc.text: The Key Reliquary gets +2 shroud for each [[Unstable]] key in play.

tsk/tskc.back_flavor: In the nexus of this jumbled otherworld rises the tower: a sinister structure of assorted materials climbing out of the tangled city, looming countless stories over you like a skyscraper of forgotten architecture. An otherworldly mist snakes around the tower's length, flanked on all sides by barren, jagged peaks.
tsk/tskc.flavor:
And o'er it all loomed the blasphemous effigy,
a ruinous testament to conquered worlds.
 – Virgil Gray, "In the Court of the Outsiders"
tsk/tskc.name: The Knotted Tower
tsk/tskc.text: [reaction] After a location is placed adjacent to The Knotted Tower: Move to that location (from The Knotted Tower).

tsk/tskc.back_text: The gate to Gravity-Defying Climb is sealed and forgotten. As an additional cost to enter Gravity-Defying Climb, investigators at The Knotted Tower must spend 4 [per_investigator] clues.
tsk/tskc.name: Gravity-Defying Climb
tsk/tskc.text: Forced – When a concealed mini-card around Gravity-Defying Climb is exposed: If it is... - ...the next in the sequence listed on The Towering Vertex, it remains in play and exposed, and you may expose another concealed mini-card. - ...any other mini-card, flip it and each other concealed mini-card facedown (without shuffling them).

tsk/tskc.back_text: The Red-Gloved Man cannot be defeated. The way to The Towering Vertex is impossibly perplexing. In order for an investigator to enter The Towering Vertex, concealed mini-cards around Gravity-Defying Climb must be exposed in the following sequence: First, City of Remnants (L); second, City of Remnants (M); third, City of Remnants (R).
tsk/tskc.name: The Towering Vertex
tsk/tskc.text: Forced – When a concealed mini-card around The Towering Vertex is exposed: If it is... - ...the Mimetic Nemesis's mini-card, deal the Mimetic Nemesis 3 damage, then flip all concealed mini-cards facedown and shuffle them facedown. - ...a decoy, it remains in play and exposed.

tsk/tskc.name: Mimetic Nemesis
tsk/tskc.text: Massive. Cannot make attacks of opportunity. Mimetic Nemesis gets +3 [per_investigator] health. Forced – When Mimetic Nemesis would take 1 or more damage from an attack or player card: Choose and reveal a concealed mini-card. If it is a decoy, cancel all damage just dealt (the decoy remains in play and faceup). Otherwise, the damage is dealt as normal, then flip all revealed mini-cards facedown and shuffle them.

tsk/tskc.flavor: A flash of red and a fleeting shadow.
tsk/tskc.name: Coterie Agent (A)
tsk/tskc.text: Concealed 2. Forced - After Coterie Agent enters the shadows: Place 1 doom on it. [reaction] When Coterie Agent is exposed: Discard it.

tsk/tskc.flavor: A flash of red and a fleeting shadow.
tsk/tskc.name: Coterie Agent (B)
tsk/tskc.text: Concealed 2. Forced - After Coterie Agent enters the shadows: Place 1 doom on it. [reaction] When Coterie Agent is exposed: Discard it.

tsk/tskc.flavor: A flash of red and a fleeting shadow.
tsk/tskc.name: Coterie Agent (C)
tsk/tskc.text: Concealed 2. Forced - After Coterie Agent enters the shadows: Place 1 doom on it. [reaction] When Coterie Agent is exposed: Discard it.

tsk/tskc.flavor: The moment she described his outfit, the line went dead.
tsk/tskc.name: Conspiracy in Red
tsk/tskc.text: Revelation - Place 1 doom on an enemy in the shadows. If there are no enemies in the shadows, search the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy with the concealed keyword and draw it. Shuffle the encounter deck.

tsk/tskc.flavor: "Flint, are you seeing what I am seeing?"
tsk/tskc.name: Pinch in Reality
tsk/tskc.text: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): Spend 1 clue or choose and discard half of the non-weakness cards in your hand (rounded up).

tsk/tskc.flavor: They mostly come out when it rains. Mostly.
tsk/tskc.name: Heavy Rain
tsk/tskc.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, you must either take 1 horror, or place 1 of your clues on your location.

tsk/tskc.name: Coterie Envoy
tsk/tskc.text:
Aloof. Patrol (nearest location with a concealed mini-card and no Coterie Envoy)
While Coterie Envoy is ready, concealed mini-cards at its location cannot be exposed.
[reaction] After you defeat Coterie Envoy: Look at the revealed side of any concealed mini-card in play.

tsk/tskc.name: In Plain Sight
tsk/tskc.text: Revelation - Attach to an enemy in the shadows without a copy of In Plain Sight attached. If you cannot, In Plain Sight gains surge. Forced - After you expose attached enemy: That enemy attacks you and gets +2 fight until the end of the round. Discard In Plain Sight.

tsk/tskc.name: Knives in the Dark
tsk/tskc.text: Revelation - Put Knives in the Dark into play in your threat area if there is no copy of it in your threat area. Otherwise, this card gains surge. Forced - After you expose a decoy: Take 2 damage. (Limit once per round.) Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, discard Knives in the Dark.

tsk/tskc.name: Undercover
tsk/tskc.text: Revelation - If there are no enemies in the shadows, Undercover gains surge. Otherwise, test [intellect] or [agility] (4). If you fail, place a decoy at the location with the most concealed mini-cards, flip it facedown, and shuffle each concealed mini-card at that location.

tsk/tskc.name: Seeing Shadows
tsk/tskc.text: Revelation - Put Seeing Shadows into play in your threat area. Forced - After you fail a skill test while at a location with a concealed mini-card: Take 1 horror. [action][action]: Discard Seeing Shadows.

tsk/tskc.name: Figures in the Dark
tsk/tskc.text: Peril. Revelation - If there are no enemies in the shadows, Figures in the Dark gains surge. Otherwise, you must decide (choose one): - Each enemy in the shadows attacks you. - Each investigator loses an action.

tsk/tskc.flavor: "You know what to do."
tsk/tskc.name: Coterie Enforcer (A)
tsk/tskc.text: Concealed 1. Forced - After you expose an enemy in the shadows not named Coterie Enforcer, if Coterie Enforcer is in the shadows: It attacks you.

tsk/tskc.flavor: "You know what to do."
tsk/tskc.name: Coterie Enforcer (B)
tsk/tskc.text: Concealed 1. Forced - After you expose an enemy in the shadows not named Coterie Enforcer, if Coterie Enforcer is in the shadows: It attacks you.

tsk/tskc.flavor: By any means necessary.
tsk/tskc.name: Coterie Assassin (A)
tsk/tskc.text: Concealed 1. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Coterie Assassin is in the shadows: It attacks each investigator at each location with 1 or more concealed mini-cards.

tsk/tskc.flavor: By any means necessary.
tsk/tskc.name: Coterie Assassin (B)
tsk/tskc.text: Concealed 1. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Coterie Assassin is in the shadows: It attacks each investigator at each location with 1 or more concealed mini-cards.

tsk/tskc.name: Swift Retreat
tsk/tskc.text: Revelation - If there are no [[Coterie]] enemies in play, Swift Retreat gains surge. Otherwise, find the nearest [[Coterie]] enemy and test [agility] (3). If you fail, that enemy attacks you. If you fail and that enemy is not in the shadows, resolve its concealed keyword (if able).

tsk/tskc.name: Bound in Red
tsk/tskc.text: Revelation - If there are no [[Coterie]] enemies in play, Bound in Red gains surge. Otherwise, attach it to the [[Coterie]] enemy with the highest printed health. Attached enemy gets +1 fight, +1 evade, +1 damage, and +1 horror. [action]: Flip a [[Stable]] key you control to its [[Unstable]] side. Then, discard Bound in Red. An investigator at any location may trigger this ability.

tsk/tskc.flavor:
My vision blurred as they manipulated the tool with some daemonic purpose...
- Virgil Gray, "In the Court of the Outsiders"
tsk/tskc.name: Key Charge
tsk/tskc.text: Surge. Revelation - Each [[Coterie]] enemy shifts each key attached to it.

tsk/tskc.flavor: File #AT-1S1 / Subject appears as hyperphysical distortion devoid of mass. Capable of "hollowing" contacted matter (see file #AV-245). Containment impossible.
tsk/tskc.name: Paracausal Entity
tsk/tskc.text: Hunter. Forced - When Paracausal Entity engages you: Look at the top card of your deck. If it is not a weakness, set it aside, out of play, as a hollow.

tsk/tskc.name: Apocalyptic Presage
tsk/tskc.text: Forced - When Apocalyptic Presage enters play: Each investigator chooses a non-weakness card they control in their hand or play area and sets it aside, out of play, as a hollow. [reaction] When Apocalyptic Presage is defeated: Instead of adding it to the victory display, discard it and choose up to 3 set-aside hollows. Add them to their owners' hands.

tsk/tskc.flavor: File #AV-245, supplemental / No energy conversion observed. What happens to hollowed matter?
tsk/tskc.name: Substance Dissimulation
tsk/tskc.text: Revelation - For each set-aside hollow you own, if there are 1 or more copies of that hollow in your play area and/ or hand, discard those copies and take 1 damage and 1 horror. If no cards are discarded by this effect, choose a non-weakness card you control in your hand or play area and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow.

tsk/tskc.flavor: File #AV-261, supplemental / Subject appears to have returned to normal state of matter.
tsk/tskc.name: Otherworldly Mimic
tsk/tskc.text: Aloof. Hunter. Forced - If Otherworldly Mimic is ready, when an investigator at its location plays, commits, or triggers an ability on a copy of a set-aside hollow: It attacks that investigator.

tsk/tskc.name: Memory Variant
tsk/tskc.text: Revelation - Put Memory Variant into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - After an event is played: Instead of discarding it, set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. [action]: Test [willpower] (4). If you succeed, discard Memory Variant. Any investigator may trigger this ability.

tsk/tskc.name: Secrets Lost
tsk/tskc.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. If you succeed by 2 or more, you may take 1 horror to choose a set-aside hollow and add it to its owner's hand.

tsk/tskc.name: Paradigm Effacer
tsk/tskc.text: Aloof. Hunter. Forced - After you end your turn at Paradigm Effacer's location: Look at the top card of your deck. If it is not a weakness, set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. Then, if you own 3 or more set-aside hollows, Paradigm Effacer attacks you.

tsk/tskc.name: Matter Inversion
tsk/tskc.text: Revelation - Attach to an [[Outsider]] enemy without a copy of Matter Inversion attached. If you cannot, Matter Inversion gains surge. Attached enemy loses aloof, gains retaliate, and gets +1 fight and +1 evade. Forced - After attached enemy is successfully evaded: Discard Matter Inversion and draw 1 of your set-aside hollows.

tsk/tskc.name: Emissary from Yuggoth
tsk/tskc.text: Concealed 2. Hunter. Massive. Forced - After you discover a clue at a location with 1 or more concealed mini-cards, if Emissary from Yuggoth is in the shadows: It attacks you.

tsk/tskc.name: Tenebrous Eclipse
tsk/tskc.text: Revelation - Put Tenebrous Eclipse into play next to the agenda deck. No more than 1 concealed mini-card can be exposed by each investigator each round. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard 1 copy of Tenebrous Eclipse from play. (Max once per round.)

tsk/tskc.name: Splintered Space
tsk/tskc.text: Revelation - Attach Splintered Space to your location and test [agility] (3). If you fail, take 1 damage for each [[Hex]] treachery attached to your location. After this test ends, if there are exactly 3 copies of Splintered Space in play, discard them.

tsk/tskc.name: Beyond the Pale
tsk/tskc.text: Revelation - Attach Beyond the Pale to your location and test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take 1 horror for each [[Hex]] treachery attached to your location. After this test ends, if there are exactly 3 copies of Beyond the Pale in play, discard them.

tsk/tskc.name: Warped Reality
tsk/tskc.text: Revelation - Attach to your location. Forced - After you end your turn at attached location: Choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. [action][action]: Discard Warped Reality.

tsk/tskc.flavor:
I felt a curious humming from deep within, as though I were being called elsewhere.
- Virgil Gray, "In the Court of the Outsiders"
tsk/tskc.name: Touch of the Beyond
tsk/tskc.text: Revelation - Place 1 doom on the asset you control with the highest printed resource cost. If no doom was placed by this effect, Touch of the Beyond gains surge.

tsk/tskc.name: Compulsion
tsk/tskc.text: Revelation - Put Compulsion into play in your threat area. Forced - When your turn begins: Reveal a random chaos token from the chaos bag. If it is a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing] token, the first action you perform during this turn must be the below ability, if able. [action][action]: Discard Compulsion.

tsk/tskc.name: Distorted Reasoning
tsk/tskc.text: Revelation - Put Distorted Reasoning into play in your threat area. You cannot perform the same type of action twice in a row. (Types include activate, engage, evade, fight, investigate, move, play, resource, and draw.) Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Distorted Reasoning.

tsk/tskc.back_text: Concealed 1. Forced - When you expose this location: - If it is in the left position in the shadows, take 1 damage. - If it is on the right position in the shadows, take 1 horror.
tsk/tskc.name: Rambling Route
tsk/tskc.text: Increase the difficulty to fight or evade each concealed mini-card at Rambling Route by 2. [action] Spend X resources: Choose a concealed mini-card adjacent to a location X connections away. Look at its revealed side (without exposing it). (Group limit once per game.)

tsk/tskc.back_text: Concealed 1. Forced - When you expose this location: - If it is in the left position in the shadows, lose 2 resources. - If it is in the middle position in the shadows, lose 1 action.

tsk/tskc.text: Increase the difficulty to fight or evade each concealed mini-card at Rambling Route by 2. [action] Spend X resources: Choose a concealed mini-card adjacent to a location X connections away. Look at its revealed side (without exposing it). (Group limit once per game.)

tsk/tskc.name: Rambling Route
tsk/tskc.text: Increase the difficulty to fight or evade each concealed mini-card at Rambling Route by 2. [action] Spend X resources: Choose a concealed mini-card adjacent to a location X connections away. Look at its revealed side (without exposing it). (Group limit once per game.)

tsk/tskc.back_text: Concealed 1. Forced - When you expose this location: - If it is in the left position in the shadows, take 1 damage. - If it is on the right position in the shadows, take 1 horror.

tsk/tskc.back_text: Concealed 1. Forced - When you expose this location: - If it is in the left position in the shadows, lose 2 resources. - If it is in the middle position in the shadows, lose 1 action.

[action] Take 1 horror: Look at the revealed side of either a location in the shadows, or the top card of the Otherworld deck. (Group limit once per game.)

tsk/tskc.back_text: Concealed 1. Forced - When you expose this location: - If it is in the left position in the shadows, lose 2 resources. - If it is in the middle position in the shadows, lose 1 action.

[fast] If there are no clues on Weald of Effigies: Either swap the positions of 2 concealed mini-cards adjacent to locations, or swap the positions of 2 locations in the shadows. (Group limit once per game.)

tsk/tskc.back_text: Concealed 1. Forced - When you expose this location: - If it is in the middle position in the shadows, choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. - If it is in the right position in the shadows, set an asset you control aside, out of play, as a hollow.
tsk/tskc.name: Weald of Effigies
tsk/tskc.text: Forced - After you reveal Weald of Effigies: Look at the top card of your deck. If it is not a weakness, set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. [fast] If there are no clues on Weald of Effigies: Either swap the positions of 2 concealed mini-cards adjacent to locations, or swap the positions of 2 locations in the shadows. (Group limit once per game.)

tsk/tskc.back_text: Concealed 1. Forced - When you expose this location: - If it is in the left position in the shadows, take 1 damage. - If it is in the middle position in the shadows, choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. - If it is on the right position in the shadows, take 1 horror.
tsk/tskc.name: Cliffs of Insanity
tsk/tskc.text: Forced - After you reveal Cliffs of Insanity: Move each concealed mini-card adjacent to it so they are arranged as evenly as possible in empty spots adjacent to locations not named Cliffs of Insanity.

tsk/tskc.name: Paradimensional Terror
tsk/tskc.text: Peril. Revelation - You must decide (choose one): - Flip each decoy over. Shuffle all concealed mini-cards in play, then place them facedown at random in the positions they were in. - Each investigator takes 1 damage and 1 horror.

tsk/tskc.flavor: "So vou--remember. The final-err."
tsk/tskc.name: The Red-Gloved Man
tsk/tskc.text: Retaliate. Forced - After you flip a key from its [[Unstable]] side to its [[Stable]] side: The Red-Gloved Man attacks you. Then, the Red-Gloved Man shifts each of his attached keys.

tsk/tskc.name: La Chica Roja
tsk/tskc.text: Aloof. Spawn - Location farthest from you. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if La Chica Roja is unengaged: Move 1 resource from each investigator to her. She shifts each of her attached keys. [reaction] After La Chica Roja is defeated: Distribute her resources among the investigators, as you wish.

tsk/tskc.flavor: "I have a hypothesis. Would you care to let me test it with you?"
tsk/tskc.name: The Sanguine Watcher
tsk/tskc.subname: He Sees What Is Not There
tsk/tskc.text: Hunter. Forced - When you defeat The Sanguine Watcher: He shifts each of his attached keys twice.

tsk/tskc.name: The Beast in a Cowl of Crimson
tsk/tskc.text: Hunter. Spawn - Location farthest from you. Forced - After you fail a skill test while at The Beast in a Cowl of Crimson's location, if it is ready: It shifts each of its attached keys.

tsk/tskc.flavor: "Dispose of these irrelevant rats!"
tsk/tskc.name: The Claret Knight
tsk/tskc.text: Spawn - Location farthest from you. Each other [[Coterie]] enemy gets +2 fight. Forced - After another [[Coterie]] enemy is discarded from play: The Claret Knight shifts each of his attached keys.

tsk/tskc.name: Thorne
tsk/tskc.text: Hunter. Forced - After Thorne enters play: They shift each of their attached keys. [fast] Choose a key attached to your investigator and remove it from the game: Add Thorne to the victory display. Thorne is now the bearer of the chosen key. (Update the Campaign Log.)

tsk/tskc.flavor: "I look out for my own."
tsk/tskc.name: Desiderio Delgado Álvarez
tsk/tskc.text: Patrol (nearest location with at least one other [[Coterie]] enemy). Forced - When another [[Coterie]] enemy at Desiderio Delgado Álvarez's location would take 1 or more damage: Deal that damage to him, instead. Then, he shifts each of his attached keys.

tsk/tskc.flavor: "You won't be coming back."
tsk/tskc.name: Amaranth
tsk/tskc.text: Hunter. Forced - When Amaranth attacks: She shifts each of her attached keys. If damage and/ or horror from this attack is assigned to an asset, defeat that asset.

tsk/tskc.flavor: "Shhh... soon, my shade, soon."
tsk/tskc.name: Tzu San Niang
tsk/tskc.text: Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - When you succeed at a skill test by 2 or more while fighting or attempting to evade Tzu San Niang: She shifts each of her attached keys.

tsk/tskc.name: Aliki Zoni Uperetria
tsk/tskc.text: Aloof. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Each investigator looks at the top card of their deck. Set each non-weakness card looked at in this way aside, out of play, as a hollow. If there is already a copy of that card set aside as a hollow, Aliki Zoni Uperetria shifts each of her attached keys.

tsk/tskc.flavor: If you know both yourself and your enemy, you can win a hundred battles without a single loss. - Sun Tzu
tsk/tskc.name: Inspector Flint
tsk/tskc.text: [reaction] When you expose a decoy, exhaust Inspector Flint: Cancel the exposing of that decoy, flip it facedown and either draw 1 card or choose a different concealed mini-card at that location to expose.

tsk/tskc.flavor: "The truth is out there."
tsk/tskc.name: Agent Ari Quinn
tsk/tskc.text:
While there is a concealed mini-card at your location, you get +1 [intellect], +1 [combat], and +1 [agility].
[reaction] After you expose a card in the shadows, exhaust Agent Ari Quinn: Draw 1 card.

tsk/tskc.name: Dr. Dewi Irawan
tsk/tskc.text:
You get +1 [willpower].
[fast] Exhaust Dr. Dewi Irawan: Either reveal a card from your hand to shuffle each copy of that card that is set-aside as a hollow into its owner's deck, or discard a card from your hand to shuffle any set-aside hollow into its owner's deck. In either case, gain 1 resource for each card shuffled in this way.

tsk/tskc.name: Expedited Ticket
tsk/tskc.text: Permanent. While embarking to a new destination on the map, you may exile Expedited Ticket and mark 1 time in your Campaign Log to travel anywhere on the map.

tsk/tskc.flavor: This dossier, while filled with important findings, isn't related to your situation in the slightest. You should probably drop it off at the sanctum Taylor indicated at your earliest convenience.
tsk/tskc.name: Foundation Intel
tsk/tskc.text: Foundation Intel cannot leave your hand.

tsk/tskc.name: Paradimensional Understanding
tsk/tskc.text: Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Immediately shift an [[Unstable]] key you control. - Flip each [[Stable]] key you control to its [[Unstable]] side.

tsk/tskc.flavor: File #52-U13 / Subject Class: Red / Subject is glasslike shard 26 cm in length and less than 3 mm at thinnest edge, sharp enough to cut through any known material.
tsk/tskc.name: The Mirroring Blade
tsk/tskc.text: Shift - Deal 2 damage to an enemy at your location, or 1 damage to all enemies at your location. Flip this key to its [[Unstable]] side.

tsk/tskc.flavor: ...different for each individual who perceives reflection. No known explanation for this discrepancy.
tsk/tskc.name: The Mirroring Blade
tsk/tskc.text: Shift - Each investigator takes 1 direct damage. Then, if an investigator shifted this key, flip it to its [[Stable]] side.

tsk/tskc.flavor: File #54-W14 / Subject Class: Green / Subject appears to be mechanical apparatus of unknown design. Engineering purpose eludes any known school of science.
tsk/tskc.name: The Bale Engine
tsk/tskc.text: Shift - Add 1 ammo, charge, secret, supply, or evidence to an asset controlled by an investigator at your location. Fliip this key to its [[Unstable]] side.

tsk/tskc.flavor: ...currently does not recommend activation of device, without understanding of indirect consequences.
tsk/tskc.name: The Bale Engine
tsk/tskc.text: Shift - Each investigator loses 3 resources. Then, if an investigator shifted this key, flip it to its [[Stable]] side.

tsk/tskc.flavor: File #45-P15 / Subject Class: Yellow / Subject appears as small bell made of black metallic substance. Despite lack of clapper, subject resounds with paradimensional acoustics when disturbed.
tsk/tskc.name: The Ruinous Chime
tsk/tskc.text: Shift - Automatically evade all enemies at your location. Flip this card to its [[Unstable]] side.

tsk/tskc.flavor: ...unclear what parameters establish capability to hear or endure subject frequency. Use with caution.
tsk/tskc.name: The Ruinous Chime
tsk/tskc.text: Shift - Each investigator takes 1 direct horror. Then, if an investigator shifted this key, flip it to its [[Stable]] side.

tsk/tskp.back_flavor: Carson Sinclair has served three generations of the Webb family in Arkham. Always proper, Carson watched with disapproval as his most recent employer, Hercule Webb, began bringing bizarre artifacts and profane tomes into the house, aided in these endeavors by Webb's business manager, Dupuis. When Mr. Webb was swallowed by a dimensional rift, no one believed Carson's description of the harrowing event. Carson has devoted himself to proving Dupuis's guilt, and to restoring the children as the rightful heirs to the Webb fortune.
tsk/tskp.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Secondary Class Choice: At deck creation, choose Seeker ([seeker]), Mystic ([mystic]), or Survivor ([survivor]). Deckbuilding Options: Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 10 level 0-1 events and/or skills of your chosen secondary class. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): 2 copies of "As you wish", Selfless to a Fault, 1 random basic weakness.
tsk/tskp.name: Carson Sinclair
tsk/tskp.text:
You may take an additional action during your turn, which can only be used on the below [action] ability.
[action]: Choose another investigator at your location. They immediately take an action as if it were their turn. (Limit once per round for each investigator.)
[elder_sign] effect: +0. Draw 1 card. You may resolve this effect anytime another investigator at your location resolves their [elder_sign] effect.

tsk/tskp.name: "As you wish"
tsk/tskp.text:
Carson Sinclair deck only.
Commit only to a skill test being performed by another investigator.
If this test succeeds, the performing investigator draws 1 card. If this test fails, you draw 1 card.

tsk/tskp.name: Selfless to a Fault
tsk/tskp.text: Revelation - Put Selfless to a Fault into play in your threat area. Forced - At the end of your turn, if you did not commit at least 1 card to a skill test performed by another investigator this turn: Take 1 horror and shuffle Selfless to a Fault into your deck.

tsk/tskp.back_flavor: After the third or fourth mutilated body showed up during his time at St. Mary’s Hospital in Arkham, Vincent Lee began to suspect that these were not mere wild animal attacks. When a young man died screaming in his sleep from a burst heart, Vincent knew for a fact that dark times were ahead. Taking a leave of absence from his position at the hospital, he has set out to ease the suffering of those afflicted by the spreading chaos, hoping that the trail of bodies will lead him to the answers he craves.
tsk/tskp.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5, cards that "heal damage" level 0-5, up to 15 other Guardian and/or Survivor cards level 0-1 ([guardian] and/or [survivor]). Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Bonesaw, 1 [per_investigator] copies of On the Mend, Wounded Bystander, 1 random basic weakness. Additional Setup: You begin each game with 1 [per_investigator] copies of On the Mend set aside, out of play.

deck_options.error: You cannot have more than 15 level 0-1 Guardian and/or Survivor cards

tsk/tskp.flavor: "I will find the answers, even if it kills me."
tsk/tskp.name: Vincent Lee
tsk/tskp.text:
[reaction] After one of your card effects heals damage from an investigator or an investigator's [[Ally]] asset: Add one of your set-aside On the Mend skills to that investigator's hand.
[elder_sign] effect: +1. You may heal 1 damage from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset at your location.

tsk/tskp.name: Bonesaw
tsk/tskp.text: Vincent Lee deck only. [action]: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack. If this attack is successful, you may take 1 damage to deal +1 damage for this attack. [action]: Heal 5 damage from an investigator at your location. Test [intellect] (4). If you fail, that investigator suffers 1 physical trauma. (Max once per game.)

tsk/tskp.name: On the Mend
tsk/tskp.text: Limit 1 On the Mend in your hand. Commit only to a test you are performing. Forced - When On the Mend would be discarded from anywhere: Set it aside, out of play, instead.

tsk/tskp.name: Wounded Bystander
tsk/tskp.text: Revelation - Put Wounded Bystander into play in your play area with 3 damage on it. It cannot leave play while it has damage (unless it is defeated). If it has no damage, discard it. Forced - When you take non-direct damage: At least 1 of it must be assigned to Wounded Bystander, if able. Forced - If Wounded Bystander is defeated: You suffer 1 mental trauma.

tsk/tskp.back_flavor: When the Taíno artifacts went missing from the Miskatonic Museum, Kymani was hired to assess the museum's liability. Of course, Kymani already knew who the thief was - it has been their own heist, all along. But Kymani had no interest in selling the relics. As far as Kymani was concerned, they weren't the one who really stole them. No; Kymani had sent the historical artifacts back home, where they truly belonged. The museum and the insurance company see only a villain to catch, but Kymani is faster, smarter, and better.
tsk/tskp.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-5, [[Tool]] cards level 0-4, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Grappling Hook, Agent Fletcher, 1 random basic weakness. Bonus Experience: You begin the campaign with 5 additional experience (does not affect the number of weaknesses you must take in Standalone Mode).
tsk/tskp.flavor: "This doesn't belong to you."
tsk/tskp.name: Kymani Jones
tsk/tskp.text:
[fast]: Engage an exhausted enemy at your location.
[reaction] When you attempt to evade an exhausted non-[[Elite]] enemy: Add your [intellect] to your skill value for this attempt. If you succeed by at least X, discard that enemy. X is that enemy's remaining health.
[elder_sign] effect: +1. If there is an exhausted enemy at your location, you automatically succeed instead.

tsk/tskp.name: Grappling Hook
tsk/tskp.text:
Kymani Jones deck only.
Actions performed using Grappling Hook do not provoke attacks of opportunity.
[action][action] Exhaust Grappling Hook: Take up to 3 different basic actions from the following list, in any order (engage, evade, investigate, or move). If you investigate, use your [agility] instead of your [intellect].

tsk/tskp.flavor: "I know who you really are, Jones."
tsk/tskp.name: Agent Fletcher
tsk/tskp.text: Alert. Hunter. Prey - Kymani Jones only. While Kymani Jones is evading Agent Fletcher, reduce their [intellect] value to 0.

tsk/tskp.back_flavor: A refugee from French-occupied Algeria, Amina arrived in Arkham with nothing more than she could carry. Six years later, Amina's sharp mind and technical skill placed her at the switchboard for the Miskatonic Valley Telephone Company. Soon after, she began to catch snippets of something strange while at work - distorted words in an unrecognizable language, out-of-place noises, calls that connected to nowhere at all and dropped almost immediately. As the phantom calls grew in frequency, Amina sought answers. She found the right extension, connected to the line, and listened in. Despite not understanding a word of the alien language on the other side, she could tell the eldritch words held real power.
tsk/tskp.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, [[Charm]] cards level 0-4. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Word of Woe, Word of Weal, Deafening Silence, 1 random basic weakness.
tsk/tskp.flavor: "What is it trying to tell me?"
tsk/tskp.name: Amina Zidane
tsk/tskp.text:
[reaction] When you play an asset: Reduce its resource cost by 3. It enters play with 1 doom on it. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +2. You may move all doom from a card at your location to another card at your location.

tsk/tskp.name: Word of Woe
tsk/tskp.text: Amina Zidane deck only. Fast. Play only during your turn. Place 1 doom on an asset you control to resolve an [action] ability on it, ignoring all costs (including its [action] cost). Then, if Word of Weal is in your discard pile, you may shuffle it into your deck.

tsk/tskp.name: Word of Weal
tsk/tskp.text:
Amina Zidane deck only.
Fast. Play when you perform a skill test on an asset with 1 or more doom on it.
Add your [willpower] to your skill value for this test. Then, if Word of Woe is in your discard pile, you may shuffle it into your deck.

tsk/tskp.flavor: "UNINTELLIGIBLE SQUIGGLES"
tsk/tskp.name: Deafening Silence
tsk/tskp.text: Revelation - Move 1 doom from an asset you control to the current agenda. This may cause the current agenda to advance. If no doom is moved in this way, shuffle Deafening Silence back into your deck.

tsk/tskp.back_flavor: Even while growing up in Arkham, Darrell always knew that there was something not quite right about the strange little town. After graduating from high school, he went to work for the Arkham Advertiser as a photographer, and in the years since, he's scoured every inch of the city. But on one fateful night, he saw something truly indescribable - a horror that shook his world to the core. His editor says he was just seeing things, but he knows the truth. With his trusty camera in tow, he will not rest until he has captured photographic evidence of the horrors that dwell in the shadows of his hometown and beyond. Just one good shot is all he needs.
tsk/tskp.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-5, Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-2, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Darrell's Kodak, Ruined Film, 1 random basic weakness.
tsk/tskp.flavor: "The truth is darker than any of us know."
tsk/tskp.name: Darrell Simmons
tsk/tskp.text:
You begin the game with Darrell's Kodak in play.
[fast] During a skill test at your location, spend 1 evidence from an asset you control: Reduce the difficulty of this test by 2. (Limit once per test.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1. Place 1 evidence on an asset you control.

tsk/tskp.name: Darrell's Kodak
tsk/tskp.text: Darrell Simmons deck only. [reaction] After an enemy or treachery enters play, exhaust Darrell's Kodak: Place 1 resource (from the token pool) on that enemy or treachery, as evidence. [reaction] After you discover any number of clues: Move that many evidence on enemies or treacheries at that location (or not at any location) to Darrell's Kodak.

tsk/tskp.flavor: Irrefutable proof, reduced to nothing by the light of day.
tsk/tskp.name: Ruined Film
tsk/tskp.text: Revelation - Remove 4 evidence from cards you control. For each evidence you cannot remove in this way, take 1 horror.

tsk/tskp.back_flavor: Charlie Kane promised the people of Arkham a safer future. He made a lot of promises - lower taxes, better schools, less crime. It was part of the job, after all. And although he sometimes had to do things he wasn't proud of, Charlie always did work for the greater good. So when he started hearing the reports, he put the people first. Of course, he couldn't tell anyone. Widespread panic would not serve the public good. Besides, who'd believe him? Still, Charlie has always had connections in town. So he made a few calls, put a task force together, and went to work.
tsk/tskp.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Class Choices: At deck creation, choose 2 classes ([guardian], [seeker], [rogue], [mystic], or [survivor]). Deckbuilding Options: [[Ally]] cards level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, cards from your chosen classes level 0-2. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Bonnie Walsh, Burden of Leadership, 1 random basic weakness.
tsk/tskp.flavor: "It can be arranged. It's just a matter of acceptable terms."
tsk/tskp.name: Charlie Kane
tsk/tskp.text:
You have 3 additional ally slots.
[fast] During a skill test you are performing, exhaust an [[Ally]] asset you control: For this test, you get +1 skill value, plus an additional +1 for each skill icon that [[Ally]] asset has that matches this test's type.
[elder_sign] effect: +3. Ready an [[Ally]] asset at your location.

tsk/tskp.flavor: "Don't forget you have a 9 p.m. appointment with Mr. Sanford. Shall I book your usual table at La Bella Luna? Also, you bought me a wristwatch for my birthday. Thank you very much."
tsk/tskp.name: Bonnie Walsh
tsk/tskp.text:
Charlie Kane deck only.
[reaction] After you exhaust Bonnie Walsh: Ready another [[Ally]] asset you control. (Limit once per round.)

tsk/tskp.flavor: "I tell myself it was for the greater good. Was it, Bonnie?"
tsk/tskp.name: Burden of Leadership
tsk/tskp.text: Revelation - If you control no [[Ally]] assets, shuffle Burden of Leadership back into your deck. Otherwise, for each [[Ally]] asset you control, you must either exhaust it or deal it 1 direct damage and 1 direct horror.

tsk/tskp.customization_change:
Item. Armor. Relic.
Hunter's Armor may be assigned damage and/or horror dealt to other investigators at your location.


Playing Hunter's Armor does not provoke attacks of opportunity.
After 1 or more damage or horror is assigned to Hunter's Armor from a treachery effect, you may exhaust it to draw 1 card.
After 1 or more damage or horror is assigned to Hunter's Armor from an enemy attack, you may exhaust it to deal 1 damage to that enemy.
tsk/tskp.customization_text: □ Enchanted. Hunter's Armor gains the [[Relic]] trait and takes up an arcane slot instead of a body slot. □□ Protective Runes. Hunter's Armor may be assigned damage and/or horror dealt to other investigators at your location. □□ Durable. Hunter's Armor gains +2 health. □□ Hallowed. Hunter's Armor gains +2 sanity. □□ Lightweight. Hunter's Armor gets -1 cost and playing it does not provoke attacks of opportunity. □□□ Hexdrinker. After 1 or more damage or horror is assigned to Hunter's Armor from a treachery effect, you may exhaust it to draw 1 card. □□□ Armor of Thorns. After 1 or more damage or horror is assigned to Hunter's Armor from an enemy attack, you may exhaust it to deal 1 damage to that enemy.
tsk/tskp.flavor: You cobbled this suit together yourself from the remnants of ancient armor, mixed with more modern "bulletproof" plating used in the Great War. It's not much, yet. But with some improvements, maybe it'll be enough.
tsk/tskp.name: Hunter's Armor
tsk/tskp.text: Customizable.

customization_options.real_text: - Glory - If this attack defeats an enemy, choose one: draw 1 card, heal 1 damage, or heal 1 horror.

tsk/tskp.customization_change: Item. Weapon. Melee. Relic. - Glory - If this attack defeats an enemy, choose one: draw 1 card, heal 1 damage, or heal 1 horror. - Elders - If this attack succeeds by an amount equal to or greater than your location's shroud, discover 1 clue at your location. - Hunt - Immediately move to a connecting location or engage an enemy at your location. - Fury - If this attack is successful, in addition to its standard damage, deal 1 damage to each other enemy engaged with you. You may imbue the same inscription up to three times. Customizable. Uses (4 charges). Replenish 2 of these charges at the start of each round. [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. Before this attack, you may spend any number of charges to imbue the axe with twice as many different inscriptions -
tsk/tskp.customization_text: □ Heirloom. This asset gets -1 cost and gains the [[Relic]] trait. □ Inscription of Glory. Add this inscription: "- Glory - If this attack defeats an enemy, choose one: draw 1 card, heal 1 damage, or heal 1 horror." □ Inscription of the Elders. Add this inscription: "- Elders - If this attack succeeds by an amount equal to or greater than your location's shroud, discover 1 clue at your location." □ Inscription of the Hunt. Add this inscription: "- Hunt - Immediately move to a connecting location or engage an enemy at your location." □ Inscription of Fury. Add this inscription: "- Fury - If this attack is successful, in addition to its standard damage, deal 1 damage to each other enemy engaged with you." □□□ Ancient Power. You may imbue the same inscription up to three times. □□□ Saga. Replenish 2 of Runic Axe's charges at the start of each round, instead of only 1. □□□□ Scriptweaver. For every charge spent, you may imbue the axe with up to two different inscriptions.
tsk/tskp.name: Runic Axe
tsk/tskp.text: Customizable. Uses (4 charges). Replenish 1 of these charges at the start of each round. [action]: Fight. You get +1 [combat] for this attack. Before this attack, you may spend any number of charges to imbue the axe with that many different inscriptions - - Accuracy - You get an additional +2 [combat] for this attack. - Power - This attack deals +1 damage.

tsk/tskp.customization_change:
If you perform an attack with attached asset against an enemy engaged with another investigator and fail, you deal no damage.
You get +2 [combat] while attacking with attached asset.
After you attach an [[Upgrade]] card other than Custom Modifications to attached asset, draw 1 card.
Fast. Play only during your turn.
After ammo is spent from or placed on attached asset by another event, place 1 ammo on attached asset.
If you succeed by 3 or more while attacking with attached asset, this attack deals +1 damage.
tsk/tskp.customization_text: □ Notched Sight. If you perform an attack with attached asset against an enemy engaged with another investigator and fail, you deal no damage. □□ Extended Stock. You get +2 [combat] while attacking with attached asset. □□ Counterbalance. After you attach an [[Upgrade]] card other than Custom Modifications to attached asset, draw 1 card. □□□ Leather Grip. Custom Modifications gets -1 cost and gains: "Fast. Play only during your turn." □□□ Extended Magazine. After ammo is spent from or placed on attached asset by another event, place 1 ammo on attached asset. □□□□ Quicksilver Bullets. If you succeed by 3 or more while attacking with attached asset, this attack deals +1 damage.
tsk/tskp.flavor: It's like an old friend in your grip.
tsk/tskp.name: Custom Modifications
tsk/tskp.text:
Customizable.
Attach to a [[Firearm]] asset you control. Limit 1 per asset.
[reaction] When you reveal a non-[auto_fail] chaos token attacking with attached asset, exhaust Custom Modifications: Cancel that chaos token, return it to the chaos bag, and reveal a new one.

tsk/tskp.flavor: You're not about to question why it works. All you know is that you're never taking it off again.
tsk/tskp.name: Obsidian Bracelet
tsk/tskp.text:
Obsidian Bracelet may only be assigned damage and/or horror dealt by treachery effects.
Obsidian Bracelet may be assigned damage and/or horror dealt to other investigators at your location.

tsk/tskp.name: Bolas
tsk/tskp.text: Evade. Attempt to evade using [combat] instead of [agility]. If you succeed and the enemy is non-[[Elite]], attach Bolas to it. Attached enemy gets -1 evade value. Forced. - After attached enemy moves: Exhaust it.

tsk/tskp.flavor: "Let's see those hands!"
tsk/tskp.name: Breach the Door
tsk/tskp.text:
Test [combat] (1). If you succeed, attach Breach the Door to your location with 1 resource on it for each point you succeeded by, as leads.
Reduce attached location's shroud by 1 for each lead on Breach the Door.

tsk/tskp.flavor: This is gonna hurt.
tsk/tskp.name: Grievous Wound
tsk/tskp.text: Fast. Play after you successfully attack a non-[[Elite]] enemy using a [[Melee]] asset. Attach Grievous Wound to the attacked enemy. Forced - At the end of the round: Deal 1 damage to attached enemy.

tsk/tskp.flavor:
"Think they bought it?"
"They certainly do not suspect the world is ending, Mr. Kane."
tsk/tskp.name: Motivational Speech
tsk/tskp.text: Parley. Choose an investigator at your location. That investigator may play an [[Ally]] asset from their hand, reducing its cost by 3.

tsk/tskp.name: One in the Chamber
tsk/tskp.text:
Fast. Play at the end of an attack or effect that spends the last ammo from a [[Firearm]] asset you control.
Add 1 ammo to that asset. You get +3 skill value for your next attack with that asset this round.

tsk/tskp.flavor: "Aim and pull the damned trigger. It ain't hard, kid."
tsk/tskp.name: Fighting Lessons
tsk/tskp.text:
Commit only to a skill test during an attack or evasion attempt.
You can commit this skill to an investigator's test at any location.

tsk/tskp.name: Helping Hand
tsk/tskp.text:
You may commit Helping Hand to any type of test. Max 1 committed per test.
While Helping Hand is committed to a skill test, double the skill icons of each other card committed to that test.

tsk/tskp.name: Bestow Resolve
tsk/tskp.text:
Uses (4 charges).
[fast] During a skill test performed by an investigator at your location or a connecting location, spend 1 charge: Commit a non-weakness card from your hand to that skill test, treating all of its skill icons as [wild]

tsk/tskp.flavor: Day 15. The entities appear to be feeding. On what, I cannot imagine. I dare not approach further.
tsk/tskp.name: Field Agent
tsk/tskp.text:
You get +1 [intellect].
[fast] Exhaust Field Agent and deal 1 horror to it: Discover 1 clue at your location.

tsk/tskp.name: Guard Dog
tsk/tskp.text: [fast] Exhaust Guard Dog: Engage an enemy at your location. That enemy attacks you. [reaction] When an enemy attack deals damage and/or horror to Guard Dog: Deal 1 damage to the attacking enemy. Card design by the Council-in-Exile at Arkham Nights 2020.

tsk/tskp.name: Handcuffs
tsk/tskp.text: Fast. [action] If Handcuffs is not attached to an enemy: Evade. Use only on a [[Humanoid]] enemy. This evasion attempt uses [combat] instead of [agility]. If you succeed, remove all doom from the just-evaded enemy and attach Handcuffs to it. If the attached enemy is non-[[Elite]], it cannot ready and doom cannot be placed on it.

tsk/tskp.name: Prepared for the Worst
tsk/tskp.text: Choose an investigator at your location. That investigator search the top 9 cards of their deck for a [[Weapon]] asset, adds it to their hand or plays it (paying its resource cost), and shuffles their deck.

tsk/tskp.name: Martyr's Vambrace
tsk/tskp.text:
You get +1 skill value while resolving revelation abilities on encounter cards.
[reaction] After another investigator at your location draws a non-peril encounter card, before resolving that card's effects, exhaust Martyr's Vambrace: You are considered to have drawn that encounter card, instead.

tsk/tskp.name: Girish Kadakia
tsk/tskp.text:
Girish Kadakia may be assigned damage and/or horror dealt to other investigators at your location.
[fast] During a skill test being performed by an investigator at your location, exhaust Girish Kadakia: That investigator gets +2 skill value for this test. If this test is successful, heal 1 damage or horror from Girish Kadakia.

tsk/tskp.flavor:
He had to give Logan credit:
the man knew how to gear up for Armageddon.
tsk/tskp.name: Ever Vigilant
tsk/tskp.text: One at a time, investigators at your location, as a group, may play up to 4 assets in total from their hands, reducing the resource cost of each by 1.

tsk/tskp.customization_change:
- Heal 2 damage.
- Heal 2 horror.
- Place 1 charge or secret on an asset you control.
- Move up to 2 times.
Customizable. Uses (5 supplies).
When you initiate this skill test, you may increase its difficulty by 2. If you do, increase the value of the effect granted by each option by 1 for this test.
[action] Spend 1 supply: Choose an investigator at your location and test [intellect] (1). If you succeed, that investigator performs one of the following options (2 options instead if you succeed by 2 or more) -
tsk/tskp.customization_text: □ Mending Distillate. Add this option: "- Heal 2 damage." □ Calming Distillate. Add this option: "- Heal 2 horror." □ Enlightening Distillate. Add this option: "- Place 1 charge or secret on an asset you control." □ Quickening Distillate. Add this option: "- Move up to 2 times." □□ Refined. Alchemical Distillation enters play with 2 additional supplies on it. □□□□ Empowered. When you initiate this skill test, you may increase its difficulty by 2. If you do, increase the value of the effect granted by each option by 1 for this test. □□□□□ Perfected. If you succeed by 2 or more, the chosen investigator may perform two different options instead of one.
tsk/tskp.name: Alchemical Distillation
tsk/tskp.text:
Customizable. Uses (3 supplies).
[action] Spend 1 supply: Choose an investigator at your location and test [intellect] (1). If you succeed, that investigator performs one of the following options -
- Draw 2 cards.
- Gain 2 resources.

tsk/tskp.customization_change:
- You run out of cards in your hand.
- You are dealt damage or horror.
- You discard a treachery or enemy from play.
- You enter a location with 3 or more shroud.
When the chosen criteria is met by any investigator at your location, you may exhaust Empirical Hypothesis to add 1 evidence to it. Other investigators at your location may trigger [fast] abilities on Empirical Hypothesis.
[fast] Spend 2 evidence: Reduce the cost of the next card you play this phase by 3.
[fast] Spend 3 evidence: Discover 1 clue at your location.
After you exhaust Empirical Hypothesis, you may resolve its forced effect, choosing a criteria you have not chosen this round. Then, ready it.
tsk/tskp.customization_text: □ Pessimistic Outlook. Add the following criteria: "you run out of cards in your hand." □ Trial and Error. Add the following criteria: "you are dealt damage or horror." □ Independent Variable. Add the following criteria: "you discard a treachery or enemy from play." □ Field Research. Add the following criteria: "you enter a location with 3 or more shroud." □□ Peer Review. The chosen criteria is met if any investigator at your location meets it, instead of only you. Other investigators at your location may trigger [fast] abilities on Empirical Hypothesis. □□ Research Grant. Empirical Hypothesis gains: "[fast] Spend 2 evidence: Reduce the cost of the next card you play by 3." □□□ Irrefutable Proof. Empirical Hypothesis gains: "[fast] Spend 3 evidence: Discover 1 clue at your location." □□□□ Alternative Hypothesis. After you exhaust Empirical Hypothesis, you may resolve its forced effect, choosing a criteria you have not chosen this round. Then, ready it.
tsk/tskp.name: Empirical Hypothesis
tsk/tskp.text: Customizable. Limit 1 per investigator. Forced - At the start of the round: Choose one of the following criteria for this round - You fail a test by 2 or more. - You succeed at a test by 3 or more. When the chosen criteria is met, you may exhaust Empirical Hypothesis to add 1 evidence to it. [fast] Spend 1 evidence: Draw 1 card.

tsk/tskp.customization_change: Named asset: Using attached asset's [action] abilities does not provoke attacks of opportunity. Attached asset does not take up any slots. You get +2 skill value while performing skill tests on attached asset. Additional named assets: [fast] Exhaust The Raven Quill: Move 1 secret or charge from an asset you control to attached asset. After you resolve an [action] ability on attached asset, you may exhaust The Raven Quill to ready another asset you control. Attach to a named asset you control, or you may search your deck, discard pile, and hand for a copy of a named asset and play it (paying its cost). Then, attach The Raven Quill to it.
tsk/tskp.customization_text: Named [[Tome]] or [[Spell]] asset: □ Living Quill. Using attached asset's [action] abilities does not provoke attacks of opportunity. □ Spectral Binding. Attached asset does not take up any slots. □□ Mystic Vane. You get +2 skill value while performing skill tests on attached asset. □□ Endless Inkwell. Name two more [[Tome]] or [[Spell]] assets: □□ Energy Sap. The Raven Quill gains: "[fast] Exhaust The Raven Quill: Move 1 secret or charge from an asset you control to attached asset." □□□ Interwoven Ink. After you resolve an [action] ability on attached asset, you may exhaust The Raven Quill to ready another asset you control. □□□□ Supernatural Record. When you play The Raven Quill, instead of attaching it to a named asset you control, you may search your deck, discard pile, and hand for a copy of a named asset and play it (paying its cost). Then, attach The Raven Quill to it.
tsk/tskp.name: The Raven Quill
tsk/tskp.text:
Customizable. When you purchase The Raven Quill, name a [[Tome]] or [[Spell]] asset and record that name on its upgrade sheet.
Attach to a named asset you control.
[reaction] When you resign or the game ends: Either mark a checkbox on The Raven Quill's upgrade sheet, or reduce the experience cost to upgrade the attached asset before the next scenario by 1.

tsk/tskp.name: Dissection Tools
tsk/tskp.text: [reaction] After an enemy at your location is defeated: Place 1 resource (from the token pool) on this card, as evidence. While Dissection Tools has... - ... 1 or more evidence, you get +1 [agility]. - ... 2 or more evidence, you get +1 [combat]. - ... 3 or more evidence, you get +1 sanity.

tsk/tskp.flavor: What follows is a true account. Would that it were not so.
tsk/tskp.name: Grim Memoir
tsk/tskp.text: Uses (4 secrets). [action] Spend 1 secret: Investigate. You get +2 [intellect] for this investigation. If you succeed by 2 or more, you may draw 1 card.

tsk/tskp.name: Research Notes
tsk/tskp.text:
[reaction] After a player card ability places 1 or more of your clues on your location: Place that many resources on Research Notes, as evidence.
[action]: Test [intellect] (0). For each point you succeed by, you may spend 1 evidence to discover 1 clue at your location.

tsk/tskp.flavor: Unconventional ailments require unconventional treatments.
tsk/tskp.name: Bizarre Diagnosis
tsk/tskp.text: Place 1 of your clues on your location. Then, heal 3 damage from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset at your location.

tsk/tskp.flavor:
"Don't you realize what this means?"
"Why don't you calm down and tell me very slowly?"
tsk/tskp.name: Captivating Discovery
tsk/tskp.text: Search the top 6 cards of your deck. You may place up to 3 of your clues on your location. For each clue placed in this way, choose and add 2 of the searched cards to your hand. Shuffle your deck.

tsk/tskp.name: Map the Area
tsk/tskp.text: Investigate. Add your [willpower] or [agility] to your skill value for this investigation. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues at this location, attach Map the Area to it. Limit 1 per location. Reduce the difficulty of all skill tests at attached location by 1.

tsk/tskp.name: Analysis
tsk/tskp.text: After revealing a chaos token for this skill test, you may place 1 of your clues on your location to cancel that chaos token, return it to the chaos bag, and reveal a new one. (You may do this any number of times.)

tsk/tskp.flavor: It makes you feel like you know what you're doing, even when you're in way over your head.
tsk/tskp.name: Lab Coat
tsk/tskp.text: [reaction] When you would fail a skill test on a [seeker] card by 1 or less, exhaust Lab Coat: You succeed by 0, instead.

tsk/tskp.name: Orphic Theory
tsk/tskp.text:
Uses (4 secrets).
[fast] Spend 1 secret: Choose any non-weakness treachery not attached to an [[Elite]] enemy. Until the end of the round, treat that card's printed text box as if it were blank (except for [[Traits]]).

tsk/tskp.name: Existential Riddle
tsk/tskp.text: Parley. Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location and test [willpower] or [intellect] (8). This test gets -1 difficulty for each other card in your hand. If you succeed, automatically evade the chosen enemy and attach Existential Riddle to it. Attached enemy gains aloof.

tsk/tskp.name: Guidance
tsk/tskp.text: Choose another investigator at your location who has yet to take their turn this round. During their turn this round, the chosen investigator gets +1 to each of their skills, and may take an additional action. Playing Guidance does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

tsk/tskp.name: Dr. William T. Maleson
tsk/tskp.text: [reaction] When any investigator draws an encounter card from the encounter deck, exhaust Dr. William T. Maleson and place 1 of your clues on your location: That investigator draws another card from the top of the encounter deck, chooses one of those 2 cards to resolve, and cancels and discards the other.

tsk/tskp.flavor: It's amazing how differently everyone treats you while you're wearing one.
tsk/tskp.name: Press Pass
tsk/tskp.text: [reaction] After you spend 1 or more clues or place 1 or more clues on your location, exhaust Press Pass: You may take an additional action during this turn (or your next turn if it is not currently your turn).

tsk/tskp.name: Surgical Kit
tsk/tskp.text:
Uses (4 supplies).
[reaction] When one of your card effects heals damage from an investigator, spend 1 supply: Either that effect heals 1 additional damage, or you draw 1 card and heal 1 horror.
[action] [action]: Heal 3 damage from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset at your location.

tsk/tskp.name: Fingerprint Kit
tsk/tskp.text: Uses (3 supplies). [action] Exhaust Fingerprint Kit and spend 1 supply: Investigate. You get +2 [intellect] for this investigation. If you succeed, you discover 2 additional clues at your location.

tsk/tskp.name: Gray's Anatomy
tsk/tskp.text:
[action]: Choose a card at your location and test [intellect] (1). For each point you succeed by, choose one -
- The next time that card would be healed this round, heal +1 damage/horror (to a maximum of +3).
- The next time that card would be dealt damage this round, deal +1 damage (to a maximum of +3).

tsk/tskp.customization_change:
