tde/tsh_encounter.back_text: Set The Unnamable aside. It keeps all tokens and attachments. Remove each location from the game (or place it in the victory display if it has Victory X and no clues on it). Investigators are not defeated during this process. (Other enemies and attachments at those locations are discarded.) Shuffle the set-aside Mysterious Stairs locations and put 5 of them into play in a vertical line. Remove the remaining Mysterious Stairs location from the game. Place each investigator and the set-aside The Unnamable enemy at the topmost Mysterious Stairs location, revealing it. Search the encounter deck and discard pile for both copies of Locked Door and both copies of Secrets in the Attic, and remove them from the game. Shuffle each set-aside copy of Endless Descent into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile.
tde/tsh_encounter.flavor: You're still not sure exactly what you're meant to find inside the old house, but Randolph insists that you need to locate the "key." Seems like you have no choice but to search the house and see what you can turn up.
tde/tsh_encounter.name: Searching the Unnamable
tde/tsh_encounter.text: Objective - Explore the house to find a way into the Dreamlands. (Find and complete an objective on another scenario card to advance.)

tde/tsh_encounter.back_flavor:
The forlorn cries of the unnamable creature - whatever it is or once was - echo throughout the unnatural cavern from far above you. "It cannot reach us down here," Randolph says, letting out a sigh of relief. It was a harrowing descent, but you are finally safe from the indescribable thing. Even so, your safety is fleeting. The stairway coils below you with no end in sight. Windows in the spire's stone wall overlook an endless landscape of rocky crags and barren peaks, dimly lit by a grey phosphorous light. You are still many miles above the floor of this subterranean world, and who knows what horrors you may find once you arrive?
"This is only the beginning," Randolph warns you. "There is no turning back now. Are you ready to proceed?"
tde/tsh_encounter.flavor: The steps seem to descend forever. Every time you think you're nearing the end, you round another corner and see hundreds more.
tde/tsh_encounter.name: The Endless Stairs
tde/tsh_encounter.text: While the bottommost Mysterious Stairs location is revealed, it gains: "[action]: Resign." Objective - Reach the bottom of the stairs. If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

tde/tsh_encounter.back_flavor:
"Looking toward the giant willow in the centre of the cemetery, whose trunk has nearly engulfed an ancient, illegible slab, I had made a fantastic remark about the spectral and unmentionable nourishment which the colossal roots must be sucking in from that hoary, charnel earth...”
 - H. P. Lovecraft, "The Unnamable"
tde/tsh_encounter.name: Burial Ground
tde/tsh_encounter.text:
Each [[Ghoul]] enemy drawn spawns at Burial Ground instead of at its normal location.
[free] Investigators in the Burial Ground spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Remember that the investigators "noticed the missing bones."

tde/tsh_encounter.back_flavor:
"I'd like to see that house, Carter. Where is it? Glass or no glass, I must explore it a little. And the tomb where you put those bones, and the other grave without an inscription - the whole thing must be a bit terrible.”
 - H. P. Lovecraft, "The Unnamable"
tde/tsh_encounter.name: Entryway
tde/tsh_encounter.text:
[free] Investigators in the Entryway spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Reveal the Upstairs Hallway.
[free] If The Unnamable has 1 [per_investigator] or more damage on it: Smoke trails off of the creature, leading to a tomb near the center of the cemetery outside. Put the set-aside Unmarked Tomb location into play.

tde/tsh_encounter.back_flavor: This doorway was not open before. You only turned for a moment, but you thought you saw something. But what, exactly? A blur? A figure?
tde/tsh_encounter.name: Den
tde/tsh_encounter.text:
[reaction] After you successfully investigate the Den, discard 1 card from your hand: Discover an additional clue at this location.
[free] Investigators in the Den spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Remember that the investigators "studied a desecrated portrait."

tde/tsh_encounter.back_flavor: This doorway was not open before. You only turned for a moment, but you thought you saw something. But what, exactly? A blur? A figure?
tde/tsh_encounter.name: Parlor
tde/tsh_encounter.text:
For each investigator at the Parlor, it gets +1 shroud.
[free] If The Unnamable has 2 [per_investigator] or more damage on it: The mirror gleams unnaturally, revealing a glint of silver. Remember that the investigators "recovered a strange key."

tde/tsh_encounter.back_flavor: "There! I was just trying to track my progress, and you can see it. Those little glints are eyes! They have to be! Something was watching me." - Annie VanderMeer Mitsoda, <u>The Investigators of Arkham Horror</u>
tde/tsh_encounter.back_text: A malodorous presence prevents you from venturing upstairs. You cannot enter the Upstairs Hallway.
tde/tsh_encounter.name: Upstairs Hallway
tde/tsh_encounter.text: [free] Investigators in the Upstairs Hallway spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Put the set-aside Attic location into play.

tde/tsh_encounter.back_flavor: Something scratches at the wood on the other side. Rats? Your imagination? No, something else. Something unnatural.
tde/tsh_encounter.name: Library
tde/tsh_encounter.text:
As an additional cost to investigate the Library, you must either lose 1 action or take 1 horror.
[free] Investigators in the Library spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: You read a strange journal entry regarding one of the graves in the burial ground outside. Put the set-aside Unmarked Tomb location into play.

tde/tsh_encounter.back_flavor: Something scratches at the wood on the other side. Rats? Your imagination? No, something else. Something unnatural.
tde/tsh_encounter.name: Bedroom
tde/tsh_encounter.text:
[action] [action]: Discard all non-weakness treachery cards from your threat area.
[free] Investigators in the Bedroom spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Remember that the investigators "found a cracked mirror."

tde/tsh_encounter.back_flavor:
"They never unlocked that attic door, but left the whole house as it was, dreaded and deserted. When noises came from it, they whispered and shivered; and hoped that the lock on that attic door was strong."
 - H. P. Lovecraft, "The Unnamable"
tde/tsh_encounter.name: Attic
tde/tsh_encounter.text: [free] Investigators in the Attic spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Deep within a pile of monstrous bones, you see a glint of silver. Remember that the investigators "recovered a strange key."

tde/tsh_encounter.back_flavor:
"...from the tomb came such a stifled uproar of gasping and whirring that my fancy peopled the rayless gloom with Miltonic legions of the misshapen damned."
 - H. P. Lovecraft, "The Unnamable"
tde/tsh_encounter.name: Unmarked Tomb
tde/tsh_encounter.text: Objective - At the end of the round, if each undefeated investigator is at Unmarked Tomb and the investigators "recovered a strange key," advance the act.

tde/tsh_encounter.back_flavor:
"So worn and narrow were the steps, and so greasy with the ooze of inner earth, that the climber never quite knew when to expect a breathless fall and hurtling down to the ultimate pits..."
 - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath</u>
tde/tsh_encounter.back_text: Mysterious Stairs is connected to the locations above and below it.
tde/tsh_encounter.name: Mysterious Stairs
tde/tsh_encounter.text: Mysterious Stairs is connected to the locations above and below it. Forced - After you enter this location: Lose 1 action.

tde/tsh_encounter.back_flavor:
"So worn and narrow were the steps, and so greasy with the ooze of inner earth, that the climber never quite knew when to expect a breathless fall and hurtling down to the ultimate pits..."
 - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath</u>
tde/tsh_encounter.back_text: Mysterious Stairs is connected to the locations above and below it.
tde/tsh_encounter.name: Mysterious Stairs
tde/tsh_encounter.text:
Mysterious Stairs is connected to the locations above and below it.
While there are clues on this location, investigators at this location cannot move or resign.

tde/tsh_encounter.back_flavor:
"So worn and narrow were the steps, and so greasy with the ooze of inner earth, that the climber never quite knew when to expect a breathless fall and hurtling down to the ultimate pits..."
 - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath</u>
tde/tsh_encounter.back_text: Mysterious Stairs is connected to the locations above and below it.
tde/tsh_encounter.name: Mysterious Stairs
tde/tsh_encounter.text: Mysterious Stairs is connected to the locations above and below it. While there is a ready enemy at this location, investigators at this location cannot move or resign. Forced - When this location is revealed: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Ghoul]] enemy and spawn it at this location. Shuffle the encounter deck.

tde/tsh_encounter.back_flavor:
"So worn and narrow were the steps, and so greasy with the ooze of inner earth, that the climber never quite knew when to expect a breathless fall and hurtling down to the ultimate pits..."
 - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath</u>
tde/tsh_encounter.back_text: Mysterious Stairs is connected to the locations above and below it.
tde/tsh_encounter.name: Mysterious Stairs
tde/tsh_encounter.text: Mysterious Stairs is connected to the locations above and below it. Forced - When this location is revealed: Place 1 [per_investigator] resources on it. While there are resources on this location, investigators at this location cannot move or resign. [action]: Test your lowest skill (2). If successful, discard 1 resource from this location.

tde/tsh_encounter.back_flavor:
"So worn and narrow were the steps, and so greasy with the ooze of inner earth, that the climber never quite knew when to expect a breathless fall and hurtling down to the ultimate pits..."
 - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath</u>
tde/tsh_encounter.back_text: Mysterious Stairs is connected to the locations above and below it.
tde/tsh_encounter.name: Mysterious Stairs
tde/tsh_encounter.text: Mysterious Stairs is connected to the locations above and below it. Forced - When this location is revealed: Move The Unnamable to it. While The Unnamable is at this location and has fewer than 1 [per_investigator] damage on it, investigators at this location cannot move or resign.

tde/tsh_encounter.back_flavor:
"So worn and narrow were the steps, and so greasy with the ooze of inner earth, that the climber never quite knew when to expect a breathless fall and hurtling down to the ultimate pits..."
 - H. P. Lovecraft, <u>The Dream-Quest of Unknown Kadath</u>
tde/tsh_encounter.back_text: Mysterious Stairs is connected to the locations above and below it.
tde/tsh_encounter.name: Mysterious Stairs
tde/tsh_encounter.text:
Mysterious Stairs is connected to the locations above and below it.
As an additional cost for you to move or resign at this location, you must discard 1 or more cards from your hand with at least 2 instances of the same skill icon among them.

tde/tsh_encounter.flavor:
"Inside, wrapped in a discoloured parchment, was a huge key of tarnished silver covered with cryptical arabesques; but of any legible explanation there was none."
 - H. P. Lovecraft, "The Silver Key"
tde/tsh_encounter.name: The Silver Key
tde/tsh_encounter.subname: Key to the Gate of Dreams
tde/tsh_encounter.text: [reaction] When you would take horror, exhaust The Silver Key: Cancel 1 of that horror.

tde/tsh_encounter.name: Endless Descent
tde/tsh_encounter.text: Revelation - Move each investigator and enemy at the topmost location to the location below it. Flip the topmost location to its unrevealed side, discard all tokens and attachments from it, and place it below the bottommost location. Shuffle the positions of each unrevealed location so you cannot tell which is which. Add this card to the victory display.

tde/tsh_encounter.name: Indescribable Apparition
tde/tsh_encounter.text: Revelation - Put Indescribable Apparition into play in your threat area. You get -1 to each of your skills while The Unnamable is at your location. [action] [action]: Discard Indescribable Apparition.

tde/tsh_encounter.name: Glowing Eyes
tde/tsh_encounter.text: Revelation - Put Glowing Eyes into play in your threat area. Forced - At the end of the round: Take 1 horror for each card in your threat area, to a maximum of 3 horror. Discard Glowing Eyes.

tde/tsh_encounter.name: Deceptive Memories
tde/tsh_encounter.text: Revelation - Put Deceptive Memories into play in your threat area. Forced - After another card enters your threat area: Choose and discard 1 card from your hand. [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Deceptive Memories.

tde/tsh_encounter.name: Secrets in the Attic
tde/tsh_encounter.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take 1 horror and put Secrets in the Attic into play next to the agenda deck. [free] abilities on locations cannot be triggered. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard 1 copy of Secrets in the Attic from play. (Max once per round.)

parallel/ptr.back_flavor: Zoey had known that she was special ever since God spoke to her one night when she was six years old... the night that terrible fire took away her parents. He told her that He had chosen her from among all the people of the world to be His agent. She would protect the innocent and punish the wicked. Since then, He comes to her in times of trouble, offering guidance and comfort. Zoey now travels from city to city, taking work as a chef to support herself. When she isn’t working, she stalks the night, guided by the Lord’s voice. Wherever she finds wickedness, she strikes it down without remorse or hesitation.
parallel/ptr.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-3, [[Blessed]] and [[Charm]] cards level 0-4, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to five other Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Zoey's Cross, Smite the Wicked, 1 random basic weakness.

deck_options.error: You cannot have more than 5 Mystic cards.

parallel/ptr.name: Zoey Samaras
parallel/ptr.text:
[reaction] After you deal 1 or more damage to an enemy: Add 1 [bless] token to the chaos bag. (Limit once per phase.)
[fast] Before you reveal chaos tokens during an attack, remove 3 [bless] tokens from the chaos bag: This attack deals +1 damage. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1 for each [bless] token in the chaos bag.

parallel/ptr.name: Zoey's Cross
parallel/ptr.text:
Zoey Samaras deck only. Advanced.
[reaction] After you engage an enemy, exhaust Zoey’s Cross and spend 1 resource: Deal 1 damage to that enemy.
[fast] Remove 2 [bless] tokens from the chaos bag: Engage an enemy at your location.

parallel/ptr.name: Smite the Wicked
parallel/ptr.text: Advanced. Attached enemy gets +2 fight and +2 health. Revelation - Discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until an enemy is discarded. Attach Smite the Wicked to that enemy and spawn it at the location farthest from you. Forced - When the game ends, if attached enemy is in play: Zoey Samaras suffers 1 mental trauma.

parallel/rtr_encounter.back_text:
Hard / Expert
skull]: -X. X is the number of [[Suspect]] and [[Hideout]] cards in the victory display.
[cultist]: -3. (-5 instead if you are parleying with a [[Suspect]] enemy or investigating a [[Hideout]] location).
[tablet]: -4. If you succeed, look at the top card of the Leads deck. You may choose to shuffle the Leads deck.
[elder_thing]: -2. If you fail, shuffle the top card of the encounter deck into the Leads deck.
parallel/rtr_encounter.name: Red Tide Rising
parallel/rtr_encounter.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is half the number of [[Suspect]] and [[Hideout]] cards in the victory display (rounded up).
[cultist]: -2. (-4 instead if you are parleying with a [[Suspect]] enemy or investigating a [[Hideout]] location).
[tablet]: -3. If you succeed, look at the top card of the Leads deck. You may choose to shuffle the Leads deck.
[elder_thing]: -1. If you fail, shuffle the top card of the encounter deck into the Leads deck.

parallel/rtr_encounter.back_flavor: You’re used to people turning you down and pushing you away, but for some reason, the locals here are even more upset at your prying questions than you could have expected. The last person you speak to is a man who reeks of fish, with pale, sickly skin and strange ridges across his neck. Next thing you know, you are being followed everywhere you go, and the lot of them don’t look all too friendly.
parallel/rtr_encounter.back_text:
Spawn the set-aside Angry Mob enemy at Innsmouth Square, exhausted.
Place 1 [per_investigator] clues on each [[Suspect]] enemy and [[Hideout]] location in play.
parallel/rtr_encounter.flavor: You arrive in Innsmouth and immediately set to work asking the townspeople if they’ve seen your Dad, the place in the photograph, or the man in the derby who dropped off the photo.
parallel/rtr_encounter.name: The New Girl
parallel/rtr_encounter.text: Forced - When this agenda would advance by reaching its doom threshold: Instead, remove all doom in play and shuffle a random set-aside [[Monster]] enemy into the [[Leads]] deck. Then, if there are no set-aside [[Monster]] enemies, advance to agenda 1b.

parallel/rtr_encounter.back_flavor: You hide behind a sour-smelling pile of trash and wait for the pounding of heavy steps as the mob searches relentlessly for you. You don’t know why they’re after you—you were only asking questions!—but it’s clear you can’t stay here any longer. In Arkham, everyone’s gaze passes right over street urchins like you. Suddenly, you wish that were the case here, too.
parallel/rtr_encounter.flavor: The longer you stick around and the more questions you ask, the more danger seeks you out. The locals eye you with anger and suspicion, and worse: strange winged creatures prowl about the rooftops, searching for prey...
parallel/rtr_encounter.name: Trail Goes Cold
parallel/rtr_encounter.text:
Angry Mob cannot be defeated.
[reaction] After Wendy Adams evades Angry Mob: She may discover 1 clue from its location.
Each [[Suspect]] enemy loses aloof and enters play with +1 [per_investigator] clues.
Each [[Hideout]] location gets +1 [per_investigator] clue value.

parallel/rtr_encounter.back_flavor:
It’s no use. Maybe Dad was in Innsmouth at some point, but he’s long gone now. And the townsfolk here don’t seem too keen on anybody asking about him. Might be they know more than they’re letting on, or it might just be they’re protecting other, unrelated secrets. Either way, it’s no longer safe to stick around.
But just as you are ready to give up and head back to the bus stop to return to Arkham, you spot a man in a familiar outfit: a long wool coat and a brown derby.
parallel/rtr_encounter.flavor: To say that this town is less friendly than even Arkham would be an understatement.
parallel/rtr_encounter.name: Searching for Dad
parallel/rtr_encounter.text: [[Suspect]] and [[Hideout]] cards cannot be added to the victory display except using Mysterious Photo. Forced – If there are no [[Suspect]] or [[Hideout]] cards in play: Wendy Adams must draw cards from the top of the Leads deck until she draws a [[Suspect]] or [[Hideout]] card. Objective – Search for Dad using Mysterious Photo. The fewer cards that remain in the Leads deck, the better. If it is empty, advance.

parallel/rtr_encounter.name: Mysterious Photo
parallel/rtr_encounter.subname: All I Have Left of Him
parallel/rtr_encounter.text: [fast] Exhaust Mysterious Photo: Either take a parley action on a [[Suspect]] enemy or flip Mysterious Photo over. [fast] If there is a [[Suspect]] enemy with no clues on it at your location, investigators at your location spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group (2 [per_investigator] clues instead if it is agenda 2): “Have you seen my dad?” Add that enemy to the victory display.

parallel/rtr_encounter.name: Mysterious Photo
parallel/rtr_encounter.subname: All I Have Left of Him
parallel/rtr_encounter.text: [fast] Exhaust Mysterious Photo: Either take an investigate action at a [[Hideout]] location or flip Mysterious Photo over. [fast] If you are at a [[Hideout]] location with no clues on it, investigators at that location spend clues, as a group, equal to its clue value: “Where is Dad now?” Add that location to the victory display, moving each enemy and investigator there to a connecting location.

parallel/rop.back_flavor: Young Jack traveled the world with his father’s archaeological expeditions. Now a globe-trotting treasure hunter and an accomplished archaeologist in his own right, “Monterey” follows in his father’s footsteps, securing the treasures of ancient civilizations and lost cultures. But after discovering a silver pendant with a familiar symbol on it, Monterey must explore his own past. Years ago, his father was found murdered with the very same sigil carved onto his forehead. The image has haunted Monterey’s dreams ever since. But he’s getting close. He won’t stop until he solves the mystery of his father’s murder... no matter what it takes.
parallel/rop.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-3, [[Charm]] and [[Relic]] cards level 0-4, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 5 other Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Trusty Bullwhip, Buried Secrets, 1 random basic weakness.

deck_options.error: You cannot have more than 5 level 0 Seeker cards

parallel/rop.name: Monterey Jack
parallel/rop.text:
[reaction] After you discover the last clue at your location: Search the top X cards of your deck for a [[Charm]] or [[Relic]] asset and play it, reducing its cost by X. X is the printed shroud of your location. Shuffle your deck. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1. Gain 1 resource for each [[Charm]] asset and each [[Relic]] asset you control.

parallel/rop.name: Trusty Bullwhip
parallel/rop.text: Fast. Monterey Jack deck only. Advanced. [action]: Fight. This attack uses [agility] instead of [combat]. You get +2 skill value for this attack. If this attack succeeds, you may exhaust Trusty Bullwhip to deal +1 damage for this attack and automatically evade the attacked enemy.

parallel/rop.name: Buried Secrets
parallel/rop.text: Advanced. Revelation - Put Buried Secrets into play in your threat area. If your location can be investigated, you cannot move except by scenario card effects. [action] [action]: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, discard Buried Secrets.

parallel/bad_encounter.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is 1 more than the number of memories Agnes Baker has collected.
[cultist]: -3. Ready Elspeth Baudin and resolve her patrol keyword. If she is engaged with an investigator, she makes an attack.
[tablet]: -5. If you fail and there is a memory at Elspeth Baudin's location, place this token on that location.
[elder_thing]: -8. Agnes Baker may take up to 3 damage to increase your skill value by 2 for each damage taken.
parallel/bad_encounter.name: Bad Blood
parallel/bad_encounter.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the number of memories Agnes Baker has collected.
[cultist]: -2. Ready Elspeth Baudin and resolve her patrol keyword.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail and there is a memory at Elspeth Baudin's location, place this token on that location.
[elder_thing]: -6. Agnes Baker may take up to 3 damage to increase your skill value by 2 for each damage taken.

parallel/bad_encounter.back_flavor: A crackle of arcane power lashes throughout the sky, seeking out you and your companions. For a brief moment, the torment is unbearable. The pain forks through your body like poison in your veins. A flash of light in the back of your vision blinds you. Then, just as suddenly, it is over. But there is something missing. Something lost. Is she trying to steal your memories?
parallel/bad_encounter.back_text: Elspeth Baudin attacks each investigator in player order, regardless of their current location (even if she is exhausted). Flip this agenda back over.
parallel/bad_encounter.name: Hyperborean Blood
parallel/bad_encounter.text: Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Elspeth Baudin is ready and there is a memory at her location: Reveal a random token from the chaos bag and place it on that location. Forced - If there are 1 or more chaos tokens on a location without a memory: Return them to the chaos bag. Forced - If there are chaos tokens on a location with a memory that have a combined value of 6 or more (ignoring +/- and treating each [auto_fail] and [elder_sign] as a -6): Return them to the chaos bag, and Elspeth Baudin collects that memory.

parallel/bad_encounter.back_text:
If Agnes collected more memories than Elspeth:
Elspeth falls before you, pain coursing through her body. "Go on, then. Finish it," she hisses through her teeth, glaring up at you with seething hatred. Arcane power crackles in your hand. She is your enemy. Your conquest. Her life, her memories, they are in your hands. You should take what is rightfully yours.
(→R1)
If Elspeth collected more memories than Agnes:
You fall to your knees, overcome by pain. Elspeth looms over you, her hands crackling with arcane energy. "You are weak," she taunts. "You are not deserving of this power. But I..." she grins. "I will be so much better."
(→R2)
parallel/bad_encounter.flavor: You must recover the lost memories of your previous life before Elspeth does!
parallel/bad_encounter.name: A Walk Down Memory Lane
parallel/bad_encounter.text: [fast] Investigators at Agnes Baker's location spend 2 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Agnes Baker collects the memory at her location. Forced - If Agnes Baker is defeated, proceed to (→R2). Objective - Collect more memories than Elspeth. If all 9 memories have been collected (by either party), advance.

parallel/bad_encounter.name: Elspeth Baudin
parallel/bad_encounter.text: Alert. Patrol (nearest location with at least 1 memory). Retaliate. Elspeth Baudin cannot be automatically evaded and gets -1 fight and -1 evade for each memory she has collected. Forced - When Elspeth Baudin would be defeated: Instead, heal all damage from her, flip her over, and resolve the text on her other side.

parallel/bad_encounter.flavor: Light crashes against the night sky as your magic and Elspeth's intersect. A blaring peal - like an otherworldly siren, calling for judgment - sends you and Elspeth both to your knees. She reels in pain, digging her nails into her temples. You reach out with your power, grasp at her memories, and pull with all your strength.
parallel/bad_encounter.name: Triumph and Subjugation
parallel/bad_encounter.text:
Agnes Baker must decide (choose one):
- Agnes Baker collects 1 memory from Elspeth Baudin.
- Agnes Baker gains 2 [per_investigator] clues from the token bank.
Then, flip this card over, exhausted and unengaged.

parallel/ltr_encounter.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is 2 more than the number of copies of Unfinished Business in the victory display.
[cultist]: -X. X is twice the number of cards attached to The Beyond.
[tablet]: -X. X is twice the number of [[Spectral]] locations in play.
[elder_thing]: -3. If there is a [[Geist]] enemy at your location, you automatically fail.
parallel/ltr_encounter.name: Laid to Rest
parallel/ltr_encounter.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is 1 more than the number of copies of Unfinished Business in the victory display.
[cultist]: -X. X is the number of cards attached to The Beyond.
[tablet]: -X. X is the number of [[Spectral]] locations in play.
[elder_thing]: -2. If there is a [[Geist]] enemy at your location, reveal another token.

parallel/ltr_encounter.back_flavor: A cold wind blows down the haunted hill, chilling your bones. The spirits grow more and more restless.
parallel/ltr_encounter.back_text: Place 1 horror on the scenario reference card under Spiritual Disturbance. If there is 4 horror on the scenario reference card, each investigator who has not been eliminated is defeated and suffers 1 mental trauma. (→R2) Otherwise (if there is 3 or fewer horror on the scenario reference card), perform the following: - Place clues on each location until it has 1 [per_investigator] clues on it. - Flip each location except for Jean Devereux’s location to its non-[[Spectral]] side. Flip this agenda back over.
parallel/ltr_encounter.flavor: Hangman’s Hill is crawling with specters.
parallel/ltr_encounter.name: Gathering Mists
parallel/ltr_encounter.text: Forced – When the enemy phase begins: Deal 1 damage to Jean Devereux for each ready Ravenous Spirit at his location. Forced – If Jim Culver is defeated: Advance the act. [action] Spend 2 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Parley. You banish a spirit. Discard the top card of the Spirit deck. (Hint: Draw Heretics out of the Beyond and summon them with Jean’s help!)

parallel/ltr_encounter.back_flavor: Soft chanting guides you to a gloomy clearing near the abandoned chapel. A circle of witchweed surrounds the clearing, swaying gently in the breeze. At the center of the clearing, a cloaked woman kneels in front of an unmarked grave, far from the remainder of the graveyard. You watch in quiet for a few minutes while the woman sings an old, somber melody. It reminds you somewhat of a child's lullaby - soothing, but with a dark gravity that betrays its purpose. As soon as the song ends, the woman's cloak dissolves into mist, and she vanishes in a swirl of shadows.
parallel/ltr_encounter.back_text:
If this act advanced via its objective:
“Wait,” says Jean, steadying himself. His eyes roll back in his head and he collapses into your arms, shaking. The spiritual energy around you seems to still.
Find each Ravenous Spirit in play and place it in the victory display. (→R1)
Otherwise:
“It’s too much!” Jean screams as he holds his hands to his bleeding ears. A cacophanous cry echoes across the wind-swept hill as you both flee the scene.
Jim Culver suffers 1 mental trauma for each Heretic enemy still in The Beyond (to a minimum of 1 mental trauma). Each other investigator who was not eliminated is defeated and suffers 1 mental trauma. (→R2)
parallel/ltr_encounter.flavor: If you help these ghosts, they'll help you.
parallel/ltr_encounter.name: Laid to Rest
parallel/ltr_encounter.text: [fast] Either exhaust Jim’s Trumpet, or spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Choose an enemy to move once toward Jim Culver’s location. [fast] Spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Flip your location. (Group limit once per round per location.) Objective – If there are 4 copies of Unfinished Business in the victory display, advance.

parallel/ltr_encounter.name: Jean Devereux
parallel/ltr_encounter.text: Aloof. Patrol (Nearest location with a Ravenous Spirit enemy beneath it). Cannot be engaged. [action] Draw a facedown card beneath Jean Devereux’s location and choose a Heretic attached to The Beyond: Parley. Jim Culver draws the chosen Heretic, flips it, and resolves its text. Forced – When Jean Devereux would be defeated: Instead, heal all damage from him and flip him.

parallel/ltr_encounter.name: Jean Devereux
parallel/ltr_encounter.text: Hunter. Prey – Jim Culver only. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (3). This test gets +1 difficulty for each copy of Unfinished Business in the victory display. If you succeed, heal all damage from Jean Devereux and flip him (he is no longer engaged). Forced – If Jean Devereux is defeated: Advance the act.

parallel/ltr_encounter.name: Ravenous Spirit
parallel/ltr_encounter.text: Aloof. Patrol (Jean Devereux’s location). Retaliate. Ravenous Spirit gets +2 [per_investigator] health. Forced – When this enemy enters a location: Flip that location to its [[Spectral]] side. One at a time, each investigator at that location resolves each haunted ability on it.

parallel/rod.back_flavor: As a respected librarian at Miskatonic University, Daisy had always felt that books were the most important thing in her life. She explored in fiction what she abhorred in life: horror, violence, fear. Then, she stumbled across the John Dee translation of the Necronomicon. It was blasphemous, unholy, and too awful to be read. But given her studies in obscure and occult subjects, Daisy knew there was more truth than fiction within the book's pages. She began to wonder what other secrets the restricted collection of the Orne Library held...
parallel/rod.back_text: Deck size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: [[Tome]] cards level 0-5, Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to five other level 0 Guardian and/or Mystic cards ([guardian] and/or [mystic]). Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Daisy’s Tote Bag, The Necronomicon (John Dee Translation), 1 random basic weakness.

deck_options.error: You cannot have more than 5 Guardian and/or Mystic cards

parallel/rod.flavor: "I can shut the book, but I can never unread its words."
parallel/rod.name: Daisy Walker
parallel/rod.text:
You get +1 [willpower] and +1 sanity for each [[Tome]] asset you control.
[fast]: One at a time, resolve an [action] ability on each [[Tome]] asset you control, ignoring their [action] cost. (Limit once per game.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1. You may return a [[Tome]] asset from your discard pile to your hand.

parallel/rod.name: Daisy's Tote Bag
parallel/rod.text:
Daisy Walker deck only. Advanced.
You have 2 additional hand slots, which can only be used to hold [[Tome]] assets.
[reaction] When you play a [[Tome]] asset during your turn, exhaust Daisy's Tote Bag: That asset gains fast.

parallel/rod.name: The Necronomicon
parallel/rod.text: Advanced. Revelation - Put this card into play in your threat area, with 3 horror on it. It cannot leave play while it has 1 or more horror on it. While it is in play, treat each [elder_sign] you reveal on a chaos token as a [cultist], [tablet], and [elder_thing] (resolve all three). [action]: Move 1 horror from this card to Daisy Walker. Then, if The Necronomicon has no horror on it, discard it.

parallel/btb_encounter.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is 1 plus the number of [[Cultist]] enemies in the victory display.
[cultist]: -3. If a [[Cultist]] enemy is engaged with you, reveal an additional chaos token.
[tablet]: -4. Ready each [[Cultist]] enemy engaged with you.
[elder_thing]: -5. If you fail, Roland Banks takes 1 damage.

parallel/btb_encounter.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the number of [[Cultist]] enemies in the victory display, to a maximum of 5.
[cultist]: -2. If a [[Cultist]] enemy is engaged with you, reveal an additional chaos token.
[tablet]: -3. Ready each [[Cultist]] enemy engaged with you.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, Roland Banks takes 1 damage.

parallel/btb_encounter.flavor: Mr. Grey is a powerful man with a lot of friends. Getting him behind bars is going to be tricky.
parallel/btb_encounter.name: A Covert Conspiracy
parallel/btb_encounter.text: Forced - When a non-weakness [[Cultist]] enemy would be defeated: Heal damage from that enemy until it has 1 remaining health, instead. Forced - If Roland Banks is defeated: Proceed to (→R2) [action]: Resign. You don't want to miss your deadline, so you close the case.

parallel/btb_encounter.flavor: "Take comfort in the idea that your death serves a much greater purpose."
parallel/btb_encounter.name: Mr. Grey
parallel/btb_encounter.text: Spawn - Engaged with Roland Banks. Hunter. Mr. Grey gets +2 [per_investigator] health. Forced - After Mr. Grey attacks an investigator: That investigator draws the top card of the encounter deck.

parallel/btb_encounter.back_flavor:
"It's not enough," your superior scolds you. "I'm sorry, but it's just too contrived for me to believe. And if I don't believe it, the courts won't, either. I mean, honestly. Cults? Human sacrifices?"
You grit your teeth and slam your hand down on the myriad documents and evidence you've collected. It's all there, you insist.
"It's been weeks and you don't have a real case here. Just a lot of circumstantial mumbo-jumbo," he deflects. "And besides, Mr. Grey is a cornerstone of this community. That you would disparage him with these accusations..." The hint of derision towards you in his voice gives him away. Is he on Grey's payroll? Or worse? Either way, it's clear arguing won't get you anywhere. You know better than to make a fuss. You'll have to keep your head down and do things your own way if you want to make a difference in Arkham.
parallel/btb_encounter.back_text: Remove a [[Cultist]] enemy in the victory display from the game (Mr. Grey, if able). (→R1).
parallel/btb_encounter.flavor: Your superiors are pressuring you to drop your investigation. Mr. Grey's influence, no doubt. Meanwhile, he and his lackies are doing everything in their power to quietly remove you from the equation, once and for all.
parallel/btb_encounter.name: Your Deadline Nears
parallel/btb_encounter.text: Forced - When a non-weakness [[Cultist]] enemy would be defeated: Heal damage from that enemy until it has 1 remaining health, instead. Forced - If Roland Banks is defeated: Proceed to (→R2) [action]: Resign. You don't want to miss your deadline, so you close the case.

parallel/btb_encounter.back_flavor:
Mr. Grey paces the length of his cell, glaring at you from behind the bars. "You're going to regret this, Agent Banks," he snarls. "You'll be begging for my mercy when this is over."
You politely remind Mr. Grey that threatening a federal agent is a felony.
"There are worse things to be afraid of than the likes of you," he replies, before slumping into the corner of his cell, defeated.
The true culprit is behind bars, but you still don't know what his real purpose was in aiding the conspirators behind the murders. What could possibly compel one to take the lives of so many? You don't know - but you intend to find out.
parallel/btb_encounter.flavor: Taking down the culprits behind the sacrifices can only be done with proof, in a court of law. You'll have to do this fair and square.
parallel/btb_encounter.name: Capture the Conspirators
parallel/btb_encounter.text: [fast] The investigators spend 1 [per_investigators] clues, as a group: Flip over a facedown conspirator at your location and put it into play engaged with you. [fast] Spend 1 resource: Exhaust a [[Cultist]] enemy engaged with you (it remains engaged). Only Roland Banks may trigger this ability.] Objective - Parley with as many conspirators as you can. If 10 [[Cultist]] enemies are in the victory display, advance.

parallel/btb_encounter.back_flavor: With Sheriff Engel and the rest of the officers dismissive of your suspicions, you set off to investigate the murders yourself.
parallel/btb_encounter.back_text: Arkham Police Station is connected to Rivertown, Downtown, and Easttown, and vice versa.
parallel/btb_encounter.name: Arkham Police Station
parallel/btb_encounter.text: Arkham Police Station is connected to Rivertown, Downtown, and Easttown, and vice versa. [fast]: Move to a connecting location. [fast] Choose a non-weakness [[Cultist]] enemy at this location and spend clues equal to its remaining health: Parley. Add that enemy to the victory display.

Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is 1 more than the number of locations with 1 or more doom on them.
[cultist]: -2. If you are poisoned, reveal another token.
[tablet]: -4. Place 1 doom on your location.
[elder_thing]: -5. After this test resolves, the nearest ready, unengaged [[Serpent]] enemy moves once toward your location.
parallel/rop_encounter.name: Relics of the Past

Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the number of locations with 1 or more doom on them.
[cultist]: -1. If you are poisoned, reveal another token.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, place 1 doom on your location.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, the nearest ready unengaged [[Serpent]] enemy moves once toward your location.

parallel/ltr.back_flavor: Jazz has been nothing but trouble for Jim since the day he picked up his daddy’s trumpet. But the dead sure love it when he plays, so Jim has no intention of stopping.
parallel/ltr.back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-3, [[Spell]] and [[Cursed]] cards level 0-4, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to five other Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Jim's Trumpet, Final Rhapsody, The Beyond, 1 random basic weakness. Spirit Deck Size: 10. Spirit Deckbuilding Options: 9 different [[Ally]] assets from any class level 0–2, Vengeful Shade. Spirit Deck Instructions: Shuffle the “spirit deck” separately from your deck and place it next to The Beyond asset, facedown. This deck may be upgraded separately using your unspent experience.

deck_options.error: You cannot have more than 5 Survivor cards.

parallel/ltr.flavor: “I know I can make the dead dance.”
parallel/ltr.name: Jim Culver
parallel/ltr.text:
[reaction] After you reveal 1 or more [skull] or [curse] tokens during a skill test you are performing: Replenish 1 charge on an asset you control. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +2. You may treat this token as if it were a [skull] or [curse] token instead.

parallel/ltr.name: Jim's Trumpet
parallel/ltr.text:
Jim Culver deck only. Advanced.
[reaction] When a [skull] or [curse] token is revealed during a skill test you are performing, exhaust Jim's Trumpet: Heal 1 horror from each investigator and [[Ally]] asset at your location or a connecting location.

parallel/ltr.flavor: When the dead start talking about what scares them, that's when it's time to listen.
parallel/ltr.name: Final Rhapsody
parallel/ltr.text: Advanced. Revelation - Reveal 5 chaos tokens from the chaos bag. For each non-[elder_sign], non-[bless] symbol token revealed, take 1 damage and 1 horror.

parallel/ltr.name: The Beyond
parallel/ltr.text: Jim Culver deck only. Permanent. Each attached spirit loses all printed traits and gains the [[Geist]] trait. When damage/horror would be placed on an attached spirit, it must be placed on Jim Culver, instead. Forced – When your turn begins: Attach the top card of the spirit deck to The Beyond, as a spirit. If 4 or more spirits are attached, flip this card and resolve its text.

parallel/ltr.name: The Beyond
parallel/ltr.text:
Forced – One at a time, choose each non-weakness spirit attached to The Beyond and reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If it is... - ... an [elder_sign] token: You may either heal 1 horror, or attach the top card of the spirit deck to The Beyond, as a spirit. (Do not reveal tokens for the spirit you attach after resolving this effect.) - ... an [auto_fail] token: Discard this spirit. Take 1 direct damage/horror. - ...a [skull] token: Discard this spirit. Heal 1 horror. - ...a [cultist], [elder_thing], [tablet], or [curse] token: You must either discard this spirit or take 1 direct damage. - ...any other token: Discard this spirit. Flip this card back to its asset side.
Reminder: Spirits attached to The Beyond are in play but only retain their names and text boxes. Spirits do not take up slots and do not have health or sanity values. When a unique spirit is attached to The Beyond, any other asset that shares its name and is already in play is discarded. Spirits are always discarded to the bottom of the spirit deck.

parallel/ltr.name: Vengeful Shade
parallel/ltr.text: Hunter. Prey – Jim Culver only. You may fight or evade this enemy while it is attached to The Beyond (as if it were engaged with you). If you succeed, discard it. If you fail, spawn it engaged with you. Forced – When you attach a spirit to The Beyond via its forced effect: Vengeful Shade attacks you (even if it is not at your location).

parallel/bad.back_flavor: Agnes Baker may be just an unassuming waitress in this life, but in a previous life, she had been a powerful witch. It began when she found a strange artifact - a key of some kind - in a dusty collection of family belongings in her attic. When she touched it, the memories came flooding back, along with one word: "Hyperborea."
parallel/bad.back_text: Deck size: 25. Deckbuilding Options: Mystic cards ([mystic]) level 0-5, [[Spell]] cards level 0-3, [[Occult]] cards level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Heirloom of Hyperborea, Dark Memory, 1 random basic weakness. Additional Options: When you upgrade a [[Spell]] card, you may instead pay the full experience cost of the higher level version and leave the lower level version in your deck (it does not count towards your deck size or the number of copies of that card in your deck).
parallel/bad.flavor:
"The magic is in my blood.
Coursing through my veins.
Pumping through my heart."
parallel/bad.name: Agnes Baker
parallel/bad.text:
As an additional cost to play a [[Spell]] event, you may take 1 damage. If you do, reduce the cost to play that event by 2, and you may shuffle that event back into your deck instead of discarding it.
[elder_sign] effect: +1. You may heal 1 damage.

parallel/bad.name: Heirloom of Hyperborea
parallel/bad.text:
Agnes Baker deck only. Advanced.
Only damage and/or horror from player card effects can be assigned to Heirloom of Hyperborea.
[reaction] After you play a [[Spell]] card: Draw 1 card.

parallel/bad.name: Dark Memory
parallel/bad.text: Advanced. Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effect may cause the current agenda to advance. Forced - If Dark Memory is in your hand at the end of your turn, reveal it and take 2 horror.

parallel/aon.back_flavor: Skids hadn't planned on a life of crime. But sometimes doing the right thing means getting your hands dirty. His cellmate, Brad Hollins, would rant and rave about the "Old Ones". Skids didn't give it much thought until the night he woke to the sight of his cellmate bursting into flames. When Skids was finally released, he returned to Arkham, looking for answers.
parallel/aon.back_text: Deck size: 25. Deckbuilding Options: Rogue cards ([rogue]) level 0-5, [[Fortune]] cards level 0-3, [[Gambit]] cards level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): On the Lam, Hospital Debts, 1 random basic weakness. Additional Options: When you upgrade a [[Fortune]] or [[Gambit]] card, you may instead pay the full experience cost of the higher level version and leave the lower level version in your deck (it does not count towards your deck size or the number of copies of that card in your deck).
parallel/aon.name: "Skids" O'Toole
parallel/aon.text:
[fast] Spend up to 3 resources: Test a base skill value of 3 against a difficulty equal to the amount of resources just spent. If you succeed, gain twice the number of spent resources. Only [agility] and [wild] skill icons may be committed to this test. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1. Choose a level 2 or less card in your discard pile. Add the chosen card to your hand.

parallel/aon.name: On the Lam
parallel/aon.text:
"Skids" O'Toole deck only. Advanced.
Fast. Play during any [fast] window.
Until the end of the round, non-[[Elite]] enemies cannot attack you. At the end of the round, you may disengage from each engaged enemy and move up to 2 locations away.

parallel/aon.name: Hospital Debts
parallel/aon.text: Advanced. Revelation - Put Hospital Debts into play in your threat area. [fast]: Move 1 resource from your resource pool to Hospital Debts. (Limit three times per round.) Forced - When the game ends, if Hospital Debts has fewer than 9 resources on it: You earn 2 fewer experience for this scenario.

parallel/btb.back_flavor: Roland had always taken comfort in procedure and rules. As an agent in the Bureau, he was relieved to have guidelines to follow in any given situation. But lately, his Federal Agent's Handbook had been entirely unhelpful given the cases he'd been assigned. Try as he might, Roland could find no mention of what to do when confronted with strange creatures, gates through time and space, or magic spells. If he hadn't seen it with his own eyes, he would never have believed it... and there's no way his superiors would understand.
parallel/btb.back_text: Deck size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0-3, [[Insight]] cards level 0-3, [[Tactic]] cards level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Roland's .38 Special, Cover Up, 1 random basic weakness. Bonus Experience: You begin the campaign with 5 additional experience (does not affect the number of weakneses you must take in Standalone Mode).
parallel/btb.flavor: "If I stir up trouble, Sheriff, it will be because there's trouble to stir up."
parallel/btb.name: Roland Banks
parallel/btb.text: At deck creation, choose 3 different Directive assets to add to your deck. [fast]: Flip a Directive asset facedown (ignoring its permanent keyword). (Limit once per game.) [elder_sign] effect: +2. Choose a Directive asset. You may ignore its regulation ability this round.

parallel/btb.name: Directive
parallel/btb.text: Roland Bank deck only. Permanent. Regulation - You cannot fight more than twice each round. [fast] During a skill test while investigating, evading, or parleying, exhaust Directive: You get +2 skill value for this test for each enemy engaged with you.

parallel/btb.name: Directive
parallel/btb.text: Roland Bank deck only. Permanent. Regulation - You cannot play more than 2 cards each round. [reaction] When you play an [[Insight]] or [[Tactic]] event, exhaust this Directive: That event gains fast.

parallel/btb.name: Directive
parallel/btb.text: Roland Bank deck only. Permanent. Regulation - You cannot voluntarily assign damage or horror to [[Ally]] assets. You have 1 additional ally slot.

parallel/btb.name: Directive
parallel/btb.text: Roland Bank deck only. Permanent. Regulation - When your location has 1 or more clues, you cannot commit cards to skill tests unless you have discovered a clue this round. [reaction] After you discover a clue, if an enemy is at your location, exhaust this Directive: Draw 1 card.

parallel/btb.name: Directive
parallel/btb.text: Roland Bank deck only. Permanent. Regulation - You cannot move more than twice each round. You get +3 sanity.

parallel/btb.name: Roland's .38 Special
parallel/btb.text: Roland Banks deck only. Advanced. Uses (4 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +2 [combat] for this attack (if there are 1 or more clues on your location, you get +4 [combat], instead). This attack deals +1 damage. If this attack defeats an enemy and there are no clues on your location, place 1 ammo on Roland's .38 Special

parallel/btb.name: Cover Up
parallel/btb.text: Advanced. Revelation - Put Cover Up into play in your threat area, with 4 clues on it. [reaction] When you would discover 1 or more clues at your location: Discard that many clues from Cover Up instead. Forced - When the game ends, if there are any clues on Cover Up: You suffer 1 mental trauma.

parallel/rtr.back_flavor: Mama used to let Wendy play with her necklace when she was small. Mama would tell her stories, and Wendy would spin the necklace and watch as it glittered. Then, word came that her father had been lost at sea, and Mama started acting strange, drawing unusual symbols in chalk all over the house. They took Mama to the asylum, and Wendy went to the orphanage. Before they took her away, Mama gave her the necklace, to "protect her." Wendy stayed in the orphanage for several years before running away, deciding that she could take better care of herself on her own.
parallel/rtr.back_text: Deck Size: 30. [[Trait]] Choice: At deck creation, choose [[Blessed]] or [[Cursed]], or choose both and gain +5 Deck Size. Deckbuilding Options: Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, cards of your chosen trait(s) 0-5. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Wendy's Amulet, Abandoned and Alone, 1 random basic weakness.
parallel/rtr.flavor: "The little things are important. Grown-ups don't see that."
parallel/rtr.name: Wendy Adams
parallel/rtr.text:
Add Tidal Memento to your deck.
[reaction] After you successfully evade a non-[[Elite]] enemy: Seal either 1 [bless] or [curse] token from the chaos bag, or any [bless] or [curse] tokens revealed from the chaos bag during this test, on that enemy.
[elder_sign] effect: +2. Search the chaos bag for up to 2 [bless] and/or [curse] tokens and reveal them, ignoring their effects.

parallel/rtr.name: Tidal Memento
parallel/rtr.text:
Wendy Adams deck only. Permanent.
[reaction] When an enemy would ready or doom would be placed on it, release a [bless] or [curse] token sealed on that enemy: Cancel that effect.
[reaction] During a skill test you are performing, when a chaos token would be revealed from the chaos bag: Resolve a [bless] or [curse] token sealed on an enemy instead.

parallel/rtr.name: Wendy's Amulet
parallel/rtr.text: Wendy Adams deck only. Advanced. You may play any event in your discard pile as if it were in your hand. Forced - After you play an event or discard an event from play: Place it on the bottom of your deck instead of in your discard pile.

parallel/rtr.flavor: I don't need them. I don't need anyone.
parallel/rtr.name: Abandoned and Alone
parallel/rtr.text: Advanced. Revelation - Remove all non-weakness cards in your discard pile from the game. If no cards were removed by this effect, shuffle this card back into your deck. Otherwise, take 3 direct horror.

parallel/rod_encounter.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is 1 more than the number of [[Tome]] assets Daisy Walker controls.
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail, discard the top 3 cards of your deck.
[tablet]: -3. If this is an attack or evasion attempt against Namer of the Dead and you do not succeed by at least 3, it attacks you.
[elder_thing]: -5. If you fail, Daisy Walker takes 1 horror.
parallel/rod_encounter.name: Read or Die
parallel/rod_encounter.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the number of [[Tome]] assets Daisy Walker controls.
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail, discard the top 2 cards of your deck.
[tablet]: -2. If this is an attack or evasion attempt against Namer of the Dead and you do not succeed by at least 2, it attacks you.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, Daisy Walker takes 1 horror.

parallel/rod_encounter.back_flavor: A tremendous whirlwind and a thunderous voice erupts from the Necronomicon, sending a tornado of pages into the sky. A sinister shadow looms over the entire campus, then escapes through the ensuing tempest. When it is done, the grimoire clatters to the floor, devoid of energy. Whatever presence it held before is now gone. It feels somehow empty in your hands.
parallel/rod_encounter.flavor: Whatever entity has been unleashed from within the Necronomicon, it is spreading across the campus like a deadly shadow. You must put a stop to it before it grows too powerful to be contained.
parallel/rod_encounter.name: Mortal Inquiry
parallel/rod_encounter.text:
Dr. Henry Armitage does not take up an ally slot and gains: "You have 2 additional hand slots, which can only be used to hold [[Tome]] assets."
"Jazz" Mulligan gains: "[action]: Move to a [[Miskatonic]] location up to 3 connections away."

parallel/rod_encounter.back_flavor: You stand in the restricted section of the Orne Library, surrounded by volumes of ancient, heretical texts. The incantations you have found may prove to be enough to dispel the entity - or perhaps bind it back within the Necronomicon from whence it came. Your voice rises to a crescendo as you repeat the words. Shadows crawl across the room. The walls and ceiling bend. Pages flutter in the tempestuous gale. Every fiber of your hair is whisked into the air. All is swept away in the ensuing chaos, like a wet paintbrush kissing the canvas of reality.
parallel/rod_encounter.flavor: The way to seal this being away must be recorded in one of the many tomes around campus...
parallel/rod_encounter.name: Speed Reading
parallel/rod_encounter.text: Ignore all Objectives on locations. [fast] If you are Daisy Walker, investigators at your location spend 1 [per_investigator] clues: Shuffle 1 facedown player card beneath this location into your deck. Objective - Find a way to banish the Namer of the Dead before it is too late.

parallel/rod_encounter.name: Namer of the Dead
parallel/rod_encounter.text: Hunter. Prey - Daisy Walker only. Forced - When Namer of the Dead would be defeated: Instead, fully heal it, exhaust it, and move it to Orne Library. [action] If you are Daisy Walker and you control at least 4 non-weakness [[Tome]] assets: Parley. Text [willpower] (18). This test gets -2 difficulty for each [[Tome]] asset you control. If you succeed, advance the act.

parallel/aon_encounter.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -2 for each clue you have.
[cultist]: -4 (-8 instead if you have 10 or more resources).
[tablet]: -3. Lose 3 resources.
[elder_thing]: -5. If you fail, "Skids" O'Toole takes 1 horror.
parallel/aon_encounter.name: All or Nothing
parallel/aon_encounter.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1 for each clue you have.
[cultist]: -2 (-4 instead if you have 10 or more resources).
[tablet]: -2. If you fail, lose 3 resources.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, "Skids" O'Toole takes 1 horror.

parallel/aon_encounter.back_flavor: It's getting late, and you've been gambling all night. Exhausted, you try to stand up, but stumble and spill your drink all over a scruffy-looking fellow at your table. Slowly turning to you with a wicked scowl, the husky hoodlum stares at you with contempt. The man leaps out of his seat and lunges at you. Now you've done it. The mobsters are sure to kick you out...
parallel/aon_encounter.back_text: Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated and suffers 1 physical trauma. If "Skids" O'Toole has resigned, proceed to (→R1). Otherwise, proceed to (→R2)
parallel/aon_encounter.flavor: The Clover Club is filled with mobsters and gamblers from all walks of life. Winning big without causing alarm may not be as easy as you thought.
parallel/aon_encounter.name: Eyes All Around You
parallel/aon_encounter.text: [action] If you are in the Clover Club Cardroom, spend any number of clues: You cash in your chips. Gain 5 resources for each clue just spent. Forced - If "Skids" O'Toole is defeated: (→R2)

parallel/aon_encounter.back_flavor:
Fueled by luck and adrenaline, you've wont a bit too much and failed to keep a low profile. The O'Bannions know you're here and despise having their money stolen by "cheaters." A commanding voice from La Bella Luna calls out, "That O'Toole vermin is here. Split up and get him!"
You freeze and your mind clears at the sound of your name. It may be time to stop. Once-oblivious mobsters now rise and pursue you with fierce determination. Do you confront the trouble before escaping out the front, or do you try to find the back door?
parallel/aon_encounter.back_text: Spawn the set-aside Siobhan Riley enemy in La Bella Luna. Each investigator spawns 1 set-aside Clover Club Bouncer enemy engaged with them.
parallel/aon_encounter.flavor: You don't want trouble, so it's best not to cause it. Try not to go all in too soon, or you'll likely take the bounce.
parallel/aon_encounter.name: Playing Cards
parallel/aon_encounter.text: Investigators cannot resign. Clover Club Pit Boss gains aloof. Forced - After a [[Criminal]] enemy is defeated: Place 1 doom on the agenda. Objective - At the end of the round: If an investigator has 15 or more resources, advance.

parallel/aon_encounter.back_flavor: You run out the door and sprint around the corner, winnings in hand. The adrenaline rush is like no other. Once at a safe distance, you count your money. You take a deep breath and are relieved; this outing put a big dent in your debts. Surely this night will only add to your reputation. Lady Luck is always on your side!
parallel/aon_encounter.name: Hot on your Tail
parallel/aon_encounter.text: Each [[Criminal]] enemy gains hunter and gets +1 health. Forced - When an investigator resigns: Place each of that investigator's resources on this act. Objective - Collect as many resources as you can and get out. When each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

parallel/aon_encounter.name: Siobhan Riley
parallel/aon_encounter.text: Forced - After Siobhan Riley engages you: For every 5 resources you have, lose 1 resource. Forced - After an investigator at Siobhan Riley's location gains 1 or more resources during the investigation phase: Siobhan Riley readies, engages that investigator, and makes an attack.

parallel/aon_encounter.name: Clover Club Bouncer
parallel/aon_encounter.text: When Clover Club Bouncer is engaged with you, it gets +1 fight and +1 evade for every 5 resources you have. [action] Spend 3 resources: Parley. Test [intellect] (2). If you succeed, disengage from Clover Club Bouncer and exhaust it. It does not ready during the next upkeep phase.

parallel/otr.back_flavor: At night, "Ashcan" Pete sleeps wherever his travels take him: in a field, on a train, or maybe, if he’s lucky, in a barn. He bunks with his loyal hound dog, Duke, on one side and his beat-up guitar on the other. And sometimes when Pete sleeps, he dreams. He dreams of haunted, tortured places and of horrible creatures. When he wakes up, he knows that someone needs his help, because his dreams are true. He could not say how long he has been on the road, living by his wits, but he can say for certain no place is too far to go to help someone in need. And as long as Pete can help people, he is not likely to stop wandering any time soon.
parallel/otr.back_text: Deck size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Survivor cards ([survivor]) level 0-3, [[Improvised]] and [[Tactic]] cards level 0-4, Neutral cards level 0-5, up to 5 other Guardian cards ([guardian]) level 0. Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Duke, Wracked by Nightmares, 1 random basic weakness.

deck_options.error: You cannot have more than 5 level 0 Guardian cards

parallel/otr.flavor: "C'mere, boy... We got work to do."
parallel/otr.name: "Ashcan" Pete
parallel/otr.text:
You begin the game with Pete's Guitar in play.
[reaction] When a card you own that is attached to a scenario card would be discarded: Add it to your hand instead. (Limit once per round.)
[elder_sign] effect: +1. Choose a card you own attached to a scenario card. You may return the chosen card to your hand.

parallel/otr.name: Pete's Guitar
parallel/otr.text:
"Ashcan" Pete deck only. Replacement.
[fast] Exhaust Pete's Guitar: Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location or a connecting location. Move that enemy once in a direction of your choice. Then, if there are no enemies at your location, either heal 1 horror or gain 1 resource.

parallel/otr.name: Hard Times
parallel/otr.text: Replacement. Revelation - Put Hard Times into play in your threat area. Forced - After you draw 1 or more cards: Choose and discard that many cards from hand. [action][action]: Discard Hard Times.

tcu/fgg_encounter.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is the total number of doom among [[Cultist]] enemies in play.
[cultist]: -2. Reveal another token.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, place 1 doom on each [[Cultist]] enemy in play. If there are no [[Cultist]] enemies in play, reveal another token.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, move all doom from the [[Cultist]] enemy with the most doom on it to the current agenda. If no [[Cultist]] enemies in play have doom on them, reveal another token.
tcu/fgg_encounter.name: For the Greater Good
tcu/fgg_encounter.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the highest number of doom on a [[Cultist]] enemy in play.
[cultist]: -2. Reveal another token.
[tablet]: -3. If you fail, place 1 doom on the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, move 1 doom from the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy to the current agenda.

tcu/fgg_encounter.back_flavor:
As you explore the building, you almost wander into a heated debate between several members of the Lodge in a nearby hallway. Seeing an opportunity to learn more, you hide and eavesdrop on the conversation. "Mr. Sanford's orders are to complete the geist-trap at any cost," one of them says firmly. "If that means we must put lives in danger, so be it. The good of the many outweigh the good of the few; you know this."
Another member, a woman, pounds her fist on the wall."No! Our first resort cannot be to spill blood. There must be another way."
"There is no time," the other responds, and there is a murmur of agreement among the rest. "It is clear you do not have the will to proceed. Take her away. We will make her see for herself the sacrifices that must be made for the greater good."
"No! You can't do this!" the woman yells. You wince as her screams echo down the corridor. What are they planning to do?
tcu/fgg_encounter.back_text: Discard the top 5 cards of the encounter deck. In player order, each investigator must draw a [[Cultist]] enemy discarded in this way.
tcu/fgg_encounter.flavor:
ADAPT YOUR BELIEFS AND BE OPEN TO NEW TRUTHS.
YOU ARE EXPECTED TO CONFORM.
DO NOT STRAY FROM THE PATH.
tcu/fgg_encounter.name: THE HIEROPHANT · V
tcu/fgg_encounter.text: Forced - When you defeat a [[Silver Twilight]] enemy: You leave behind some evidence of the scuffle. Move 1 doom from each enemy at that location to the current agenda.

tcu/fgg_encounter.back_text: Revelation - Replace the act and agenda decks with The Greater Good. Spawn the set-aside Summoned Beast at the Puzzle Box's location (or any [[Sanctum]] location if the Puzzle Box is not in play) and remove the Puzzle Box from the game.
tcu/fgg_encounter.flavor: The Lodge will resort to drastic measures in order to achieve their goals. If you don’t act quickly, blood will surely be shed.
tcu/fgg_encounter.name: Ends and Means
tcu/fgg_encounter.text: Each [[Silver Twilight]] enemy in a [[Sanctum]] location loses aloof. Forced - When you defeat a [[Silver Twilight]] enemy: You leave behind some evidence of the scuffle. Move 1 doom from each enemy at that location to the current agenda.

tcu/fgg_encounter.back_flavor: "Ah, it's you." You are approached by a member of the Lodge whom you recognize: one of Carl Sanford's bodyguards from your previous meeting with the president. "I regret to inform you that Mr. Sanford and the other members of the Lodge are busy with an important task at the moment. I would suggest you come back at a later time." You tell the man that your task is important, and offer to help in return for a meeting with Mr. Sanford. He considers you for a moment, then nods. "All right. We are attempting to open a device which we believe will help us bind the revenant you encountered earlier. You'll want to speak with Nathan Wick if you want to help. You can find him in the library upstairs." You thank him and turn to leave, but he grabs your arm and stops you, adding one final warning: "You should know that we intend to open this device at any cost. If you cannot stomach the consequences, once again, I suggest you leave."
tcu/fgg_encounter.back_text: If the Library is not in play, put it into play. Spawn the set-aside Nathan Wick enemy in the Library, (Master of Initiation) side faceup. Attach the set-aside Puzzle Box story asset to him.
tcu/fgg_encounter.flavor: You have arrived at the Lodge’s manor in French Hill to see if they can help you piece together the evidence you’ve collected. Perhaps you can even speak with the president of the Lodge again. But as you approach the manor, you begin to wonder if this was a test of your loyalty all along.
tcu/fgg_encounter.name: Warm Welcome

tcu/fgg_encounter.back_flavor:
At first, your investigation yields few answers. There is indeed a meeting of some sort happening at the manor tonight, though you're not sure why. Finally, you catch a break. On a nearby table, a written summons explains the reason for tonight's gathering:
"Our timetable has moved forward. We must complete the trap by midnight tonight. The device we found will aid us in binding the revenant, so it is imperative that we find a way to open it before the ceremony begins. We have no time to waste with prudence or cowardice. Report to Nathan Wick in the sanctum at once."
You are left with more questions than answers.
tcu/fgg_encounter.back_text: If the Inner Sanctum is not in play, put it into play. Spawn the set-aside Nathan Wick enemy in the Inner Sanctum, (Master of Indoctrination) side faceup. Attach the set-aside Puzzle Box story asset to him. For the remainder of the game, the current act gains "[reaction] After you evade an enemy: Remove all doom from it." Place this card next to the act deck as a reminder, then advance to act 2a.
tcu/fgg_encounter.flavor: The Lodge is up to something - you’re sure of it. You’re not sure exactly what their plans entail, but your suspicions have proven correct so far. You have decided to sneak into the Lodge’s manor in French Hill to learn what they are plotting.
tcu/fgg_encounter.name: Infiltrating the Lodge
tcu/fgg_encounter.text: [reaction] After you evade an enemy: Remove all doom from it.

tcu/fgg_encounter.back_text:
If you advanced by defeating Nathan Wick:
You quickly pry the device from Nathan's hands and flee before you are noticed.
If you advanced by evading Nathan Wick:
You wait until Nathan is not looking, then sweep in and steal the device from the table next to him. You are long gone by the time he realizes it is missing.
If you advanced by parleying with Nathan Wick:
"All right, listen," Nathan explains quietly. "Truth is, there probably is a safer way for us to open the device. This building holds many secrets; more than you could possible know. But time is running thin, and Mr. Sanford wants it open by midnight. If you can open it before then, great. If not, well... If I were you, I wouldn't be around it when we try to force it open." He hands you the device and walks away, leaving you in silence.
tcu/fgg_encounter.flavor: Whatever the Lodge is planning, it involves a "device" they will do anything to open. It seems a Lodge member by the name of Nathan Wick holds the device at the moment. One way or another, you have to get your hands on it.
tcu/fgg_encounter.name: Obtaining the Device
tcu/fgg_encounter.text: Objective - If Nathan Wick is added to the victory display by any means, choose an investigator to take control of the attached Puzzle Box, and advance.

tcu/fgg_encounter.back_flavor: Though the box itself seems to fight you at every turn, with all four key components in your possession, you finally manage to piece together how to open the contraption. First, you twist and contort the box's many mechanical devices until the image on its lid lines up perfectly with the diagram in your possession ([tablet]). Next, you chant the Latin incantation inscribed on the small wooden plaque you found ([cultist]). It takes a few tries to get it right, but eventually you hear a click as the surface of the wooden container shifts and changes. A round indentation has appeared on the side of the box, matching the size of your mysterious block onyx coin ([elder_thing]). As soon as you place the coin inside, another wooden panel opens on the other side, revealing a keyhole. Finally, you insert the key of bone ([skull]) into the keyhole and turn it. The lid begins to open, and suddenly the entirety of the room is engulfed in a rush of air as all light, color, sound, and matter is sucked into the box.
tcu/fgg_encounter.back_text: Check Campaign Log. - If the investigators are members of the Lodge, (→R1). - Otherwise, (→R2).
tcu/fgg_encounter.flavor: The "device" is nothing more than a locked puzzle box, just about large enough to hold a pair of shoes. The diagram on its surface depicts a broken pattern which can be manipulated to no apparent end, and there does not appear to be a keyhole of any kind.
tcu/fgg_encounter.name: The Four Keys
tcu/fgg_encounter.text: Objective - If investigators at the same location control the Puzzle Box, the [skull] key, the [cultist] key, the [tablet] key, and the [elder_thing] key, advance.

tcu/fgg_encounter.back_flavor: As you approach the gates of the Lodge’s manor in French Hill, you are surprised to see several automobiles parked nearby, in the street. Light shines in several of the windows of the manor. Is there a gathering of some sort here tonight?
tcu/fgg_encounter.flavor: The headquarters of the Silver Twilight Lodge is a gorgeous Victorian mansion in French Hill, overlooking most of the city. Light flickers beyond its prominent stained-glass door.
tcu/fgg_encounter.name: Lodge Gates
tcu/fgg_encounter.text: Enemies cannot spawn at the Lodge Gates. [action]: Resign. On second thought, maybe coming here was a bad idea.

tcu/fgg_encounter.back_flavor: As you approach the gates of the Lodge’s manor in French Hill, you are surprised to see several automobiles parked nearby, in the street. Light shines in several of the windows of the manor. Is there a gathering of some sort here tonight?
tcu/fgg_encounter.flavor: The headquarters of the Silver Twilight Lodge is a gorgeous Victorian mansion in French Hill, overlooking most of the city. Light flickers beyond its prominent stained-glass door.
tcu/fgg_encounter.name: Lodge Gates
tcu/fgg_encounter.text: Enemies cannot spawn at the Lodge Gates. [action]: Resign. On second thought, maybe coming here was a bad idea.

tcu/fgg_encounter.back_flavor: The front entrance to the Lodge’s manor is guarded by two men in trenchcoats, who nod to you as you approach.
tcu/fgg_encounter.back_text: The entrance to the Silver Twilight Lodge is guarded. You cannot enter the Lobby. Lodge Gates gains: "[action]: Parley. The guards recognize you from the Meiger estate and let you pass. Reveal the Lobby."
tcu/fgg_encounter.flavor: The guards step aside and allow you to enter the lobby. "Mr. Sanford has been expecting you," one of them says cryptically. The interior of the mansion is clean and well-kept, as you would expect from Arkham's most prestigious social club. Plaques, pictures, and other trinkets adorn the wooden walls, hinting at the Lodge's long and storied history.
tcu/fgg_encounter.name: Lobby

tcu/fgg_encounter.back_flavor: The front entrance to the Lodge’s manor is guarded by two men in trenchcoats. Perhaps there is another way into the building...
tcu/fgg_encounter.flavor: The interior of the mansion is clean and well-kept, as you would expect from Arkham's most prestigious social club. Plaques, pictures, and other trinkets adorn the wooden walls, hinting at the Lodge's long and storied history.
tcu/fgg_encounter.name: Lobby
tcu/fgg_encounter.text: Forced - After the Lobby is revealed: Place 1 random set-aside key on it.

tcu/fgg_encounter.back_flavor: Several locked windows along the basement level of the manor reveal the dark cellar within.
tcu/fgg_encounter.flavor: The cellar of the Lodge contains only a large wine rack and several unmarked barrels. A heavy steel door bars your passage deeper into the basement. You almost don't want to know what lies beyond it. Almost.
tcu/fgg_encounter.name: Lodge Cellar
tcu/fgg_encounter.text: Forced - After the Lodge Cellar is revealed: Place 1 random set-aside key on it.

tcu/fgg_encounter.back_flavor: Several windows along the basement level of the manor reveal the dark cellar within.
tcu/fgg_encounter.back_text:
The rear entrance to the Silver Twilight Lodge is hidden. You cannot enter the Lodge Cellar.
Lodge Gates gains: "[action] Investigators at the Lodge Gates spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Reveal the Lodge Cellar."
tcu/fgg_encounter.flavor: You slip through an unlocked window into the building's cellar. It contains only a large wine rack and several unmarked barrels. A heavy steel door bars your passage deeper into the basement. You almost don't want to know what lies beyond it. Almost.
tcu/fgg_encounter.name: Lodge Cellar

tcu/fgg_encounter.back_flavor: As you approach the staircase leading to the second floor of the mansion, you smell burning candle wax. It is quiet enough that you can hear the gentle crinkling of a page being turned.
tcu/fgg_encounter.flavor: As you enter the warm lounge, you spot an elegantly dressed man reading by the fire. To your surprise, he pays you almost no heed whatsoever.
tcu/fgg_encounter.name: Lounge
tcu/fgg_encounter.text: Forced - After the Lounge is revealed: Put the set-aside Vault and Library locations into play. Put the set-aside August Lindquist asset into play in the Lounge. Place 1 random set-aside key on him.

tcu/fgg_encounter.back_flavor: A heavy wooden door with an iron-barred window appears to lead into a small vault. It is sealed shut from prying eyes.
tcu/fgg_encounter.back_text: The door to the Vault is locked. You cannot enter the Vault unless you control the [elder_thing] key.
tcu/fgg_encounter.flavor: This simple unadorned room contains many shelves and filing cabinets, where important documents and records pertaining to the Lodge are kept. A small combination safe hides in a corner of the room. You wonder what secrets you could uncover here if you had more time.
tcu/fgg_encounter.name: Vault
tcu/fgg_encounter.text: Forced - After the Vault is revealed: Place 1 random set-aside key on it.

tcu/fgg_encounter.back_flavor: A narrow, windowless hallway slopes upward from the lounge, leading you to a tall, wooden door.
tcu/fgg_encounter.flavor: Even the Lodge's library is arranged to showcase the organization's wealth and power. There are hundreds of books among the room's tall, cramped shelves.
tcu/fgg_encounter.name: Library
tcu/fgg_encounter.text: While you are investigating the Library, if you control the [tablet] key, the Library gets -3 shroud.

tcu/fgg_encounter.back_flavor: A windowless steel door blocks your way into paths unknown. You get the feeling this basement is much larger than it appears.
tcu/fgg_encounter.back_text: The door to the catacombs is locked. You cannot enter the Lodge Catacombs unless you control at least 1 ([skull]/[cultist]/[tablet]/[elder_thing]) key.
tcu/fgg_encounter.flavor: Beyond the steel door, torchlit stone halls lead deeper underground. Compared to the polished wood upstairs, this area feels grimy and unclean. What the hell is this place?
tcu/fgg_encounter.name: Lodge Catacombs
tcu/fgg_encounter.text: Forced - When Lodge Catacombs is revealed: Put the set-aside Inner Sanctum and each of the set-aside Sanctum Doorway locations into play.

tcu/fgg_encounter.back_flavor: Beyond a stone archway lies an unmarked iron door, mocking you with untold secrets and hidden truths.
tcu/fgg_encounter.flavor: At the center of this room lies an ornately carved stone altar. Blood drains from the altar through a series of channels in the mosaic stone floor.
tcu/fgg_encounter.name: Ceremony Room
tcu/fgg_encounter.text: Forced - When the round ends: Each investigator and each [[Ally]] asset in the Ceremony Room takes 1 direct horror. Cancel this effect if an investigator in the Ceremony Room controls the [skull] key.

tcu/fgg_encounter.back_flavor: Beyond a stone archway lies an unmarked iron door, mocking you with untold secrets and hidden truths.
tcu/fgg_encounter.name: Holding Cells
tcu/fgg_encounter.text: Forced - After Holding Cells is revealed: Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Cultist]] enemy and spawn it in the Holding Cells. Shuffle the encounter deck.
