eoe/eoec.text: Forced – When a treachery is attached to Rocky Crags: That treachery gains surge. (Max once per phase.) Shelter 3.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"...it surely looked like madness to find six imperfect monstrosities carefully buried upright in nine-foot snow graves under five-pointed mounds..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.back_text: As an additional cost for you to enter this location, investigators at your location must spend 2 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
eoe/eoec.name: Snow Graves
eoe/eoec.text: [reaction] After you discover the last clue from Snow Graves, shuffle the top 3 cards of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck without looking at them: In the "Supplies Recovered" section of the Campaign Log, record Green Soapstone. (Group limit once per campaign.) Shelter 5.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"...we effected a difficult landing on Ross Island shortly after midnight on the morning of the 9th..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.back_text: As an additional cost for you to enter this location, investigators at your location must spend 2 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
eoe/eoec.name: Icebreaker Landing
eoe/eoec.text: [action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (4) to search the trapped ship for supplies. If you succeed, either remove 1 [frost] token from the chaos bag or record Small Radio in the "Supplies Recovered" section of the Campaign Log. (Max one success per campaign.) Shelter 5.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"Close flying shews many cave-mouths, some unusually regular in outline, square or semicircular. You must come and investigate."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.back_text: As an additional cost for you to enter this location, investigators at your location must spend 2 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
eoe/eoec.name: Frigid Cave
eoe/eoec.text: [action] Add 1 [frost] token to the chaos bag: In the "Supplies Recovered" section of the Campaign Log, record Mineral Specimen. (Group limit once per campaign.) Shelter 6.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"Our camp on the frozen shore below the volcano’s slope was only a provisional one; headquarters being kept aboard the Arkham."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.back_text: As an additional cost for you to enter this location, investigators at your location must spend 4 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
eoe/eoec.name: Barrier Camp
eoe/eoec.text: [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (4) to convince some of the other explorers here to give you something useful. If you succeed, in the "Supplies Recovered" section of the Campaign Log, record Dynamite. (Max one success per campaign.) Shelter 7.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"It is only with vast hesitancy and repugnance that I let my mind go back to Lake’s camp and what we really found there..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.back_text: As an additional cost for you to enter this location, investigators at your location must spend 4 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
eoe/eoec.name: Remnants of Lake’s Camp
eoe/eoec.text: [action]: Test [combat] (4) to dig through the snow in search of supplies. If you succeed, in the "Supplies Recovered" section of the Campaign Log, record Wooden Sledge. (Max one success per campaign.) Shelter 7.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"Parts, especially upper parts, seem to be of lighter-coloured rock than any visible strata on slopes proper, hence an evidently crystalline origin."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.back_text: As an additional cost for you to enter this location, investigators at your location must spend 4 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
eoe/eoec.name: Crystalline Cavern
eoe/eoec.text: [action]: Test [agility] (5) to climb up one of the crystalline walls in search of evidence. If you succeed, in the "Supplies Recovered" section of the Campaign Log, record Miasmic Crystal. (Max one success per campaign.) Shelter 8.

eoe/eoec.name: Skittering Nonsense
eoe/eoec.text: Hunter. Forced – When you defeat Skittering Nonsense: Shuffle the top card of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck without looking at it (if you cannot, Skittering Nonsense attacks you).

eoe/eoec.name: Apeirophobia
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation – Test [willpower] (X), where X is your location’s shelter value. If you fail, you must decide (choose one): - Take 1 horror for each point you failed by. - Place 2 of your clues on your location. - Add 1 [frost] token to the chaos bag.

eoe/eoec.name: Zero Visibility
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation – Put Zero Visibility into play in your threat area. As an additional cost for you to leave a location with a treachery attached to it, you must spend 1 action. Forced – At the end of your turn: Test [agility] (2). If you succeed, discard Zero Visibility.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"Hold on! Come see this!" one of the other team members shouts as you trudge ahead through the snow. You turn back and examine what they have found - a second set of tracks in the snow, but smaller, misshapen. Almost impossibly so.
"What in the hell could have made these tracks?" one of your party asks. You stand dumbfounded. Very little wildlife exists out here in the frozen wastes. And these tracks match nothing you’ve ever seen before. Nothing you can even imagine.
You don’t have to question what could make such tracks for long. A shape emerges from the erupting snow, twisted and deformed, like a splotch of ink spilled upon the canvas of reality. It makes
a strange, almost familiar cry that is eaten by the howling wind: "- li! -li!" Then, with terrifying speed, it rushes toward you.
eoe/eoec.back_text: Spawn a set-aside Skittering Nonsense at the lead investigator’s location. Shuffle the remainder of the set-aside Skittering Nonsense enemies and the set-aside Creatures in the Ice encounter set into the encounter deck.
eoe/eoec.flavor: This isn’t exactly how you imagined your first foray into the Antarctic wilds. The stinging cold and lashing, frozen winds will only get worse over time.
eoe/eoec.name: Cold Welcome
eoe/eoec.text: Forced - After a location is entered by an investigator for the first time: Put into play each set-aside location connected to that location. (Use the map in the Campaign Guide for reference.)

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
These things, these manifestations, they’re not beasts or even alien creatures like those Dyer and Danforth encountered in their last expedition. You’re not even sure they are entities at all. They have no shape, consisting of an almost proto-plasmic substance that seeps back into the ice when harmed or whenever you escape their clutches. Given the persistence of these entities and the inclement, deadly conditions of Antarctica, you know you won’t survive the night without finding shelter.
Just as you are pondering what your next move should be, the ice beneath you rumbles with tremendous force, letting out a terrifying groan. "An earthquake?" one of your party asks over the raucous noise.
"No, that’s impossible," another replies. You share a dreadful glance. Could it be one of those...things?
eoe/eoec.back_text: Spawn the set-aside Terror of the Stars enemy at the revealed location with the highest shelter value.
eoe/eoec.flavor: Something dwells beneath the ice. Something you’ve never seen or heard of before, not even in William Dyer’s horrifying report. Something...unreal.
eoe/eoec.name: Into the White
eoe/eoec.text: Forced - After a location is entered by an investigator for the first time: Put into play each set-aside location connected to that location. (Use the map in the Campaign Guide for reference.)

eoe/eoec.back_flavor: You can go on no longer. It’s not ideal, but you’ll have to make do with the shelter you’ve found. You only hope that it’s enough to keep your party from freezing... or worse.
eoe/eoec.back_text: Each investigator, including those who are eliminated, shuffles the top card of the Tekeli-li deck into their deck. Choose a location in play with no clues on it. Each undefeated investigator moves to that location and immediately resigns. The higher that location’s shelter value, the better. If the investigators cannot choose such a location, they must move to the Crash Site and immediately resign, even if they otherwise could not. (Then, resolve the [[Objective]] on act 1a.)
eoe/eoec.flavor: The sun hangs low in the sky, but never sets. Your party is exhausted from the long , arduous day. Though the sky is never plunged into the dark of night, you know it’s only a matter of time before you are forced to make camp.
eoe/eoec.name: Running Out of Time
eoe/eoec.text: Forced - After a location is entered by an investigator for the first time: Put into play each set-aside location connected to that location. (Use the map in the Campaign Guide for reference.)

eoe/eoec.back_flavor: Exhausted and terrified by your ordeal, you decide this is as good a place as any to make camp for the night. Perhaps tomorrow you can salvage some kind of academic value out of this hellish journey, but for now such things seem trivial. Survival is the only thing on your mind.
eoe/eoec.flavor: You’re going to have to find a way back to camp, and soon...or you’ll have to make due camping in the wilds.
eoe/eoec.name: Search for a Camp Site
eoe/eoec.text: [action] If each investigator is at the same location and that location has no clues on it: Resign. You set up camp. Each investigator resigns. Objective – Find somewhere safe to set up camp. If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance. The higher the shelter value of the location they resigned at, the better.

eoe/eoec.name: Terror of the Stars
eoe/eoec.text:
Hunter. Massive.
Terror of the Stars gets +3 [per_investigator] health.
While Terror of the Stars is ready, investigators cannot resign at its location or discover clues at its location.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor: As you journey through the glacial wilds, you stumble across a set of tracks in the snow leading farther from camp. You pause and investigate further. Were these tracks made by one of your missing team members? Or by something more...monstrous?
eoe/eoec.back_text: Choose a facedown encounter card beneath a location. Look at the other side of that card (without resolving its text). Then return it facedown beneath that location.
eoe/eoec.flavor: Several of your party have mysteriously vanished in the night. Without a sign of any struggle, you can only assume they left of their own accord...but why?
eoe/eoec.name: A Harsh Wind Blows

eoe/eoec.back_flavor: As you journey through the glacial wilds, you stumble across a set of tracks in the snow leading farther from camp. You pause and investigate further. Were these tracks made by one of your missing team members? Or by something more...monstrous?
eoe/eoec.back_text: Choose a facedown encounter card beneath a location. Look at the other side of that card (without resolving its text). Then return it facedown beneath that location.
eoe/eoec.flavor: The low-hanging sun dimly illuminates the Antarctic night. Gray clouds cover the sky, threatening an icy storm.
eoe/eoec.name: The Chill of Night

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
As the night ends, the storm arrives in its full ferocity. Raging, icy winds and dense snowfall make your task impossible. You’ll never find the remaining team members in these conditions, and even if you did...
A hard lump of guilt and despair forms in your throat. There’s no way they would survive in this storm, not without supplies or shelter. That you are forced to choose between your life and theirs is a burden you will surely carry with you for the rest of your life. And you’ll be lucky if that's more than a couple of days.
eoe/eoec.back_text: Each remaining investigator is defeated and suffers 1 mental trauma. (→R1)
eoe/eoec.flavor: The storm grows closer, and with it looming in the sky, that damnable sound returns. It haunts you with its presence, worming its way into your mind. Is it the cause of this folly? This madness?
eoe/eoec.name: Madness and Death

eoe/eoec.back_flavor: With night coming to a close, the storm approaches faster and faster. Soon, the weather will be too deadly for your search to continue. If anyone is still out there, you doubt they’ll survive - and neither will you if you remain unsheltered any longer. You return to your camp, your heart heavy with guilt and and your mind addled by that foul noise that festers within.
eoe/eoec.flavor: You set out to search for the missing team members, hoping to find them before daybreak...
eoe/eoec.name: The Lost Expedition
eoe/eoec.text: [fast] Investigators at your location spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Draw the encounter card beneath your location. [action] If you are at camp: Resign. You turn in for the night. Objective – Find as many missing expedition members as you can by adding them to the victory display, then head back to camp before daybreak. If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

eoe/eoec.flavor: There is nothing here but ice and snow, and no sign of any missing team members. Frustrated, you turn back. You won't find anyone here.
eoe/eoec.name: Dead End
eoe/eoec.text:
Remove 1 [frost] token from the chaos bag.
Add this story card to the victory display.

eoe/eoec.flavor:
As you traverse the glacial wilds, something rumbles and churns beneath your feet. Is that where these depths of the ice?
A somber thought crosses your mind. If you are right, such entities could exert their vile influence no matter where you stand. Perhaps this has something to do with your missing companions after all, though there are no signs of them here.
eoe/eoec.name: Cracks in the Ice
eoe/eoec.text:
Search your deck for a copy of Tekeli-li and place it on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck without resolving it. Shuffle your deck.
Add this story card to the victory display.

eoe/eoec.flavor: You come across evidence of one of your lost companions, abandoned and half-buried in snow - torn scraps from a heavy fur coat and a pair of goggles. Examining the goggles closely yields a terrifying discovery - a dark, sticky substance that you cannot, for the life of you, identify.
eoe/eoec.name: Somber Remains
eoe/eoec.text:
Search the top 9 cards of your deck for each copy of Tekeli-li and place each one you find on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck without resolving it. Shuffle your deck.
Add this story card to the victory display.

eoe/eoec.flavor:
The tracks continue for some time before vanishing , bafflingly, into the snow. There’s no sign of any struggle, nor are there any other tracks that might indicate where they could have gone. Could the winds have covered the tracks? And if so, why were you able to follow the rest of the footprints so easily?
But when you turn back to examine the prints you first followed, they too are gone.
eoe/eoec.name: Disappearing Footprints
eoe/eoec.text:
Remove 1 [frost] token from the chaos bag.
Add this story card to the victory display.

eoe/eoec.flavor: You follow a set of tracks into a small cavern carved into a glacial wall, and your stomach lurches at the sight before you. One of your missing team members lies in a crumpled heap at the end of the hollow, his clothing torn open. A clean vertical incision has bisected his torso open from his sternum to his belly, and his entrails have been carefully removed. You struggle not to retch. Who could have possibly done such a thing?
eoe/eoec.name: Dissected Explorer
eoe/eoec.text:
Search your deck for a copy of Tekeli-li and place it on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck without resolving it. Shuffle your deck.
Add this story card to the victory display.

eoe/eoec.flavor: You are fleeing from a creature made of kaleidoscopic ooze when you suddenly freeze in place, a web of cracks reaching out across the ice beneath your boots. Your breath catches in your throat. Another step could spell your doom or save your life. Behind you, the entity gains on you, reaching out with arms that are not quite solid or liquid. Feeling lucky, you decide to roll the dice, striking the ground behind you and fleeing to the side. Just as you hoped, the ice is thin enough to splinter open, and the creature tumbles down through the crack, into the icy depths. You breathe a sigh of relief, thankful you did not share a similar fate.
eoe/eoec.name: Evil Within
eoe/eoec.text:
Discard an [[Eidolon]] enemy that does not have the [[Elite]] trait from play.
Add this story card to the victory display.

eoe/eoec.flavor: You follow a set of footprints through the snow, hoping they will lead you to a sign, any sign, of your lost companions. Sadly, the evidence you discover is not the kind you were hoping to find. Where the prints end, you find an ice pick covered in freshly frozen blood. To your horror, a human eye lies nearby, staining the snow red. A shudder creeps up your spine. What on Earth could compel somebody to do such a thing?
eoe/eoec.name: Bloody Evidence
eoe/eoec.text:
Search the top 9 cards of your deck for each copy of Tekeli-li and place each one you find on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck without resolving it. Shuffle your deck.
Add this story card to the victory display.

eoe/eoec.flavor: To your relief, you come across one of your missing team members - but they are not themself. Their eyes glazed over, their expression dazed and lost. A murky, slimy substance drips from their face and trickles onto the ice below. When you finally manage to get through to them, they wipe the strange, inky miasma from their face, staining their cheeks black. "What...was I doing?" they ask.
eoe/eoec.name: Madness Inside
eoe/eoec.text:
Choose a [[Possessed]] enemy in play that does not have the [[Elite]] trait. Take control of each doom on that enemy, flipping them to their clue sides. Discard the chosen enemy.
Add this story card to the victory display.

eoe/eoec.name: Professor William Dyer
eoe/eoec.text: [action] Choose and discard up to 2 cards from your hand: Parley. Place that many resources on Professor William Dyer (from the token bank). If there are 3 [per_investigator] resources on him, add him to the victory display. Forced – If Professor William Dyer is defeated: Cross his name off in the Campaign Log.

eoe/eoec.name: Danforth
eoe/eoec.text: [action]: Parley. You listen closely to Danforth’s rambling. Draw up to 2 cards from the top of the Tekeli-li deck. Then, place that many resources on Danforth (from the token pool). If there are 3 [per_investigator] resources on him, add him to the victory display. Forced – If Danforth is defeated: Cross his name off in the Campaign Log.

eoe/eoec.name: Eliyah Ashevak
eoe/eoec.text: [action]: Parley. Test [agility] (2) to sneak by Anyu and speak with Eliyah. For each point you succeed by, place 1 resource on him (from the token pool). If you fail, he attacks you. If there are 2 [per_investigator] resources on him, add him to the victory display. Forced – If Eliyah Ashevak is defeated: Cross his name off in the Campaign Log.

eoe/eoec.name: Dr. Mala Sinha
eoe/eoec.text: [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (2) to attempt to calm Dr. Sinha down. For each point you succeed by, place 1 resource on her (from the token pool). If you fail, she attacks you. If there are 2 [per_investigator] resources on her, add her to the victory display. Forced – If Dr. Mala Sinha is defeated: Cross her name off in the Campaign Log.

eoe/eoec.name: Avery Claypool
eoe/eoec.text: [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (5) to get Claypool to stop babbling nonsense. If you succeed, place 1 resource on him (from the token pool). If you fail, he attacks you. If there are 1 [per_investigator] resources on him, add him to the victory display. Forced – If Avery Claypool is defeated: Cross his name off in the Campaign Log.

eoe/eoec.name: James "Cookie" Fredericks
eoe/eoec.text: Retaliate. [action]: Parley. Test [combat] (2) to wrestle the gun away from Cookie. For each point you succeed by, place 1 resource on him (from the token pool). If you fail, he attacks you. If there are 2 [per_investigator] resources on him, add him to the victory display. Forced – If James "Cookie" Fredericks is defeated: Cross his name off in the Campaign Log.

eoe/eoec.name: Dr. Amy Kensler
eoe/eoec.text: [action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (2) to convince Dr. Kensler to tell you what she has seen. For each point you succeed by, place 1 resource on her (from the token pool). If you fail, she attacks you. If there are 2 [per_investigator] resources on her, add her to the victory display. Forced – If Dr. Amy Kensler is defeated: Cross her name off in the Campaign Log.

eoe/eoec.name: Roald Ellsworth
eoe/eoec.text: [action]: Parley. Test [combat] or [agility] (5) to get Ellsworth to let go of the strange rock he is clutching. If you succeed, place 1 resource on him (from the token pool). If you fail, he attacks you. If there are 1 [per_investigator] resources on him, add him to the victory display. Forced – If Roald Ellsworth is defeated: Cross his name off in the Campaign Log.

eoe/eoec.name: Takada Hiroko
eoe/eoec.text: [action] Spend up to 3 resources: Parley. Place each of these resources on Takada Hiroko. If there are 5 [per_investigator] resources on her, add her to the victory display. Forced – If Takada Hiroko is defeated: Cross her name off in the Campaign Log.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor: This place is not what it seems. You feel as though you have trespassed somewhere ancient and terrible, and now its wrath is erupting all around you.
eoe/eoec.back_text:
The lead investigator must decide (choose one):
- Add 1 [frost] token to the chaos bag.
- In player order, each investigator shuffles the top 2 cards of the Tekeli-li deck into their deck (each investigator who cannot takes 1 damage and 1 horror instead).
eoe/eoec.flavor: Something stirs beneath the ice. Through the cracks, a vile ichor bubbles forth, its odor pungent and rancid.
eoe/eoec.name: Manifestations of Evil
eoe/eoec.text: Forced – When this agenda would advance, if there is at least 1 facedown card beneath a Seeping Nightmare: Instead of advancing this agenda, remove 2 doom from play and find the Seeping Nightmare with the most facedown cards beneath it. Choose one of the cards beneath it at random and spawn it at its location.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
Your only warning is a thin web of cracks that tears through the ice before your feet, and then a sudden explosion of mist and ink-like miasma erupts around you. The force slams you to the ground. You crawl desperately along the freezing-cold ice as the miasma reaches for you. An incomprehensible sound, like the rushing of a furious whirlwind, fills your ears. Then a thunderous crack, and you are falling - no, sliding - down along the ice toward the freezing cold waters below.
It is a wonder you are even still conscious. You summon all of your strength and cling to the ice shelf just before you plummet below. You finally haul yourself back over the edge, casting a panicked glance at the horizon, but there is no sign of any miasma or mist. The crack in the ice shelf extends for hundreds of feet in front of you, separating you from your pursuers. Somehow, you’ve unwittingly escaped...although you won’t be forgetting that near-death experience anytime soon.
eoe/eoec.back_text: Each remaining investigator is defeated and suffers 1 physical trauma.
eoe/eoec.flavor: The violent quakes have risen to a crescendo. Any second now, you feel as though the entire ice shelf could collapse, spilling you into the frigid ocean - or worse, if your theory about the underground source of these creatures is correct.
eoe/eoec.name: Icy Depths

eoe/eoec.back_text:
If there are no [[Eidolon]] enemies in play:
The last of the nightmarish creatures falls, its miasmatic body at once dissolving into inky, prismatic liquid and dissipating into wisps of gray mist filled with screaming shapes. Then, silence.
(→R1)
If the investigators advanced by resigning:
You follow a makeshift path through a jagged split in the ice shelf, making your way deeper into the mainland, toward the mountains. You don’t know if these creatures can follow human tracks - or indeed if they need tracks at all in order to pursue you - but you take the time to cover them, regardless. Hopefully, with this shortcut you’ve found, you’ll be safe...
(→R2)
eoe/eoec.flavor: Your camp has been discovered, and now the monsters prowling about the ice and snow are converging on your position. You have only two ways out of this nightmare: you must fight, or you must flee.
eoe/eoec.name: Under Attack!
eoe/eoec.text: Each [[Eidolon]] enemy gains Victory 0. The camp gains: "[action] Investigators at your location spend 4 clues, as a group: Resign." Objective – If there are no [[Eidolon]] enemies in play, advance. Objective – If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

eoe/eoec.name: Seeping Nightmare
eoe/eoec.text: While an [[Eidolon]] enemy at Seeping Nightmare’s location is moving, its location is considered connected to the camp. While there are no facedown cards beneath Seeping Nightmare, it gains hunter. Forced – When Seeping Nightmare is defeated: Remove each facedown card beneath it from the game.

eoe/eoec.name: Phantasmagoria
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation – If there are no Seeping Nightmares in play, Phantasmagoria gains surge. Otherwise, find the Seeping Nightmare nearest to an investigator. If there are 1 or more cards beneath it, choose one of them at random and spawn it at its location. If there are no cards beneath it, it moves and attacks as if it were the enemy phase (without exhausting).

eoe/eoec.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is the current agenda number plus the number of story cards in the victory display.
[cultist]: –2. If you do not succeed by at least 2, place 1 of your clues on your location.
[tablet]: –4. If you fail, you must either move to the Prison of Memories, or shuffle the top card of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck without looking at it. (If you fail by 2 or more, do both instead.)
[elder_thing]: –5. If you fail, place 1 doom on an [[Eidolon]] enemy in play.
eoe/eoec.name: Fatal Mirage
eoe/eoec.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is the number of story cards in the victory display.
[cultist]: –2. If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location.
[tablet]: –3. If you fail, you must either move to the Prison of Memories, or shuffle the top card of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck without looking at it.
[elder_thing]: –4. If you fail, place 1 doom on an [[Eidolon]] enemy in play.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
Bit by bit, your consciousness fades. You are lost in the ever-expanding weave of memories, your senses drowning in a deluge of thought and emotion. A jumbled cage of fear, doubt, and horror.
When you finally awaken, only seconds have passed.
eoe/eoec.back_text: Each remaining investigator is defeated and must shuffle the top card of the Tekeli-li deck into their deck.
eoe/eoec.flavor: You find yourself trapped in an endless prison of distorted thought. Each door is another world to discover, another memory to explore...
eoe/eoec.name: Ethereal Tangle (v. I)
eoe/eoec.text: [fast] Take 1 horror: Move to the Prison of Memories.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
Again, your consciousness fades. You tumble through everlasting moments, empathy tugging your emotions in every direction at once. It is an ocean of bottomless thought, deep and dark and tenebrous.
When you finally awaken, once again only seconds have passed.
eoe/eoec.back_text: Each remaining investigator is defeated and must either suffer 1 mental trauma or shuffle the top 2 cards of the Tekeli-li deck into their deck.
eoe/eoec.flavor: You once again find yourself trapped in an endless prison of distorted thought...
eoe/eoec.name: Ethereal Tangle (v. II)
eoe/eoec.text: [fast] Take 1 horror: Move to the Prison of Memories.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
Your consciousness is dismantled, this time violently. It is as though your capacity to feel, to think, has been ripped to shreds by the incomprehensible depth of this awful prison. Infinite leagues apart, your every molecule struggles to remain you as your mind is usurped.
When you finally awaken, a full day has passed.
eoe/eoec.back_text: Each remaining investigator is defeated and suffers 1 mental trauma.
eoe/eoec.flavor: You once again find yourself trapped in an endless prison of distorted thought...
eoe/eoec.name: Ethereal Tangle (v. III)
eoe/eoec.text: [fast] Take 1 horror: Move to the Prison of Memories.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
Understanding sets in. Dream though it may be, this place is like a nexus of minds - a place within the miasma where thought is material. Where madness is embodied.
As you ponder the deeper truths that might have taken shape in this maze of horrors, a door appears just in the periphery of your sight: the same door you once used to trap yourself in this hellish place.
Perhaps there are more mysteries to discover here, but for now, you’ve seen enough. You open the door...
eoe/eoec.flavor: In this strange, alternate reality, past memories and nightmares come to life. Is this place real or a figment of your imagination? Or perhaps both?
eoe/eoec.name: Shadow of the Past (v. I)
eoe/eoec.text: Objective – Confront your demons to strengthen your resolve. (Hint: You may have more than one opportunity to advance this act. Until then, you are trapped. If you are running out of time and are given the chance to advance, consider taking it...)

eoe/eoec.back_flavor: Once again, as you wonder about the deeper significance this place holds, the exit appears before you, a door of solid oak that stands out within the mirage. Hallucination or not, it is your only way out of this strange place. Maybe the truth is out there, somewhere, but for now, it’s safer to leave and return to reality. You open the door...
eoe/eoec.flavor: In this strange, alternate reality, past memories and nightmares come to life. Is this place real or a figment of your imagination? Or perhaps both?
eoe/eoec.name: Shadow of the Past (v. II)
eoe/eoec.text: Objective – Confront your demons to strengthen your resolve. (Hint: You may have more than one opportunity to advance this act. Until then, you are trapped. If you are running out of time and are given the chance to advance, consider taking it...)

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
As you confront yet another memory locked inside this strange hallucination, you spot another door - not a wooden one or indeed any door made by human hands, but rather a colossal circular gate of rock with an elaborately carved slab of slate-gray stone blocking your way. Enigmatic glyphs wind around its frame, their meaning inscrutable. You step forward, place your hand upon the stone, and to your surprise, the door cracks open with an immense rumble.
A layer of thick, prismatic miasma drips from the doorway as you peer inside. Thum-thum. Thum-thum. Thum-thum. The beating is tremendous. Something quivers and throbs on the other side, something hideous and enormous, like a beating heart. Thum-thum. Thum-thum. Thum-thum. The heart of the mountain. The heart of the mirage. Then the door slams open, tendrils of ichor slap around your wrists, and you are dragged, screaming, through the door-
eoe/eoec.flavor: In this strange, alternate reality, past memories and nightmares come to life. Is this place real or a figment of your imagination? Or perhaps both?
eoe/eoec.name: Shadow of the Past (v. III)
eoe/eoec.text: Objective – Confront your demons to strengthen your resolve. (Hint: You may have more than one opportunity to advance this act. Until then, you are trapped. If you are running out of time and are given the chance to advance, consider taking it...)

eoe/eoec.name: Prison of Memories
eoe/eoec.text:
Mirage 1 [per_investigator] (Base Camp, Deck of the Theodosia, University Halls).
X is the current agenda number.

eoe/eoec.flavor:
You wander for what seems like hours through the myriad reflections. The further you venture from where you arrived, the more distant reality becomes. There are many paths to take through the hallucination. Places you recognize from your memories, and others you do not, taken from the memories of your companions.
As the shape of the mirage changes around you, you consider which prison might be worse - the one that reveals its true, deadly nature? Or the one that hides it?
eoe/eoec.name: Prison of Memories
eoe/eoec.text:
Choose one:
- Put the set-aside Base Camp location into play.
- Put the set-aside Deck of the Theodosia location into play.
- Put the set-aside University Halls location into play.
Flip this card back over.

eoe/eoec.name: Base Camp
eoe/eoec.text:
Mirage 1 [per_investigator] (Coastal Waters, Deserted Station, Riverview Theatre).
[reaction] When you would you fail a skill test by exactly 1 while investigating Base Camp, take 1 horror: You get +1 skill value for this test.

eoe/eoec.flavor:
Eliyah and his companion, Anyu, shimmer into view along the outskirts of the camp. "Where have you been?" Takada says, also appearing before your very eyes.]
"It is foolish to venture out alone," Dr. Sinha joins in the scolding.
"Relax. I wasn’t alone," Eliyah replies, his gloved hand gently petting Anyu’s neck.
The physician rolls her eyes and departs, but Takada remains, folding her arms across her chest. "There is still a lot to do before we head out, you know," she states.
Eliyah sighs and nods. "I know. Just...anxious. Something about this place..." he trails off.
Takada nods. "Yes. I feel it, too."
eoe/eoec.name: Base Camp
eoe/eoec.text:
Choose one:
- Follow Takada’s memories. Put the set-aside Coastal Waters location into play.
- Follow Eliyah’s memories. Put the set-aside Deserted Station location into play.
- Follow Dr. Sinha’s memories. Put the set-aside Riverview Theatre location into play.
Flip this card back over.

eoe/eoec.name: Deck of the Theodosia
eoe/eoec.text: Mirage 1 [per_investigator] (Coastal Waters, Hedge Maze, Standing Stones). Forced – When you investigate Deck of the Theodosia: You must either give it +2 shroud for this investigation, or spend 1 additional action to investigate it.

eoe/eoec.flavor:
Ellsworth appears in a shimmer of mirage-light, staring out over the railing into the cold, blue ocean. "Beautiful, isn’t it?" he says.
Cookie and Claypool appear nearby, carrying several crates of supplies between them. "Y’know what would be beautiful?" Cookie hollers. "If maybe yeh helped out a lil’ bit. Think yeh might get off yer ass for a minute ’n pitch in, Ellsworth?"
The explorer nods with a soft sigh and takes the weight from Claypool’s hands, nodding aside for him to take a break. Claypool gives him a gentle, knowing smile.
eoe/eoec.name: Deck of the Theodosia
eoe/eoec.text:
Choose one:
- Follow Cookie’s memories. Put the set-aside Coastal Waters location into play.
- Follow Ellsworth’s memories. Put the set-aside Hedge Maze location into play.
- Follow Claypool’s memories. Put the set-aside Standing Stones location into play.
Flip this card back over.

eoe/eoec.name: University Halls
eoe/eoec.text: Mirage 1 [per_investigator] (Elder Chamber, Riverview Theatre, Standing Stones). Forced – When University Halls is flipped over: Each investigator discards the top 3 cards of their deck for each clue they spent. Each investigator draws each Tekeli-li weakness they discarded in this way. Shuffle each other weakness discarded in this way back into its owner’s deck.

eoe/eoec.flavor:
Three figures shimmer into view as they cross one another in the darkened halls. "Professor," you hear Dr. Kensler’s voice acknowledge, and her outline becomes defined. Professor Dyer and his protégé appear next. "I do hope you’ll consider my proposal," she continues. If she truly cared one way or the other, her tone of voice surely does not reveal it.
In response, Dyer simply glances at Danforth, who appears to be staring behind her - far, far behind her. "Well. In any event..." she adjusts her glasses, and enters the door labeled with her name.
Dyer shakes his head with a sigh, but Danforth is the one who breaks the silence. "I...I think we should go."
eoe/eoec.name: University Halls
eoe/eoec.text:
Choose one:
- Follow Danforth’s memories. Put the set-aside Elder Chamber location into play.
- Follow Dr. Kensler’s memories. Put the set- aside Riverview Theatre location into play.
- Follow Dyer’s memories. Put the set-aside Standing Stones location into play.
Flip this card back over.

eoe/eoec.name: Hedge Maze
eoe/eoec.text: Mirage 2 [per_investigator] (Mo‘ai Statues). Forced – After you investigate Hedge Maze during your turn: Increase its shroud value by 1 until the end of your turn. You cannot leave Hedge Maze this turn.

eoe/eoec.flavor: "You really think I can’t navigate a simple maze?" Ellsworth chuckles. He looks several years young instead of his comfortable jacket and trousers. The figure he speaks to stands just out of view, a dark silhouette with a muffled, indistinct voice. "Fine," the explorer replies with a roll of his eyes. He hands the figure his champagne glass and loosens his tie. "But when I get back, you are going to tell me what this is really all about."
eoe/eoec.name: Hedge Maze
eoe/eoec.text:
Put the set-aside Mo‘ai Statues location into play.
Flip this card back over.

eoe/eoec.name: Deserted Station
eoe/eoec.text:
Mirage 2 [per_investigator] (Alaskan Wilds).
Deserted Station gets +3 shroud while there is at least one treachery attached to it.

eoe/eoec.flavor:
When Eliyah materializes into view, you are stunned to see him without his steadfast companion, Anyu. He holds an unfamiliar woman’s hands, her wavy hair the color of a brilliant ruby. The two young lovers stare into one another’s eyes as the old train approaches. "How long do you think you will be gone?"
"I...I’m not sure," he confesses. "It is a lengthy journey. Alaska is a hell of a big place."
"So, this is goodbye, then," the woman says. She wipes angry tears from her eyes. "Will you write?"
"I’ll try, but..." he glances away.
"Right, right," she says, understanding. The train pulls into the station, its piercing squeal muffling their words. "You...fool." She leans up and kisses his cheek. "You are a fool, Eliyah."
"I...I know," he replies. "I know."
eoe/eoec.name: Deserted Station
eoe/eoec.text:
Put the set-aside Alaskan Wilds location into play.
Flip this card back over.

eoe/eoec.name: Coastal Waters
eoe/eoec.text: Mirage 2 [per_investigator] (Airfield, Ottoman Front). Forced – After you reveal a [frost] token while investigating Coastal Waters: Take 1 horror. If this investigation is successful, discover 1 additional clue at Coastal Waters. (Limit once per test.)

eoe/eoec.flavor:
"Hell of a test run!" Cookie yells over the roar of the rushing wind. The two of them are up in one of Takada's aeroplanes - this must have happened just after she completed work on the first plane, before the lot of you set off toward the peaks, and the events that ensued.
"Get used to it!" Takada shouts from the pilot’s seat. "Weather’s gonna be rough anytime we’re in the air. Don’t worry though, she’ll hold." You see the grim copilot hold back a smile. "You’re enjoying this, aren’t you?" Takada chimes.
"Naw," Cookie lies. "Just been a while, is all."
eoe/eoec.name: Coastal Waters
eoe/eoec.text:
Choose one:
- Follow Takada’s memories. Put the set- aside Airfield location into play.
- Follow Cookie’s memories. Put the set- aside Ottoman Front location into play.
Flip this card back over.

eoe/eoec.name: Elder Chamber
eoe/eoec.text: Mirage 2 [per_investigator] (Cluttered Dormitory). Forced – After you discover 2 or more clues from Elder Chamber during a single investigation or card effect: Shuffle the top card of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck.

eoe/eoec.flavor:
These are the sledges missing from Lake’s camp," Professor Dyer remarks, shimmering into view. He doesn’t sound particularly surprised - it seems they must have accounted for this possibility.
Danforth is already at the first of the sledges, examining its contents. "Here’s the gasoline stove, the fuel, all of their research instruments..." he trails off. "God, what is that awful stench?" He motions toward the farthest sledge, the tarpaulin strapped around its cargo bulging oddly.
"Danforth, don’t-" Dyer calls out, but it’s too late. The moment Danforth removes the tarpaulin, he staggers backward, covering his mouth and nose. Frozen and preserved beneath the tarpaulin are the corpses of a young explorer and one of his sled dogs. "Gedney," Dyer whispers.
eoe/eoec.name: Elder Chamber
eoe/eoec.text:
Put the set-aside Cluttered Dormitory location into play.
Flip this card back over.

eoe/eoec.name: Riverview Theatre
eoe/eoec.text: Mirage 2 [per_investigator] (Dr. Kensler’s Office, Infirmary). Forced – When you draw a Tekeli-li card while at Riverview Theatre: Resolve its effects an additional time. Then, discover 1 clue at Riverview Theatre.

eoe/eoec.flavor:
"Thank you for...for inviting me here, Dr. Sinha," Dr. Kensler says quietly, her outline shimmering into view. She and Dr. Sinha sit next to one another in the almost-empty theatre. The lights are dim and the curtain drawn, but the show has not yet begun.
"Of course. And just Mala is fine."
Kensler flinches and clears her throat. "Then call me Amy."
"I already do," the physician replies as the screen in front of them kindles to life.
eoe/eoec.name: Riverview Theatre
eoe/eoec.text:
Choose one:
- Follow Dr. Kensler’s memories. Put the set-aside Dr. Kensler’s Office location into play.
- Follow Dr. Sinha’s memories. Put the set-aside Infirmary location into play.
Flip this card back over.

eoe/eoec.name: Standing Stones
eoe/eoec.text: Mirage 2 [per_investigator] (The Black Stone, Dyer’s Classroom). Forced – After you reveal a [frost] token while investigating Standing Stones: Take 1 damage. If this investigation is successful, discover 1 additional clue at Standing Stones. (Limit once per test.)

eoe/eoec.flavor:
Claypool stares up at the ruins with a twinkle of wonder in his eyes. "Marvelous, isn’t it, William?" Behind him, Professor Dyer materializes within the mirage. Both of them are at least a decade younger, perhaps more. You note Claypool did not address the professor by his title.
"Marvelous and mysterious," Dyer replies. "Nobody knows the true purpose of this site. Perhaps nobody ever will."
"But that’s why we do this, right?" Claypool says with a grin. "To learn the truth."
Dyer glances back at the youth, lines of worry pulling at his eyes. "Yes," he whispers, "the truth."
eoe/eoec.name: Standing Stones
eoe/eoec.text:
Choose one:
- Follow Claypool’s memories. Put the set-aside The Black Stone location into play.
- Follow Dyer’s memories. Put the set-aside Dyer’s Classroom location into play.
Flip this card back over.

eoe/eoec.name: Airfield
eoe/eoec.text:
Mirage 2 [per_investigator] (Memory of a Missing Father).
While Takada Hiroko is at this location, it gets –2 shroud.
As an additional cost for you to investigate Airfield, you must spend 1 resource.

eoe/eoec.flavor: A teenage girl shimmers into view. You recognize Takada’s chestnut eyes and thin, straight hair. Her cheeks are stained with tears and rain. She waves as the old, rickety aeroplane takes off. You don’t recognize the design - this must have been over a decade ago. "Don’t worry, kiddo." The man next to her grips her shoulder encouragingly. "He’ll be back soon," he reassures her, his voice soft with compassion. "You’ll see."
eoe/eoec.name: Airfield
eoe/eoec.text: If Takada Hiroko is alive: Spawn the set-aside Memory of a Missing Father enemy at this location. Flip this card back over. If Takada Hiroko is crossed out: Move each investigator and enemy at this location to Prison of Memories. Discard each card attached to this location. Add this card to the victory display. The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.

eoe/eoec.name: Alaskan Wilds
eoe/eoec.text:
Mirage 2 [per_investigator] (Memory of a Hunt Gone Awry).
While Eliyah Ashevak is at this location, it gets –2 shroud.
As an additional cost for you to enter Alaskan Wilds, you must either shuffle the top card of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck, or spend 1 action.

eoe/eoec.flavor: Eliyah sits huddled up against a tree, a torrent of snow falling around him. In his arms, Anyu whines. Blood soaks his gloves, staining the dog’s fur red as he holds her tight. "I know, girl," he chants, "I know, I know. We...we are going to be okay. You and me, girl. Anyu, right? That was your name?" The dog peers up into his eyes. "We will be okay, Anyu. I promise you."
eoe/eoec.name: Alaskan Wilds
eoe/eoec.text: If Eliyah Ashevak is alive: Spawn the set-aside Memory of a Hunt Gone Awry enemy at this location. Flip this card back over. If Eliyah Ashevak is crossed out: Move each investigator and enemy at this location to Prison of Memories. Discard each card attached to this location. Add this card to the victory display. The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.

eoe/eoec.name: Cluttered Dormitory
eoe/eoec.text: Mirage 2 [per_investigator] (Memory of an Unspeakable Evil). While Danforth is at this location, it gets –2 shroud. Forced – When you resolve the revelation ability on a Tekeli-li card while at Cluttered Dormitory: Shuffle it back into your deck instead of placing it on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck.

eoe/eoec.flavor: Danforth screams and throws his covers aside. Sweat drenches his forehead and drips down his cheeks. "Just a dream," he whispers. "Just a dream, just a dream." He collapses from his bed, dabs his head with a handkerchief, and wanders over to the nearby window to peer outside. The shape he sees on the other side causes him to leap back in fear, crashing into the opposite wall. "No...no!"
eoe/eoec.name: Cluttered Dormitory
eoe/eoec.text: If Danforth is alive: Spawn the set-aside Memory of an Unspeakable Evil enemy at this location. Flip this card back over. If Danforth is crossed out: Move each investigator and enemy at this location to Prison of Memories. Discard each card attached to this location. Add this card to the victory display. The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.

eoe/eoec.name: Dyer’s Classroom
eoe/eoec.text:
Mirage 2 [per_investigator] (Memory of a Regretful Voyage).
While Professor William Dyer is at this location, it gets –2 shroud.
[action] Shuffle the top card of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck: Heal 1 horror from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset at this location.

eoe/eoec.flavor:
Dyer shakes the man’s hand vigorously, a smile beaming across his face. "You have no idea how much this means to me," he exclaims. "This will be a journey of profound importance. For all of us."
You recognize the man he speaks to - it is the late Professor Lake, one of many who ventured with Dyer to Antarctica and never returned.
"Yes, William," Lake replies, his eyes dribbling over with terrible black ichor. "This expedition will change everything."
eoe/eoec.name: Dyer’s Classroom
eoe/eoec.text: If Professor William Dyer is alive: Spawn the set-aside Memory of a Regretful Voyage enemy at this location. Flip this card back over. If Professor William Dyer is crossed out: Move each investigator and enemy at this location to Prison of Memories. Discard each card attached to this location. Add this card to the victory display. The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.

eoe/eoec.name: Infirmary
eoe/eoec.text: Mirage 2 [per_investigator] (Memory of a Lost Patient). While Dr. Mala Sinha is at this location, it gets –2 shroud. Forced – After you enter Infirmary for the first time this game, if you have more than 6 remaining health: Take damage until you have exactly 6 remaining health. Otherwise, take 1 damage.

eoe/eoec.flavor:
A young Dr. Sinha appears by the bedside, her face contorted with grief. You have never seen her so stricken. A nurse places a hand on top of Dr. Sinha’s in consolation, but she bats it away. "Don’t," she barks, choking back a sob.
"There is nothing more you could have done, Doctor," the nurse says.
"There is always more that can be done," Dr. Sinha shouts. "We could have been smarter! Faster!" Her hands shake as she tries to make a fist. Black miasma seeps from between her knuckles. "We - I - this is my fault. All my fault."
eoe/eoec.name: Infirmary
eoe/eoec.text: If Dr. Mala Sinha is alive: Spawn the set-aside Memory of a Lost Patient enemy at this location. Flip this card back over. If Dr. Mala Sinha is crossed out: Move each investigator and enemy at this location to Prison of Memories. Discard each card attached to this location. Add this card to the victory display. The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.

eoe/eoec.name: Dr. Kensler’s Office
eoe/eoec.text: Mirage 2 [per_investigator] (Memory of an Unrequited Love). While Dr. Amy Kensler is at this location, it gets –2 shroud. Forced – After you successfully investigate Dr. Kensler’s Office: You must either take 1 horror, or remove 1 secret from an asset you control.

eoe/eoec.flavor: Dr. Kensler sits at her desk, struggling to focus on her work. Various papers sit in neat piles around her, and the bookshelf is perfectly ordered, just as you would expect from the professor. But the journal she writes in is cluttered and unkempt. She runs her hand through her hair, undoing her ponytail. "No, no, no..." she mutters, ripping a piece of paper from the book. You spot a photograph serving as a bookmark, keeping her page as she shuts the journal angrily. She opens one of her desk drawers and throws the crumpled paper inside, barely noticing the way the drawer bubbles over with miasma, and the putrid gray mist emanating from within...
eoe/eoec.name: Dr. Kensler’s Office
eoe/eoec.text: If Dr. Amy Kensler is alive: Spawn the set-aside Memory of an Unrequited Love enemy at this location. Flip this card back over. If Dr. Amy Kensler is crossed out: Move each investigator and enemy at this location to Prison of Memories. Discard each card attached to this location. Add this card to the victory display. The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.

eoe/eoec.name: Mo‘ai Statues
eoe/eoec.text: Mirage 2 [per_investigator] (Memory of an Alien Translation). While Roald Ellsworth is at this location, it gets –2 shroud. Forced – When the revelation effect of a treachery attaches it to Mo‘ai Statues: That treachery gains surge. (Limit once per phase.)

eoe/eoec.flavor: Rain patters against the face of the statue as Ellsworth examines the inscription at its foundation. "This one isn’t like the rest," he murmurs to himself. "This isn’t Rapa Nui. This isn’t one of the mo‘ai at all." The statue in the mirage cracks open, and miasma begins to seep from inside...
eoe/eoec.name: Mo‘ai Statues
eoe/eoec.text: If Roald Ellsworth is alive: Spawn the set-aside Memory of an Alien Translation enemy at this location. Flip this card back over. If Roald Ellsworth is crossed out: Move each investigator and enemy at this location to Prison of Memories. Discard each card attached to this location. Add this card to the victory display. The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.

eoe/eoec.name: Ottoman Front
eoe/eoec.text:
Mirage 2 [per_investigator] (Memory of a Ravaged Country).
While James "Cookie" Fredericks is at this location, it gets –2 shroud.
Each non-[[Elite]] enemy at Ottoman Front gets +2 fight and loses retaliate.

eoe/eoec.flavor:
Through the din of war - a hail of gunfire and mortars so loud it shakes the earth - Cookie reloads his rifle, slowly and methodically. "Sergeant Fredericks!" a voice calls out to him. His companion ducks through the trench as another nearby explosion kicks up a spray of mud. "Germans broke the line last night. They’re circling around. We have to get out of here!"
Cookie affixes a bayonet to the end of his rifle. "Did the lieutenant give the order?" he asks.
"Lieutenant Williams is dead," the soldier replies, the fear in his voice palpable. "Sir...you’re in charge."
eoe/eoec.name: Ottoman Front
eoe/eoec.text: If James "Cookie" Fredericks is alive: Spawn the set-aside Memory of a Ravaged Country enemy at this location. Flip this card back over. If James "Cookie" Fredericks is crossed out: Move each investigator and enemy at this location to Prison of Memories. Discard each card attached to this location. Add this card to the victory display. The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.

eoe/eoec.name: The Black Stone
eoe/eoec.text:
Mirage 2 [per_investigator] (Memory of a Terrible Discovery).
While Avery Claypool is at this location, it gets –2 shroud.
[fast] Add 1 [frost] token to the chaos bag: Discover 2 clues at The Black Stone. (Group limit once per game.)

eoe/eoec.flavor:
"According to Inuit legend, this megalith has stood here since before humanity walked the Earth," a young Avery recounts, examining the runic language along its surface.
"I don’t know about any of that, but it is definitely ancient. That’s not even the weirdest part, though." "What is?" one of the other explorers asks, pulling his hood down to get a better view of the towering structure.
"See for yourself," Claypool says, unfolding a map and placing it against the smooth stone. Drawn over the map’s surface are many rings and lines depicting various weather patterns. "This thing...is like a lightning rod."
eoe/eoec.name: The Black Stone
eoe/eoec.text: If Avery Claypool is alive: Spawn the set-aside Memory of a Terrible Discovery enemy at this location. Flip this card back over. If Avery Claypool is crossed out: Move each investigator and enemy at this location to Prison of Memories. Discard each card attached to this location. Add this card to the victory display. The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.

eoe/eoec.name: Memory of a Hunt Gone Awry
eoe/eoec.text: Alert. Retaliate. Prey – Investigator with Eliyah Ashevak. [reaction] After you successfully evade this enemy by 3 or more: Deal it 3 damage. Forced – When this enemy is defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.

eoe/eoec.flavor: "We almost died that day. Anyu and I," the real Eliyah says as the mirage fades. Anyu licks his gloved hand and whines. "We were the only two that survived. And nobody ever believed me when I told them about the creature that attacked us. They turned me into a pariah. I thought...maybe I was crazy, after all." He shudders as he recalls the shape the mirage took. "But now I know. What attacked us that day was real."
eoe/eoec.name: Memory of a Hunt Gone Awry
eoe/eoec.text: In your Campaign Log, record Eliyah has confronted his demons. Draw a checkmark next to his name in the Expedition Team section. From now on, whenever Eliyah Ashevak is included or used during a scenario, use the set-aside [[Resolute]] version instead of the version from the Expedition Team encounter set. If he is currently in play, switch him with that version now. Add this card to the victory display. The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.

eoe/eoec.name: Memory of a Lost Patient
eoe/eoec.text: Retaliate. Prey – Investigator with Dr. Mala Sinha. [reaction] After you heal 1 or more damage while this enemy is exhausted: Deal that much damage to this enemy. Forced – When this enemy is defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.

eoe/eoec.flavor: "I will never forget that day. The day I lost my first patient." She crosses her arms as the mirage fades. Her eyes are tired and worn. "They tell you it happens to even the best of us, but even so, we are never prepared. I was not foolish enough to vow that I would never lose another one. I knew that was a fantasy." She glances at you knowingly. "Instead, I simply vowed never to get attached. So do not be upset at my distance. It is for my own sake. So if - when - I lose you, I am not lost, myself."
eoe/eoec.name: Memory of a Lost Patient
eoe/eoec.text: In your Campaign Log, record Dr. Sinha has confronted her demons. Draw a checkmark next to her name in the Expedition Team section. From now on, whenever Dr. Mala Sinha is included or used during a scenario, use the set-aside [[Resolute]] version instead of the version from the Expedition Team encounter set. If she is currently in play, switch her with that version now. Add this card to the victory display. The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.

eoe/eoec.name: Memory of a Missing Father
eoe/eoec.text: Retaliate. Prey – Investigator with Takada Hiroko. [reaction] After you gain 1 or more resources while this enemy is exhausted: Deal 1 damage to this enemy. Forced – When this enemy is defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.

eoe/eoec.flavor: "He never did come home," Takada whispers, choking on her words. "I spent my whole life following in his footsteps. I thought...I thought if I did, maybe..." she wipes the tears - and inky miasma - from her eyes. "He’s gone. Gone forever."
eoe/eoec.name: Memory of a Missing Father
eoe/eoec.text: In your Campaign Log, record Takada has confronted her demons. Draw a checkmark next to her name in the Expedition Team section. From now on, whenever Takada Hiroko is included or used during a scenario, use the set-aside [[Resolute]] version instead of the version from the Expedition Team encounter set. If she is currently in play, switch her with that version now. Add this card to the victory display. The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.

eoe/eoec.name: Memory of a Ravaged Country
eoe/eoec.text: Retaliate. Prey – Investigator with James "Cookie" Fredericks. [reaction] After this enemy attacks you: Deal it 1 damage. Forced – When this enemy is defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.

eoe/eoec.flavor: As the mirage dissolves, you watch a young Sergeant James Fredericks command his men to flee, a hail of bullets and mortar fire following in their wake. "Kid never did make it back," the real Cookie says, grinding his teeth. "Very few of us did that day. And for what?" He spits. The roar of gunfire fades into the distance. "For what?"
eoe/eoec.name: Memory of a Ravaged Country
eoe/eoec.text: In your Campaign Log, record Cookie has confronted his demons. Draw a checkmark next to his name in the Expedition Team section. From now on, whenever James "Cookie" Fredericks is included or used during a scenario, use the set-aside [[Resolute]] version instead of the version from the Expedition Team encounter set. If he is currently in play, switch him with that version now. Add this card to the victory display. The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.

eoe/eoec.name: Memory of a Regretful Voyage
eoe/eoec.text: Retaliate. Prey – Investigator with Dr. William Dyer. [reaction] After you draw 1 or more cards while this enemy is exhausted: Deal that much damage to this enemy. Forced – When this enemy is defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.

eoe/eoec.flavor: "We never should have gone," the real Dyer whispers as the shape of Professor Lake fades into the mirage. "I should have convinced him. I should have...but I was too greedy, too eager." he chokes. "And now, here I am again. You and I, we have led these people to their ends. Even if we survive, we will never forget what we have done to these people. What we have risked."
eoe/eoec.name: Memory of a Regretful Voyage
eoe/eoec.text: In your Campaign Log, record Dyer has confronted his demons. Draw a checkmark next to his name in the Expedition Team section. From now on, whenever Professor William Dyer is included or used during a scenario, use the set-aside [[Resolute]] version instead of the version from the Expedition Team encounter set. If he is currently in play, switch him with that version now. Add this card to the victory display. The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.

eoe/eoec.name: Memory of an Unspeakable Evil
eoe/eoec.text: Alert. Retaliate. Prey – Investigator with Danforth. [action][action] Shuffle the top 3 cards of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck: Parley. Deal 3 damage to this enemy. Forced – When this enemy is defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.

eoe/eoec.flavor: "It’s here, it’s here," the real Danforth mutters as he sees the miasma dripping from the cracked window. "It was always here, always here and I returned, returned to hear that accursed sound..." He continues to watch in horror as the miasma retreats, returning his dormitory to its natural state. It takes several minutes for him to stop shaking.
eoe/eoec.name: Memory of an Unspeakable Evil
eoe/eoec.text: In your Campaign Log, record Danforth has confronted his demons. Draw a checkmark next to his name in the Expedition Team section. From now on, whenever Danforth is included or used during a scenario, use the set-aside [[Resolute]] version instead of the version from the Expedition Team encounter set. If he is currently in play, switch him with that version now. Add this card to the victory display. The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.

eoe/eoec.name: Memory of a Terrible Discovery
eoe/eoec.text: Alert. Prey – Investigator with Avery Claypool. [action] Add 1 [frost] token to the chaos bag: Parley. Deal 4 damage to this enemy. Forced – When this enemy is defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.

eoe/eoec.flavor:
"After that, there was no going back," the real Claypool explains. "We had opened Pandora’s box, so to speak. I could no longer bury my head in the sand. There are forces out there beyond our comprehension. Things that science cannot explain. Just as I could not explain that stone’s meteorological impact on the region. Nor could I explain the nature of the storm that hit us after we uncovered it."
You ask Claypool what happened to the other man who was with him that day. He grinds his teeth and shakes his head.
eoe/eoec.name: Memory of a Terrible Discovery
eoe/eoec.text: In your Campaign Log, record Claypool has confronted his demons. Draw a checkmark next to his name in the Expedition Team section. From now on, whenever Avery Claypool is included or used during a scenario, use the set-aside [[Resolute]] version instead of the version from the Expedition Team encounter set. If he is currently in play, switch him with that version now. Add this card to the victory display. The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.

eoe/eoec.name: Memory of an Alien Translation
eoe/eoec.text: Alert. Prey – Investigator with Roald Ellsworth. [reaction] After this enemy is exhausted, if there is an attachment on its location: Deal 4 damage to this enemy. Forced – When this enemy is defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.

eoe/eoec.flavor: "I...I remember this," the real Ellsworth says, staring at his own memory. "This is what made me want to become an explorer. To discover things like this. Ancient secrets, left behind by God knows what. But the more I discover, the more I think that perhaps there are parts of the Earth better left alone. Perhaps all of this is the fault of people like me, who refuse to let history lie. Arrogant fools, the lot of us."
eoe/eoec.name: Memory of an Alien Translation
eoe/eoec.text: In your Campaign Log, record Ellsworth has confronted his demons. Draw a checkmark next to his name in the Expedition Team section. From now on, whenever Roald Ellsworth is included or used during a scenario, use the set-aside [[Resolute]] version instead of the version from the Expedition Team encounter set. If he is currently in play, switch him with that version now. Add this card to the victory display. The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.

eoe/eoec.name: Memory of an Unrequited Love
eoe/eoec.text: Alert. Prey – Investigator with Dr. Amy Kensler. [reaction] After you discover 1 or more clues at this enemy’s location: Deal that much damage to this enemy. Forced – When this enemy is defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.

eoe/eoec.flavor: Dr. Kensler - the real one - eyes you coldly. "This memory is not for you," she warns. "Though I suppose you have no more control over this than I do." You cannot help but be a little curious what kind of academic work would rattle somebody like her, so you ask. "It was not academic in nature," she confesses, running her hand idly along the vision of her office desk, before pulling the photograph out from inside the journal and examining it in private. "I was never very skilled in expressing myself in...matters of the heart," she says, and the photograph fades in her hands, along with the rest of the mirage. "Come along. I do not wish to remain here any longer," she states.
eoe/eoec.name: Memory of an Unrequited Love
eoe/eoec.text: In your Campaign Log, record Dr. Kensler has confronted her demons. Draw a checkmark next to her name in the Expedition Team section. From now on, whenever Dr. Amy Kensler is included or used during a scenario, use the set-aside [[Resolute]] version instead of the version from the Expedition Team encounter set. If she is currently in play, switch her with that version now. Add this card to the victory display. The investigators may advance the current act or continue playing.

eoe/eoec.name: Horrifying Shade
eoe/eoec.text: Aloof. Hunter. While Horrifying Shade is at a location that is cleared of mirages, it loses aloof. Forced – After you discover or take control of 1 or more clues at Horrifying Shade’s location: Place an equal amount of doom on Horrifying Shade.

eoe/eoec.name: Evanescent Mist
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation – Attach Evanescent Mist to the nearest location that is not cleared of mirages. Place 2 clues on attached location. In order to flip attached location over, investigators at attached location must either spend 2 additional clues as a group, or each take 2 damage. Forced – If attached location is cleared of mirages: Discard Evanescent Mist.

eoe/eoec.name: Anamnesis
eoe/eoec.text: Peril. Revelation – You must either (choose one): - Take 2 horror. - Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance.

eoe/eoec.flavor: "We should never have come back."
eoe/eoec.name: Professor William Dyer
eoe/eoec.text:
Partner. Uses (3 secrets).
[fast] Spend 1 secret and exhaust Professor William Dyer: Heal 2 horror from an investigator or another [[Ally]] asset at your location.

eoe/eoec.flavor: "...the windowless place... wings... eyes in the darkness..."
eoe/eoec.name: Danforth
eoe/eoec.text:
Partner. Uses (5 secrets).
[reaction] After an investigator at your location resolves a Tekeli-li weakness, exhaust Danforth and spend 1 secret: That investigator draws 3 cards. Discard each Tekeli-li weakness drawn by this effect without resolving its effects.

eoe/eoec.flavor: "I know, Anyu. This place is all wrong."
eoe/eoec.name: Eliyah Ashevak
eoe/eoec.text: Partner. Uses (3 secrets). [fast] During your turn, spend 1 secret and exhaust Eliyah Ashevak: Evade. Attempt to evade with a base [agility] skill of 6. If you succeed, you may move to a connecting location.

eoe/eoec.flavor: "I'll see what I can do, but some of these wounds are beyond the understanding of modern medicine..."
eoe/eoec.name: Dr. Mala Sinha
eoe/eoec.text:
Partner. Uses (3 supplies).
[fast] Spend 1 supply and exhaust Dr. Mala Sinha: Heal 2 damage from an investigator or another [[Ally]] asset at your location.

eoe/eoec.flavor: "These are not stormclouds. These are something else entirely."
eoe/eoec.name: Avery Claypool
eoe/eoec.text:
Partner. Uses (3 supplies).
[reaction] When an investigator at your location reveals a [frost] token during a skill test, exhaust Avery Claypool: Cancel that token. Then, you must either reveal a new chaos token, or spend 1 supply.

eoe/eoec.flavor: "Next thing that moves is gettin' a lead hole through its teeth."
eoe/eoec.name: James "Cookie" Fredericks
eoe/eoec.text: Partner. Uses (3 ammo). [fast] during your turn, spend 1 ammo and exhaust James "Cookie" Fredericks: Fight. Fight with a base [combat] skill of 6. If you succceed and the attacked enemy is non-[[Elite]], it cannot attack for the remainder of the round.

eoe/eoec.flavor: "The beings that built this place... did they create this, too?"
eoe/eoec.name: Dr. Amy Kensler
eoe/eoec.text: Partner. Uses (3 secrets). [fast] During your turn, spend 1 secret and exhaust Dr. Amy Kensler: Investigate. Investigate with a base [intellect] skill of 6. If you succceed, look at the top card of any investigator's deck or the encounter deck. You may discard that card.

eoe/eoec.flavor: "I thought I knew this place. I really did."
eoe/eoec.name: Roald Ellsworth
eoe/eoec.text:
Partner. Uses (3 supplies).
[fast] During an investigator's turn, exhaust Roald Ellsworth or spend 1 supply: Choose a non-weakness in play. Treat that treachery's text box as if it were blank until the end of this turn.

eoe/eoec.flavor: "No wonder nobody has flown over these parts."
eoe/eoec.name: Takada Hiroko
eoe/eoec.text:
Partner. Uses (9 resources).
[action] Exhaust Takada Hiroko: Gain 1 resource. Move up to 3 resources from Takada Hiroko to your resource pool.

eoe/eoec.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is 2 plus the level of your location.
[cultist]: –1. If you fail, after this test ends move to the location directly below you.
[tablet]: –4. If you fail, lose control of an [[Expedition]] asset and place it at your location.
[elder_thing]: –5. If you fail, the nearest [[Elder Thing]] enemy moves once toward you. If it is engaged with you, it attacks.
eoe/eoec.name: To the Forbidden Peaks
eoe/eoec.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is the level of your location.
[cultist]: –1. If you fail, after this test ends move to the location directly below you.
[tablet]: –3. If you fail, lose control of an [[Expedition]] asset and place it at your location.
[elder_thing]: –4. If you fail, the nearest [[Elder Thing]] enemy moves once toward you. If it is engaged with you, it attacks.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor: The mountainside splits and erupts with snow. A storm of jagged ice shards bursts forth from the womb of the mountain. Behind it, the beast emerges: a whirlwind of mist; haunting , alien shapes; hideous effluvia. It sets its terrible gaze on your party and reaches for you with a tendril of miasma.
eoe/eoec.back_text: Put the set-aside Terror of the Stars enemy into play at the highest level location with one or more investigators. Each investigator at that location loses control of all [[Expedition]] assets and places them at their location. Read Scenario Interlude: Tragedy Strikes in the Campaign Guide.
eoe/eoec.flavor: You arrive at the foothills of the menacing mountain. The strange caves and odd formations at the mountain’s summit beg to be explored.
eoe/eoec.name: Forbidden Peaks
eoe/eoec.text: Forced - After you move to a location: Return all of your clues to the token pool.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor: The snowfall is so thick now that you can no longer see your destination, nor can you hear your companions’ shouts over the howling wind. Every step takes the breath out of you. The air is so thin up here, it is a wonder you even have any breath to spare. You glance up at the blanket of white cast in an endless net overhead. Perhaps you were never close to the summit - just another trick of the eye, like everything else in this godforsaken place.
eoe/eoec.back_text: If one or more investigators have resigned, proceed to (→R1). Otherwise, proceed to (→R2).
eoe/eoec.flavor: The once-flurrying snow has become a tempest of wind and heavy snowfall. If you don’t make it across the peaks soon, you’ll be forced to take shelter...or spend the rest of eternity as a frozen corpse along the mountainside.
eoe/eoec.name: Terror Descends
eoe/eoec.text: Forced - After you move to a location: Return all of your clues to the token pool.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor: After a long and arduous journey up the mountainside, you’ve reached the forbidden peaks. You hope the pain and horror you’ve suffered along the way is behind you, but you fear that it will persist...and become relentless.
eoe/eoec.flavor: Carrying as much expedition gear as you can, you must climb the imposing mountainside to unlock the secrets that lie on the other side.
eoe/eoec.name: Ascend the Mountain
eoe/eoec.text: [action]: Take control of an [[Expedition]] asset at your location. Objective – Get to the top of the mountain. If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"The touch of evil mystery in these barrier mountains, and in the beckoning sea of opalescent sky glimpsed betwixt their summits, was a highly subtle and attenuated matter..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.back_text: You cannot enter this location unless all of the clues on the location directly below it have been discovered.
eoe/eoec.name: Deep Drifts
eoe/eoec.text: Forced – After you move to Deep Drifts from a location below it: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck. Draw each weakness discarded this way.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"The touch of evil mystery in these barrier mountains, and in the beckoning sea of opalescent sky glimpsed betwixt their summits, was a highly subtle and attenuated matter..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.back_text: You cannot enter this location unless all of the clues on the location directly below it have been discovered.
eoe/eoec.name: White Bluff
eoe/eoec.text: Forced – After you move to White Bluff from a location below it: Test [agility] (X). X is 1 plus this location’s level. If you fail, lose control of an [[Expedition]] asset and place it at White Bluff.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"The touch of evil mystery in these barrier mountains, and in the beckoning sea of opalescent sky glimpsed betwixt their summits, was a highly subtle and attenuated matter..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.back_text: You cannot enter this location unless all of the clues on the location directly below it have been discovered.
eoe/eoec.flavor:
"The last stage of our descent to the town was unusually steep and abrupt...."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Steep Incline
eoe/eoec.text: Forced – After you move to Steep Incline from a location below it: Take 1 damage.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"The touch of evil mystery in these barrier mountains, and in the beckoning sea of opalescent sky glimpsed betwixt their summits, was a highly subtle and attenuated matter..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.back_text: You cannot enter this location unless all of the clues on the location directly below it have been discovered.
eoe/eoec.flavor:
"...before noon we all felt a thrill of excitement at beholding a vast, lofty, and snow-clad mountain chain which opened out and covered the whole vista ahead."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Narrow Ridge
eoe/eoec.text: Forced – After you move to Narrow Ridge from a location below it: Take 1 horror.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"The touch of evil mystery in these barrier mountains, and in the beckoning sea of opalescent sky glimpsed betwixt their summits, was a highly subtle and attenuated matter..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.back_text: You cannot enter this location unless all of the clues on the location directly below it have been discovered.
eoe/eoec.flavor:
"They had crossed the icy peaks on whose templed slopes they had once worshipped and roamed among the tree-ferns."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Rocky Ledge
eoe/eoec.text: Forced – After you move to Rocky Ledge from a location below it: Shuffle the top card of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck without looking at it.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"The touch of evil mystery in these barrier mountains, and in the beckoning sea of opalescent sky glimpsed betwixt their summits, was a highly subtle and attenuated matter..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.back_text: You cannot enter this location unless all of the clues on the location directly below it have been discovered.
eoe/eoec.flavor:
"The distribution of cryptical cave-mouths on the black snow- denuded summits seemed roughly even...."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Snow-Covered Crag
eoe/eoec.text: Forced – After you move to Snow-Covered Crag from a location below it: Exhaust each asset you control.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"The touch of evil mystery in these barrier mountains, and in the beckoning sea of opalescent sky glimpsed betwixt their summits, was a highly subtle and attenuated matter..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.back_text: You cannot enter this location unless all of the clues on the location directly below it have been discovered.
eoe/eoec.name: Windswept Path
eoe/eoec.text: Forced – After Windswept Path is revealed: If it is at level 0, place 1 [per_investigator] clues on it (from the token pool). Forced – After you move to Windswept Path from a location below it: Place 1 clue on it (from the token pool).

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"As we drew near the forbidding peaks, dark and sinister above the line of crevasse-riven snow and interstitial glaciers, we noticed more and more the curiously regular formations..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.back_text: You cannot enter this location unless all of the clues on the location directly below it have been discovered.
eoe/eoec.name: The Summit
eoe/eoec.text: Clues on The Summit can only be discovered by investigating. Forced – When The Summit is revealed: Add 1 [frost] token to the chaos bag. [action]: Resign. Add each [[Expedition]] asset you control to the victory display. Return all of your clues to the token pool.

eoe/eoec.name: Terror of the Stars
eoe/eoec.text: Hunter. Massive. Terror of the Stars gets +3 [per_investigator] health. X is the level of your location (to a minimum of 1). Forced – At the end of the round: Move all investigators at Terror of the Stars’s location to the location directly below it.

eoe/eoec.name: Constricting Elder Thing
eoe/eoec.text:
Hunter.
X is the level of your location (to a minimum of 1).
While Constricting Elder Thing is engaged with you, you cannot move to locations above your location.

eoe/eoec.flavor:
"...the still lower horizon-grazing southern sun of midnight poured its hazy reddish rays over the white snow, bluish ice and water lanes, and black bits of exposed granite slope."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Snowfall
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation – Place 2 clues on your location (from the token pool).

eoe/eoec.name: Avalanche
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation – If the level of your location is 1–4, move to the location directly below you. Then test [willpower] (X). X is the level of your location. If you fail, repeat this process. If you did not move by this effect, Avalanche gains surge.

eoe/eoec.name: Hanging on the Edge
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation – Test [agility] (3). If you fail, take 2 damage, lose control of each [[Expedition]] asset you control (placing it at your location), and move to the location directly below you.

eoe/eoec.name: Hypothermia
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation – Test [willpower] (3). If the level of your location is 4 or 5, reveal 1 additional chaos token for this skill test. If you fail, either add 1 [frost] token to the chaos bag, or take 1 horror for each point you failed by.

eoe/eoec.name: Green Soapstone
eoe/eoec.text:
Uses (4 charges).
