[reaction] When you perform a successful attack, spend 1 charge and exhaust Green Soapstone: Deal +1 damage for that attack.

eoe/eoec.name: Wooden Sledge
eoe/eoec.text:
[action] Exhaust Wooden Sledge: An investigator at this location searches the top 6 cards of their deck for up to 3 non-weakness [[Item]] or [[Supply]] cards and attaches them facedown to Wooden Sledge. Shuffle their deck.
While Wooden Sledge is under an investigator's control, facedown cards attached to it may be played as if they were in the hand of any investigator at its location.

eoe/eoec.name: Dynamite
eoe/eoec.text:
Uses (2 supplies).
[action] Spend 1 supply and exhaust Dynamite: Choose either your location or a connecting location. Deal 3 damage to each enemy and investigator at the chosen location.

eoe/eoec.name: Miasmic Crystal
eoe/eoec.text:
Uses (3 charges).
[reaction] When an investigator at your location draws a Tekeli-li weakness, spend 1 charge: That investigator cancels the effects of that weakness, places it on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck, and draws 1 card.

eoe/eoec.name: Mineral Specimen
eoe/eoec.text: Uses (3 charges). [action] Spend 1 charge: Investigate. Investigate with a base [intellect] skill of 5. Cancel each [frost] token revealed during this test. If you succeed, discover 1 additional clue at your location.

eoe/eoec.name: Small Radio
eoe/eoec.text: Uses (3 supplies). You may trigger abilities on assets from the Expedition Team encounter set that are not in play, but whose names are not crossed off in the Campaign Log. Instead of paying that ability's non-[action] costs, exhaust Small Radio and spend 1 supply.

eoe/eoec.name: Spare Parts
eoe/eoec.text:
Uses (3 supplies).
[fast] Spend 1 supply and exhaust Spare Parts: Add 1 supply to another asset at your location, or choose an investigator at your location to gain 1 resource.

eoe/eoec.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is 2 plus the number of keys you control.
[cultist]: –2. Place a key you control on your location.
[tablet]: –4. If a [frost] token was revealed during this test, take 1 damage and you automatically fail, instead.
[elder_thing]: –5. If you fail, the nearest enemy moves once toward you. If it is engaged with you, it attacks.
eoe/eoec.name: City of the Elder Things
eoe/eoec.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is the number of keys you control.
[cultist]: –2. If you fail, place a key you control on your location.
[tablet]: –3. If a [frost] token was revealed during this test, you automatically fail, instead.
[elder_thing]: –4. If you fail, the nearest enemy moves once toward you. If it is engaged with you, it attacks.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor: The walls of the city call to you in surreptitious whispers, ethereal songs indecipherable to human ears, and yet somehow familiar all the same. You try your best to shut them out, to make believe it is just your imagination, but not all of your companions are as successful...
eoe/eoec.back_text: Read Scenario Interlude: Gaze into Madness in the Campaign Log.
eoe/eoec.flavor: The hidden alien city looms before you, ancient and enigmatic. What secrets - and terrors - lie in wait within?
eoe/eoec.name: Lurking Horrors
eoe/eoec.text:
[fast] During your turn, spend 1 clue: Look at the revealed side of a City Landscape in your column or row. (Limit once per round.)
[fast] During your turn, spend 3 clues: Move to any location in your column or row. (Limit once per round.)

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
Your thoughts become convoluted, a tangle of fear, worry, and doubt. Danger lurks around every corner of this abominable place, but most dangerous of all is the growing feeling that you should not be here - that you should flee from this place and never return.
As the weather outside turns foul, you hole up in the relative safety of one of the city’s towering structures. It is too late to return to camp. Your only hope is to take shelter within the alien city, hoping your presence goes unnoticed by the denizens that still prowl through its streets and ancient halls.
eoe/eoec.flavor: Below the darkened ice, more of the city lies trapped, encased and frozen in time. This is but the tip of the iceberg...
eoe/eoec.name: Doom from Below
eoe/eoec.text:
[fast] During your turn, spend 1 clue: Look at the revealed side of a City Landscape in your column or row. (Limit once per round.)
[fast] During your turn, spend 3 clues: Move to any location in your column or row. (Limit once per round.)

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
What you have found is almost too wild to believe. According to the murals and records within the city, the "Elder Things" were travelers from the stars. They colonized the Earth long before the time of humanity, settling far and wide. And deep in the undercity beneath the tallest mountain, they created monstrous creatures - "Shoggoths" - to be their servants. But the Shoggoths rebelled against them and soon their civilization collapsed...
Suddenly, a distant noise stops you and the other explorers in their tracks: a deep, bellowing roar that seems to come from somewhere far below. You dare not ponder what kind of monstrosity could have made such a hideous sound.
eoe/eoec.back_text:
Shuffle the set-aside Shoggoths encounter set and the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
You know the route into the undercity. Reveal the Hidden Tunnel.
Put the set-aside Terror of the Stars enemy into play at the Hidden Tunnel, exhausted.
eoe/eoec.flavor: This is the discovery of a lifetime. Dyer’s report was true - all of it. You must explore this alien civilization in order to learn more...
eoe/eoec.name: Sprawling City (v. I)
eoe/eoec.text: [action] Spend two [elder_thing] keys: Remember that the team "studied the history of the Elder Things." [action] Spend two [tablet] keys: Remember that the team "discerned the origin of the Shoggoths." Objective – If the team has "studied the history of the Elder Things" and "discerned the origin of the Shoggoths," advance.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
What you have found is almost too wild to believe. According to the murals and records within the city, the "Elder Things" were travelers from the stars. They colonized the Earth long before the time of humanity, settling far and wide. And deep in the undercity beneath the tallest mountain, they found a dormant, primordial power - something so terrifying, they built a gateway to seal it within. But eventually, it began to escape, and their civilization collapsed...
There must be even more preposterous secrets buried deep below. You have to learn the truth of this ancient power, and in order to do so, you must find the secret passageway that will lead you deeper into the heart of the mountain.
eoe/eoec.back_text:
Shuffle the set-aside Creatures in the Ice encounter set and the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
You know the route into the undercity. Reveal the Hidden Tunnel.
Add 1 [frost] token to the chaos bag.
eoe/eoec.flavor: This is the discovery of a lifetime. Dyer’s report was true - all of it. You must explore this alien civilization in order to learn more...
eoe/eoec.name: Sprawling City (v. II)
eoe/eoec.text: [action] Spend two [elder_thing] keys: Remember that the team "studied the history of the Elder Things." [action] Spend two [cultist] keys: Remember that the team "discovered a hidden power." Objective – If the team has "studied the history of the Elder Things" and "discovered a hidden power," advance.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
What you have found is almost too wild to believe. According to the murals and records within the city, a race of monstrous creatures known as "Shoggoths" were created to serve the masters of this city. The Shoggoths were sent deep into the undercity beneath the tallest mountain, where they would construct a gateway to seal some dormant, primordial power, something so terrifying even the Shoggoths’ masters feared it. But the Shoggoths rebelled against them and let the seal decay, leading to the collapse of this ancient civilization...
Suddenly, a distant noise stops you and the other explorers in their tracks: a deep, bellowing roar that seems to come from somewhere far below. You dare not ponder what kind of monstrosity could have made such a hideous sound.
eoe/eoec.back_text:
Shuffle the set-aside Shoggoths encounter set and the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
You know the route into the undercity. Reveal the Hidden Tunnel.
In player order, each investigator draws 1 card from the top of the encounter deck.
eoe/eoec.flavor: This is the discovery of a lifetime. Dyer’s report was true - all of it. You must explore this alien civilization in order to learn more...
eoe/eoec.name: Sprawling City (v. III)
eoe/eoec.text: [action] Spend two [tablet] keys: Remember that the team "discerned the origin of the Shoggoths." [action] Spend two [cultist] keys: Remember that the team "discovered a hidden power." Objective – If the team has "discerned the origin of the Shoggoths" and "discovered a hidden power," advance.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor: The path, now clear, leads into a labyrinth of dark, treacherous tunnels. For good or ill, your rigorous journey is coming to an end. Taking a deep breath, you gather your courage and delve into the depths of the mountain.
eoe/eoec.flavor: Somewhere in this sprawling web of icy streets and cyclopean structures lies an ancient gateway leading to the undercity beneath the great mountain. You’ll have to find it if you wish to learn more...
eoe/eoec.name: Pursuit of the Unknown (v. I)
eoe/eoec.text: [action] Spend two [cultist] keys: Each investigator may heal 1 damage, 1 horror, and 1 trauma. Objective – If each undefeated investigator is at the Hidden Tunnel and it has no clues, advance.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor: The path, now clear, leads into a labyrinth of dark, treacherous tunnels. For good or ill, your rigorous journey is coming to an end. Taking a deep breath, you gather your courage and delve into the depths of the mountain.
eoe/eoec.flavor: Somewhere in this sprawling web of icy streets and cyclopean structures lies an ancient gateway leading to the undercity beneath the great mountain. You’ll have to find it if you wish to learn more...
eoe/eoec.name: Pursuit of the Unknown (v. II)
eoe/eoec.text: [action] Spend two [tablet] keys: Each investigator searches their deck for each Tekeli-li weakness, shuffles each of them into the Tekeli-li deck, then shuffles their deck. Objective – If each undefeated investigator is at the Hidden Tunnel and it has no clues, advance.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor: The path, now clear, leads into a labyrinth of dark, treacherous tunnels. For good or ill, your rigorous journey is coming to an end. Taking a deep breath, you gather your courage and delve into the depths of the mountain.
eoe/eoec.flavor: Somewhere in this sprawling web of icy streets and cyclopean structures lies an ancient gateway leading to the undercity beneath the great mountain. You’ll have to find it if you wish to learn more...
eoe/eoec.name: Pursuit of the Unknown (v. III)
eoe/eoec.text: Forced – When a [[Shoggoth]] or [[Elite]] enemy enters a location: Defeat each [[Elder Thing]] enemy at that location. [action] Spend two [elder_thing] keys: Remove each [elder_thing] token from the chaos bag. Objective – If each undefeated investigator is at the Hidden Tunnel and it has no clues, advance.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"...our study of the decadent sculptures brought about a change in our immediate objective. This of course had to do with the chiselled avenues to the black inner world, of whose existence we had not known before...."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.back_text: The passageway into the undercity is hidden. You cannot enter the Hidden Tunnel.
eoe/eoec.name: Hidden Tunnel
eoe/eoec.text:
Clues on Hidden Tunnel cannot be discovered or moved to other locations.
[action]: Test a skill of your choice (4). You may spend a [skull] key to get +5 skill value for this test. If you succeed, return 1 clue on Hidden Tunnel to the token pool (2 clues instead if you spent a [skull] key).

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"Yet now the sway of reason seemed irrefutably shaken, for this Cyclopean maze of squared, curved, and angled blocks had features which cut off all comfortable refuge. It was, very clearly, the blasphemous city of the mirage in stark, objective, and ineluctable reality."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Ancient Planetarium
eoe/eoec.text: [action] Spend two "0" keys: Add one of the spent "0" keys to the chaos bag (as a chaos token) for the remainder of the campaign. Record in the Campaign Log the team photographed the astronomical charts.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"Yet now the sway of reason seemed irrefutably shaken, for this Cyclopean maze of squared, curved, and angled blocks had features which cut off all comfortable refuge. It was, very clearly, the blasphemous city of the mirage in stark, objective, and ineluctable reality."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.flavor:
"All of these febrile structures seemed knit together by tubular bridges crossing from one to the other at various dizzy heights..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Stone Bridge
eoe/eoec.text:
[action]: Test [combat] (4) or [agility] (4). If you succeed, discover 1 clue from Stone Bridge.
[action]: Move to another Stone Bridge location.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"Yet now the sway of reason seemed irrefutably shaken, for this Cyclopean maze of squared, curved, and angled blocks had features which cut off all comfortable refuge. It was, very clearly, the blasphemous city of the mirage in stark, objective, and ineluctable reality."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Cylindrical Tower
eoe/eoec.text: [action] Spend two "–2" keys: Draw 2 cards, gain 2 resources, and remove 2 [frost] tokens from the chaos bag. Record in the Campaign Log the team studied the mural carvings.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"Yet now the sway of reason seemed irrefutably shaken, for this Cyclopean maze of squared, curved, and angled blocks had features which cut off all comfortable refuge. It was, very clearly, the blasphemous city of the mirage in stark, objective, and ineluctable reality."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Labyrinthine Chamber
eoe/eoec.text: Each time a chaos token is revealed during a skill test at this location, double its modifier if a key matching that chaos token is on this location or under the control of an investigator at this location.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"Yet now the sway of reason seemed irrefutably shaken, for this Cyclopean maze of squared, curved, and angled blocks had features which cut off all comfortable refuge. It was, very clearly, the blasphemous city of the mirage in stark, objective, and ineluctable reality."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Map Room
eoe/eoec.text: [action] Spend two "–3" keys: Choose 3 locations other than Hidden Tunnel and reveal them. Discover 1 clue from each of these locations. Record in the Campaign Log the team read the map.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"Yet now the sway of reason seemed irrefutably shaken, for this Cyclopean maze of squared, curved, and angled blocks had features which cut off all comfortable refuge. It was, very clearly, the blasphemous city of the mirage in stark, objective, and ineluctable reality."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.flavor:
"...farther on there was a huge roofless rampart still complete in its gigantic five-pointed outline..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Roofless Rampart
eoe/eoec.text: [action] Spend two "–1" keys: Either remove 1 doom from the agenda, or choose and discard from play 1 non-[[Elite]] enemy or treachery. Record in the Campaign Log the team discovered an ancient vault.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"Yet now the sway of reason seemed irrefutably shaken, for this Cyclopean maze of squared, curved, and angled blocks had features which cut off all comfortable refuge. It was, very clearly, the blasphemous city of the mirage in stark, objective, and ineluctable reality."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Ruinous Streets
eoe/eoec.text: Forced – After you reveal 1 or more [frost] tokens during a skill test at Ruinous Streets: Take 1 damage. [reaction] After you discover the last clue from Ruinous Streets: Discover 1 clue on a connecting location.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"Yet now the sway of reason seemed irrefutably shaken, for this Cyclopean maze of squared, curved, and angled blocks had features which cut off all comfortable refuge. It was, very clearly, the blasphemous city of the mirage in stark, objective, and ineluctable reality."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.flavor:
"There were composite cones and pyramids either alone or surmounting cylinders or cubes or flatter truncated cones and pyramids, and occasional needle-like spires in curious clusters..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Cyclopean Spires
eoe/eoec.text: [action]: Move 1 key on another location in this row to Cyclopean Spires. (Group limit once per game.)

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"Yet now the sway of reason seemed irrefutably shaken, for this Cyclopean maze of squared, curved, and angled blocks had features which cut off all comfortable refuge. It was, very clearly, the blasphemous city of the mirage in stark, objective, and ineluctable reality."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.flavor:
"Had the coming of the ice been foreseen, and had a nameless population left en masse to seek a less doomed abode?"
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Submerged Passageway
eoe/eoec.text: [action]: Move 1 clue from this location to an unrevealed location in this column or row.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"Yet now the sway of reason seemed irrefutably shaken, for this Cyclopean maze of squared, curved, and angled blocks had features which cut off all comfortable refuge. It was, very clearly, the blasphemous city of the mirage in stark, objective, and ineluctable reality."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Temple of the Elder Things
eoe/eoec.text: Forced – After you reveal 1 or more [frost] tokens during a skill test at this location: Take 1 horror. [action] If there are no clues on Temple of the Elder Things: Choose 2 locations with keys on them. Swap each key on those locations. (Group limit once per game.)

eoe/eoec.name: Terror of the Stars
eoe/eoec.text:
Hunter. Massive.
Terror of the Stars gets +3 [per_investigator] health.
While Terror of the Stars is ready, investigators at its location cannot spend or take control of keys.

eoe/eoec.name: Benign Elder Thing
eoe/eoec.text: Spawn – Any empty location. Benign Elder Thing enters play with 1 doom on it. Forced – When Benign Elder Thing is defeated: Place 1 doom on the agenda. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, remove Benign Elder Thing from the game.

eoe/eoec.name: Reawakened Elder Thing
eoe/eoec.text: Hunter. Forced – When this enemy engages you: Place a key you control on it. When it leaves play, place that key on its location. Forced – When an investigator at this enemy’s location takes control of a key: This enemy readies, engages, and attacks them.

eoe/eoec.name: Dawning of the Truth
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation – Test [willpower] (2). Increase the difficulty of this test by 1 for each key on your location or under your control. If you fail, take 2 horror (3 horror instead if you fail by 3 or more).

eoe/eoec.name: Crumbling Ruins
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation – Test [agility] (3). During this test, if you reveal a chaos token that matches a key on your location or under the control of an investigator at your location, you automatically fail. For each point you fail by, take 1 damage.

eoe/eoec.name: Frostbitten
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation - Put Frostbitten into play in your threat area. Frostbitten can be healed as if it were a single point of damage on you (if it is healed, discard it). Forced - When you reveal a [frost] token during a skill test: You must either take 1 damage or you automatically fail this test. (Limit once per test.)

eoe/eoec.name: Possessed
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation - Put Possessed into play in your threat area. Possessed can be healed as if it were a single point of horror on you (if it is healed, discard it). Forced - When you reveal a [frost] token during a skill test: You must either take 1 horror or you automatically fail this test. (Limit once per test.)

eoe/eoec.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –2 (–4 instead if there is an [[Ancient One]] enemy at your location).
[cultist]: –1. If there is a seal at your location, or if your location is a Mist-Pylon, treat this token as a [frost] token in addition to its modifier.
[tablet]: –3. Draw the top card of the Tekeli-li deck.
[elder_thing]: –5. If you fail by 3 or more, place 1 doom on the current agenda. This can cause the current agenda to advance.
eoe/eoec.name: The Heart of Madness
eoe/eoec.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –1 (–3 instead if there is an [[Ancient One]] enemy at your location).
[cultist]: –1. If there is a seal at your location, or if your location is a Mist-Pylon, treat this token as a [frost] token, instead.
[tablet]: –3. If you fail, draw the top card of the Tekeli-li deck.
[elder_thing]: –4. If you fail by 3 or more, place 1 doom on the current agenda. This can cause the current agenda to advance.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor: -the black pit - the carven rim - the proto-shoggoths - the windowless solids with five dimensions - the nameless cylinder - the elder pharos - the primal white jelly - the wings - the eyes in darkness - the moon-ladder - the original - the eternal - the undying-
eoe/eoec.back_text: A wall of churning miasma blocks the ancient gateway. Investigators and enemies cannot enter The Gate of Y’quaa. The Gate of Y’quaa cannot have attachments.
eoe/eoec.name: The Gate of Y’quaa
eoe/eoec.text: [action]: Place an activated seal you control on The Gate of Y’quaa. [action]: Resign. You retreat, hoping you’ve done enough to seal away whatever lies beyond the gate. (If you control 1 or more seals, you retain control of them.)

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"Other apertures were undoubtedly connected with bygone mechanical facilities - heating, lighting, and the like - of a sort suggested in many of the carvings. Ceilings tended to be plain, but had sometimes been inlaid with green soapstone or other tiles, mostly fallen now."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Geothermal Vent
eoe/eoec.text: [action] If you control the [seal_a] seal: Test [combat] (3). If you succeed, investigators at Geothermal Vent spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, to activate the [seal_a] seal. Then, remove 1 [frost] token from the chaos bag.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"Other apertures were undoubtedly connected with bygone mechanical facilities - heating, lighting, and the like - of a sort suggested in many of the carvings. Ceilings tended to be plain, but had sometimes been inlaid with green soapstone or other tiles, mostly fallen now."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Forsaken Temple
eoe/eoec.text: [action] If you control the [seal_c] seal: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, investigators at Forsaken Temple spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, to activate the [seal_c] seal. Then, look at the revealed side of each unrevealed location on the same spoke as Forsaken Temple.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"Other apertures were undoubtedly connected with bygone mechanical facilities - heating, lighting, and the like - of a sort suggested in many of the carvings. Ceilings tended to be plain, but had sometimes been inlaid with green soapstone or other tiles, mostly fallen now."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Library of Kós
eoe/eoec.text: [action] If you control the [seal_b] seal: Test [intellect] (3). If you succeed, investigators at Library of Kós spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, to activate the [seal_b] seal. Then, look at the revealed side of each unrevealed location on the same ring as Library of Kós.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"Other apertures were undoubtedly connected with bygone mechanical facilities - heating, lighting, and the like - of a sort suggested in many of the carvings. Ceilings tended to be plain, but had sometimes been inlaid with green soapstone or other tiles, mostly fallen now."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Protoplasmic Pool
eoe/eoec.text: [action] If you control the [seal_d] seal: Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, investigators at Protoplasmic Pool spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, to activate the [seal_d] seal. Then, deal 2 damage to each enemy in play.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"Other apertures were undoubtedly connected with bygone mechanical facilities - heating, lighting, and the like - of a sort suggested in many of the carvings. Ceilings tended to be plain, but had sometimes been inlaid with green soapstone or other tiles, mostly fallen now."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Hall of the Sunless Sea
eoe/eoec.text: [action] If you control the [seal_e] seal, investigators at Hall of the Sunless Sea spend 1 [per_investigator] clues and discard 2 [per_investigator] cards from their hands, as a group: Activate the [seal_e] seal.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"Other apertures were undoubtedly connected with bygone mechanical facilities - heating, lighting, and the like - of a sort suggested in many of the carvings. Ceilings tended to be plain, but had sometimes been inlaid with green soapstone or other tiles, mostly fallen now."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Subnautical Sprawl
eoe/eoec.text: Treat the modifier of the first [frost] token revealed during each skill test at Subnautical Sprawl as –3 instead of –1. (Limit once per round.)

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"Other apertures were undoubtedly connected with bygone mechanical facilities - heating, lighting, and the like - of a sort suggested in many of the carvings. Ceilings tended to be plain, but had sometimes been inlaid with green soapstone or other tiles, mostly fallen now."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Vaulted Corridor
eoe/eoec.text: [fast]: Choose another Vaulted Corridor and test [agility] (X). X is the number of locations away that Vaulted Corridor is from this one. If you succeed, move there. (Limit once per round.)

eoe/eoec.flavor:
"The sheer appalling antiquity and lethal desolation of the place were enough to overwhelm almost any sensitive person..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Primeval Terror
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation – Test [willpower] (2). This test gets +1 difficulty for each location away from The Gate of Y’quaa you are. If you fail, take 2 horror.

eoe/eoec.flavor:
"The things once rearing and dwelling in this frightful masonry in the age of dinosaurs were not indeed dinosaurs, but far worse."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Roots of the Earth
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation – Test [agility] (2). This test gets +1 difficulty for each location away from The Gate of Y’quaa you are. If you fail, take 2 damage.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor: A dark, primordial energy seeps forth from the walls, the very same miasma that has haunted your every step throughout this doomed journey. You freeze in your tracks and back away. You’ve seen the kinds of hideous shapes it can take. The kinds of memories it conjures- foul and fair alike. But not everyone sees the mirage for what it truly is...
eoe/eoec.back_text: Read Scenario Interlude: The Final Straw in the Campaign Guide.
eoe/eoec.flavor: Five darkened paths lead away from the gateway, through icy caverns and down vaulted corridors of smooth black stone. Quiet dread fills the ancient, dormant structure.
eoe/eoec.name: The Beating Heart
eoe/eoec.text: Forced – If two or more activated seals are controlled by investigators at the same location: The latent energy stored within the seals fuses together, and the ensuing chain reaction sets off an electrostatic detonation that destroys all life on Earth. (→R3)

eoe/eoec.back_flavor: The seals pulse with dangerous electrostatic energy, filling the icy chambers with bright blue light. You struggle to contain the power within each seal as you move quickly to put them in their proper place.
eoe/eoec.back_text:
Check the seals controlled by each investigator (if a seal is not controlled by an investigator, skip it).
The investigator who controls the [seal_a] seal takes 1 damage (2 instead if the seal is activated).
The investigator who controls the [seal_b] seal discards 2 random cards from their hand (4 instead if the seal is activated).
The investigator who controls the [seal_c] seal takes 1 horror (2 instead if the seal is activated).
The investigator who controls the [seal_d] seal loses 1 action (2 instead if the seal is activated).
The investigator who controls the [seal_e] seal loses 3 resources (6 instead if the seal is activated).
eoe/eoec.flavor: Eldritch whispers and the dribbling of inky miasma permeates the once-silent ruins. Something is reaching out to you from within its walls. Calling to you.
eoe/eoec.name: The Miasma Beckons
eoe/eoec.text: Forced – If two or more activated seals are controlled by investigators at the same location: The latent energy stored within the seals fuses together, and the ensuing chain reaction sets off an electrostatic detonation that destroys all life on Earth. (→R3)

eoe/eoec.back_flavor: Before you can find and place all five seals, a tremendous noise fills the cavernous halls of the facility, and inky, prismatic miasma begins to seep from every inch of the walls and ceiling. Waves of creeping ichor and wafting black mist block every route but the one from which you came. You flee back to the gateway to escape or find another path forward, but by the time you reach the massive door, it is too late.
eoe/eoec.back_text: Each remaining investigator is defeated and must either suffer 1 mental trauma or shuffle the top 3 cards of the Tekeli-li deck into their deck.
eoe/eoec.flavor: The gateway stirs. Whatever is calling to you from within these walls, it hears your every word, your every footstep. It knows of your presence, of your hopes, of your fears. And it yearns to be free.
eoe/eoec.name: Call of Madness
eoe/eoec.text: Forced – If two or more activated seals are controlled by investigators at the same location: The latent energy stored within the seals fuses together, and the ensuing chain reaction sets off an electrostatic detonation that destroys all life on Earth. (→R3)

eoe/eoec.back_flavor: As soon as you set the seal into place, it locks into the door with an audible click. The energy stored within the seal reaches out, coursing through channels and grooves along the doorway, and lighting the entire chamber with an eerie glow. Perhaps if you can activate and place the remaining four seals, you can put a stop to this madness.
eoe/eoec.back_text: Check which seal was just placed (do not remove it). If it was the [seal_a] seal, the investigator who placed it heals 1 damage. If it was the [seal_b] seal, the investigator who placed it draws 2 cards. If it was the [seal_c] seal, the investigator who placed it heals 1 horror. If it was the [seal_d] seal, the investigator who placed it may take an additional action this turn. If it was the [seal_e] seal, the investigator who placed it gains 3 resources.
eoe/eoec.flavor: You have decided to explore the rest of this antediluvian complex in order to find the devices that fit this strange doorway.
eoe/eoec.name: Dormancy
eoe/eoec.text: Objective – If an activated seal is placed on The Gate of Y’quaa, advance.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor: The final seal locks into place. With a hum, power flows through the facility. Small orbs embedded in the ceiling begin to light, one by one. The realization dawns on you that this sanctuary is far more advanced than you could have ever imagined.
eoe/eoec.flavor: Placing the first of the five seals has awoken a strange power within the facility. You believe if you can find and activate the remaining seals, they will aid in containing the thing that dwells on the other side of this gate...
eoe/eoec.name: The Great Seal
eoe/eoec.text: Objective – Place as many activated seals as you can on The Gate of Y’quaa before whatever is inside escapes. If all five seals have been placed, advance.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"Other apertures were undoubtedly connected with bygone mechanical facilities - heating, lighting, and the like - of a sort suggested in many of the carvings. Ceilings tended to be plain, but had sometimes been inlaid with green soapstone or other tiles, mostly fallen now."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Glacial Grotto
eoe/eoec.text: Forced – After Glacial Grotto is revealed: Place the dormant [seal_a] seal on it. [action]: Test [combat] (2) to shatter the ice. If you succeed, investigators at Glacial Grotto may spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, for you to take control of the seal on it.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"Other apertures were undoubtedly connected with bygone mechanical facilities - heating, lighting, and the like - of a sort suggested in many of the carvings. Ceilings tended to be plain, but had sometimes been inlaid with green soapstone or other tiles, mostly fallen now."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Sculptured Crypt
eoe/eoec.text: Forced – After Sculptured Crypt is revealed: Place the dormant [seal_b] seal on it. [action]: Test [intellect] (2) to decipher the alien script. If you succeed, investigators at Sculptured Crypt may spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, for you to take control of the seal on it.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"Other apertures were undoubtedly connected with bygone mechanical facilities - heating, lighting, and the like - of a sort suggested in many of the carvings. Ceilings tended to be plain, but had sometimes been inlaid with green soapstone or other tiles, mostly fallen now."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Undercity Altar
eoe/eoec.text: Forced – After Undercity Altar is revealed: Place the dormant [seal_c] seal on it. [action]: Test [willpower] (2) to break the ancient ward. If you succeed, investigators at Undercity Altar may spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, for you to take control of the seal on it.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"Other apertures were undoubtedly connected with bygone mechanical facilities - heating, lighting, and the like - of a sort suggested in many of the carvings. Ceilings tended to be plain, but had sometimes been inlaid with green soapstone or other tiles, mostly fallen now."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Ichor-Laden Tunnels
eoe/eoec.text: Forced – After Ichor-Laden Tunnels is revealed: Place the dormant [seal_d] seal on it. [action]: Test [agility] (2) to traverse the ichor. If you succeed, investigators at Ichor-Laden Tunnels may spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group, for you to take control of the seal on it.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"Other apertures were undoubtedly connected with bygone mechanical facilities - heating, lighting, and the like - of a sort suggested in many of the carvings. Ceilings tended to be plain, but had sometimes been inlaid with green soapstone or other tiles, mostly fallen now."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Limestone Caverns
eoe/eoec.text: Forced – After Limestone Caverns is revealed: Place the dormant [seal_e] seal on it. [action] Investigators at Limestone Caverns spend 1 [per_investigator] clues and 3 [per_investigator] resources, as a group: Take control of the seal on Limestone Caverns.

eoe/eoec.name: Protoplasmic Mass
eoe/eoec.text: Hunter. Spawn – Location farthest from you on the outer ring. Prey – Nearest investigator with a seal only. Forced – When the enemy phase ends, if an investigator controls an activated seal: Protoplasmic Mass readies and resolves the enemy phase again (it resolves its hunter keyword and attacks a second time). (Limit once per phase.)

eoe/eoec.name: Electrostatic Discharge
eoe/eoec.text: Surge. Revelation – Each investigator at the same location as a seal takes 1 horror, and 1 damage if that seal is activated

eoe/eoec.back_flavor: From the nameless depths at the very core of the Earth, the miasma’s true form emerges. It is a shapeless thing, a creature of whirling mist and putrid ichor that screams and whispers and crawls and flies. It seeps through the walls and up from the ice; it is everywhere; it is everything.
eoe/eoec.back_text:
Spawn 1 set-aside copy of The Nameless Madness enemy at the Mist-Pylon nearest to an investigator.
Check the Campaign Log. If the truth of the mirage eludes you:
You stare, dumbstruck, at the hideous phantasmagoria. The air shimmers with a dreamlike quality about its damnable form, an endless weave of intermingled nightmare and memory. The very sight of it drives you to your knees. It is the final truth. Reality was the mirage.
Each investigator searches their deck for each copy of Tekeli-li and draws them one at a time in a random order, without placing them on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck. After resolving all of them, shuffle each of them back into their bearer’s deck.
eoe/eoec.flavor: Miasma has completely consumed this part of the facility. The walls and ceiling drip with polychromatic ooze, polar mist swirls through the halls, and the air shimmers with the insubstantial quality of a mirage. What manner of power is this? And how can you possibly hope to destroy it?
eoe/eoec.name: The Seal Weakens

eoe/eoec.back_flavor: It is too late. You cannot contain the creature that dwells beneath the mountain. All you can hope to do now is escape with your lives.
eoe/eoec.back_text:
For each Mist-Pylon that is collapsed, set 3 copies of The Nameless Madness aside.
Each investigator loses all of their clues.
Remove each location except The Gate of Y’quaa from the game. Investigators and copies of The Nameless Madness are not defeated by this effect. All other cards at these locations are discarded.
Put the 4 set-aside Titanic Ramp locations into play in a straight line to the right of The Gate of Y’quaa. Put the set-aside Hidden Tunnel location into play to the right of the rightmost Titanic Ramp. Place each investigator and each remaining copy of The Nameless Madness in play at the leftmost Titanic Ramp.
Remove the act deck from the game and advance to the set-aside The Final Mirage. It is both the current act and the current agenda.
eoe/eoec.flavor: Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li!
eoe/eoec.name: That Which Has No Name
eoe/eoec.text: Forced – When 1 or more doom would be put into play, if there are any copies of The Nameless Madness still set aside: Instead, spawn 1 set-aside copy of The Nameless Madness at the location nearest to an investigator without a copy of that enemy that is connected to a location with a copy of that enemy. Objective – At the end of the round, if all 15 copies of The Nameless Madness are in play and not every Mist-Pylon is collapsed, advance this agenda.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor: The facility shakes to its very core. Without the Mist-Pylons powering the structure, the nameless entity that resides within is free - and its days are numbered, as are yours. The mountain groans and trembles, threatening to collapse all around you.
eoe/eoec.back_text:
Set all but 3 copies of The Nameless Madness aside.
Each investigator loses all of their clues.
Remove each location except The Gate of Y’quaa from the game. Investigators and copies of The Nameless Madness are not defeated by this effect. All other cards at those locations are discarded.
Put the 4 set-aside Titanic Ramp locations into play in a straight line to the right of The Gate of Y’quaa. Put the set-aside Hidden Tunnel location into play to the right of the rightmost Titanic Ramp. Place each investigator and each remaining copy of The Nameless Madness in play at the leftmost Titanic Ramp.
Remove the agenda deck from the game and advance to the set-aside The Final Mirage. It is both the current act and the current agenda.
eoe/eoec.flavor: Five pylons hold this facility together. Your only hope is to destroy them - and everything else.
eoe/eoec.name: Collapse the Pylons
eoe/eoec.text: Each revealed Mist-Pylon can be attacked as if it were an enemy. Its fight value is equal to its shroud value and its health is equal to its clue value. While it has no health remaining, it is collapsed (it remains in play). [reaction] When you discover 1 or more clues at a Mist-Pylon, spend those clues: Deal that much damage to that Mist-Pylon. Objective – At the end of the round, if each Mist-Pylon is collapsed, advance this act.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"In the whole spectacle there was a persistent, pervasive hint of stupendous secrecy and potential revelation; as if these stark, nightmare spires marked the pylons of a frightful gateway..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.back_text: As an additional cost for you to enter Mist-Pylon, investigators at your location must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
eoe/eoec.name: Mist-Pylon
eoe/eoec.text: [fast] If you control the [seal_a] seal, and it is activated: You unleash the seal’s power. Place the [seal_a] seal on this Mist-Pylon. For the remainder of the game, each time you deal damage to a Mist-Pylon, deal 1 additional damage.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"In the whole spectacle there was a persistent, pervasive hint of stupendous secrecy and potential revelation; as if these stark, nightmare spires marked the pylons of a frightful gateway..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.back_text: As an additional cost for you to enter Mist-Pylon, investigators at your location must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
eoe/eoec.name: Mist-Pylon
eoe/eoec.text: [fast] If you control the [seal_d] seal, and it is activated: You unleash the seal’s power. Place the [seal_d] seal on this Mist-Pylon. For the remainder of the game, reduce the shroud value of each Mist-Pylon by 2.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"In the whole spectacle there was a persistent, pervasive hint of stupendous secrecy and potential revelation; as if these stark, nightmare spires marked the pylons of a frightful gateway..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.back_text: As an additional cost for you to enter Mist-Pylon, investigators at your location must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
eoe/eoec.name: Mist-Pylon
eoe/eoec.text: [fast] If you control the [seal_c] seal, and it is activated: You unleash the seal’s power. Place the [seal_c] seal on this Mist-Pylon. For the remainder of the game, each investigator gets +1 to each of their skills while they are at a Mist-Pylon.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"In the whole spectacle there was a persistent, pervasive hint of stupendous secrecy and potential revelation; as if these stark, nightmare spires marked the pylons of a frightful gateway..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.back_text: As an additional cost for you to enter Mist-Pylon, investigators at your location must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
eoe/eoec.name: Mist-Pylon
eoe/eoec.text: [fast] If you control the [seal_e] seal, and it is activated: You unleash the seal’s power. Place the [seal_e] seal on this Mist-Pylon. For the remainder of the game, whenever an investigator at a Mist-Pylon would be dealt 1 or more damage and/or horror, cancel 1 of that damage or horror.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"In the whole spectacle there was a persistent, pervasive hint of stupendous secrecy and potential revelation; as if these stark, nightmare spires marked the pylons of a frightful gateway..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.back_text: As an additional cost for you to enter Mist-Pylon, investigators at your location must spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
eoe/eoec.name: Mist-Pylon
eoe/eoec.text: [fast] If you control the [seal_b] seal, and it is activated: You unleash the seal’s power. Place the [seal_b] seal on this Mist-Pylon. For the remainder of the game, each enemy gets –2 fight and –2 evade while it is at a Mist-Pylon.

eoe/eoec.name: The Nameless Madness
eoe/eoec.text: Alert. Massive. Retaliate. The Nameless Madness cannot take damage. Forced – After you successfully evade or attack The Nameless Madness: For each point you succeeded by, exhaust the nearest ready copy of The Nameless Madness.

eoe/eoec.name: Unsealed Phantasm
eoe/eoec.text: Spawn – The nearest Mist-Pylon that is not collapsed (or your location, if there are none in play). While Unsealed Phantasm is ready and at a Mist-Pylon, damage cannot be dealt to that Mist-Pylon. Forced – At the end of the enemy phase, if Unsealed Phantasm is ready: Move it once toward the Mist-Pylon nearest to it that is not collapsed.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor: You emerge from the tunnel, daylight blinding you as the sun peeks out from behind the jagged mountaintops in the distance. Behind you, the entity rushes toward the exit. You prepare yourself for the end, the wall of mist, miasma, and madness feeling much like an oncoming train.
eoe/eoec.back_text: Check the Campaign Log. - If all 5 Mist-Pylons were collapsed and Dr. Kensler has a plan, proceed to (→R1). - If all 5 Mist-Pylons were collapsed and the truth of the mirage eludes you, proceed to (→R2). - Otherwise, proceed to (→R3).
eoe/eoec.name: The Final Mirage
eoe/eoec.text: The Nameless Madness gains hunter. Forced – When 1 or more doom would be put into play: Instead, spawn 1 set-aside copy of The Nameless Madness at the leftmost investigator’s location. Objective – Run.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"...over our former trail back to the city, along ice-sunken megalithic corridors to the great open circle, and up that archaic spiral ramp in a frenzied automatic plunge for the sane outer air and light of day."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.back_text: Titanic Ramp is connected to the locations to its left and right.
eoe/eoec.name: Titanic Ramp
eoe/eoec.text:
Titanic Ramp is connected to the locations to its left and right.
As an additional cost for you to leave Titanic Ramp, test [agility] (4). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move. Any investigator at your location or a connecting location may spend 1 clue to have you automatically succeed at this test.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"...over our former trail back to the city, along ice-sunken megalithic corridors to the great open circle, and up that archaic spiral ramp in a frenzied automatic plunge for the sane outer air and light of day."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.back_text: Titanic Ramp is connected to the locations to its left and right.
eoe/eoec.name: Titanic Ramp
eoe/eoec.text:
Titanic Ramp is connected to the locations to its left and right.
As an additional cost for you to leave Titanic Ramp, test [agility] (3). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move. Any investigator at your location or a connecting location may spend 1 clue to have you automatically succeed at this test.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"...over our former trail back to the city, along ice-sunken megalithic corridors to the great open circle, and up that archaic spiral ramp in a frenzied automatic plunge for the sane outer air and light of day."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.back_text: Titanic Ramp is connected to the locations to its left and right.
eoe/eoec.name: Titanic Ramp
eoe/eoec.text:
Titanic Ramp is connected to the locations to its left and right.
As an additional cost for you to leave Titanic Ramp, test [agility] (2). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move. Any investigator at your location or a connecting location may spend 1 clue to have you automatically succeed at this test.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"...over our former trail back to the city, along ice-sunken megalithic corridors to the great open circle, and up that archaic spiral ramp in a frenzied automatic plunge for the sane outer air and light of day."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.back_text: Titanic Ramp is connected to the locations to its left and right.
eoe/eoec.name: Titanic Ramp
eoe/eoec.text:
Titanic Ramp is connected to the locations to its left and right.
As an additional cost for you to leave Titanic Ramp, test [agility] (1). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move. Any investigator at your location or a connecting location may spend 1 clue to have you automatically succeed at this test.

eoe/eoec.back_flavor:
"Thank heaven we did not slacken our run. The curling mist had thickened again, and was driving ahead with increased speed; whilst the straying penguins in our rear were squawking and screaming..."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.back_text: Hidden Tunnel is connected to the location to its left.
eoe/eoec.flavor:
"...not even the fear of collapse could make us pause before reaching the normal outer realm of sun and sky."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Hidden Tunnel
eoe/eoec.text: Hidden Tunnel is connected to the location to its left. Objective – If each undefeated investigator is at the Hidden Tunnel, advance the act.

eoe/eoec.name: Primordial Evil
eoe/eoec.text: Hunter. Retaliate. Forced – When you deal any amount of damage to Primordial Evil: Shuffle the top card of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck without looking at it (if you cannot, Primordial Evil attacks you).

eoe/eoec.name: The Madness Within
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (4). For each point you fail by, shuffle the top card of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck without looking at it (for each card you cannot shuffle, take 1 horror).

eoe/eoec.name: Manifestation of Madness
eoe/eoec.text: Hunter. Forced – When Manifestation of Madness attacks you: Shuffle the top 2 cards of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck without looking at them (for each card you cannot shuffle, Manifestation of Madness deals +1 damage and +1 horror for this attack).

eoe/eoec.name: Glacial Phantasm
eoe/eoec.text: Forced – At the end of the enemy phase, if Glacial Phantasm is ready: Move it once toward the location with the most investigators. In player order, each investigator at Glacial Phantasm’s location or a connecting location shuffles the top card of the Tekeli-li deck into their deck without looking at it (each investigator who cannot takes 1 horror).

eoe/eoec.name: Kindred Mist
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation – Attach to the nearest location without a copy of Kindred Mist attached. Forced – When 1 or more cards from the Tekeli-li deck would be shuffled into your deck while you are at attached location: Draw them instead, placing them on the bottom of your deck instead of the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck. Discard Kindred Mist at the end of this round.

eoe/eoec.name: Antarctic Wind
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation – Attach to the nearest location without a copy of Antarctic Wind attached. Investigators at attached location cannot play cards or draw cards from their deck. Forced – At the end of the round: Discard Antarctic Wind.

eoe/eoec.name: Whiteout
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation – Attach to your location. Each investigator at attached location gets –1 [willpower], –1 [intellect], –1 [combat], and –1 [agility]. Forced – At the end of the round: Discard Whiteout.

eoe/eoec.name: Polar Vortex
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation – Attach to your location. Forced – When you end your turn at attached location: Each card you control with health (including your investigator) takes 1 direct damage. Forced – At the end of the round: Discard Polar Vortex.

eoe/eoec.flavor:
"Of the life of the Old Ones, both under the sea and after part of them migrated to land, volumes could be written."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Elder Thing Scavenger
eoe/eoec.text: Hunter. Forced – After Elder Thing Scavenger attacks you: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck. Draw each weakness discarded this way.

eoe/eoec.name: Guardian Elder Thing
eoe/eoec.text: Hunter. Forced – When you deal damage to Guardian Elder Thing: For each point of damage dealt, discard the top card of your deck. Draw each weakness discarded this way.

eoe/eoec.name: Rise of the Elder Things
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation – Find the topmost [[Elder Thing]] enemy in the encounter discard pile and spawn it engaged with you. Each [[Elder Thing]] enemy currently engaged with you gets +1 fight and +1 evade until the end of the round. If Rise of the Elder Things put no enemies into play, it gains surge.

eoe/eoec.flavor: One false step...
eoe/eoec.name: Ice Shaft
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation – Test [agility] (3). For each [frost] token revealed during this test, take 1 damage. If you fail, take 2 damage.

eoe/eoec.name: Through the Ice
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation – Attach to the nearest location without a copy of Through the Ice attached. As an additional cost for you to enter or leave attached location (except by a scenario card effect), test [agility] (2). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move, take 1 damage and 1 horror, and discard Through the Ice.

eoe/eoec.name: Lost Researcher
eoe/eoec.text: Spawn – Any location (empty, if able). Lost Researcher enters play with 1 doom on it. Forced – When Lost Researcher is defeated: Move each doom on it to its location. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3). If you succeed, take control of 1 doom on Lost Researcher and flip it to its clue side. Then, if there is no doom on Lost Researcher, discard it.

eoe/eoec.name: Frenzied Explorer
eoe/eoec.text: Frenzied Explorer enters play with 1 doom on it. Forced – When Frenzied Explorer is defeated: Move each doom on it to its location. [reaction] After you successfully evade Frenzied Explorer by 2 or more: Take control of 1 doom on Frenzied Explorer and flip it to its clue side. Then, if there is no doom on Frenzied Explorer, discard it.

eoe/eoec.name: Abandoned to Madness
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation – Attach to the nearest [[Possessed]] enemy and place 1 doom on that enemy. If there are no [[Possessed]] enemies in play, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Possessed]] enemy, draw it, and attach Abandoned to Madness to it (shuffle the encounter deck). Increase the difficulty to fight, evade, or parley with attached enemy by 1.

eoe/eoec.name: Blasphemous Visions
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation – Shuffle the top card of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck without looking at it. Then, put Blasphemous Visions into play in your threat area. Resolve the effects of each Tekeli-li weakness you draw an additional time. [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Blasphemous Visions.

eoe/eoec.name: Glimpse the Unspeakable
eoe/eoec.text: Peril. Revelation – Draw the top card of the Tekeli-li deck (and resolve its effects). Shuffle it into any investigator’s deck instead of placing it on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck. If no Tekeli-li weakness is drawn by this effect, Glimpse the Unspeakable gains surge.

eoe/eoec.name: Nightmarish Vapors
eoe/eoec.text: Peril. Revelation – You must either (choose one): - Lose 2 actions. - Shuffle the top 2 cards of the Tekeli-li deck into your deck without looking at them.

eoe/eoec.name: Miasmatic Torment
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation – If you control a partner asset, exhaust them and attach Miasmatic Torment to them. Otherwise, Miasmatic Torment gains surge. Attached asset cannot ready. Forced – At the end of your turn: Attached asset takes 1 damage or 1 horror. [action]: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3). If you succeed, discard Miasmatic Torment.

eoe/eoec.name: Nebulous Miasma
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation – Attach to your location. Forced – When you end your turn at attached location: Each card you control with sanity (including your investigator) takes 1 direct horror. Forced – At the end of the round: Discard Nebulous Miasma.

eoe/eoec.flavor:
"...it was only a penguin - albeit of a huge, unknown species larger than the greatest of the known king penguins, and monstrous in its combined albinism and virtual eyelessness."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Giant Albino Penguin
eoe/eoec.text:
Aloof.
As an additional cost for you to enter or leave this enemy’s location, you must spend 1 action.

eoe/eoec.name: Wuk! Wuk! Wuk!
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation – Find the Giant Albino Penguin enemy farthest from you. You must either move it to your location or place 1 doom on it. If there are no Giant Albino Penguins in play, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Giant Albino Penguin, draw it, and shuffle the encounter deck.

eoe/eoec.flavor:
"...shoggoths and their work ought not to be seen by human beings or portrayed by any beings."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Forgotten Shoggoth
eoe/eoec.text: Hunter. Forced – After Forgotten Shoggoth engages you: Draw the top card of the Tekeli-li deck (if you cannot, Forgotten Shoggoth attacks you).

eoe/eoec.name: Rampaging Shoggoth
eoe/eoec.text: Hunter. Massive. Rampaging Shoggoth gets +2 [per_investigator] health. Forced – At the end of the enemy phase: Deal 2 damage to each investigator and non-[[Shoggoth]] enemy at Rampaging Shoggoth’s location. Each of those investigators draws the top card of the Tekeli-li deck.

eoe/eoec.name: Polar Mirage
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation – Attach to the nearest location with at least 1 clue, and without a copy of Polar Mirage attached. Forced – After you discover or take control of 1 or more clues at attached location: Discard each non-weakness card in your hand. Discard Polar Mirage.

eoe/eoec.flavor:
"The phosphorescent organisms supplied light with vast effectiveness, and doubtless atoned for the loss of the familiar polar auroras of the outer-world night."
 – H. P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Dark Aurora
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation – Test [willpower] (3). For each [frost] token revealed during this test, take 1 horror. If you fail, take 2 horror.

eoe/eoec.flavor: "Doubt of the real facts, as I must reveal them, is inevitable." - H.P. Lovecraft, At the Mountains of Madness
eoe/eoec.name: Professor William Dyer
eoe/eoec.text:
Partner. Uses (3 secrets).
[action] Spend 1 secret and exhaust Professor William Dyer: Heal 2 horror from an investigator or another [[Ally]] asset at your location.

eoe/eoec.flavor: "Danforth was a great reader of bizarre material..." - H.P. Lovecraft, At the Mountains of Madness
eoe/eoec.name: Danforth
eoe/eoec.text:
Partner. Uses (5 secrets).
[reaction] After an investigator at your location resolves a Tekeli-li weakness, exhaust Danforth and spend 1 secret: That investigator draws 2 cards.

eoe/eoec.flavor: "Anyu's got the scent. Haven't you, girl?"
eoe/eoec.name: Eliyah Ashevak
eoe/eoec.text: Partner. Uses (3 secrets). [action] Spend 1 secret and exhaust Eliyah Ashevak: Evade. Attempt to evade with a base [agility] skill of 5. If you succeed, you may move to a connecting location.

eoe/eoec.flavor: "Want to survive the trip? Good. Then don't get on my bad side."
eoe/eoec.name: Dr. Mala Sinha
eoe/eoec.text:
Partner. Uses (3 supplies).
[action] Spend 1 supply and exhaust Dr. Mala Sinha: Heal 2 damage from an investigator or another [[Ally]] asset at your location.

eoe/eoec.flavor: "Weather is turning foul again. I would tell you to turn back, but I gather you would refuse - right?"
eoe/eoec.name: Avery Claypool
eoe/eoec.text:
Partner. Uses (5 supplies).
[reaction] When an investigator at your location reveals a [frost] token during a skill test, exhaust Avery Claypool and spend 1 supply: Cancel that token and reveal a new one.

eoe/eoec.flavor: "No I ain't leavin' my damn gun back at camp!"
eoe/eoec.name: James "Cookie" Fredericks
eoe/eoec.text: Partner. Uses (3 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo and exhaust James "Cookie" Fredericks: Fight. Fight with a base [combat] skill of 5. If you succceed and the attacked enemy is non-[[Elite]], it cannot attack for the remainder of the round.

eoe/eoec.flavor: "All of this is so fascinating! Do you not agree?"
eoe/eoec.name: Dr. Amy Kensler
eoe/eoec.text: Partner. Uses (3 secrets). [action] Spend 1 secret and exhaust Dr. Amy Kensler: Investigate. Investigate with a base [intellect] skill of 5. If you succceed, look at the top card of any investigator's deck or the encounter deck. You may discard that card.

eoe/eoec.flavor: "I have been all over the world. Please, just trust me."
eoe/eoec.name: Roald Ellsworth
eoe/eoec.text:
Partner. Uses (5 supplies).
[fast] During an investigator's turn, exhaust Roald Ellsworth and spend 1 supply: Choose a treachery attached to any location. Treat that treachery's text box as if it were blank until the end of this turn.

eoe/eoec.flavor: "Nobody knows these machines better than I do."
eoe/eoec.name: Takada Hiroko
eoe/eoec.text:
Partner. Uses (9 resources).
[action] Exhaust Takada Hiroko: Move up to 3 resources from Takada Hiroko to your resource pool.

eoe/eoec.flavor:
"Still came that eldritch, mocking cry - 'Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li!'"
 - H.P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness.</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Tekeli-li
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation - Take 1 horror. Place Tekeli-li on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck.

eoe/eoec.flavor:
"Still came that eldritch, mocking cry - 'Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li!'"
 - H.P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness.</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Tekeli-li
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation - Take 1 damage. Place Tekeli-li on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck.

eoe/eoec.flavor:
"Still came that eldritch, mocking cry - 'Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li!'"
 - H.P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness.</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Tekeli-li
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation - Discard 1 card at random from your hand. Place Tekeli-li on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck.

eoe/eoec.flavor:
"Still came that eldritch, mocking cry - 'Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li!'"
 - H.P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness.</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Tekeli-li
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation - Lose 2 resources. Place Tekeli-li on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck.

eoe/eoec.flavor:
"Still came that eldritch, mocking cry - 'Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li!'"
 - H.P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness.</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Tekeli-li
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation - If it is your turn, lose 1 action. Otherwise, lose 1 action during your next turn. Place Tekeli-li on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck.

eoe/eoec.flavor:
"Still came that eldritch, mocking cry - 'Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li!'"
 - H.P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness.</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Tekeli-li
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation - Place 1 of your clues on your location. Place Tekeli-li on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck.

eoe/eoec.flavor:
"Still came that eldritch, mocking cry - 'Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li!'"
 - H.P. Lovecraft, <u>At the Mountains of Madness.</u>
eoe/eoec.name: Tekeli-li
eoe/eoec.text: Revelation - Discard an asset you control. Place Tekeli-li on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck.

eoe/eoec.name: Claypool's Furs
eoe/eoec.text:
Fast.
[reaction] When you reveal a [frost] token during a skill test you are performing, deal 1 damage to Claypool's Furs: Cancel that chaos token and return it to the bag. Reveal a new chaos token.

eoe/eoec.name: Collected Works of Poe
eoe/eoec.text:
Uses (3 charges).
[action] Spend 1 charge: Choose an investigator at your location to search the top 6 cards of their deck for each copy of Tekeli-li and place each of them on the bottom of the Tekeli-li deck. Shuffle that investigator's deck. That investigator draws 1 card.

eoe/eoec.name: Cookie's Custom .32
eoe/eoec.text: Fast. Uses (2 ammo). [action] Spend 1 ammo: Fight. Either fight with a base [combat] skill of 5, or get +2 [combat] for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage.

eoe/eoec.flavor: Professor Dyer kept many sketches depicting the creatures he encountered.
eoe/eoec.name: Dyer's Sketches
eoe/eoec.text:
Fast. Play during any [fast] window.
Draw 3 cards.

eoe/eoec.name: Ellsworth's Boots
eoe/eoec.text:
Limit 1 [[Footwear]] per investigator.
[reaction] After the last clue is discovered from your location, exhaust Ellsworth's Boots: Move to a connecting location, or discard Ellsworth's Boots to move to any revealed location.

eoe/eoec.name: Kensler's Log
eoe/eoec.text: Fast. Uses (2 secrets). [action] Spend 1 secret: Investigate. Either investigate with a base [intellect] skill of 5, or get +2 [intellect] for this investigation. If you succeed, you discover 1 additional clue at your location.

eoe/eoec.name: Sinha's Medical Kit
eoe/eoec.text:
Uses (3 supplies).
[fast] Exhaust Sinha's Medical Kit and spend 1 supply: Heal 1 damage or 1 horror from an investigator or [[Ally]] asset at your location.

eoe/eoec.flavor: Takada left these spare supplies behind. Maybe you can make use of them.
eoe/eoec.name: Takada's Cache
eoe/eoec.text:
Fast. Play during any [fast] window.
Gain 3 resources and draw 1 card. Remove Takada's Cache from the game.

eoe/eoec.name: Anyu
eoe/eoec.text: [fast] Exhaust Anyu: Choose one, or discard Anyu to choose up to three, in any order - - Move to a connecting location. - You get +2 skill value for your next skill test this round. - Evade. Attempt to evade with a base [agility] skill of 4.

side/guardians_encounter.back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X. X is 1 more than the strength of the abyss.
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail and the strength of the abyss is 5 or lower, add 1 strength to the abyss.
[tablet]: -2. For this skill test, ignore all bonuses to your skill value.
[elder_thing]: -6. You may add 1 strength to the abyss to automatically succeed, instead.
side/guardians_encounter.name: The Eternal Slumber
side/guardians_encounter.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X. X is the strength of the abyss.
[cultist]: Reveal another token. If you fail and the strength of the abyss is 3 or lower, add 1 strength to the abyss.
[tablet]: 0. For this skill test, ignore all bonuses to your skill value.
[elder_thing]: -5. You may add 1 strength to the abyss to automatically succeed, instead.

side/guardians_encounter.back_flavor: You've found enough leads to confirm the existence of a shadowy organisation within Cairo, and perhaps the origin of the curse afflicting the city. However, despite your best efforts, the secret cabal has vanished from the city without a trace. You're going to need a lot more information if you are to cure this illness.
side/guardians_encounter.back_text: Find each [[Brotherhood]] enemy currently in play (at a location or in an investigator's threat area). Place each of those enemies beneath the scenario reference card, out of play. Shuffle each set-aside copy of Abyssal Revenant into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile. Add 1 strength to the abyss. If it is act 1, advance the current act.
side/guardians_encounter.flavor: Jessie Burke, a government agent who works in Egypt, has asked you to come to Cairo to help her solve a medical quandary. People all over Cairo, from all walks of life, are mysteriously falling into a wakeless slumber - including Jessie's husband and partner, John. It is up to you to get to the bottom of this strange phenomenon.
side/guardians_encounter.name: Jessie's Request
side/guardians_encounter.text: [action] Investigators spend 1 [per_investigator] clues, as a group: Randomly spawn one of the enemies beneath the scenario reference card.

side/guardians_encounter.back_flavor: As more and more fall victim to the curse that has infected Cairo, a silent terror grips the city. When night falls again, the streets are filled with a sudden panic. It starts with turmoil outside the hospital, as people demand to know what has happened to their loved ones and what the doctors are doing to solve the problem. Before long, rioting and looting erupt throughout the city. By midnight, the streets have descended into utter chaos.
side/guardians_encounter.back_text:
Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
Add 1 strength to the abyss.
side/guardians_encounter.flavor: The sun rises over Cairo. Many more people within the city did not wake up this morning. A grim thought seizes your mind: Should you fall asleep, you too may never wake again. Having gotten little rest the previous night, you struggle to stay awake and continue your investigation…
side/guardians_encounter.name: Curse of the Abyss
side/guardians_encounter.text: Forced - If the strength of the abyss is 0: Set the strength of the abyss to 1. Each investigator draws 1 card and heals 1 horror.

side/guardians_encounter.back_flavor:
You are too exhausted to go on. Your mind screams at your body to keep moving, but your muscles have betrayed you. You sink to the ground like a sack of bricks.
You resist with all your strength, but all it amounts to is a wiggling of your fingers. You feel as thought a heavy weight is pressed upon your head, and a dark cloak is thrown over your eyes.
If you fall asleep here, you are sure you'll never wake again. And yet, somehow, deep within your mind, you're too tired to care.
You yawn.
side/guardians_encounter.back_text: Add 1 strength to the abyss. Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated and is "taken by the abyss."
side/guardians_encounter.flavor: When morning comes, the city is silent once more. The hospital is overflowing with last night's victims, and many more comatose people fill the streets. You've evaded sleep for this long, but you can't go on much longer. Fatigue has inflicted its toll on your body and mind. If you don't act fast, you may be the spell's next victim.
side/guardians_encounter.name: Garden of Shadows
side/guardians_encounter.text: Forced - If the strength of the abyss is 0 or 1: Set the strength of the abyss to 2. Each investigator either draws 1 card or heals 1 horror.

side/guardians_encounter.back_flavor: You corner one of the organization's agents in a dark alleyway as he attempts to flee the city. "It is too late to stop the prophecy," he says with a frightened expression. "Please, just let me go." Seeing weakness in the man's heart, you tell him that he can help you stop what the organization is plotting, if he tells you everything he knows. "The Brotherhood of the Beast believes they have found their vessel," he explains, stuttering nervously. "Now they're giving their Chosen untold power. There's no way you can stop them!" He struggles and breaks free from your grasp, fleeing back toward the main street. If you follow that man, perhaps he will lead you to the brotherhood's hideout…
side/guardians_encounter.back_text:
Create the exploration deck by shuffling together each of the set-aside [[Expedition]] locations. Search the encounter deck and discard pile for 1 copy each of the following treachery cards: Terror Under the Pyramids, Swarm of Locusts, Abyssal Reach, Eclipse, and Sandstorm. Shuffle those cards into the exploration deck, then shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
Each investigator loses each of his or her clues.
Remove all clues from each [[Cairo]] location.
side/guardians_encounter.flavor: As you scour Cairo for answers, you begin to suspect that Jessie's hunch was right. You're being tailed by shadowy figures throughout the city, and several of the people you interview want nothing to do with you. What are they hiding?
side/guardians_encounter.name: Curse of Endless Sleep
side/guardians_encounter.text: Forced - After a [[Brotherhood]] enemy enters the victory display: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side. Objective - Find as many [[Evidence]] cards as you can and add them to the victory display before the agenda advances. (If there are 6 [[Evidence]] cards in the victory display, advance.)

side/guardians_encounter.back_flavor:
You are unable to find the Brotherhood's hideout, but you are able to find the agent you interrogated in Cairo… Or at least, what remains of him. Inside the halls of an ancient temple dedicated to a long-forgotten pharaoh, the man's corpse has been placed upon a stone altar. His body is riddled with fresh stab wounds. You can't help but wonder if this was - in a way - your doing.
Investigating the body and the remainder of the half-buried temple yields a troubling discovery. As you suspected, the Brotherhood of the Beast is behind the curse afflicting Cairo. You find several passages describing the spell in greater detail - though these descriptions do not match what you have seen with your own eyes. The Brotherhood's tomes describe how to transport their victims to another realm, a place called the Abyss. A nightmarescape from which the dreamers cannot awaken. With each dreamer, their "Chosen" grows in strength…
side/guardians_encounter.back_text:
Place 1 [per_investigator] damage tokens on each [[Cairo]] location. Until the end of the scenario, damage tokens on locations represent "dreamers" - victims who have been cursed with eternal slumber.
Put the set-aside Neith enemy into play in the Streets of Cairo.
side/guardians_encounter.flavor: You pursue the Brotherhood's agent west as he flees the city. Following his trail into the desert will be easier if you join the archaeological expedition currently underway.
side/guardians_encounter.name: Secrets in the Sand
side/guardians_encounter.text: Clues cannot be placed on [[Cairo]] locations. [action] If you are at an [[Expedition]] location: Explore. Draw the top card of the exploration deck. If it is a connecting location, put it into play and move to it.

side/guardians_encounter.back_flavor: With each of the dreamers you set free, the arcane power wielded by Neith fades. Before long, she has collapsed to her knees, the power completely drained from her body. However, even with the spells and records you found in the Brotherhood's temple, you're unable to awaken all of the victims; only those most recently put under the spell's sway. As for the remainder of the victims - including John Burke - their fate is inextricably tied to Neith. "If you believe that this is the end, you deserve the fate Xzharah has in store for you," she warns you. "Slay me and you will be next in line to die." You waver. But if she is allowed to live, those she has ensnared in sleep will never awaken. What is one life, compared to the lives of so many innocents?
side/guardians_encounter.back_text:
The investigators must decide (choose wisely): -Destroy Neith once and for all.
By choosing this option, you believe those still under the curse of eternal slumber will be freed. (→R1) - Spare Neith and listen to what she has to say.
By choosing this option, you believe you can learn more about the one Neith refers to as Xzharah. (→R2)
side/guardians_encounter.flavor: The final record you find describes a time of reaping, wherein a thousand dreamers will be sacrificed. Armed with the Brotherhood's knowledge, you believe you can reverse their curse before they claim the waking lives of every last man, woman, and child in Cairo.
side/guardians_encounter.name: The Hour of Judgment
side/guardians_encounter.text: [action] If there is a dreamer at your location: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (X) to attempt to awaken a dreamer. X is the strength of the abyss. If you succeed, move a dreamer from your location to Neith, as damage. Objective - If Neith has no remaining health, advance.

side/guardians_encounter.back_flavor: It is an unusually dry month in Cairo. The narrow, winding streets of the city are baked by the hot, unrelenting sun. Pedestrians travel from shadow to shadow to keep out of the sunlight… Or are they avoiding you?
side/guardians_encounter.name: Streets of Cairo
side/guardians_encounter.text: Forced - After you discover 2 or more clues at Streets of Cairo during a single turn: Take 1 horror. [action] If there are no clues on Streets of Cairo: Test [agility] (4). If you succeed, remember that you have "found a door marked with blood."

side/guardians_encounter.back_flavor: The busy streets of the bazaar are packed with peddlers hawking their wares and a raucous throng of patrons. Navigating your way through the crowd is difficult enough - finding your mark will be even more troublesome.
side/guardians_encounter.name: Cairo Bazaar
side/guardians_encounter.text:
While you are at Cairo Bazaar, reduce the cost of each [[Item]] asset you play by 1 and increase the cost of each other asset you play by 1.
[action] Spend 10 resources: Remember that you "bought an odd trinket."

side/guardians_encounter.back_flavor: This new museum - built in Tahrir Square after the Nile flooded the previous building - houses the world's largest collection of Pharaonic antiquities, including papyrus, coins, statues, tablets, coffins, and even mummies.
side/guardians_encounter.name: Museum of Egyptian Antiquities
side/guardians_encounter.text: [action]: Test [intellect] (5). If you succeed, remember that you have "discovered an ancient tablet." Forced - After you investigate Museum of Egyptian Antiquities, if you did not succeed by at least 2: Lose all remaining actions and immediately end your turn.

side/guardians_encounter.back_flavor: As the hot sun sets over Cairo, the sky is bathed in beautiful rays of orange and red. It is a magnificent prelude to the horrors to come.
side/guardians_encounter.name: Outskirts of Cairo
side/guardians_encounter.text: [action] Choose and discard 5 cards from your hand: Remember that you have "sabotaged the train." [action] If no investigator has "sabotaged the train": Resign. You take the train out of Cairo, leaving the dreamers to their unceasing nightmare.

side/guardians_encounter.back_flavor: Silvery rays of light gently bathe the courtyard in a soft glow. Despite the urgency of your task, you feel at peace here. You vow to return if you're still awake when this is over.
side/guardians_encounter.name: Temple Courtyard
side/guardians_encounter.text:
While there are no clues remaining on Temple Courtyard, each copy of Humble Supplicant loses aloof.
[action]: Test [combat] (5). If you succeed, remember that you have "broken into a deserted temple."

side/guardians_encounter.name: Neith
side/guardians_encounter.text: Hunter. Retaliate Forced - After horror from Neith's attack defeats an investigator or [[Ally]] asset: That card is "taken by the abyss." Forced - When Neith is dealt any amount of damage from an attack, if there is at least 1 dreamer at her location: Remove 1 dreamer from her location and cancel 1 damage just dealt to Neith.

side/guardians_encounter.name: Humble Supplicant
side/guardians_encounter.text: Spawn - Any [[Cairo]] location (with a [[Brotherhood]] enemy, if able). Aloof. Each [[Brotherhood]] enemy at Humble Supplicant's location cannot be attacked or damaged. Forced - When the enemy phase ends: Move Humble Supplicant once toward the nearest [[Brotherhood]] enemy, if able.

side/guardians_encounter.name: Creature from the Abyss
side/guardians_encounter.text: Retaliate. X is the strength of the abyss. Forced - After Creature from the Abyss enters play, if the strength of the abyss is 2 or lower: Add 1 strength to the abyss.
